name: 0 Miles Per Hour
description: 0 Miles Per Hour is a loud, fuzzy, in your face rock band hailing from Orlando Florida. The group has just released their most recent project "Gallop" through Chicago-based label New Morality Zine. The EP captures the band in a moment of clarity and growth. Across five songs they channel the energy of alternative rock through a hazy, melodic lens. "Gallop" represents 0 Miles Per Hour’s most confident and fully realized work to date.

name: 2charm
description:
2charm☆ blends indie house heaven pop techno dubstep baile to make magic ☆
Sticky and playful vocal hooks abound, pairing beatific production with beautiful vocal melodies, delivering something that’s equal parts ecstasy and transcendence. 2charm’s music could be likened to the sparkle that bounces off sheened cheeks under dingy club lights, in the same way the Balearic sea shines in July ☆

name: 60 JUNO
description:
Emerging from Merced, CA, 60 JUNO (sixty juno) leads the Central Valley Post-Punk scene with a blend of his own creation as he merges DIY Indie-Rock with Post-Punk elements to create a notable sound worth remembering.

By incorporating heightened energy and rough, low vocals into the usual wistful, dreamy componenets typical of the Indie-Rock genre, 60 JUNO has truly created a lane of his own making.

The independent 22-year old musician is the sole driving force behind the bass, drums, guitar and vocals that seamlessly translate heavy nostalgia into deep, dreamy melodies.

name: ¿Qiensave?
description:
Salinas’ own Cumbia Urbana band, ¿Qiensave?, delivers an infectious fusion of traditional cumbia and modern urban sounds, known for electrifying performances that keep crowds moving. With roots in Michoacán, Mexico, and a home base in Salinas, California, the band has been making waves since 2009, blending cumbia with rock, reggae, and hip-hop while bringing their dynamic live show to stages across the U.S., Mexico, and Colombia.
They gained wider attention with their 2019 debut Mujer, featuring “High Class” and “La Fuga,” and continued their momentum with releases like “Mata De Mota” featuring Tropa Magica, “El DUI” produced by Eduardo Arenas (Chicano Batman), and the fan favorite “Quemayama.” In 2024, they partnered with Grammy-nominated producer El Dusty for the remix album Reanimación and collaborated with Chuck Prophet on Wake The Dead, which hit #1 on the AMA/CDX Americana charts.
Now entering their next chapter, ¿Qiensave? prepares to release their new album Así Las Cosas in summer 2026, led by the single “SED De Tu Amor,” as they continue pushing cumbia forward with a fresh, evolving sound.

name: Aaron Page
description: Aaron Page is an emerging force in contemporary R&B whose music is as heartfelt as it is captivating. His journey began early, watching his older brother perform in a high school quartet and singing at talent shows during summers spent at his family’s camp. Early on, those cafeteria performances sparked a love for music that deepened with time. Aaron’s artistic foundation was laid at a music and arts academy in Bridgeport, Connecticut, where he became the lead vocalist in a jazz ensemble and honed his understanding of song structure. It was there he realized music wasn’t just a passion – it was his purpose. Drawing inspiration from icons like Drake, Kanye West, John Mayer, Ryan Leslie, The Weeknd, and Michael Jackson, Aaron developed a sound that is moody, melodic, and emotionally raw. R&B runs deep in Aaron’s veins – it’s the core of his identity and the soundtrack of his upbringing. His lyrics are rooted in personal experiences and the world around him, unafraid to be vulnerable and honest. That sincerity resonates in tracks like “Pretty Girls Love R&B” – a breakout hit celebrating women and creating a vibe that’s both comforting and confident. Aaron has already left his mark on major stages nationwide, joining R&B heavyweights PARTYNEXTDOOR on the Sorry I’m Outside Tour and Bryson Tiller on the Back and Better Tour as an opening act. Whether on stage or in the studio, Aaron moves with love and intention, using music as both an escape and a celebration. Most recently, Aaron released his new EP, Before I Go – a sultry, rain-soaked sonic experience that offers a glimpse into his evolving style. With smooth melodies and infectious rhythms, the project is perfect for summer nights, late drives, and moments of reflection. It’s a boundary-pushing body of work that positions him as a distinctive voice in modern R&B. Now, he’s stepping boldly into the spotlight – bringing a fresh, emotionally rich perspective to R&B while honoring the genre’s timeless soul.

name: Adult DVD
description:
Adult DVD, the Leeds based six piece have become known for their relentless output of euphoric hooks and grooves along with a relentless touring schedule that has taken them to Glastonbury, Greenman, End Of The Road and several European festivals this Summer.
Formed by vocalist Harry Hanson and synth-player Greg Lonsdale, the project quickly expanded to a full band with Danny Blackburn (guitar/synth), Jake Williams (synth), Jonathan Newell (drums), and George Manson (bass). From the outset, their tongue-in-cheek lyrics, pulsating electronics, big choruses and unique production style (their releases are all self-produced) set them apart from the indie-rock landscape.
Few songs capture the chaotic fun of Adult DVD more than their first release ‘Bill Murray’ - now a firm fan favourite and sing along moment at every festival set. First ‘proper’ single ‘Do Something’ from their 'Next Day Shipping' EP earned a spot on the BBC 6 Music B-list and support from BBC Radio 1, BBC Introducing and Radio X. Subsequent single ‘Because I Like It’ also landed onto the 6 Music B-list, and accompanying live performance from the BBC’s 6 Music festival.
Adult DVD’s live shows are fast becoming legendary. From sold-out hometown headline gigs at Brudenell Social Club and Belgrave Music Hall (2 in the round shows in one day) to storming sets at The Great Escape, Deer Shed Festival, and Live at Leeds, their performances are high-energy and unmissable.
Whether tapping into their love for chorus-centric indie or the influence of acid house floor fillers, DJing, or remixing their musical contemporaries their core appeal remains consistent: undeniable humour, bold danceable instrumentals and instantly memorable songwriting."

events.venue: Radio Day Stage @ Downright Austin Backyard
British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth Patio

name: Agatha is Dead!
description:
Formed in the lockdown winter of 2021, Agatha Is Dead! began as a post-punk experiment between longtime friends Lilly and Noah, who first made music together in their school days. Their shared love for Joy Division, The Cure, Molchat Doma, and Fontaines D.C. laid the foundation for their darkly urgent sound. With the addition of drummer Joey Ramone Hansen−bringing grunge and pop−punk bite−and Arthur on bass, the band played their first shows in 2022 and quickly carved out a place in Berlin's underground scene.

The band signed to Berlin label Duchess Box Records in May 2025 and will release their debut EP "order" in on 10th October.

The first singles drew attention from big online magazines such as Post-Punk.com and Diffus as well as major radio station airplay and big playlist support from Spotify and Apple Music.

This September, the band will embark on their first-ever headline tour with shows in Berlin and Leipzig selling out in advance., marking a new chapter in their journey. Their Berlin show at Privatclub sold out an incredible five months in advance, underscoring the growing excitement surrounding the band.

Drawing further inspiration from The Pretty Reckless, DIIV, Liily, and Bloc Party, Agatha Is Dead! have honed a sound that is heavy, hypnotic, and deeply emotional. With their debut EP Order on the horizon, the band are staking their claim in the next wave of alternative rock−grabbing hearts, shaking stages, and refusing to go unnoticed.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: Aiko
description:
Czechia raised, UK based, Aiko is an alt pop artist with music talking about confidence and empowerment and a high energetic performance as a duo together with the drummer Kat Almagro. Highlights include:
- representing Czechia at Eurovision 2024
- headline European tour with 23 stops, multiple sold out stops in cities like London, Warsaw, or Paris
- performing at SXSW, Japan EXPO, Sziget festival, Rock for people, and many more
- appearing on Times Square as part of the Spotify Equal programme, editorial playlisting, face of the Glow playlist
- music in the Netflix show Elite, Love Island UK and multiple MTV series
- latest album accumulated over 10 million streams
- mentions in Vogue, Harpers Bazaaar, The Rolling Stone UK, Austin Chronicle, Elle and many more

Aiko is currently in the process of creating her fourth album that is planned to be released in September/October 2026 and with another headline tour ahead of her in Autumn of 2026.

name: Ain TheMachine
description:
“We have never seen a proposal even remotely similar to that of Ain TheMachine.” — DJ Mag

Ain TheMachine is a Grammy-nominated Brazilian artist based in Berlin whose work reimagines how electronic music is made and performed. Instead of conventional instruments, he creates music live from the body, the voice and everyday objects, working across genres from Brazilian downtempo to Techno. His shows and videos often break the fourth wall, inviting the audience to contribute sounds that become part of the piece.

His unique approach has drawn international attention: he has been featured in one of Beatport’s most viewed and commented posts and has performed at iconic clubs and festivals such as Fusion Festival (Germany), Sisyphos (Berlin), D-EDGE (Brazil) and Suma Han (Turkey). Supported by artists including Purple Disco Machine, Sam Divine and Mano Le Tough, he releases music on his label Mundo Afora Records and on respected imprints such as Black Book.

He has delivered four TEDx talks in three countries, played with Prince’s guitarist Miko Weaver, jammed with Bobby McFerrin, and had his productions remixed by Mad Professor.

name: AKA BK
description:
AKA BK is an alternative indie project based in Los Angeles. With influences from bands like The Pixies, The Yeah Yeah Yeahs, and the Breeders, their live show plays like nerves exposed: charged, joyful and disarmingly human, turning their vulnerability into sharpened momentum. The band closes the distance between their fans, both literally and figuratively, inviting them to join in on their tongue-in-cheek moments of mushy playfulness and feverish moshing.

The foundation of AKA BK is built on long standing friendships, with BK (lead vocals) and Cecile Herledan (bassist) forming their first band at the age of 11 in Metro Detroit. The band is rounded out by fellow guitarists Julian Cullars and Sean Gunner Lee, who have been playing in LA bands since 2013.

name: Akira Galaxy
description:
Born Akira Galaxy Ament, the 24-year-old singer cut her teeth as a musician while fronting high school bands in Seattle, having been steeped in eclectic music by her family since she was a toddler. In her songwriting and performance, she combines the grit and attitude of the alt-rock of her hometown—where she often retreats to write—with a sleeker, more transatlantic aesthetic. Aided by producers Chris Coady (Beach House, TV On the Radio, The Kills) and Sam Westhoff, the songs on the EP blend rock ’n’ roll edge with synth gestures reminiscent of ’80s dream pop. Akira’s smoky vocals feel intimate and otherworldly at the same time, mirroring the moments in her songs when the real and the imagined seem to fold together and become inextricable.

Ultimately, Akira hopes her songs will connect with people who have gone through experiences similar to hers and effectively describe inner states that feel difficult to articulate—for instance, the desire for complete knowledge of another person. In the most powerful moments on What’s Inside You, she writes about our strange proclivities in love without judgment. These indelible songs capture emotional truth—the bold handiwork of an artist who prizes depth and substance in addition to her adventurous sounds.

name: Alahsîn
description:
Alahsîn is more than an artist , she’s a storyteller and visionary whose music lives in the space between confidence and vulnerability. Blending melodic flows with atmospheric production, her sound captures late nights, love, ambition, and the moments that shape who we become.

With a visual world inspired by symbolism, art, and emotion, Alahsîn creates not just songs but experiences. This March, she brings that immersive, expressive energy to the stage in Texas, delivering a performance designed to connect and leave a lasting impression.

name: Alex Cano
description: Alex Cano is a nationally touring Rock/Americana artist hailing from New York’s Hudson Valley. Known for his rich baritone and soaring, gritty rock vocals, Cano’s sound lives at the crossroads of high octane, blues driven rock ’n’ roll and vulnerable Americana balladry. His debut album, Every Rise of the Sun, is a raw chronicle of resilience and survival—equal parts cathartic release and anthemic triumph. Praised by outlets including Paste Magazine and Indie Current for its authenticity and emotional weight, the record established Cano as a voice unafraid to merge heartfelt intimacy with road-tested rock energy. Cano has toured across the US, performing everything from intimate listening rooms to major festivals. He has shared the stage with artists such as Plain White T's, Gin Blossoms, Tyler Bryant and the Shakedown, Band of Heathens, and Chris Barron. Along the way, he’s built a grassroots fanbase bound by a sense of community, connection, and resilience, values that run through all of his work. With a career already marked by resilience, authenticity, and growth, Alex Cano continues to carve his place as one of the most compelling voices in modern Rock/Americana.

name: Alex Irish
description:
Alex Irish is a Texas-born artist redefining modern hip-hop through a genre-blurring sound that weaves rap, rock, pop, and Latin influences into something unmistakably her own. Rooted in Dallas, her music balances emotional depth with bold production, pairing lived experience with sharp musical instincts.
After surviving a life-altering shooting in 2021, Alex turned adversity into creative momentum, channeling resilience into her art rather than retreating from it. Her latest EP "From Dallas, With Love" debuted to strong momentum, earning over 50,000 streams in its first week and charting on the iTunes Hip-Hop charts. The project also received a nomination for EP of the Year at the Dallas Entertainment Awards.
Known for commanding performances and cinematic songwriting, Alex continues to carve out her own lane. With new music on the way, she represents a new chapter of Dallas hip-hop that is fearless, versatile, and unmistakably global.

name: Ali Almighty
description:
Ali Almighty, born Aaliyah Ashante White, is a rising rapper from Greenville, TX, proudly known as the "Queen of da 903." Her music blends Southern rap with contemporary sounds, creating a unique and captivating style that resonates with a diverse audience.
Her latest album, *EA$T TX $HAWTY*, showcases her lyrical talent and storytelling, offering authentic narratives rooted in her experiences. With compelling beats and insightful lyrics, she is quickly gaining recognition in the rap community.
Beyond music, Ali Almighty actively engages with her growing fanbase on social media, sharing her journey and connecting with supporters. Her strong online presence has helped build a dedicated following eager for her next move.
Inspired daily by her family, Ali Almighty is a testament to resilience—never willing to give up or give in. Focused on making a lasting impact, she continues pushing boundaries, representing her East Texas roots with powerful and authentic music.

name: Alien Chicks
description:
Alien Chicks are a trio hailing from the streets of South London, known for their electrifying blend of punk, rap and jazz. They create a sound that is raw and innovative, capturing the spirit of London's underground music culture. The line-up features the vocals and sharp guitar work of Josef Lindsay, the pulsating basslines of Stefan Parker-Steele and the explosive drumming of Martha Daniels. Whether delivering rapid-fire rap verses, intricate jazz-inspired bass riffs, or thunderous punk rhythms, Alien Chicks continue to push boundaries and defy expectations, drawing praise from The Independent, NME, Rolling Stone, and Radio 1.

The band’s journey began in grassroots venues across the city, in particular The Windmill, Brixton, where their high-energy performances and unique sound helped them build a loyal following. With huge momentum following their biggest London headliner yet at The Garage, following a sold out Oslo Hackney, four iconic sets at The Great Escape, 2000 Trees and Glastonbury. They have also toured with English Teacher, Lambrini Girls, The Libertines and Big Special.

Alien Chicks' music is a testament to their diverse influences and fearless approach to genre.

name: Alina Pash
description:
Alina Pash is a Ukrainian artist now based in Los Angeles, building a bold new live experience in the U.S.—a mystic rap-based opera that fuses deep-root Ukrainian ritual, ethnic vocal power, and modern bass/electronic production. Her performances feel like ceremony: cinematic, high-voltage, and emotionally precise—where folklore meets the club, and tradition becomes future music.

Back home, Alina built a major name fast: she performed on Kyiv’s main square for Independence Day in front of President Volodymyr Zelensky, and later that same night headlined the country’s biggest rave, Brave! Factory—proof of her rare ability to command both national stages and underground culture. She’s shared bills with top international acts, earned wide media attention, and continues to push Ukrainian sound into global pop and bass ecosystems.

In March she drops a deluxe release with 15 remix features—largely U.S. collaborators—bridging her world into American scenes. Now, she’s developing a new album and an expanded 2026–2027 performance program—built for discovery rooms and tastemaker festivals in the U.S. and beyond.

name: Alkyone
description:
Alkyone is a Greek singer-songwriter hailing from the mountains of northern Greece. Born and raised in a small town surrounded by rivers and forests, she began her musical journey at the age of six, training as a classical pianist, before embracing songwriting as her true path.
Influenced by her father’s deep love for folk music, Alkyone began experimenting with traditional songs and textures, weaving a distinct folklore thread into her musical identity. Her sound blends indie songwriting, cinematic atmospheres, and folk elements from the Mediterranean and the Balkans. Singing in both English and Greek, her lyrics explore memory, growing up, and our evolving relationship with the world, while her concerts carry an intimate, personal, and emotionally charged atmosphere.
She has performed across Europe (Konzerthaus, Tonhalle, Carré, SNF, Onassis Foundation and others). In 2023, she collaborated with Vincent Moon and was featured on La Blogothèque. Her critically acclaimed debut album Exit Sign was released in 2023, while her second studio album, Small Philosophies, is expected in late spring 2026.
Her stage name, Alkyone, is a tribute to a recurring dream in which she was a bird.

name: The All-American Rejects
description: Formed in 1999 in Stillwater, Oklahoma, The All-American Rejects quickly became one of the most iconic rock bands of the 2000s. Led by Tyson Ritter and Nick Wheeler, the band debuted in 2002, featuring their hit "Swing, Swing." Their 2005 album Move Along cemented their place in rock with chart-toppers like "Dirty Little Secret" and "It Ends Tonight." In 2008, "Gives You Hell" became a global hit and a Billboard No. 1 in 2009. The band continued pushing creative boundaries on Kids in the Street in 2012. Throughout the years, The Rejects have continued evolving, taking their sound in new directions while staying true to the emotional core that’s always defined their music. Their latest singles, “Eggshell Tapdancer” and “Easy Come, Easy Go”, from their upcoming 5th album have proven their undying commitment to writing songs that resonate with fans and prove that their relevance and connection with fans are only getting stronger with time.

name: Alma Muñeca
description:
Alma Muñeca is a three piece art pop group based in Austin, TX. Formed in 2024, the band is lead by Cocó Allegra and produced by Ernesto Grey (credits with Font, Farmer’s Wife, The Opera, Almost Heaven, etc). Cocó, a Panamanian immigrant, settled in Austin five years ago. It wasn’t until she met collaborator, Ernesto, that she fully committed to writing and performing live. The band’s sound is inspired by 90’s icons such as Bjork and contemporaries like FKA Twigs and Rosalia. Through their live performances, Cocó aims to highlight and lift up the queer and Latino community.

The band’s debut EP, “Deseo un Brillo”, was released on October 24, 2025. Since then they’ve continued building momentum in the Austin scene by opening for bands such as Sextile and Snooper. The band is in the process of relocating to Brooklyn, NY, where they hope to expand on their already defined sound and fanbase.

name: Alto Moon
description:
Atlanta-based artist, producer & songwriter, Alto Moon is redefining “Future Soul”, a sleek collision of Pop, R&B, and electronica that feels both nostalgic and next-gen. Though raised on heartfelt sounds from Southern gospel, Alto’s sound pulses with a modern edge where soul meets synths. Drawing sonic comparisons to Sam Smith, Lenny Kravitz, & Usher, Alto’s smart, cheeky signature songwriting makes it unmistakably his own.

His latest album "godspeed." caught the attention of Bob the Drag Queen, who later appeared on the project’s lead single, "ride." The record marks a defining moment in Alto’s ascent blending bold, club-ready production with nostalgic Pop/R&B.

After appearances on American Idol, MTV, and NPR, Alto continues to spark Atlanta’s underground scene with high-energy performances and a signature retro-futuristic aesthetic. A proud queer voice in pop, he celebrates freedom, reinvention, and the art of moving at your own speed.

name: Alumni Cloud
description:
Alumni Cloud is a hip-hop artist from Orlando, Florida, known for elite freestyle ability, sharp lyricism, and proven global reach as an independent artist. His breakout single “Two Cents” reached #1 on Spotify’s Viral Charts in multiple countries, driving his catalog and introducing his music to an international audience. The record’s viral success marked a turning point, solidifying Alumni Cloud as an artist capable of charting worldwide without major-label backing.
Blending confident delivery with introspective storytelling, Alumni Cloud’s music connects authenticity with modern hip-hop energy. His performances are defined by crowd control, lyrical precision, and the rare ability to freestyle at a high level on command — a skill set that consistently separates him on stage.
With chart-topping viral success, multiple live competition wins, and a rapidly growing fanbase, Alumni Cloud continues to stand out as a dynamic performer and artist built for big stages.

name: Ama Louise
description: Blending her sweet tones with beautifully constructed lyricism, Ama Louise brings her own style of modern day R&B. With a sound that resonates and chills, the rising North London singer songwriter has a distinctive sound that she’s bringing to the music scene. She draws on influences from the likes of Jazmine Sullivan and Destiny’s Child amongst others, to create a sound that is reflective of her talent and craft. Ama Louise’s sultry and buttery music is born out of a love for music from the late era of 90s R&B and when paired with her keen sense of emotion and melody gives rise to music that evokes feelings from the listener. Born to French and Ghanaian parents, Ama Louise is ready to take the music scene by storm bringing her own personal twist to what R&B music means to her.

name: Amber Jaii
description: Amber Jaii is a multidisciplinary artist, producer, and DJ creating high energy music and experiences rooted in confidence, movement, and self-expression. Blending dance driven production with bold, genre-fluid sound, she designs every layer of her world. From music and visuals to live sets and curated events. AJaii’s work invites audiences to step into their power, move freely, and feel unapologetically themselves!

name: Amie Blu
description: “Rich with honesty and unbridled emotion” (Rolling Stone UK), Amie Blu feels perfectly at home in a new wave of alternative artists - Mk.gee, Dijon, SZA - whose casual handle on genre nonetheless feels completely rooted in classic, crafted songwriting. Born of French heritage in South East London, Amie cut her teeth in community projects growing up - ArtsTrain, Flames Collective – whilst developing her sound, and sense of self, across 2024 mixtape how we lose. Introspective but frank, songs like ‘everything about her’ showed a poetic brand of realism - and soulful, stop-you-in-your-tracks voice - way beyond Amie Blu’s years. Since then, Amie has opened for Joy Crookes, Jacob Banks, Faye Webster and sold-out her own headline dates as she builds up to 2025's debut album, when all is said and done. Featuring acclaimed singles like 'swimming in pity', 'shadow', and 'missing everything', it's a record drenched in feeling; startling explorations of love, loss, depression and human connection, but ultimately about the relationship with the self. Far from an exploration of endings, when all is said and done is the start of something truly special from Amie Blu.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: amri
description:
amri fuses her Indian roots into putting a spin on her much-loved Soul and R&B to create a fresh, new, jazzy, colourful sound. Branching into a range of sounds built in Carnatic melodies, amri balances relatable lyrics to a fun, fresh groove. Born and primarily brought up in London alongside Guernsey, she draws from these experiences in her writing. With so many inspirations she branches from, her soulful, sweet melodies will surely hold a piece of something you love and play over in your head!

She touches on her exposure in the world as a young woman of colour, translating this into getting you to feel, sing and move with her. Her debut EP ‘grooves in a SMILE’ invites you into her world to feel, sing and move with her. Having been interviewed on BBC Bristol’s Breakfast show, songs featured on BBC Introducing Radio and showcased in RESONATE and KICKDRUM magazines, amri has been gaining attention, and seems not to be slowing down.
Now based in Bristol with her band, her blend of the smooth, sultry edges of jazz and soul, combined with brass and sitar, creates a unique fusion that’s not one to miss..

name: Amy Gadiaga
description:
As a bassist, vocalist, and composer, my journey as a music creator has been shaped by my rich cultural heritage and passion for blending traditional jazz with contemporary influences. I grew up in the suburbs of Paris, born to parents of Senegalese, Gambian, and Malian descent. This background continues to inspire my artistry, which merges the sounds of jazz legends like Betty Carter and Wayne Shorter with the soulful rhythms of artists such as D’Angelo and Stevie Wonder.

Since moving to London at 18 to study double bass at Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance, I have built a strong live track record, performing at renowned festivals and venues including the EFG London Jazz Festival, Jazz Café, Cheltenham Jazz Festival, We Out Here, Brick Lane Jazz Festival, and Pizza Express Soho. These experiences have been pivotal in building my fanbase and establishing my presence in the UK. Internationally I have performed at the Montreux Jazz Festival and countries around the world including France, Poland , South Korea and more.

name: Ananto
description:
Ananto is a multifaceted saxophonist, singer, and rapper whose sound lives at the intersection of heritage and modern expression. Drawing from his Indian roots and deep influences in jazz and R&B, Ananto creates music that feels both timeless and forward-thinking.

Rooted in improvisation and groove, his saxophone work carries the emotional depth of jazz while his vocals and rap bring a contemporary edge shaped by soul, rhythm, and storytelling. Ananto seamlessly blends melodic phrasing with rhythmic flow, crafting performances that move fluidly between genres without losing authenticity.

Inspired by the richness of Indian musical identity and the expressive freedom of jazz and R&B, Ananto’s artistry is a celebration of cultural fusion. Whether on stage or in the studio, he uses music as a bridge—connecting tradition and innovation, discipline and spontaneity, sound and story.

With a distinct voice and an ever-evolving sound, Ananto represents a new generation of artists unafraid to honor their roots while redefining the boundaries of modern music.

name: Anaya Kobe
description:
Anaya Kobe is a Houston-based Hip-Hop and R&B artist originally from Columbus, Ohio, known for her emotionally resonant lyricism, refined storytelling, and moody, early-2000s-inspired aesthetic. A classically trained musician and lifelong creative, she blends soulful melodies with incisive rap, exploring themes of love, power, vulnerability, and personal reckoning.

Her most-streamed single, “Love Sick,” has connected deeply with listeners, showcasing her ability to translate emotional complexity into memorable hooks and intimate songwriting.

In 2025, Anaya released her second EP, Lord Save Me, a fully self-directed, zero-budget visual project that reflects her commitment to cohesive storytelling and independent creative control. She was selected as an official SXSW Artist for 2025 and has been featured in The Austin Chronicle for her live performances, recognized for their commanding presence and genre-blending sound.

With a growing catalog and a distinct visual identity, Anaya Kobe continues to carve out her own lane — poised, emotionally compelling, and unmistakably her own

name: Ancient Greece
description: Ancient Greece hails from the underworld of the Toronto music scene. This is the odyssey of a band stitched together not just by music but by camaraderie and a penchant for the anarchic. Raspy echoes, beating drums, guttural chords, and sharp melodic riffs weave tales of urban decay and what it means to be chewed up, swallowed alive, and come out the other end kicking and screaming.

name: Andrea Daniela
description:
Andrea Daniela was born to be on stage. A dynamic singer, violinist, dancer, and actor raised in Houston, she blends deep mariachi roots with a fearless, modern edge. Her career has taken her to international stages and acclaimed theatrical productions, earning recognition for both her powerful voice and magnetic presence.

Now based in Austin, Andrea steps into a new era with her debut album “Mariachi Mestiza y Mala Mujer” a bold fusion of mariachi, cumbia, pop, and hip-hop that celebrates culture, duality, womanhood, and self-made artistry. As the founder of Houston’s first all-female mariachi band and the creative force behind her own talent agency, she continues to redefine what mariachi means for the next generation.

name: Andrew Cushin
description:
Firmly established as an artist’s artist with the likes of Noel Gallagher, Sam Fender, Louis Tomlinson and Pete Doherty.
Andrew Cushin is primed to rise to the next level with the May 2nd release of his second album ‘Love
Is For Everyone’. Building upon his acclaimed debut ‘Waiting For The Rain’. The 2nd album charted in the UK official top 40 album charts.
Andrew recently teamed up with his local brewery Anarchy Brew Co to create his own L.I.F.E IPA beer,
which is now available from their website. It represents his latest brand collaboration after being invited to headline
The Soundcheck, the debut live event from the Aston Martin Aramco Formula One team, late last year. Andrew has played Italian, Dutch and British GP with Aston Martin F1 team in 2025.
Andrew toured the full UK headline in May and October 2025 as well as EU . He is currently on his 3rd successive year of touring North American/Canada headline tour.
In October 25th 2025 Andrew Cushin sold out his hometown show at Newcastle City Hall in front of 2500 fans.
2025 has been a huge success for Andrew Cushin breaking through the top 40 and now firmly establishing himself as a firm favourite in the UK live scene.
location: NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE, UNITED KINGDOM, ENGLAND

name: Angela Autumn
description: Angela Autumn is a songwriter and banjo player from a forgotten steel town. Strongly tied to the buried stories of her childhood, her dark country songs reinvent folk tradition through the lens of eco-feminist transcendentalism. The singer’s straightforward lack of pretension speaks from the vantage point of the outsider— and, often — the sounds of the unspoken.

name: ANJA SCHNEIDER
description:
Anja Schneider is a DJ, producer, radio broadcaster, label boss, tireless creative force and mentor. She was recognised in 2021 with the award of an Honour Prize by The Berlin Music Commission for having had “an outstanding impact on the music scene” as recognition for her work supporting fellow artists and cultural institutions.

Anja continues to operate as one of electronic music’s most vital artists, currently focused on multiple projects. Including her 20th anniversary as a professional DJ and producer featuring an array of internationally recognized artists and worldwide gigs. Her 'Club Room' radio show that just crossed the mark of over 300 episodes, the freshly launched 'The Story / Loveparade' podcast that gained remarkable recognition in the scene and last but not least a new, monthly party series 'PuMp' at Tresor’s little sibling OHM.

name: Anna Shoemaker
description: Following the release of her 2023 EP Hey Anna, a breakup, and a move, Anna Shoemaker’s 2025 album 'Someone Should Stop Her' marked the start of a transformative new chapter for her. Known for her alt-leaning production, intoxicating pop melodies, and unflinching lyricism, Anna’s music vividly captures the turbulence, charm, and self-reflection of young adulthood. Recorded in Nashville, the album captures her personal evolution as she embraces a fresh, stripped-back sound, moving beyond the synth-heavy production that defined her debut album Everything Is Fine (I’m Only On Fire).

name: Armen Paul
description:
Armen Paul is a multi-platinum artist, songwriter and instrumentalist. His latest collaboration, "Hope" received 3x platinum certification in 2025 (#1 on national radio, #3 on UK dance radio). He performed the song in July at Tomorrowland 2023 in Belgium. Armen’s solo work took off when Bella Poarch (#3 top TikTok creator worldwide) and Tony Hawk featured his song "Devil Knows" in their social content (accumulating +175M views on TikTok). His work has received notable acclaim on DSPs with +50M streams ('New Music Friday' in +10 countries, 9 Spotify 'Viral 50' Charts).

He’ll be releasing a collaboration EP produced by Moby in 2026 with a single collaboration with Don Diablo and remix from Brooks. Armen also has an upcoming single with Nicky Romero.

Armen’s music has been licensed by WWE, Adobe, Lyft, and Samsung, and he secured a sync in the feature film titled 'The System' starring Tyrese Gibson & Lil' Yachty (October 2022). His recent Eurovision placement “Survivor” qualified for the 2025 Grand Final in Basel, Switzerland for +160 Million viewers, aired on Peacock globally, and reached Spotify’s Top 50 Global Viral Chart and the Spotify Viral 50 Charts in 25 Countries.

name: Arroba Nat
description: Just a girl, with her feelings and a guitar.

name: ARXX
description:
Queer Brighton powerpop besties Hanni (they/them) and Clara (she/her) released their second album ‘Good Boy’ in Autumn 2024. They’ve toured with MUNA, Fletcher, Yungblud and The Big Moon, and they composed several original songs performed by the cast of BBC drama Riot Women, which aired in Autumn 2025.

They are currently working on their third album with longterm collaborator Steve Ansell (Blood Red Shoes), which will continue their mission to spread queer joy in 2026 and beyond.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Astralorp
description: They define themselves “Discomatica”: an electric guitar that becomes a synthesizer, were a classic arpeggio moves bass and melody in a flowing counterpoint as if it were three instruments in one, and a drumbeat that flows between disco, dance, math-rock and alternative, all with a video game feel. Everything is recorded live! An electronic DJ set played with feet and fingers by guitarist Andrea Faccioli (already with Vasco Brondi, Le Luci Della Centrale Elettrica, Baustelle, Cisco), and drummer Niccolò Fornabaio (already with Vasco Brondi, Le Luci Della Centrale Elettrica, Vinicio Capossela, Marlene Kuntz).

name: Astrokeyy
description:
Astrokeyy is a Houston-based hip-hop artist carving his own lane with sharp lyricism, atmospheric production, and a sound rooted in Southern culture with a forward-thinking edge. Known for his commanding live presence, Astrokeyy has been selected as an **official SXSW artist twice**, cementing his reputation as a standout performer on one of the world’s most influential stages.

He has shared stages with respected names in hip-hop including **Rome Streetz, Jay Worthy, and Devin The Dude**, holding his own alongside both underground heavyweights and Southern legends. Recently, Astrokeyy released his latest project "Southern Hospitality" fully produced by Marc Spano and executive produced by Dough Networkz a cohesive body of work that highlights his growth, Southern identity, and refined sonic vision.

Blending raw storytelling, confident delivery, and hypnotic beats, Astrokeyy represents the grind, ambition, and creativity of Houston’s new generation. With momentum fueled by high-profile performances and a focused artistic direction, he continues pushing his sound forward with longevity, authenticity, and impact in mind.

name: Atsuko Chiba
description: Montréal’s Atsuko Chiba offer “pounding, angular rock” (BrooklynVegan), venturesomely crossing genre-defining borders with a cohesive and hypnotic blend of post-rock, progressive rock, and krautrock, weaving together a rich sonic tapestry that subverts through offbeat songwriting. In concert, they combine their unique brand of experimental rock with video and light installations triggered in real time by the band. While touring Canada, the United States, Europe, and the United Kingdom with their telepathic audiovisual tempest, the outfit have shared the stage with the likes of ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead, Big Business, King Buffalo, and Duchess Says, also playing notable events such as Portals Festival, SXSW, and M for Montreal. Since 2013, they have released three full-length albums (Jinn, Trace, and Water, It Feels Like It’s Growing), two EPs (Figure and Ground and The Memory Empire), as well as a slew of singles. After offering booming tracks “Pope’s Cocaine” and “Climax Therapy” in the Summer of 2025, the five-piece unveil Atsuko Chiba on April 24th, 2026 via Mothland.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: Attalie
description:
Attalie is a California-based music seamstress whose sound lives at the intersection of jazz, alternative R&B, and neo-soul. Her music serves as a sanctuary — a space where listeners are invited to let their guard down, look inward, and reconnect with themselves, empowered to be and become in spite of societal norms.

Her work has received critical acclaim and has been featured by The Guardian, The FADER, CLASH, Mixmag, BBC Radio 1Xtra, KEXP, KCRW, NTS Live and more.

She is currently unveiling a new chapter of her work led by two visual singles, Carry Me and Light, both offering an intimate glimpse into the sonic and visual world of her upcoming project, set for release in 2026.

name: Avanti Patel
description:
Avanti Patel is a multi genre Musician based out of Mumbai- A hindustani classical vocalist, playback singer, theatre maker & composer.
She started learning Hindustani Classical Vocals at age 5 and is currently training with Padmashri Vidushi Ashwini Bhide Deshpande of the Jaipur Atrauli Gharana.

Among her most recent projects is O Gaanewali, a theatre-concert-piece based on the lives and music of the Courtesans, Tawaifs and Women performers in India. O Gaanewali has been widely performed, with over 75 live shows across several Indian cities and festivals like Jashn-e-Rekhta, Magnetic Fields in Rajasthan, Serendipity Arts Festival in Goa, and legacy venues like The Royal Opera House and Prithvi Theatre in Mumbai.

Avanti is currently producing her 2nd EP titled 'O Gaanewali Session 2', after the success of her debut EP released last year, titled ‘O Gaanewali Session 1’. Both EPs include the genres of Thumri, Dadra, Ghazal with a classic ‘old world meets contemporary’ style of production, available on all music streaming platforms and on Youtube.

name: Azamiah
description:
Primed to be the next group from the UK jazz underground to break out, Azamiah draw on
jazz roots while touching on everything from James Blake’s production techniques to dubby
low-end, taking the listener on a journey across moody and light landscapes. Their 2023
debut album ‘In Phases’ won praise from The Skinny and CLASH and received plays on BBC
6Music and NTS. A bridge between first album, and second, their recent EP ‘Two Lands’
released in May 2025 resonates with emotional honesty and is played with a fresh intensity.
The band has played on stages across the UK and Europe including Latitude Festival, Jazz on Wick, Hidden Door, Edinburgh Jazz and Blues Festival, Brick Lane Jazz Festival, JAZZMI (IT) & North Sea Round Town (NL). Having recently completed their first UK headline tour in October 2025 to electric audiences in Glasgow, London, Bristol, Manchester, Leeds and Brighton and flooded with requests for a re-press of 'In Phases', a dedicated fanbase is making themselves known.

name: Babatunde Hip Hopera
description:
Babatunde Akinboboye is an internationally celebrated Nigerian-American baritone and the pioneering force behind Hip Hopera—a bold, genre-defying fusion of classical opera and hip-hop. With a powerful operatic voice and magnetic stage presence, Babatunde merges centuries-old vocal mastery with the cultural pulse of modern Black music, creating a sound that is as revolutionary as it is resonant.
Born of Nigerian descent and classically trained in Western opera, Babatunde’s unique cultural and musical background fuels his mission to make opera more accessible and culturally relevant. His breakout moment came in 2018 when he went viral for blending Rossini’s Largo al Factotum with Kendrick Lamar’s HUMBLE—a performance that amassed over 10 million views and earned global media coverage from TIME, MSN, and Classic FM.

Since then, Babatunde has refined Hip Hopera into a distinct artistic movement, captivating audiences across the world through both digital platforms and live performance. With a loyal global following in the millions, he has become a cultural influencer who is using his voice—literally and figuratively—to expand the boundaries of what opera can be.
His classical résumé is just as compelling. He has performed lead roles with renowned companies such as Los Angeles Opera, Detroit Opera, and Utah Opera, including standout performances in The Central Park Five, Carmen, and Faust. A passionate advocate for African and African American composers, Babatunde brings visibility and vitality to voices often excluded from the classical canon.

Following his successful City Winery tour, Babatunde is preparing to release his debut studio album and headline an international tour in 2026—a showcase of how Hip Hopera continues to evolve as both an art form and a cultural bridge.

name: BALACLAVA
description:
BIRTHED FROM NYC WASTE WATER AND SOAKED IN FORMALDEHYDE, BALACLAVA ANSWERS THE LIFE LONG QUESTION OF WHAT ANIMATED TRASH WOULD SOUND LIKE.

BALACLAVA INVITES YOU INTO THE FRAY, WASTES NO TIME, HANDS YOU A DRINK, AND DELIVERS WHAT YOU'VE BEEN MISSING. THE DISTRACTION YOU NEEDED. THE ANTIDOTE TO THE BUMMER. BALACLAVA IS SCUZZED UP, BEER SOAKED, SYNTH SWIRLING, NECK TWISTING, MUSLCE MOVING, GAIN CRANKED, SUGARY SWEET PUNK TUNES THAT LEAVE YOU WITH EAR WORMS THAT BORROW FOR DAYS TO COME. OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS BALA HAVE BEEN CUTTING THEIR TEETH ON JUST ABOUT EVERY DIRTY NYC VENUE FLOOR, LEAVING THOSE WHO ATTEND A SHOW SWEATY, HAPPY, AND HOOKED. FOR LOVERS OF LOUD GUITARS, DELAY SOAKED VOCALS, CRUNCHED UP BASS, OR THE HEAT THAT LINGERS IN THE ROOM ONCE THE SHOW HAS ENDED, LOOK NO FURTHER. SO POUR ANOTHER, PET A DOG, KISS YOUR HOMIES, GRAB A LOVER, PICK UP YOUR FEET AND ENJOY. BALACLAVA LOVES YOU.

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: The Band Loula
description: North Georgia natives and longtime friends, The Band Loula—Malachi Mills and Logan Simmons—is poised for a big breakout with the release of their highly anticipated debut EP, Sweet Southern Summer. Produced by John Osborne (Brothers Osborne) with additional production from Greg Bieck (Little Big Town), the EP spotlights the duo’s powerful storytelling and unique swampgrass sound and consists of six tracks including their standout single, “Running Off The Angels,” which Billboard calls “An immensely promising release,” while All Country News declares, “a haunting, culturally charged ballad that cements their place as one of the genre’s most compelling new acts.” The Band Loula continues to garner widespread attention across the industry with their undeniable chemistry and near-blood harmonies, and recently made their Grand Ole Opry debut, for which they received a standing ovation. Powerful live performers, The Band Loula spent the summer 2025 with Dierks Bentley and Zach Top as part of Bentley’s Broken Branches Tour and has spent much of the past few years touring alongside artists such as Brothers Osborne, Ashley McBryde, Paul Cauthen, Elle King, Brent Cobb and Lukas Nelson.

name: Bandana Cheyenna
description: A prolific songwriter & soulful artist blending country, folk, & pop with witty, emotionally rich storytelling, "hippie songbird" BANDANA CHEYENNA is one to watch in today's music landscape. Already known as one of Nashville's hitmakers, their notable writing credits include Dasha’s global billion-stream hit “Austin (Boots Stop Workin’)," Alexandra Kay’s viral track "Cupid's A Cowgirl,” & more. As an artist, Cheyenna has released two full albums, & most recently Act I of a four-part EP series, "The Artist's Pilgrimage," which was celebrated with a sold-out release party on Music Row. Cheyenna has appeared on radio home of the Grand Ole Opry WSM-AM, performed at Nashville's Pride Festival & legendary Bluebird Café, & is gearing up for a performance on Austin’s major TV network coinciding with their SXSW appearance. A winner of Female Song of the Year at the 2024 People’s Choice Country Awards, & honoree at the 2024 & 2025 ASCAP Awards, their collaborative work includes artists & producers Gayle, Abby Anderson, Breland, Caylee Hammack, Dan Wilson (Chris Stapleton, Adele), Jonah Marais (Why Don’t We), MaRynn Taylor, Mickey Guyton, Nathan Chapman (Taylor Swift), Tigirlily Gold & more.

name: Bára Zmeková
description:
“Dreamlike.” “Poetic.” “Beautiful.” — this is how audiences describe Bára Zmeková’s performances.
The moment she steps on stage, intimacy and imagination take over. A Prague-based singer, pianist and composer, she draws from the rich Czech singer-songwriter tradition while blending it with modern jazz and subtle electronics, creating music that feels both deeply rooted and strikingly contemporary.
Her expression is civil yet emotionally powerful, inviting listeners into an inner world shaped by melody, atmosphere and nuance. Although she sings in Czech, language is never a barrier; the natural rhythm and softness of the language add a distinctive colour to her sound. Audiences across Europe and Japan consistently respond beyond words.
Her trio moves between quiet minimalism and expressive intensity, built on strong melodies and precise interplay.
The critically acclaimed Lunaves established her as one of the distinctive voices of the contemporary Czech scene. In 2024 came the album Jediný na světě, followed by the single Jiné stromy, recorded with Norwegian tubist Daniel Herskedal.
Following their second Japan tour in early 2026, the trio heads to SXSW directly from Tokyo.

name: BARTLY
description:
Based in Austin, TX, BARTLY is a soul-Americana singer-songwriter whose powerful voice and honest songwriting reflect a life spent on the move. Drawing inspiration from artists like Chris Stapleton, Marcus King, and Bruno Mars, BARTLY delivers a fresh, modern take on soul and Americana.
His growing list of accomplishments includes representing Jack Daniel’s on Willie Nelson’s ranch for Luck Reunion’s Look West festival, Also YETI for F1 weeekend, performing at Antone’s to a packed 200+ crowd opening for The Mammoths, and appearing at Utopia Fest with artists like Sir Woman, Butcher Brown, and Ghostland Observatory. He has been featured twice on FOX7 Good Morning Austin, performed on the Main Stage at the historic Pecan Street Festival, and hosted the official Stubb’s afterparty for Saint Motel.

BARTLY is set to appear on the 2026 season of American Idol, premiering this January—continuing his rise as one of Austin’s most promising new voices.

name: Basht.
description:
"Basht. are an Irish band whose backgrounds collide into something heavy and hungry." - DORK

Following on from a year of supporting Wunderhorse on tour, as well as shows with Been Stellar, Goo Goo Dolls and Deadletter, Basht. have earned their stripes with emphatic live performances. Having propelled themselves up to being one of the hottest rock/alternative acts, whispers of more new music on the horizon leaves many in eager anticipation for 2026.

name: Batry Powr (Nicole Miglis)
description:
Batry Powr is Hundred Waters frontwoman Nicole Miglis exploring long-form meditation music with battery-powered instruments.

Nicole Miglis is a songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and producer who's music has been featured in publications including Pitchfork, Stereogum, Rolling Stone, NPR and The New York Times. Her band Hundred Waters have performed on the David Letterman and Stephen Colbert late night shows, as well as festivals including Coachella, Bonnaroo, and the band’s own festival FORM. From 2022-24 she toured as the lead vocalist for Bonobo’s Fragments world tour, and artist with whom she’s collaborated with, most recently for the 2025 soundtrack of Shinichirō Watanabe’s latest anime series, Lazarus.

Her live performances feature her love of blending electronic and acoustic instrumentation, and background in classical piano, into a musical form form all her own.

name: Bayonne
description: Since his 2016 debut album Primitives, Bayonne has channeled his vast imagination into an elegant yet wildly experimental form of electronic pop, equal parts meditative and mesmerizing. In the making of his latest body of work, the Austin-based artist/producer/multi-instrumentalist otherwise known as Roger Sellers found himself in even greater need of an outlet for his kinetic creative impulses, thanks to an intense convergence of events in his personal life: his father’s diagnosis with and eventual death from cancer, the end of a significant relationship, and an overwhelming struggle with depression and anxiety. Deeply informed by a deliberate transformation of his musical process, Bayonne’s third full-length Temporary Time ultimately makes for his most expansive work to date—an album of both painfully raw introspection and otherworldly beauty.

name: Bea Porges
description:
Blending together the sounds of indie pop and folk melodies, Bea Porges lives in her own lyrical world. Throughout the years, the 25 year old singer songwriter has been working her way through the scenes of Atlanta and Athens, GA, and billing with touring acts such as hey, nothing, Infinity Songs, and Trash Panda. Her songwriting has a penchant for detail and wit, creating images that feel simultaneously personal and nostalgic.

While her love for solo songwriting is at the core of her musical endeavors, Bea performs as a five piece, turning acoustic songs into powerful and danceable live show that compliments her truthful lyrics.

Filled with electric guitar and sprinkled with the sounds of banjo and lap steel, Bea’s 2025 EP, “The Cure, The Cause, The Killer,” explores feelings of desire, longing, and letting go with nods to the artists and genres that inspire her most. Through her love for songwriting and creating a symphony of sound from scratch, Bea channels her inner lyrical world into lived experience that is fuller and brighter.

name: Ben Ellis
description:
At just 23, Cardiff-born singer-songwriter Ben Ellis has become one of the UK’s most quietly magnetic new voices, blending intimate acoustic songwriting with the emotional depth of indie-pop. His upcoming third EP marks a pivotal moment both emotionally and musically. Written across two trips to Los Angeles in the aftermath of a breakup, the project explores the complexities of heartbreak, drifting between moments of clarity and confusion.

“There was so much love still there,” Ellis says. “It’s crazy how art kind of comes from those moments.” Lead single “Where She Goes” emerged from a journal entry written the day after the breakup.

From there, the EP grew into a layered and collaborative body of work. Tracks like “When It Ends” push into rock territory with biting guitars, while “Animal” leans into warm, ’70s-inspired folk textures reminiscent of Fleetwood Mac. Co-produced by Grammy-nominated Matt Rad and longtime collaborator James October, the sessions saw Ellis push himself creatively, from late-night listens to Damien Rice to recording live drums at LA’s legendary Studio 606.

name: Ben Flournoy
description:
I’m Ben Flournoy from Quincy, FL. When I was 10 years old, I saw Marty McFly play Johnny B. Goode in Back To The Future, and the world was never the same to me.

I got my hands on a guitar and never let go. At 15 years old I decided to dedicate my life to playing the guitar, writing music, touring and living the life of an artist.

I owe a lot to my heroes Stevie Ray Vaughan, B.B. King, Albert King, Jimi Hendrix, Eric Clapton and John Mayer, but I’m here to forge my own path and creating my own sound.

name: better joy
description:
“I like that the better joy sound’s evolving; it’s what we do as people, so it’s only natural the sound grows with me” says Bria Keely, better known by her stage name - better joy. A vivid indie-pop guitar project backed by a band, better joy fuses sparky melodies with strong guitars and pulsating bass lines, coated in lyrics that delve deep into all things vulnerable. The upcoming EP ‘at dusk’, a sister EP to her debut ‘heading into blue’, reflects a moment in her life “where I just stopped trying to please anyone or caring whether the music I wrote ‘fit’ a mold. It’s not on anyone else to define what better joy is: it’s on me”.

Originally a singer-songwriter, Bria’s route into the indie guitar scene wasn’t conventional: ‘I’m not one of those musicians who grew up on The Cure or played in guitar bands when I was a teenager: I was listening to pop and that’s about it!’. A piano player and singer from a young age, it wasn’t until uni when she sang at the piano after a night out that her friends encouraged her to consider music as a career and she started writing her own music. “I was pretty bad at first, but I just kept at it. And now songwriting is something I can’t live without: for me, it’s therapy”. It was during this period that she started to fall in love with guitar bands, from Wunderhorse and Phoebe Bridgers to 80s guitar bands like The Cure and Mazzy Star, influences that have impacted the sonic development of better joy.

With her music described by BBC Radio 6 as bright, indie pop, better joy burst on the scene in 2024 with a string of singles and successful support tours; the start of 2025 saw a sell out of vinyls of her debut EP ‘heading into blue’ and a near sold out 10 city UK and EU debut headline tour in March 2025. And 2025 isn’t slowing down: she’s the main UK & EU support for Amy Macdonald in November and February 2026. “I still can’t get my head round it, to be honest. I was playing to a Glasgow audience of 100 people in March and in December I’ll be playing to over 13,000 at the Hydro Arena: it’s a bit bonkers”.

Produced by Mike Hedges (The Cure, Manic Street Preachers, U2), mixed by Caesar Edmunds (Wet Leg, Beach House) and Robbie Nelson (Rolling Stones, Gregory Porter, Beck) and recorded at Chale Abbey Studios on the Isle of Wight, the 6-track EP, ‘at dusk’ is the antidote to the previously sunny introduction to better joy, ‘heading into blue’. Where naivety and openness shone through before, ‘at dusk’ is more contemplative and vulnerable. “It’s so normal to go headfirst into something, whether it be a relationship or a situation, with positivity and excitement, then for reality to leave you a bit jaded and changed” she explains. Whilst the bright and jangly guitars still shine through, it’s lyrics like ‘I never showed you the heavy metal in my bones’ and ‘watch me push against the clouds’ that clearly mark the tonal shift. But in true better joy fashion, the whole EP is uplifting and whilst it acts as a bookend to the debut EP, it leaves the listener hopeful for what music is coming next; the EP is “closing a chapter of my life where insecurity and self-doubt dominated my everyday experience. It’s me accepting the vulnerability that I felt and kind of promising that I’m gonna back myself from now on”.

‘At dusk’ dances the indie-pop line with authenticity and joy, mixing dark and light tones and sounds, with a big injection of nostalgia. The first single, ‘this part of town’ is about embracing the unknown of relationships and acknowledging the fear that comes with vulnerability: “Eurgh, I hate being vulnerable, it’s really not my bag, but then I realised it’s such a universal feeling and sometimes you just have to accept it comes with being in unknown territory”. ‘steamroller’ is a dark and haunting anthem for anyone who has ever been trampled on by a ‘steamroller’. Bria recalls holding it back from her live set until her team encouraged her to try it, and the first time she did, she burst into tears - something that still happens now. ‘plugged in’ is a love song, for those people who go through their life believing they’re not made for love, until they meet their person and ‘i’m there’ is a thank you to the person who waited for you to come home to them. ‘big thief’ is about taking back your power, before the EP finishes with the beautiful ‘so long’, a goodbye to something that could have been.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: BettySoo
description:
BettySoo, a "Korean-Americana" artist raised by immigrant parents in Spring, Texas, grew up on a steady diet of classical music, the Great American songbook, country radio, and the jewels of folk songwriters and Texas songwriting legends. If Heat Sin Water Sin (with Gurf Morlix) built her audience, When We’re Gone (2014) firmed her place in the first rank of songwriters, and 2025's If You Never Go Away proved her staying power.
She’s won awards and played festivals/shows: Kerrville, Mountain Stage, SXSW, Calgary, E-Town, BBC2 with Bob Harris.

In addition to a heavy touring schedule, she has been a go-to harmony vocal singer and arranger for dozens of artists' albums, including Eliza Gilkyson, James McMurtry, Robert Harrison, Jaimee Harris, Bonnie Whitmore, Graham Weber, and others.

Pre-pandemic, BettySoo toured solo, and as a member of multiple bands. Since 2022, she has been touring internationally in support of (and as a member of the band for) both James McMurtry and Chris Smither.

name: Big Fat Head
description: Big Fat Head is a byproduct of 21st century indulgence and a band consumed by sin. Based in Columbus, Ohio, this five-piece rock outfit has been categorized as “post-post-post punk” and “skuzz rock” by fans and enemies alike. First conceived by frontman Nate Wilder during a weekend visit in jail, a consistent live band was ultimately formed with partner Olivia Stefanoff and close friends Jordan Latas, Stanic Russ, and Felicity Gunn in the aftermath of Covid. Since 2021, Big Fat Head has maintained loyalty to their homegrown tape label and oft slept-on Ohio rock scene, self-released over 40 songs, played nearly 200 shows, with over 75 out of town. While sharing a scene in the shadow of Ohio legends like Devo, Breeders, Times New Viking, etc. with bands like Golomb, Villagerrr, Winston Hightower, DANA, & countless others, Big Fat Head carved their own niche-within-a-niche and found opportunities opening for national acts such as Being Dead, TAGABOW, Sweeping Promises, Wishy, Bnny, GOON, Speedy Ortiz, Lewsberg, & more. With two finished albums in their back pocket and no outside support to date, Big Fat Head embarks to Austin, Texas looking for love with their hearts on their sleeves.

name: Big Soto
description: Gustavo Rafael Guerrero Soto, known professionally as Big Soto, is a Venezuelan singer and songwriter recognized for blending synthwave and city pop with trap, R&B, reggaetón, hip-hop, and soul. Born on October 19, 1996, in Cumaná, Venezuela, he began his career in 2017 and quickly became a pioneer of these sounds in his country, building a global audience with over 3 million monthly listeners on Spotify. Big Soto stands out for his fresh sonic identity and introspective lyrics that reflect everyday life experiences. In October 2024, he released SOTORIUS, an album filled with deeply personal stories that further strengthened his connection with fans. Throughout his career, he has collaborated with artists such as Eladio Carrión, Neutro Shorty, Santa Fe Klan, Danny Ocean, Mora, Junior H, Farruko, Jowell & Randy, Lunay, and Gera MX. His music has been recognized at multiple award ceremonies, positioning him as one of the most promising artists of his generation. Notable songs from his catalog include “Todo Va a Estar Bien,” “Vengo de Nada,” “La Noche Entera,” “Mezcalito en Copa,” and “El Favorito de Mami.”

events.venue: Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: Bijaan
description: “Whether I’m welcome or not” raps Bijaan on the opening bar of his debut single, “Jungle”, a line that immediately sets the tone for an artist unafraid to claim his space. Bijaan is a Calgary-based MC whose artistry bridges contents and cultures and has already captured the attention of major DSPs, key industry festivals, and fellow hip-hop artists and producers. Canadian born, with roots in East Africa and India, he brings a distinctly global perspective to hip-hop. Produced by the Polaris Prize-nominated hip-hop heavyweight Producer, Junia-T, “Jungle” is a bold exploration of identity, unapologetic self-belief, and belonging, anchored by Bijaan’s sharp lyricism and a unique, commanding delivery. From releasing mixtapes in high school, all the way to performing at major Canadian festivals and showcases such as NXNE, The JUNOs, Sled Island, Do It For The Culture, and Aurorapalooza, Bijaan has carved out his place as a rising voice in Canada’s hip-hop scene. Blending introspection with bravado, while taking inspiration from his varied cultural roots, he stands at the forefront of a new generation of artists redefining what it means to be global in hip-hop.

name: Blair Davie
description:
Blair Davie is a singer-songwriter from Perth, Scotland. Inspired by their love of emotional, heartfelt music from artists such as Dodie,
Dermot Kennedy and Bon Iver, Blair’s music is their way of presenting the most honest and passionate version of themself to the world.
Their music deals with coming to terms with their own bisexuality, loss and heartbreak; but also, the beauty that life can offer.

name: Blakchyl
description:
Rapper Blakchyl's (formerly known as T-Fly) is a talented, community-minded wordsmith, having come up in the local hip hop community collaborating with music collectives, nonprofits and filmmakers. The queer artist has three European tours under her belt plus opening slots for Talib Kweli, Snow Tha Product, Jean Grae, Bizzy Bone and Scarface and her new album Better Than I Imagined (produced by The Mask), was accompanied by a short film and dropped in July. Always indefatigable, she recently landed a deal with Brighton, UK-based Tru Thought Records as well as an Austin Chronicle cover, was nominated for Best Hip Hop Artist, released an EP (Call Me Sometimes) and played a Waterloo Records in-store. It all comes down to her
"powerful and effervescent songs" (CultureMap) and her love for the craft and it's community.

name: bloodsports
description:
Taking over the sweaty New York venues and curbside congregations that came to be
synonymous with the name, Bloodsports is set to release their long awaited debut LP Anything
Can Be A Hammer via brand new New York label Good English Records on October 17th.
Bloodsports has become an undeniable force amidst their latest line up, where members Sam
Murphy (guitar/vox), Jeremy Mock (Guitar), Liv Eriksen (bass/vox) and Scott Hale (drums) find
solace in the capitulation of sonic strain; where angular sedition blends with economical
melodies that lighten the load of the self-destruction that these songs embrace. But as bold as
their landscapes have been prior, Anything Can Be A Hammer finds the band embracing a more
dynamic approach, maturing in their techniques as these songs brim over with subtle fixations –
balancing a steady pace of experimentation and curiosity that linger amongst the rhythmic blows
and befuddling depths that the band confidently explores. Fragile, yet abundant, Bloodsports
leans into that patience that plays to our own interior designs, where Murphy’s lyricism is a
notion of both what we know and what we think we know, as it all comes to the fore when our
obsessions are at large. It’s an album that’s got blood in its veins and a finger on the pulse.

name: Bohemio
description:
Bohemio is a collective of friends from different cities, united by music and a shared creative vision. Blending their talent with natural charisma, they’ve taken off on social media, inviting audiences to connect with their youthful energy and rich musical roots.

Positioned at the forefront of the new wave of cumbia and regional Mexican music, Bohemio fuses the genre’s tradition with a fresh, original sound. They’ve built a highly engaged fanbase on TikTok and Instagram, where their modern cumbias frequently go viral and become part of their audience’s everyday soundtrack, setting them apart as one of the most promising acts in today’s regional scene.

name: bollyflow
description:
We're first generation Indian-Americans from Texas, who grew up blending our Desi roots with our American culture through music and dance.
With over 25 years of training in various dance styles such as Bollywood, Bharatnatyam, Kathak, Bhangra, Garba/Raas and Hip Hop., we came together and added a modern touch to our style, transitioning to Bollywood Fusion, Semi-Classical, Tollywood and more!

After years of professional training, dance companies, dancing in UT Austin's Bollywood Dance team, Texas Mohini, and dancing professionally in Los Angeles, our journey has brought us back to Austin, where we were eager to keep our passion for dance alive.

In 2023, bollyflow was born–a space to create fusing our unique dance styles and share the joy of dance with our community through workshops, events and wedding choreography!

name: Boogietraxx
description:
As a rhythmic renovator of retro funk, Boogietraxx offers a lens into the discoverse that brought dance music to the masses but offers a uniquely soulful and modern twist.
Born in Staten Island, NY and now living in Austin, TX for the last few years, Boogietraxx, is helmed by producer/DJ Brandon Keeks who brings an array of influences in his soundscapes that feature filter house, French touch, and filter funk.

Brought up on a nutritious diet of Prince, Kashif, George Benson, Daft Punk, DJ Falcon, Romanthony, and countless others, Boogietraxx’s sound is rooted in the future with accentuated basslines and laser-guided melodies.

Fresh off of landing a #1 Nu-Disco/Disco best selling vinyl release on Juno.uk, Boogietraxx’s music has been supported by the likes of David Penn, Chromeo, Disco Dom, Don Diablo, and even had his music spun at Coachella by Barry Can’t Swim. After a busy 2025 traveling to cities like Chicago, New York City, Seattle, Madison, and more, there's no stopping where Boogie can go to next.

name: Boooka
description: Boooka is an Austin-based hip-hop artist, curator, and creative director known for blending sharp lyricism with intentional storytelling. As the founder of SUMN2SAY, he has built a platform dedicated to spotlighting independent artists and cultivating real community through live experiences. With the release of his 2026 album BTS, Boooka continues to push his sound forward—balancing introspection, ambition, and culture while creating opportunities both on and off the stage.

name: Boutique Feelings
description: Dusted with elements of psychedelia, compounded by ethereal sonic landscapes, and catapulted by melodic rhyme schemes, Boutique Feelings (Montréal, CA) invites reflection on socio-political norms while offering an alternative take on hip-hop. Subverting traditional compositional techniques, this new project from Karim Lakhdar—known as the singer, guitarist, and keyboardist for progressive psych rock collective, Atsuko Chiba—explores themes of cultural and personal identity through vivid offbeat storytelling and catchy distortion-mangled hooks, resulting in music that toes the line between rap, psychedelic funk, trip-hop, krautrock, as well as sample-based and electroacoustic music.

name: Brainwasher
description: Brainwasher (Oklahoma City) is the brainchild of Matthew Duckworth Kirksey (vocals, drums, keyboards, sampler) and Tommy McKenzie (guitar, bass, keyboards, sampler), known for their involvement in celebrated acts such as The Flaming Lips, Miley Cyrus, Brothers Griiin, Beachy Head, and Net. The pair offers a meddled strain of trip-hop, touching on industrial, new wave, and shoegaze, in encapsulating stripped-down, psyched-out songs that connect directly with the lizard brain. Their debut full-length album, 39 Lightyears from Heaven, drops on October 24th, 2025 under Montréal boutique imprint Mothland.

name: The Braymores
description: The Braymores are an Alternative/Folk Rock group hailing from Chicago, IL. The group features members Matt Tilles (Vocals/Guitar), Keegan Melaniphy (Guitar), Russell Oren (Drums), and Connor Kohanzo (Bass). The band released their first EP ‘Talking to Trees’ in late 2023 followed by their debut LP ‘Who You’d Have Been’ in late 2024, receiving considerable underground buzz and cementing their position in the Chicago scene.

name: Bricknasty
description:
Conflict is interesting in art. It forces conversations, and asks questions that often still need to be answered. On “Black’s Law”, the third body of work from Irish quintet Bricknasty, some of society’s most complex topics are explored — religion, political disillusionment, nationalism, human mentality. For mercurial frontman/guitarist Fatboy and co, it’s less about seeing the light themselves — and more pointing others in the right direction.

The winding road to releasing the nine-track project has been arduous but enriching. After forming while studying at BIMM university in Dublin, the five initial members of the band, including the aforementioned masked maverick Fatboy, production whizz Cillian McCauley and drummer Korey Thomas, released their debut EP “INA CRUELER” via FAMM (Jorja Smith, Maverick Sabre) in June 2023, turning heads critically and garnering a loyal fan base with its idiosyncratic style and soulful tonal core.

Their inaugural project was a stinging reflection of Fatboy’s life in Ballymun, the troubled North Dublin estate where he grew up, and a vivid rumination of the familial turmoil and crippling addiction he endured during his young adulthood. But the band’s follow up mixtape a year later was “just songs,” the frontman says. That’s even what they named it — or “XONGZ አስቀያሚ ጡብ” to be precise.

Although by no means a sub par end product, Bricknasty internally were never quite content with “XONGZ”; and the assembling of the mixtape proved a tumultuous time for McCauley and Fatboy’s personal and professional relationship, having fallen out in the process of making its predecessor “INA CRUELER”. “[XONGZ”] wasn't really a hard thing to pull off,” the latter says. “Me and Cillian, we felt like we didn't give the best account of ourselves. We didn't push ourselves as hard as we should have.”

When it came to approaching this latest, third outing, the band hit the reset button. Both Fatboy and McCauley were working on music individually, but were struggling to progress beyond initial ideas. So the pair decided to escape from the drudgery of the everyday in order to gain some perspective, and booked a B&B in Ard Mhaca on the Irish border to tackle the starting foundations of the new work.

The process was reminiscent of the early days of their artistic partnership; a time prior to Bricknasty’s genesis when, having stumbled upon each other on Soundcloud as teens, they’d have stints making music in each other’s bedrooms until the early hours. The full circle return to this familiar DIY process rejuvenated the duo’s vision, and the roots of “Black’s Law” were born.

The entire project was made in six months — only six of those days were spent in a professional recording studio. Two of those months were spent on tour. “It was a huge amount of work that we had to get done in a tiny amount of time,” Fatboy recalls. “It was a bit too much for everyone to be honest.” With much to do, limited time and pressures high, the band hit a tipping point. Founding members — bassist Dara Abdurahman and keyboard/saxophonist Louis Younge bowed out of the collective, now replaced by Sam Healy and Chris LaMotte.

Despite the difficult turn of events, the remaining Nasties plowed forward to finish “Black’s Law”, largely thanks to the symbiotic musical bond between Fatboy and McCauley. The producer holds the craft and patience to condense his frontman’s volatile creativity, chiseling his bursts of genius into a digestible palette. “I can spin my wheels until the cows come home,” Fatboy laughs. “Cillian definitely is like the Quincy Jones. He finds the right spot for the right thing. I'll come in aggressive from the out go and start dancing and moving around and just trying to find stuff.”

“When it gets real sweaty,” McCauley takes over, “when it gets hot in the room, sometimes you just need to be able to see the take. That is the job.”

His counterpart interjects: “I’m in the heat of the chase. I have to make mistakes. I'm obligated to shit the bed.

The testing creative process was ultimately worth its endeavour. Rip-roaringly ambitious in its song structures, “Black’s Law” crams vast sonic and thematic themes into sharp, groove-laden, often luscious compositions that never end as they begin. The musical variety is wide-spanning — from the house-tinged varnish of “imperret illi deus " to the wonderful Irish trad folk on “is é a locht a laghad”, and a hardcore edge on the backend of “go get that blade”. The EP plays out like a musical encyclopaedia, stunningly original with an almost competitive edge to its eclectic interior; a desire to “put the audience in the tumble-drier and stamp on their neck,” Fatboy jokes.

The frontman’s lyricism is instinctively written and delivered through pained gasps and vibrato’d whispers. His words put religion at the centre, the foundations of such narrative stemming from his own finding of God in the darkest of times. Stricken by drug and alcohol ad...

name: Brie Stoner
description: Brie Stoner is a creative code-switcher who makes music for those who've never belonged to just one place. Raised in Madrid, Spain, and now based in Grand Rapids, Michigan, she channels her multilingual life into indie dream-rock that feels both intimately personal and impossibly vast. Her upcoming LP "Matador" (releasing 2026) is a California-themed love letter, lush and cinematic, featuring orchestral arrangements by acclaimed arranger Kelly Pratt (St Vincent, Beck, and Beirut) and produced by David Vandervelde (Father John Misty). The album weaves strings, woodwinds, and horns through Stoner's poetic storytelling, creating an intimate portrait of artistic endurance, perseverance, motherhood, and the quiet act of creating beauty when the world feels uncertain. Her music has been featured by Ralph Lauren, Victoria's Secret, Orange is The New Black, The Affair, and Yellowjackets as well as other international TV and film campaigns. Featured in Spin, Atwood Magazine, and Magnet, Stoner's new album proves that the best art comes from moving between languages and landscapes.

name: Brionne
description: After the raving success of her first two EP’s “23” and “Playa Shit Only” followed by the certification of her position as the DON DADA on her first full length project “ Donatella,” Brionne is ready to expand her territory towards new horizons. Meet the Griselda Blanco of Dallas’ rising Hip-Hop scene. In the past three years since her introduction to the game, she’s invested the blood, sweat, and tears which earned her the stripes needed to bet on her ability to turn a phrase for “Profit.” For those that know of Brionne, her style is, quiet as kept, setting the precedent that she is no less accepted at the table of success in any room she inhabits. Words are her luxury. Never lacking in intentionality, Brionne carefully crafts her flows together into a web that leaves you stuck hanging on her every word.

name: BrunOG
description:
From the heart of Mexico City emerges BrunOG, an artist and producer who is reshaping the Urban Latin Pop landscape. With a solid trajectory within the industry, BrunOG has evolved from being a visionary producer—recognized even with a Latin Grammy nomination—to an established singer-songwriter with viral international impact. His image has always been synonymous with inspiration and aspiration.
BrunOG’s musical proposal is a sonic blend rooted in Urban Latin Pop, yet it boldly ventures into genres such as Reggaeton, R&B, Afropop/Afrobeat, Hyperpop, Latin, and Alternative Pop. This versatility, however, always maintains a distinctive urban stamp in his lyrics, flows, and metrics, exploring themes of heartbreak, nostalgia, passionate love, sensuality, and romance.
Milestones
Global Viral Success: At 30, his track “Nuestra Canción” became an international phenomenon, driven by its inclusion in the soundtrack of the film “Culpa Mía.”
