Signing with Universal Music US Latin: In 2024, BrunOG joined the ranks of Universal Music US Latin, marking a new and exciting chapter in his career with multinational backing.

name: Bubba Lucky
description: Bubba Lucky is a project created by Taylor Lumpkin initially performing solo with a drum machine, now the band has six members, including members from Gus Baldwin, and the sketch, whisper, commercial breaks, and late wife. Taylor Lumpkin is originally from Louisiana but has spent over a decade Participating in the Austin music scene.

events.venue: Flatstock Stage @ Austin Marriott Downtown (Moontower Hall)

name: Buckets
description: Introducing Buckets: The Los Angeles-based fearsome foursome are a powerhouse of nostalgic indie punk. Piecing together shredding guitar, screaming gang vocals, and dynamic extremes from track-to-track, or even verse-to-verse, the Southern California outfit aren't shy about who they are or what they're all about. Consisting of members from across North America, Tanner Houghton, Sasha Massey, Mitch Rossiter, and Hiram Sevilla pull together their shared DIY ethos and vast experience in music to craft an emotionally powerful performance. From the studio to the stage, the group never disappoints.

name: Buddy Red
description:
Buddy Red is the Southern blues artist delivering the raw, cinematic sound of the Black American experience. A vocalist, guitarist, and preacher of truth, he stands where the cosmic mystique of Jimi Hendrix meets the uncompromising funk of James Brown and the psychedelic scope of Pink Floyd. A fixture of Atlanta's legendary Northside Tavern, Buddy is a vital voice recognized for his visceral guitar work and impassioned storytelling, captivating live and digital audiences alike.

Since his breakout debut at SXSW, which included a featured set at The Shade Room's activation in 2023, his momentum is undeniable. He recently performed at the James Brown Estate for the Black Music Action Coalition’s Juneteenth celebration and shared the stage with Little Richard's original band at Tutti Frutti Music Festival. His new single, "Sold His Soul," cemented his rise as a cinematic blues revivalist, with his cultural influence extending through partnerships with the Atlanta Hawks and BMW and a festival performance at Neon Prarie in Tulsa. Buddy Red is returning to SXSW as an essential force.

name: buffalo_farm
description:
buffalo_farm was born from a nightmare, and forged into a dream.

Night after night, he was haunted by the same nightmare. In his sleep, he found himself locked in a cage on a Buffalo Farm, forced to watch as his loved ones were brutally fed to Bison. The nightmare repeated endlessly, each time more vivid than the last. Not knowing whether his nightmares were dreams or reality, The Buffalo Farm Killer was born upon his murder of the buffalo farmer with a pitchfork, and his timely escape.

The story gives rise to buffalo_farm, a trap-metal entity that thrives in the chaos between rap and metal. His sound is raw and violent yet hypnotic, equal parts aggression and catharsis, pulling listeners into the same nightmare that birthed him. But what makes him truly unique is the contrast beneath the rage, his voice often soars in an angelic, almost ethereal way, creating a haunting beauty against the backdrop of brutality. Every track is an echo of blood-soaked visions, and every show a demonstration of the horrors he’s lived.

Will you join the journey of the Buffalo Farm Killer?

name: BULLETBALLET
description:
BULLETBALLET is an independent project from Ciudad Juárez, México formed by Analaura Fuentes & Hector Becerra. Their sound mixes elements from shoegaze, krautrock, dreampop & synth, as well as beats & rythms from electronica & trip-hop; creating hypnotic atmospheres with guitar layers, synthesizers & vocals; touching on social themes, personal experiences & fantasies.

Since 2022, they've had the opportunity of playing at different venues & events on the border of Ciudad Juárez & El Paso, Texas & in cities like Chihuahua, Delicias & Mexico City,
sharing the stage & supporting acts like Mint Field, Lorelle Meets the Obsolete, Phantogram, Holy Wave, Twin Tribes, Diles Que No Me Maten, Little Jesus, Nuovo Testamento,
Valgur, Public Memory, Mabe Fratti, among other national & international talents.

They debuted in 2023 with the EP Nice Things From A Short Life, followed in 2024 by the single Bloodsport, written and produced by the band.

At the moment, BULLETBALLET are in a production stage, hoping to launch new music & live dates in 2026.

name: The Bures Band
description:
The Bures Band, is a fresh and classic mix of American folk rock and blues, driven by
Stephen Bailey (guitar and vocals) recognised for his work as a solo artist and for his role
as lead vocals and keys in psychedelic rock outfit, Mt. Mountain (Fuzz Club UK)) who have
shared the stage with greats including: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard, Thee Oh Sees,
Moon Duo, The Murlocs, Orb, Sleep, The Babe Rainbow) and showcases the musical
talents of local musicians: Callum Anderson (lead guitar and vocals) Noah Symmans
(drums) Danny Miles (guitar and vocals) and Tom
Beech (bass)

Bookings For AUS/NZ: paul@billionsbooking.com.au
pat@billions.com.au

BOOKING AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR AUSTRALIA/NZ for;
Amyl & the Sniffers | Angel Olsen | Basia Bulat | Bon Iver | Budos Band | The Bures Band |
Car Seat Headrest | Death Cab For Cutie | Devendra Banhart | Floodlights | Gareth
Liddiard | GOAT | Grace Cummings | King Gizzard & the Lizard
Wizard | Lee Fields & the Expressions | Los Coronas | Menahan Street Band | The Murlocs |
Pavement | Soccer Mommy | Southern River
Band | Spacey Jane | Surprise Chef |
Thee Sacred Souls | Tropical F**k Storm

name: Byron Juane
description:
As soon as Byron Juane stepped onto the stage, you could feel his authenticity. There was no facade, no put-on persona to hide behind. Instead, there was raw honesty, a transparent openness that left no doubt in anyone's mind that this artist was the real deal.

And that authenticity was reflected in every note, every lyric. It wasn't just about making a catchy tune or pandering to the latest trends. Byron was creating music that meant something, that spoke to the heart and soul.

From the very beginning, he knew that he wanted his music to stand the test of time. He wanted it to be the kind of music that people would still be listening to decades from now, reminiscing about that moment when they first heard it and feeling all the same emotions rush back.

And he's been succeeding. With every new release, he's taken his music to new heights, soaring higher and higher on the wings of his talent and passion.

But what's perhaps most remarkable is how new Byron is to the game. Despite that, his sound is like nothing else out there, a fresh take on the very soul of music that feels like it's been missing for far too long.

name: Calder Allen
description:
Born and raised in Austin, Texas, Calder Allen is a fifth-generation Texan whose music reflects the deep roots and creative spirit of his upbringing. Influenced by his artist grandparents, Terry and Jo Harvey Allen, Calder grew up surrounded by authentic artistic expression. Originally set on becoming a fly-fishing guide, he turned to songwriting during the 2020 pandemic, leading to his debut album The Game, produced by mentor Charlie Sexton.
With his new album, Fault Lines, recorded at Austin’s legendary Arlyn Studios with Sexton and Jacob Sciba, Calder delivers his most personal work yet—a cinematic exploration of love, loss, and self-discovery. Featuring contributions from Martie Maguire, Jon Randall, and Jack Ingram, the record captures the emotional depth and honesty at the heart of his songwriting.
A commanding live performer, Calder has shared stages with Cody Jinks, Turnpike Troubadours, Miranda Lambert, and others, earning acclaim at festivals like Austin City Limits, Bonnaroo, and Two Step Inn. With Fault Lines, Calder Allen cements himself as a powerful new voice in Americana, blending Texas tradition with raw, introspective storytelling.

name: Caleb De Casper
description: From the horror cabaret and glam-rock theatrics of his early career to the shadowy, neon-lit world of his current dark synth-pop, Austin-based performer Caleb De Casper has never stopped evolving. A classically trained pianist and vocalist, De Casper commands the stage with a sharpened, unmistakable intensity — trading in the avant-garde gowns and stilettos of the past for a bold, more masculine and unfiltered presence that puts the focus squarely on the music, the message, and the electricity of performance. His 2022 debut LP Femme Boy expanded his sonic world, weaving dancefloor heat, cinematic drama, and queer storytelling into a record that was equal parts brooding and explosive. That same year, the City of Austin proclaimed Caleb De Casper Day, recognizing his cultural impact. He went on to perform yearly at SXSW, Austin City Limits Music Festival, Utopia Fest, Houston’s Art Car Festival, Thin Line Fest, and multiple Pride celebrations, while continuously advocating for LGBTQIA rights at the Texas State Capitol and beyond. Now, with his forthcoming sophomore album Delirium, De Casper enters a new creative chapter — darker, dirtier, dance-driven, and poised for a breakthrough.

name: Caleb Lemons
description: 26 Year Old Vocalist, Songwriter, & Music Producer based out of Austin, Texas. Caleb blends classic soul melodies with the combined use of real instruments , & modern R&B and Hip Hop production, for a poppy but classic feeling in his songs.

name: Caleb Michael And The Arrested
description:
Caleb Michael And The Arrested formed in 2021, but Caleb had been performing and singing for over a decade. Formed a band as quick as he could and became Caleb Michael And The Arrested.

By 2022, the band was a local favorite in Denton, Celina, and surrounding areas. The crowds continue to grow and the music has become a high energy Country/ Southern Rock vibe.

Headlining their first Midwest tour in Summer 2025 has raised their expectations and they have set their sights on some pretty big things in 2026!

name: Camille Schmidt
description:
Camille Schmidt is a Brooklyn-based songwriter who writes with the kind of emotional clarity most people spend their lives avoiding. Her songs are known for their near mythic ability to turn confession into something communal.

With her debut album Nude #9 (2025), Schmidt renders revealing portraits of herself, friends, exes (all real names used), and strangers encountered in passing: a rambling OBGYN, a woman reading breakup texts on a plane, a Reiki healer who ends a session early after claiming Schmidt’s blue aura is overwhelming. Schmidt reminds us here that she is, at her core, a storyteller.

Sonically, Nude #9 abandons allegiance to genre. Moving beyond the folk-rooted approach of Good Person, Schmidt folds synthesizers, sequencers, and post-punk rhythms into her writing. The album appeared on multiple Best Albums of 2025 lists, with critics describing Schmidt as one of indie music’s “most important rising voices.” The cult-like devotion forming around her work has become a defining part of her momentum, increasingly evident in the way her songs translate from record to room. Schmidt is now at work on new music.

name: Canon
description: Canon is an independent artist who turns pain into purpose and lyrics into lifelines. Raised between Chicago and Atlanta, his music is raw, cinematic, and rooted in real-life battles—surviving trauma, questioning faith, rebuilding identity, and refusing to quit. Every bar is personal, every beat intentional. He doesn’t make music to impress—he makes it to connect, to challenge, to heal. Fully hands-on with his sound, visuals, and message, Canon creates from a place of truth, and invites his listeners to face theirs. This isn’t just music—it’s movement. Welcome to the journey.

name: Cardinal Bloom
description:
Cardinal Bloom is an Indie Rock Band from Salt Lake City Utah, one of the birth places of the modern Indie Rock genre. Cardinal Bloom's debut album “The Only Place I’ve Ever Known” released September of 2024 marking a new era of their music while still holding true to the sound they've carved as their own. Cardinal Bloom’s music encapsulates the nostalgic and bittersweet feeling of ‘better days,’ yet leaving you a notion there is still so much life ahead of us to be lived.

Cardinal Bloom is currently on tour throughout the U.S. and you can find tickets here on spotify or on their website www.cardinalbloom.com.
 
“Everything they did worked together to absolutely nail that dusty Deseret sound—one that sits in between pop, rock, and folk.” -Zach Collier (Provo Music Magazine)
 
Their members include Joey St. John on guitar and vocals, Jacob Silvester on the bass and vocals, Josh Thomas on guitar, and Nate Adair on drums.

name: Cashier
description: On their debut EP ‘The Weight,’ the Lafayette, Louisiana, four-piece reaches full definition, distilling themes of desire, insecurity, and disconnection into five tightly wound, melody-driven songs released by Julia’s War Recordings, the legendary Philly label founded by Doug Dulgarian of TAGABOW. Across the EP, bandleader Kylie Gaspard’s deeply direct vocal delivery cuts through dense riffs, grounding their songs with her gritty, emotional lyrics. Having recently shared stages with genre titans like Dinosaur Jr., Whirr, Nothing, and Narrow Head, Cashier are building a reputation for a massive sound that resonates far beyond their bayou home.

name: Casket Cassette
description:
A reflection of the industrial grime and perpetual sunny glow of Los Angeles, Casket Cassette (Constant Williams) blends euphoria and melancholy in an expression of existential perseverance. Casket Cassette's depressingly danceable music takes a contemporary spin on the dark sounds of the 1980s Post-Punk and Darkwave movements, drawing further influence from New Wave, EBM, Synthpop and Indie/ Alternative to achieve this duality.

The project takes its name from a memory Williams has from childhood of his father recording a live song onto a cassette tape, then placing the tape into his grandfather's casket as it was being lowered into the ground. Williams' lyrics often reflect upon similarly somber themes such as mental health struggles, loss, heartbreak, addiction and recovery, while also offering glimmers of hope, humor and a general determination to overcome.

Williams lives in LA, and graduated in 2024 from the lowa Writers' Workshop with an MFA in poetry.

name: Casmalia
description: Casmalia is a producer, DJ, songwriter, and live vocalist based out of Los Angeles who has taken the west coast house music scene by storm. A classically trained musician with a degree in audio engineering, Casmalia has been consistently churning out club weapons since her freshman EP in 2017 on Hood Politics Records. She has since earned affiliations with Insomniac Records, mau5trap, CUFF, Night Bass, and many more. In November of 2025, her track "Don't Tell Me How To Rave" was the #1 trending song in the United States in all genres on SoundCloud, and was the subject of a billboard campaign in Times Square. She was also featured as one of Beatport's "On Our Radar" artists for August 2025. Her tracks have seen support from David Guetta, John Summit, Patrick Topping, FISHER, Solomun, AC Slater, Green Velvet, Jamie Jones, Marco Carola, and many more across both the EDM and tech house worlds. She has performed at EDC Las Vegas, the DoLab stage at Coachella, Zamna Festival and Splash House, and has provided direct support for Kyle Watson, Noizu and Diplo on tour. Casmalia's sound can be described as bass-heavy with detailed percussion and can range in style from minimal to melodic.

name: CAZAYOUX
description:
Swamp funk. Psychedelic soul.
Global rhythms + deep improvisation

In April 2026, the band releases Alpha Centauri, produced by Nico Léophonte in Austin, a record centered on ignition, growth, and the shared journey of the band as artists

Aboubacar Sylla — Djembe/Congas, Balafon
Alex Freeman — Bass
Damien Valenzuela — Tenor Saxophone
Forest Cazayoux — Drums
Fumihito Sugawara — Guitar
Joe Woullard — Baritone Saxophone, Flute
Patrick Harwell — Trombone
Tate Christian — Hammond Organ, Keys, Vocals

name: CDSM
description: CDSM a.k.a. Celebrity Death Slot Machine is a “freakout post-punk group” (FLOOD Magazine) based in Atlanta, GA. Their stylish sonic onslaught is anchored around dancey rhythms, atypical synthesizer work, timely saxophone growls, as well as goth rock-esque melodies that serve to recount bizarre humor-laden tales from a derelict parallel universe. Since forming in 2021, the band has toured North America and Europe, sharing the stage with likes of The KVB, Bodega, Sheer Mag, Iceage, and Model/Actriz, while also taking part in events such as SXSW, Treefort Festival, Art Rock Festival, Hopscotch Festival, and M for Montreal. CDSM’s introductory EP, Hell Stairs (2022), was both glamorous and bleak, swanky and derelict, uplifting and crushing, described by the band as “hedonism clinking in your glass, change jingling in the pit of your chest.” Atlanta’s hot new commodity followed with a slew of music videos – “GOGO” (May 11th, 2023), “Entertainment” (2023), “DOM” (2023), and “SHADY” (2024) – amidst a stretch that saw them bring their sweaty live set to the very best underground venues the United States, Canada and Europe have to offer.

name: CHALK
description:
Chalk is the project of award-winning musicians and filmmaker
duo Ross Cullen and Benedict Goddard. An informed mix of
Dublin's guitar band scene and the sweaty hardcore dance
floors of their native Belfast, Chalk are IDLES meets Daniel Avery,
Death Grips meets Bicep - techno-infused industrial punk.
Since forming in 2022, Chalk have had a rise like no other,
quickly establishing themselves as an unmissable live act and
unpredictable, ferocious songwriters. Their debut UK/IRE tour
sold out, and led to further bookings across Europe as word of
their performance and guitar-melded techno spread via word of
mouth and support with national radio in the UK.
These songs were collated into the Conditions Trilogy, a family of
thirteen tracks that combine gritty Irish and German-influenced
techno and dance music with gothic, post-punk and jagged
guitar riffs and vocal melodies. This unique blend earned them
the support and kudos of their peers in Fontaines D.C., IDLES
and Sprints, all of whom handpicked the band to support them
throughout their tours.

name: Chiara Savasta
description:
Chiara Savasta is a singer-songwriter from Montreal. Born in the suburbs of the city, onto a generation burdened by anxiety and desillusion, Chiara would sit in her room and romanticize her life through songwriting.

This way of escaping her teenage life became the foundation of her first project Summerhood. Released in 2022, Summerhood is Chiara’s own take on the coming-of-age experience, as she herself stumbles into adulthood.

Her new project, brand new girl, brand new machine, captures the universal experience of feeling too much of everything at once, in our early twenties. This new chapter reveals a more grounded and mature soul, gradually finding her footing in the world. It’s through these ups and downs, always chasing the next dream, that Chiara became a brand new girl, like a brand new machine.

name: Chuck Prophet and His Cumbia Shoes
description:
Chuck Prophet’s streak of more than a dozen critically acclaimed solo records stretches all the way back to 1990, when the California native first shifted focus from his tenure with pioneering neo-psych band Green on Red to working under his own name. Since then, his songs have appeared in a slew of films and television shows, and his work has been covered by Bruce Springsteen, Solomon Burke, Heart, and a host of others. Rolling Stone dubbed him a “streetwise city kid with an eye for the country,” while Uncut proclaimed him a “renaissance-rocker,” and NPR declared that “no one can turn tales from the outer limits into catchy songs quite like Prophet does.”

Wake The Dead, Chuck Prophet’s extraordinary new album recorded with ¿Qiensave?, dives headfirst into the world of Cumbia music. The songs are intoxicatingly rhythmic, all but demanding you move your body while you listen. There are flashes of rock and roll, punk, surf, and soul, wrapped up in the rich legacy of a genre that traces its roots back hundreds of years and thousands of miles.

name: CJ CHENIER AND THE RED HOT LOUISIANA BAND
description: CJ Chenier is born and raised in an indigenous American culture with its distinct language, cuisine and music. Chenier, a Grammy nominated world renowned musician and recording artist, has performed alongside many internationally recognized artists including his GRAMMY awarded winning father, Clifton Chenier “The King of Zydeco,” Paul Simon, Joe Sample, and Ray Parker, Jr. He appeared on the Jon Stewart Show, CNN, was featured on VH1, and Entertainment Weekly. He has exhibited his musicianship at many large festival venues such as the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival, Chicago Blues Festival, and Austin SxSW Music Conference. In addition, to a GRAMMY award nomination in the Best Regional Roots Music Album category, C.J has received many major awards inclusive of the Living Blues Critics’Poll Award, India Award (from AFIM) for Best Zydeco Album, Coups de Coeur (Blows of Heart) Blues Category Award from I’Academie Charles Cros (France) and Best of the Beat Best Zydeco Album (Offbeat Magazine).

name: Clova
description:
Hailing from the vibrant music hub of South Austin, Texas, Jarrett S. Williams, better known as Clova Rap Game Yoda, has been a dynamic force in the music industry for over a decade. His journey began with the legendary Austin supergroup Die Slo Ent, alongside Sertified, Southside Hippie, and WKDZD, laying a solid foundation for his solo career.
A staple in the ATX scene, Clova has graced the stages of renowned festivals like SXSW and A3C(ATL), sharing the spotlight with a diverse range of acclaimed artists including Talib Kweli, Dave Chappelle , Lil Flip, Curren$y , Niko Is, Rah Digga,Mo3, Devin The Dude, Coast Contra and more.

His talent has also garnered attention in the sync licensing world. In 2019, Clova secured a single/sync deal with Crucial Music, landing a placement on OWN Network’s critically acclaimed series "Queen Sugar" with his track "Connect The Dots." This success was followed by another placement in 2020 with the short film "Shadows," which premiered on HBO Max and Hulu.

With a discography of 16 albums, He is currently immersed in the creation of a highly anticipated new project with Niko Is, under the executive production of the esteemed Chino Chase.

name: Commercial Breaks
description: Tight, catchy, succinct, and loud are the best words for Commercial Breaks. Formed in 2025 by a gaggle of rockers and co-conspirators, the group features Lucas Martins, Trey Gutierrez and David Rawlinson, all of whom back Gus Baldwin as “The Sketch” as well as Doran Rawlinson, former drummer of Nolan Potter’s Nightmare Band. The members have performed around Austin for many years but never in such a hook-driven, song-forward capacity. Their debut record out Q4 2025 was recorded entirely at home to cassette tape to ensure absolute commercial viability, and their live shows pursue the title of either Austin’s “Loudest Pop Group” or “Pop-est Loud Group”.

name: congratulations
description:
congratulations are a hall of mirrors party troop. they are devils and tarts in equal measure. they lock their horns and then spin round and round and round until dizzy cacophony erupts. sugarcane hooks vs. slaughterhouse screams. taut, fizzing guitars & caustic electronics nipping at the heels of huge fuzz bass & booming percussive grooves. leah is the green one. jamie is dressed in blue. greg’s red, james is yellow. they’re here to move you.

Bursting onto the scene with a kinetic new sound, congratulations have quickly garnered a reputation for their raw energy, tight instrumentation and electrifying live performances. With punchy melodies and infectious hooks, congratulations deliver a mix of anthemic and experimental sounds fusing art-rock, garage, synth-pop and post-punk. The band’s lyrics explore themes of modern life, love, and self-discovery, delivered with a compelling honesty and emotion. congratulations’ fresh take on familiar sounds has earned them critical acclaim and a devoted and rapidly-growing fanbase, positioning them as one of the UK’s most exciting up-and-coming acts.

Signed to Bella Union records, with the bands debut album "Join Hands" due for release on February 13th.

Having gained support previously from BBC Radio 1 and BBC 6Music including a live session for 6Music for Marc Riley. Previous supporters of congratulations include Iggy Pop, Craig Charles, Nick Grimshaw, Chris Hawkins and Jess Izzatt.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth Patio

name: CorMae
description: CorMae started as a social media ad and a dream and now has evolved into an up and coming punk and riot grrrl inspired band. The band started in February 2024, and has been steadily making its way into the Austin music scene ever since. Starting with a pop-forward garage rock EP, Cutie Core, released in April of 2025 and ending last year with a bang in October 2025 with the release of their more punk-forward EP “Hot Damn!” and an extra bonus punkified cover of Sheb Woolley’s “Purple People Eater,” CorMae are swiftly becoming an Austin Punk mainstay. The band are nominated by the Austin Chronicle for ATX’s 2025 Best Punk Band and you may also know them from opening shows for the likes of Of Montreal, Murder City Devils, and Pretty Girls Make Graves in 2025. CorMae’s songs are written about life, love, social, and economic struggles and their live show is aimed at commiserating on these issues with the audience. CorMae aims to build a community of friends and fans of all ages, creeds, races, and genders. After all, who doesn’t need a little cathartic shouting or a little dancing every once in a while?

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

name: Couch Dog
description:
WE MAKE MUSIC FOR DANCING, CRYING AND KISSING.

Couch Dog is Maxwell Ferrer (lead vocals + guitar), Tasha Lee (bass), Pablo Acosta (lead guitar) and Liam Reece (drums). The band originally formed in San Luis Obispo, CA, and are currently based out of Los Angeles. The Dogs aim to push the boundaries of indie and garage rock with every release (whether it’d be glitchy electronics, gazey ambiance or stripped-back instrumentation). Unraveler, their latest EP, is Couch Dog’s most sonically diverse release to date. The project excels at retaining their classic and beloved sound from 2023’s “How to Ruin Your Life Fast”, distinguished by energetic guitar riffs, driving rhythms, and earnest lyricism, but elevates it with left field experimentation, song writing from different members and new textures.

Since day one, they have placed an emphasis on putting on unforgettable live shows, helping audiences connect with their material deeply. Starting from sold-out house shows in their home town, to headlining a US tour, they always work on fostering a strong sense of community, belonging and freedom to go absolutely nuts in the mosh pit.

name: CQ Wrestling
description:
CQ Wrestling are a British grunge band led by best friends and songwriters Charlie Woods and Jake Mac, delivering a fierce yet melodic 90s-inspired sound. Their lyrics tackle social and political unrest while offering moments of euphoric escape, and their chaotic, high-energy shows have built a devoted following through three sold-out UK tours, Glastonbury 2025, and European festival appearances.

After earning critical acclaim for their debut album Plus Ultra (EMI, 2023) with support from BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, and Radio X, the band are now fully independent, embracing complete creative freedom. Their first independent single, Catherine Wheels, hit the cover of Spotify’s Rock List, and their upcoming release, Guns In Their Hands, is a defiant rallying cry about choice, resilience, and connection amid the chaos of the world.

name: Creature Canyon
description:
Hailing from the vibrant scene of San Diego, CA, Creature Canyon ignites the essence of indie/alternative rock fused with tinges of modern psychedelia. Comprised of Austin Steele, Ryan Amyot, and Aaron Lund, the band radiates with electrifying performances that have garnered acclaim from Billboard, Paste, and various industry tastemakers. With a sonic journey that began with EPs like "Life I Know" and "Did You Want That," and a notable feature of their track "Brooklyn Baby" in the hit series Shameless.

Having left an indelible mark with their debut album ‘Remarks’, Creature Canyon has collaborated with the talents of producer Christian Lum (Private Island), recording engineer Mike Schuppan (Foster The People, Young the Giant), mixing engineer Jordon Silva (Vance Joy, The Avett Brothers), and mastering engineer Brian Lucey (Cage The Elephant, Arctic Monkeys, The Black Keys). The band now strides confidently into the future, embracing the next phase of their musical evolution.

name: Cure for Paranoia
description:
Formed in the heart of Dallas but born on the highway, Cure for Paranoia came together during a “doomsday road trip” intended to be their last. Having recently been diagnosed with bipolar paranoid schizophrenia, frontman Cameron McCloud found clarity in a hot-boxed rental car; making music with collaborators Jay Analog and Tomahawk Jonez gave him peace of mind. “He said, ‘this is my cure for paranoia.’ Instantly, everyone’s eyes lit up,” a pivotal realization that cemented the group’s moniker. When the predicted earth-shattering meteor failed to hit, inspiration struck instead. As Jonez recalls, “On the way from Amarillo to Colorado Springs, like eight songs got written.”

Since then, Cure for Paranoia has shared bills with icons ranging from George Clinton & Parliament Funkadelic and Nas to Ludacris and Leon Bridges. Their resume includes stops at SXSW, Fortress Festival, and the NPR Tiny Desk Contest "On The Road" Tour, solidifying their status as festival favorites. While keen to distance themselves from standard regional production, they cultivated a signature "Trippy Soul infused hip hop" sound—a blend prioritized on their anchor project, the Work of A.R.T. EP.

name: DAIISTAR
description:
BIO
DAIISTAR is an Alt-Indie band formed in Austin, Texas in the spring of 2020. The band takes their inspiration from the neo-psychedelic era of the 80s and 90s (The Jesus and Mary Chain, Spacemen 3, Primal Scream) and pulls it into the future with modulating synthesizers, heavy guitars, bouncing bass lines, and spiraling hooks, creating a narcotic blend of noise and melody. DAIISTAR recorded their first studio album produced by Alex Maas of The Black Angels and engineered by James Petralli of White Denim in the summer of 2021. The band signed to UK based label Fuzz Club Records with their debut album GOOD TIME released on September 8th 2023. The album is available on vinyl including a Levitation Exclusive Edition pressing, as well as CD and digital. DAIISTAR has performed at ACL, SXSW, Levitation Austin, Levitation France, Austin Psych Fest, Barcelona Psych Fest, KEXP, KUTX and has toured with The Black Angels, The Brian Jonestown Massacre, and The Dandy Warhols.

name: Dallas Tetnus
description:
Dallas Tenus is a four piece rock band from Raleigh, North Carolina that formed in 2022 and includes a collective of members who have traveled the world playing and performing music. The four established band members - Greg Clayton (Rhythm guitar and vocals), Billy Alphin (drums), Danny Kurtz (lead guitar) and David Wright (bass guitar) - have collectively played in various major label and national touring bands through the years including Whiskeytown, AntiSeen, Drivin’ n Cryin', Flat Duo Jets, Squirrel Nut Zippers, The Backsliders, Sarah Shook, Lustre, and The Rosebuds (to name a few). The new collective that is Dallas Tetnus is a musical combination of all of these influences, with a stage show that is packed with static energy and a pure rock showmanship that is one to be seen.

The band plays loud, short, catchy, 70s - inspired tunes with influences from The Ramones, The Stooges, and KISS. Their unique and original stage presence is hard to forget. Their shows have plenty of visual appeal and engagement with smoke and bubbles rolling through every set, with white suits and a pink lit backdrop to boot.

The debut album, Welcome To Dallas Tetnus, is available everywhere now.

name: Daniel Fears
description:
Singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist Daniel Fears knows that music is more than just sound. It’s a journey, capable of taking us to places we’ve never been or bringing us closer to who we really are. With every note, every chord, every lyric, Daniel strives to create something that feels authentic and grounded.
Since his debut in 2020, he’s been nominated for “Best R&B” at the Austin Music Awards, opened for internationally-touring artists like Mac Ayres and BLK ODYSSY, had his music featured in an NAACP Image Award-nominated short film, and toured with Latin Grammy Nominee Gina Chavez for the American Music Abroad program.

His latest release, a fully-orchestrated live EP “Close To Home”, is available on all streaming services.

name: Danxgerous
description:
Danxgerous – the solo project of Daniela “Dan” Mariti – is born from the meeting of Italian and Czech roots and a musical heritage steeped in singing and instruments. A singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist, Danxgerous crafts a sonic universe suspended between indie-rock, dreamy pop, and contemporary indie-folk, where light and melancholy intertwine to create deep and captivating emotional landscapes.
After studying music theory and harmony at Saint Louis in Rome and performing with the band In June, Danxgerous debuted as a solo artist in 2023 with the independent label We Were Never Being Boring (WWNBB), releasing the singles Keys, Sides, Cold Yet Dazzling, and Venom. In 2024, she brought the project to international stages, with a standout moment at SXSW 2024 in Austin, Texas, performing four shows including the prestigious International Day Stage, marking a pivotal step in her career and expanding her international audience.
2025 is dedicated to writing, recording, and producing her debut album “Old Soul” — a journey into the universe of an old soul navigating the modern world, exploring mystical dreams, introspection, and the beauty of nature.

name: DARKOVIBES
description: Darkovibes is a boundary-pushing Ghanaian singer, songwriter, and genre-bender whose sound blends Afrobeats, highlife, R&B, and alternative influences into a unique musical identity. A pivotal voice in the new wave of African music, he has collaborated with some of the continent’s biggest stars, including Wizkid, Davido, Shatta Wale, R2Bees, Sarkodie, Stonebwoy, Camidoh, King Promise, M.anifest, Mr. Eazi and Spinall. Known for his vibrant performances and versatility, Darkovibes has shared stages with many of these artists across Africa and beyond, captivating audiences with his infectious energy and bold creative vision. With a growing global fan base and a track record of innovative releases, Darkovibes continues to redefine contemporary African music and is poised to make a powerful impression at SXSW.

name: David Huckfelt
description:
David Huckfelt is a singer/ lyricist /folk-activist whose poetic sensibilities and songs of no-spiritual-surrender have earned him a cult following in the darker hollows far off the beaten path of the music business’s rushing roar. An Iowa native and former theology student, Huckfelt attended the prestigious Iowa Writers Workshop before dropping hold of academic and theoretical pursuits and turning his attention to songwriting and performing. With improvisational mastery and a stubborn insistence of remaining in the moment with his audience, Huckfelt’s folk shows have earned him a devoted following from small-town opera houses & theaters to national festival stages like Hardly Strictly Bluegrass, Edmonton and Calgary Folk Fests, and the legendary First Avenue mainroom. Sharing stages with artists as diverse as Mavis Staples, Bon Iver, Emmylou Harris, Arcade Fire, Calexico, Gregory Alan Isakov, Iris Dement & more, Huckfelt’s roots run deep as a folk singer steeped in the tradition of performing other artists’ songs. An early encounter and collaboration with legendary Native American poet John Trudell introduced Huckfelt as friend & ally to an array of Indigenous artists & activists including Keith Secola, Louise Erdrich, Winona LaDuke, Quiltman & more. He also served as musical director and performer at “Water Is Life” Music + Resistance Festival in Duluth, MN and his songs appear in the new AMC TV series “Dark Winds” produced by Robert Redford & George R.R. Martin. A founding frontman of Minneapolis indie-folk cult favorites The Pines,
with roots in the same Midwestern soil that produced legendary folk singers like John Prine and Greg Brown, David's new solo work preserves a rugged optimism that blasts through layers of darkness in real time with songs that speak volumes, soft & clear.

name: Dayonthetrack
description: Afroheart prodigy, Dayonthetrack was introduced to the world in November 2019, he featured on Groundup Chale tape titled “We Outside; Y3 W) Ab)nten vol 1” where he featured on three songs off the project.   After the EP, he made remarkable strides in songwriting. Writing back to back hits for including Baajo, Celebrate and toxic by Kwesi Arthur writing parts of Adekunle Gold’s lyrics on the latter. He also featured on two songs off the “Son Of Jacob” album which has been exceptional on streaming markets and gained nominations on prestigious events.   His debut EP -SOUNDS AND WAVES released in July 2023 have earned Dayonthetrack over two million streams on all platforms as a solo artist project and his "Ashawo" song off the project being his first solo hit song.

name: DD Island
description: DD Island is a Brooklyn-based folk-rock band, formed in 2023 over a shared love of analog recording. Drawing on the familiarity of '60s and '70s West Coast country and psychedelic rock, DD Island still pulses with a brightness and grit that is grounded in present-day New York. The band’s debut LP, “Setting Sun” is due in Spring 2026.

name: deCasa
description:
deCasa is a genre-bending duo hailing from Puerto Rico, now making waves from their home base in Austin, TX. Comprised of two brothers, the project blends the vibrant rhythms of the island with the wide-open sonic landscapes of the Lone Star State—a fusion they proudly call beach music.

Seamlessly weaving English and Spanish lyrics, deCasa crafts a sound where reggae meets western twang, merengue grooves collide with funk, and cultures converge in unexpected harmony. Anchored by a powerhouse drummer whose precision and flair elevate every performance, the band delivers a live show that’s as explosive as it is unforgettable.

Texas audiences have seen them light up stages from Austin’s Mohawk to San Antonio’s Paper Tiger, Dallas’ Granada, and Houston’s White Oak Music Hall. Along the way, they’ve shared bills with some of the state’s most notable acts, steadily building a reputation as one of the region’s most compelling emerging artists.

With their unique cross-cultural sound, undeniable chemistry, and high-energy performances, deCasa is a name you’ll be hearing much more of—one to watch closely in 2026.

name: Delilah
description:
Delilah Cabrera, professionally known as Delilah, is a Mexican-American singer-songwriter and Interscope Records artist from Wenatchee, Washington. Raised in a bilingual household, she discovered her passion for music early, singing mariachi at school events and participating in choir—experiences that shaped her emotionally rich, culturally rooted sound.
A multi-instrumentalist who plays piano, guitar, violin, and vihuela, Delilah blends traditional Mexican music with contemporary influences. Her career shifted after a viral performance caught the attention of Los CT Records, founded by Natanael Cano, leading to her signing as the label’s first female artist in its Mexican division through an Interscope partnership.
She has released singles including “Amor Perdido,” “Modelo,” “Entre la Maleza,” and “Butterfly,” collaborated with Becky G on “TODO,” and shared stages with Iván Cornejo. In 2025, she performed at the Selena Tribute Concert in Chicago. Her Interscope debut single, “SI DIOS LO QUERÍA,” was released in September 2025. Now 18, Delilah continues to emerge as a powerful new voice in Latin music.

name: Deloyd Elze
description: Deloyd Elze, aka Jacob Henry Allen, is a genre-blending artist and poet from Jacksonville, Florida, whose music fuses traditional American songwriting with experimental and electronic textures. Over the past decade, Deloyd has tinkered with soundscapes that meld twangy guitars, lo-fi drums, dissonant synths and rich acoustic textures into ‘digital twang,’ a sound that seamlessly weaves between country, indie and electronic. The name Deloyd Elze honors his great-grandfather, a resilient man whose legacy of grit and defiance inspires his artistry. Like his namesake, Deloyd’s music is rooted in authenticity, reflecting the complexities of the human experience. Now based in Los Angeles, he’s creating music that speaks to life’s many layers, drawing from his family’s history and his own journey of self-discovery and survival.

name: Derek Minor
description: Derek Minor is a 2x Grammy-winning American Christian rapper, singer, songwriter, record producer, entrepreneur, actor, and screenwriter known for his impactful contributions to Christian hip-hop. His music blends faith, social issues, personal growth, and life experience into lyricism aimed at both entertainment and spiritual reflection.

name: DeShaunJay
description: DeShaunJay is a rising star in the music industry and a talented artist who hails from Bolton, NC but now calls San Antonio, TX home. His love for music began at a very young age, and he has been honing his craft ever since. DeShaun made a name for himself in 2014 when he founded the Flourish Gang; from which he's released several successful projects, including the highly anticipated Phone Calls 4 which dropped in early 2023. In 2021 he was elected as Brand Ambassador for MVP Vibes. Under new management and partnerships with Chopstars/COREDJ's DJ Hollygrove and Set Da Tone Records. DeShaunJay is traveling and performing across the country and different festivals. Check his socials for weekly #FlourishFriday videos/freestyles. For bookings/collaborations contact Joshua Thompson thenamesjboi@gmail.com

name: Devin the Dude
description:
Devin the Dude is a Houston hip hop icon and one of the most enduring voices in Southern rap. Known for his laid back delivery, sharp humor, and effortless storytelling, Devin has built a decades long career rooted in authenticity and real life perspective. His music blends soul, funk, and everyday truth in a way that feels personal while remaining instantly recognizable, earning him a loyal cult following across generations.

Widely respected as an artist’s artist, Devin has collaborated across eras while staying true to his sound and point of view. His catalog includes fan favorites and timeless records that continue to resonate with listeners who value originality over trends. On stage, Devin brings a rare mix of charisma and comfort, delivering live performances that feel equal parts concert, smoke session, and community gathering.

Beyond music, Devin continues to expand his creative footprint through culture forward projects and brand building. He is the co creator of Coughee, a cannabis lifestyle brand rooted in storytelling, quality, and community. Decades into his career, Devin the Dude remains original, influential, and impossible to duplicate.

name: Devy Stonez
description:
Devy Stonez is a Louisiana-born, Dallas-based rapper whose music blends Southern rap perspective with melodic nuance and lyrical confidence. Over the past five years, he has quietly built a reputation as an artist who understands pace—favoring cohesion, replay value and presence over excess.

His most recent releases, including I LUV STONEY and Tuff, connected with audiences through soulful delivery and genre experimentation. Influenced by artists like The Notorious B.I.G., Dom Kennedy, and Curren$y, Devy pairs sharp writing with a smooth, homegrown flow that feels grounded and balanced.

With millions of streams, awards, charting releases, and a growing international audience, Devy has established real momentum as an independent artist. Now he enters a new era defined by balance, intention, and growth. His upcoming music reflects an artist moving with patience and clarity—becoming who he always knew he was meant to be, in his own time. New releases are rolling out now, with a forthcoming studio album set to mark his most focused and evolved chapter yet.

name: The Dharma Chain
description:
The Dharma Chain are an Australian-formed, Berlin-based independent band blending psychedelic textures, shoegaze, rock, and kraut-driven momentum with poetic lyricism and raw live energy. They’ve built a reputation for emotionally charged performances that feel expansive and immersive.

With no fixed front person, the band moves fluidly between roles. Mixed vocals, hip-hop drum beats, reverb-soaked guitars, and industrial undercurrents collide to create a powerful wall of sound that is dynamic, unpredictable and deeply human.

Their debut album NOWHERE continues to gather momentum, while their second full-length record 'Some Kind Of Pure State', arriving Spring 2026, marks a bold expansion in impact and atmosphere. Festival appearances include Fuzz Club and DesertFest Berlin (2026), with recent highlights at Fusion Festival (2024), Synästhesie (2025) and VOID (2025).

At SXSW, The Dharma Chain bring a live show that’s raw, hypnotic and built to pull you in.

name: Die Slo
description:
An underground hip-hop collective; Die Slo Entertainment, that doubles as a record label, is the combination of three Austin-based hip-hop groups who merged to work collectively as one unit. Its core members include Sertified , SouthSide Hippie, WKDZD, and Clova. With a particularly diverse set of emcees, all coming from different cultural backgrounds, Die Slo Entertainment produces equally diverse music, and are believers in the alternative and underground nature of their music, the group of hip-hop producers attempt to spread their positive motto
"Stay humble but stay hungry," throughout the world.

name: Differentchris
description:
Differentchris is a first generation born and raised Houston based indie artist. His music balances vulnerability and confidence, pairing catchy melodies with introspective themes that explore identity, relationships, and personal growth.

At 11 years old he began gravitating to songwriting and poetry, and knew he wanted to make music. Chris grew up listening to rock and roll with his mother and classic Norteńo with his dad, and fell in love with the structuring of songs.

Known for his dynamic live performances, Differentchris has been rapidly building momentum across Texas, headlining his own regional tour and cultivating a growing fanbase through both recorded releases and high energy shows. His sound sits at the intersection of indie, alternative pop, and modern singer-songwriter music, drawing listeners in with honest storytelling and memorable hooks.

With a clear artistic vision and a strong connection to his audience, Differentchris represents the next wave of Texas artists pushing indie pop forward. His SXSW performance marks a key moment in a fast-growing career rooted in authenticity, consistency, and creative evolution that he envisioned at a young age.

name: Diles que no me maten
description: Psychedelic Punk in Spanish. Forced Jazz meditation.

name: DJ 4:12
description:
From Greenwood, South Carolina, to Atlanta, Georgia, Debaron Hughes has always loved the art of music—the space it creates, the way it invites people in. What started out as just a passion growing up in a quaint little mom-and-pop town suddenly turned into a lifestyle in 2013: “Debaron Hughes” became DJ4:12.

He’s come a long way since he moved to the city where the players play, finding his own groove, specializing in creating inimitable moments and experiences through his fingertips on a turntable.

Over the past few years, he’s had the incredible opportunity to DJ for multiple artists, such as Lecrae in his “I’m Turnt” music video, Montell Fish, NF, KB, Tedashii, Canon, and Trip Lee (just to name a few).

He’s also been able to DJ at conferences like Destination Imagination, Catalyst, and Propel Women. When he’s not touring, he enjoys getting to DJ for Atlanta Track Club, America’s second-largest running club.

His most recent endeavors have found him DJing for multiple Fortune 500 companies, including Walmart, Pfizer, and Kraft Heinz, to name a few.

name: DJ AG
description:
DJ AG is a genre-shifting DJ and producer whose influence sits at the crossroads of Black British culture, global pop and contemporary electronic music. His sets move from grime and UK rap to afrobeats and alternative soul without losing pace or purpose. This approach has made him a trusted name for artists and audiences who want more than a standard club experience.

AG has shared stages with and played for artists including Ed Sheeran, Will Smith, Burna Boy and Skepta. His profile continues to grow as he brings his sound to live shows, brand events and cultural moments that pull in diverse crowds. Known for reading a room with accuracy rather than hype, AG builds environments where every transition feels intentional.

His work has been covered by a range of platforms and press titles reflecting his reach across culture, style and music. Coverage includes features and appearances in GRM Daily, Complex, Notion, Trench, Mixtape Madness and BBC platforms which have positioned him as one of the most versatile names emerging from the UK scene.

name: DJ Anupi
description: Hi Austin! I’m DJ Anupi, an Austin local with over 12 years in the music scene. My passion for DJing began in high school, driven by a desire to blend beats from the East and West and bring the best of both worlds together. Growing up listening to mostly Bollywood/South Asian music, I gravitated toward fusing global sounds with western styles. I started by creating mashups and quickly discovered my love for bringing people together and creating memories on the dance floor. What began as DJing high school dances soon evolved into spinning downtown on 6th Street, and eventually launching my own sound and events company. Through this journey, I’ve DJed everything from weddings and corporate events to large-scale public parties across Texas and the U.S. Running my events company gave me the opportunity to experience music from many cultures and styles around the world, further shaping my identity as a fusion DJ. Today, my style blends global rhythms and modern beats designed to move crowds and create memories. Recently, I’ve also stepped into music production, crafting remixes that I’m excited to start sharing on SoundCloud. Looking forward to SXSW 2026! See you on the dance floor!

name: DJ BONES
description:
SP
Dj/Productor mexicano y licenciado en negocios de la música que se ha consolidado como una de las propuestas jovenes mas relevantes del país; llegando a hacer mas de 120 shows al año, locales e internacionales.
Actualmente DJ del artista de regional mexicano Tito Double P además de colaborar en eventos con Travis Scott, Young Miko, Cris MJ, Natanael Cano y más.

EN
Is a Mexican DJ and Producer with a degree in Music Business.
He has established himself as one of the most relevant and with huge demand emerging talents, performing over 120 shows per year across Mexico and taking part in international tours, achieving global exposure while representing both Mexico and his hometown.
He is currently the official DJ for regional Mexican artist Tito Double P, and has also collaborated on events with artists such as Travis Scott, Young Miko, Cris MJ, Natanael Cano, among others.
With 11 years of experience, Bones stands out for a career defined by talent, a strong musical identity, and remarkable versatility.
Musical Genres: Latin House, Afro House, Reggaeton, Latin & Club Open Format.

name: DJ Candlestick
description:
DJ Candlestick has seen success throughout the music industry as a member of The Nice Guys, and then the Chopstars.
Starting his career as a young teenager Candlestick built his name up during his high school years and at University Of Houston. While there he was also a founding member of the Nice Guys. As a member of The Chopstars, he is the Founder of ChopCares.

His DJ skill has reached far beyond Houston as he’s been featured on programs such as the Ebro Show on Apple Music, as well as a Black Music Monday mix for Apple Music, NTS live (UK), was a former mixer with 93.7 The Beat , 90.9 KTSU (his alma mater) & Sound 42 on Sirius Xm radio. His work has also been featured in the Oscar Award Winning film Moonlight directed by Barry Jenkins, who he’s also collaborated with on “Purple Moonlight” as well as “If Beale Street Was Chopped” He also has Official Album remixes with Drake, Brent Faiyaz, Thundercat, Don Toliver , Metro Boomin , Little Dragon , Dvsn , Partynextdoor and more. Candlestick also was featured on Mo Amer’s Netflix special “The Vagabond” and has been a feature DJ at Coachella, Billboard and Redbull events as well as opening up for Dave Chappelle

name: DJ Dan
description: DJ Dan is a pioneering American house music DJ and producer, recognized as a key innovator of the "West Coast House" sound since the late 1980s. Known for blending funk, techno, and breakbeats, he rose to prominence in the90s rave scene, co-founded the Funky Tekno Tribe, and launched InStereo Recordings.

name: DJ Dirty Dave
description: David Sigala, better known for his stage name “Dirty Dave” has dominated the music industry with his high energy sets in various dance floors across the US. His enthusiasm for music and passion for moving crowds sets him apart from other entertainers. Based out of Salt Lake City, this influential DJ is taking the industry by storm with his versatile open-format sets.

name: DJ EXILE
description:
**DJ EXILE** has played a pivotal role in elevating Latin music within the nightlife scene of Las Vegas. As an official DJ on Jennifer Lopez’s *“It’s My Party”* tour, he brought his high-energy sound to arenas across the country, solidifying his presence on a national stage.

He has also opened for and performed alongside some of the biggest names in reggaeton and Latin music, including Bad Bunny, J Balvin, and Ozuna, at premier nightlife destinations such as Drai's Nightclub, Omnia Nightclub, Marquee Nightclub, and KAOS.

Touring extensively throughout the United States, DJ EXILE continues to expand his reach while staying deeply connected to his hometown audience.

A proud Las Vegas native with a strong and loyal following in the Vegas Valley, he is also the Co-Founder of Altura Presents, one of the premier Latin entertainment brands in Las Vegas. Through large-scale festivals, nightclub takeovers, weekly events, and concerts, Altura Presents continues to shape and elevate the city’s Latin music culture.

name: DJ Trendsetter Sense + Trendsetter Cypher
description:
DJ Sense, a founding member of "The Aphilliates,
" gained recognition as Trendsetter
Sense. Co Creator of the famous brand “Gangsta Grillz & Gangsta Grillz Radio,
landing shows on Eminem's Shade 45 and Atlanta's Hot 107.9, reaching over 30
million listeners. He then produced the mixtape series"Rhythm &
Streets”,collaborating with artists like Monica, Chris Brown, T Pain, Akon, Usher,
K.Michelle & more. In 2016, he partnered with Lil Jon, managing his worldwide tour.
Trendsetter expands his influence with Chosen Journey, a new chapter in his brand
that merges Faith, Music and Culture. Through this platform, he uplifts artist
perspectives in modern media while embracing a transformative path rooted in
faith based and purpose driven living.
Chosen Journey made history with the first ever Christian Hip Hop set at Rolling
Loud Miami 2024. Returning with CHOSEN JOURNEY PART II ROLLING LOUD ORLANDO 2026.
The Rise of Christian Hip Hop has opened a powerful new door
that a new generation desires to be filled with a message of fullfillment and
inspiration. Catch Trendsetter Sense’s Chosen Journey shows every Sunday from 8-
10am ET on HOT 107.9 ATL and SiriusXM Hip Hop Nation 10-12p ET.

name: Don Glori
description:
Unpicking the thread that stitches together Don Glori’s music would be an impossible task. His records combine elements of Jazz, Funk, Soul, RnB and Samba, yet he doesn’t fit neatly into any of those genres. His live show is more jazz - punk - funk than anything. One thing is certain, there is an undeniable, joyful, spirit that permeates through his music.

Following on from the success of his 2024 album ‘Don’t Forget to Have Fun’, Don Glori is back with his third offering, this time on Mr. Bongo - ‘Paper Can’t Wrap Fire’.
“A kaleidoscopic genre-surfing odyssey that brings together the worlds of jazz, soul and funk. Feeling both contemporary and classic, familiar yet novel, it’s an assured third release that sees an artist in full flight, showcasing their creative prowess and the uniqueness of their musical voice.”

name: DOSSEY
description: DOSSEY started out making squeaky clean pop music in 2017 (NPR’s All Songs Considered actually referred to her in 2018 as “a joyous banquet of roséwave electro-pop”). But by now in 2025, the project has mutated into something brutal, noisy, honest, and unhinged. Motherhood, a slow unspooling of her faith, and the relentless static of American political and social climate have all pushed her toward the genesis of her own brand of dance punk - glitter grunge. So now, DOSSEY’s world hinges on distortion, punk rhythm and anthemic rock vocals influenced by The Clash, Nine Inch Nails and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.

name: DR. GRECO
description:
DR. GRECO, Rawsome Recordings & Odyssey Music Festival 20XX Founder.

Since the inception of Rawsome Rave, his latest record label, he has quickly gained support from Patrick Topping, Patrick Mason, Interplanetary Criminal, Trym, Bad Boombox, Mija, David Löhlein, Justin Jay, JSTJR, t e s t p r e s s, Ollie Lishman, Mischluft, Maruwa, Benwal & many more!

The debut release on his first label, Rawsome Recordings, titled 'Be' feat. Rowetta was a massive hit and quickly became a Summer anthem gaining support from Calvin Harris, Mau P, James Hype, Loco Dice, Nora En Pure, Sonny Fodera, Claptone, Seth Troxler + many more. His work also gained recognition from Billboard, Mixmag, DJ Mag, Dancing Astronaut, Insomniac & Complex.

DR. GRECO has recently performed at EDC Orlando, We Belong Here & Space Miami. Rawsome has also hosted its own label events during ADE for the past 5 years, hosted an annual Summer boat party in New York City and currently hosts its own stage at OMF20XX each year. With early success and a string of exciting releases scheduled for 2026, DR. GRECO continues to push the boundaries of dance music into the future, all while preserving the roots of the underground.

name: Dramos
description:
Dramos is a New Jersey based DJ and producer redefining Latin club music through an East Coast lens. Rooted in Puerto Rican heritage, his sound blends Latin club rhythms, house structure, and global dance energy into a modern expression of diaspora identity. His performances are immersive and rhythm-driven, built as cultural experiences that connect tradition with forward-thinking electronic production.
Working at the intersection of ancestral rhythm and contemporary club architecture, Dramos moves fluidly between salsa-house hybrids, Latin tech grooves, percussive house, and broader Latin club influences. Live percussion textures, melodic phrasing drawn from classic Latin music, and driving low-end foundations sit at the core of his sound, creating records and sets that feel intentional, kinetic, and emotionally charged rather than trend-driven.
His releases have appeared on internationally respected labels including Dim Mak, Armada, Enhanced, and Stealth Records. With a growing catalog of original productions and hybrid Salsa-House and Latin club records, Dramos is carving out a distinct lane within global dance culture that centers identity, movement, and evolution.

name: Drea Dominique
description: Born in Long Island, New York and raised in San Diego California, Drea Dominique has the flavor of both coasts. With her smooth R&B voice and fresh twist on the pop sound, Drea Dominique has what it takes to succeed and make an impact in the music world. Drea is garnering a great deal of attention with the release of her singles, "Stutter" and the remixed version with Domino Saints. They are the first of several singles coming from her upcoming project soon to be announced. Drea has also appeared in music videos for some of today’s most high-profile artists. She has done a variety of modeling work, from magazine publications to print ads. Drea is calling Miami, Florida home now and is currently introducing herself to the music industry.

name: Dub Gideon
description: The Dub Gideon Band was founded in 2009 on the west side of San Antonio, Texas by a group of young men who were deeply inspired by Bob Marley and the spirit of RastafarI. After the release of their first EP in 2011, titled "Underworld EP in Dub", and the follow up EP "Live in Love" (2012), the band quickly became a staple at all Reggae events around Central Texas and established itself as a force to be recognized. Always rooted in the dub tradition, the band started to become a backing outfit for artists in the area who they felt needed a platform to perform their music. The band has backed amazing Texas, international, and Jamaican talent alike such as Likkle Shanx, Alika, Chris Boomer, Teki, Dre Z Melodi, Mister Kali, General Smiley (Michigan and Smiley), Admiral Tibet, Warrior king, Tristan Palma, Spiritual, Luciano, and so many more. Currently based in Austin, the band has re-emerged with a collection of some of Austin's finest Reggae musicians alongside original members from San Antonio. More than a band, Dub Gideon is a concept, and a force in the world of Reggae Music committed to upholding the true integrity of Roots and Culture Dub Music

name: Easy Honey
description: Easy Honey sounds like the starry nights, sunny graveyards, and small-town college Dairy Queens of the South, where the band took form. The group's songs have quickly become anthems of nostalgia for their indie rock audience of daydreamers and night seekers. Easy Honey released their album, Cupidity Unlimited, with contributors such as Adam Lochemes (Arlie, Zach Bryan), Jon Gilbert (Mt. Joy, Adam Melchor, Arcy Drive), and Charlie Stavish (Phoebe Bridgers, Jenny Lewis). The band's raucous yet sentimental live show delivers the realness that people crave in a post-COVID/internet-driven world.

name: EL DUSTY
description: EL DUSTY is a Latin Grammy–nominated DJ and producer from Corpus Christi, Texas, known for blending cumbia roots with modern club sounds like house, hip-hop, and global bass. Through his productions, performances, and events, he bridges Latin culture with contemporary dance floors worldwide while building community through music, parties, and collaborations that push cumbia into the future.

name: Electric Enemy
description:
Electric Enemy is the alternative rock project of London-based multi-instrumentalist and three-time award-winning songwriter Jim Lawton. Fusing the raw power of Muse, Royal Blood and Foo Fighters with sharp social commentary and introspective lyricism, Electric Enemy deliver a high-energy sound built for modern rock stages.

With 15M+ streams, multiple sold-out tours, #1 and #3 European iTunes Rock chart positions, eight weeks in Germany’s Top Rock Radio chart, and a #1 spot on TikTok’s GSA Rock playlist, the band has quickly established itself as a standout international live act.

Renowned for their explosive performances, Electric Enemy were personally invited to support Jerry Cantrell on tour across Europe, with Lawton requested to duet on Cantrell’s iconic Rooster at the London Shepherd’s Bush Empire finale. Recent headline and showcase performances across Italy and Germany have further accelerated their global momentum.

Outside the band, Lawton is an in-demand multi genre writer-producer for Universal-Sony + his music secured multiple sync placements with Netflix, ESPN, Disney+ WarnerBros+Gibson Guitars. “Is this the best live band in the UK”? - Sat Bisla - A & R Worldwide

name: Elijah Delgado
description:
Elijah Delgado is a 23-year-old singer-songwriter from Austin, Texas, creating what he calls Indie Rock Lullabies — a blend of cinematic energy, textured guitar work, and raw emotion. Since releasing his debut EP When I Was On Cloud 9 in 2021, which surpassed 700,000 Spotify streams, Elijah has emerged as one of Austin’s most compelling young voices.

He’s performed on some of the city’s biggest stages, including Blues On The Green 2025 for 20,000+ fans, the national anthem at Austin FC, and opening slots for Chaparelle, Next of Kin, Zach Person, and West 22nd. Festival highlights include Old Settler’s, UtopiaFest, Hot Summer Nights, and ACL Radio’s Drop-In, alongside headlining milestones like Meridian’s first sold-out show and a packed Stubb’s Indoors set following Dayglow.

His latest release, Moonboy (June 2025), showcases a bold evolution. The explosive single “Hide + Seek” contrasts with the aching title track, "Moonboy", exploring isolation, hope, and transformation. With vulnerable lyrics, dynamic shifts, and soulful delivery, Elijah is building a loyal audience and cementing his place as a rising Austin artist to watch.

name: Elijah Johnston
description:
Atlanta based musician, Elijah Johnston, will release a brand new album, Stupid Soul, via Strolling Bones Records on June 20, 2025.

Stupid Soul is either Elijah Johnston’s 4th record or his 7th, depending on who you ask, but possibly the first you’ve heard. The logical next step in a career of slow burns, Stupid Soul is neither a record of morose self-reflection nor a frenetic series of genre experiments, settling into a comfortable steady pace: a record built to fit like a glove.

Performed by a small team including Johnston’s brother, manager, and long-time producer, the record is full of small wonders and live band energy, the sound of four close-knit collaborators in pursuit of something timeless. 12-string acoustic guitars, vintage synthesizers, and a relentless belief in the guitar solo round out Johnston’s usual pop rock palate, and the team manages to make a coherent picture out of a mood board that takes just as many cues from Brian Wilson as it does from The Legend of Zelda.

Elijah began his career in the legendary musical community of Athens, and he was the winner of that city’s 2022 Vic Chesnutt Songwriter of the Year Award. Since then, he has toured nationally and shared stages with acts like Noah Gundersen, Susto, and Elf Power, establishing a name as a recognized songwriter with a potent live show to match.

name: Ella Ion
description:
Emerging from Kaurna Land (Adelaide, Australia), fragmented-folk musician Ella Ion crafts music that cuts deep to the core. Drawing on influences of indie-rock, folk and country, her eloquent lyricism and masterful musical control delivers a cacophony of raw emotion, anchored by grit and heart. Ion has already amassed a loyal following across Australia, as well as listeners streaming her music across the UK, US, Europe and more.

From intimate encounters of tender folk to electrifying post-rock arrangements, Ion flaunts her ability to transform a room of anyone and everyone into a fan. Ella Ion is holding nothing back as she barrels forward in a direction of raw sonic and personal exploration. Ion has supported Suki Waterhouse, Folk Bitch Trio, Jake Bugg, and Greg Mendez at shows across Australia, UK and Europe, as well as taking to the stage at The Great Escape Festival and Green Man Festival in the UK.

name: Emi Angeles
description: EMI ANGELES is a trap artist born in Mexico City and raised in Nuevo León, whose music emerges from a deep creative and spiritual duality. His name comes from the abbreviation of José Emiliano Angeles Aguado and his strong connection to the Catholic faith, a constant pillar within his identity. His project is built around two alter egos: CRVZ, which embodies madness, contained rage, and raw energy, and Ángeles, his more human, sensitive, and everyday side. Influenced by Detroit trap, hood trap, and artists such as Playboi Carti, Ye, and Abhir, EMI ANGELES delivers an authentic and daring sound designed to send chills through the body, shake emotions, and leave a lasting imprint on the listener. His first encounter with music came at an early age after discovering Michael Jackson, leading him from dance to songwriting and eventually to the microphone. Key moments such as his EP ALTER/EGO and the loss of his best friend marked a turning point in his journey, solidifying his artistic commitment. Today, EMI ANGELES transforms the unknown into experience, creating music that connects with what many are afraid to name, aiming to leave a lasting legacy within the Mexican trap scene.

name: Emily Frembgen
description:
A longtime favorite of New York City’s Americana scene, Emily Frembgen returns to SXSW for her third consecutive year as an official artist at Don Giovanni Records.

“Fentanyl,” the first single off Frembgen’s album No Hard Feelings released under Don Giovanni, was hailed by Glide Magazine as “brimming with sharp and twangy guitar and vocals that bring to mind the likes of Lucinda Williams, Laura Cantrell, and Amy Rigby.”

Frembgen spent her childhood bouncing between Colorado and Baltimore, then finally to New York City in 2000. She was shaped musically by both the grittiness of city and by Americana heroes like Kathleen Edwards and Alejandro Escovedo.

In 2021 Frembgen released her debut studio album with producer Hugh Pool at Excello Studio in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, in 2021. Irreverently titled It’s Me or the Dog, it garnered widespread critical praise, with New York Music Daily naming it “one of the best records of the year” and Glide Magazine calling it “a strong study in writing both melodies and powerful lyrics.”

Her next full length album, Little Stranger, is due out in 2026.

name: Endearments
description:
The music of Endearments has always turned a mirror on the inner self, reflecting life’s deeply personal, often painful moments in the light of clarity and new resolve. Principal songwriter Kevin Marksson and his bandmates, guitarist Anjali Nair and drummer Will Haywood Smith, craft emotionally dense and instrumentally lush pop songs, viewed through the lens of contemporary, dreamy indie rock and embedded with a John Hughes-ian romanticism.

Drawing on the emotive qualities of 80s synthpop and late-90s emo in equal measure, 'An Always Open Door', Endearments’ first full-length record, fine-tunes this heartfelt songcraft, widening the band’s influences and turning up the volume while maintaining the raw lyrical storytelling that’s made them a mainstay in Brooklyn’s highly competitive scene. The end result is a record that reevaluates the past, foregrounding emotional truths through performances that are as kinetic as they are introspective. Produced by Abe Seiferth, the album blends dreamy and down-to-earth influences into a vibrant, varied, and dynamic image of the band’s inner world.

An Always Open Door will be available on March 6, 2026, via Trash Casual.

name: Enus Sunne
description:
SP
Enus Sunne es una figura clave en la evolución de la escena urbana en México. Con más de una década de trayectoria, se ha consolidado como uno de los DJs y productores más completos del país, fusionando versatilidad técnica con una visión empresarial única.
Como CEO y cofundador de Cincodoce, ha transformado la vida nocturna de la CDMX, posicionando el club y su sello discográfico (Cincodoce Music) como referentes internacionales. Su talento lo ha llevado desde el escenario del Coca-Cola Flow Fest hasta clubes emblemáticos en Berlín, Valencia, Montreal y Bogotá.
Más que un DJ, Enus es un curador de experiencias y un visionario que sabe exactamente cómo encender la pista. Su propuesta es, hoy por hoy, un "must" en la escena global.

EN
Enus Sunne, DJ, Producer, and Visionary of the Mexican urban scene.
With a 10-year career, he is the mastermind behind Cincodoce (Club & Music Label) and a benchmark of versatility behind the decks. From Mexico City to the world, he has taken his sound to major stages like Flow Fest and international cities including Berlin and Montreal.

Talent curator and dancefloor architect: Enus Sunne doesn’t just play music—he sets the pulse for what’s next.

name: Era Wadi
description: Era Wadi is an artist, rapper, and songwriter based in Austin, TX. His early musical inspirations began from his father's collection of soul and rock vinyls of the 60s/70s and hip hop of the late 90s/early 2000s. Era Wadi continues to build up his own discography and is releasing music independently. His constant aim at originality and being authentically himself attracts new audiences and has an exciting new EP releasing this Spring. When he’s not making music, you will find him hosting The Wadi Show with his DJ, Lil Em on Twitch + YouTube, a platform for artists by artists that has become one of the top live streaming channels for entertainment. Era Wadi’s unique voice, relatable songwriting, infectious energy, and impeccable beat selection, insure Wadi will carve out his place as an innovator in this new and ever evolving era of culture.

name: The Eric Hisaw Band
description: The Eric Hisaw Band is a roots rock’n’roll trio based in Austin, Tx. The 2025 Flak Records release Otra Vez draws on influences ranging from John Lee Hooker, Jerry Lee Lewis & Link Wray filtered through a 1960’s Nuggets era garage rock sensibility. The bulk of the material was developed while Hisaw was laid up with a gunshot wound from a wayward bullet that entered his family’s southeast Austin home. Using small Fender amps, lots of tremolo, Silvertone & telecaster guitars, Hisaw, drummer Shawn Peters and bassist Ron McRae create a rough and tumble, driving sound to support Hisaw’s literate tales of outsiders living on the fringes of the American dream. Since McRae’s departure to Eugene, OR, bass duties have been filled by Jimmy Pettit (of the great 80’s Joe Ely Band) who has brought his own unique raw power rock’n’roll spirit to the band’s live show. Look for lots of regional shows & new music from the band coming soon.

name: Esau Ortiz
description:
Desafiante, innovador e inquebrantable, Esaú Ortiz se ha consolidado como una de las voces más originales de la nueva música mexicana. Creador del fenómeno global “Triple Lavada”, el artista originario de Monterrey, NL, rompe con lo establecido al fusionar la música regional mexicana con pop, rap y funk, dando forma a un sonido propio que él denomina retro bélico.
Antes de consolidarse como intérprete, Ortiz ya era una fuerza creativa dentro de la industria. Su talento como compositor escribió éxitos para Carin León, Grupo Firme, Junior H, Tito Double P, Luis R. Conriquez y Peso Pluma, colaboración que le valió su primer Latin GRAMMY® en 2024. Entre sus composiciones más reconocidas destacan “Voy a Amarte”, “De Fresa y de Coco”, “Tronando Ligas”, “VVS” y “Mr. International”.
escribió su primera canción a los 13 años, desarrolló un estilo versátil tras explorar géneros como el hip-hop, la música reginoal. El punto de quiebre llegó con “Triple Lavada”, tema que se viralizó en TikTok antes de su lanzamiento oficial, superó los 62M de streams y alcanzó el Top 10 de Billboard con su remix. Esaú Ortiz representa la evolución sonora del regional mexicano y su proyección global.

name: eydrey
description:
eydrey is a 26-year-old bilingual artist emerging from the U.S.–Mexico border cities of El Paso, Texas, and Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua. Shaped by a bi-cultural upbringing, her music reflects the fluid exchange of language, rhythm, and identity that defines the region. Proudly Latina and proudly Mexican, eydrey draws from her roots to create music that reflects both her vulnerability and strength.

Her sound varies across regional mexicano and reggaeton— with bilingual lyrics that explore themes of heartbreak and healing. With a unique sound and a genre-fluid approach to music, eydrey is slowly but surely positioning herself as a compelling voice in the evolving Latin music landscape.

name: FAMA
description:
FAMA is the musical project of brothers Facundo and Mateo, born in Peru with Argentine roots. Their name [Fa + Ma] reflects a lifelong bond shaped by music, art, and shared creative curiosity. Blending intimate acoustic pop with touches of country, funk, and organic textures. Their first-ever release surpassed 100K views on YouTube, and they continue to build momentum with a steady stream of new music.

Raised on influences like Michael Jackson, Elvis Presley, Justin Bieber, and Shawn Mendes, both brothers bring distinct creative backgrounds (acting, fashion, and DJ culture) into a single, authentic vision. Currently working with Los Angeles-based producers including Joel Jones, Brandon Shoop, and Juan Ariza, FAMA represents the meeting point between intimacy and universality, music that feels personal, yet instantly relatable.

FAMA is born from the need to feel without fear. To speak from the heart in a world that so often hides it. They don’t come to be perfect, they come to be real. FAMA doesn’t seek fame; it seeks connection. Every verse, every chord, every silence is an invitation to look inward and recognize yourself, always from a place of love.

name: The Family Battenberg
description:
‘The Family Battenberg have perfected a filthy, fuzzy psychedelic sound that they’ve coined as “spider rock.” (The Face)
The Family Battenberg's 'Anteater' single, released in April 2025, is an independent release by the Cardiff based four-piece. The track was written in just a day, and it was recorded at Tom Rees’ (Buzzard Buzzard Buzzard) studio while he was on holiday. To master the recording the group sought out long-time collaborator Eddie Al-Shakarchi (Boy Azooga, Loathe, Swim Deep.)

Aligning with the soundscape that’s signature to them, ‘Anteater’ is The Family Battenberg finessed. Drenched in fuzzy saturation, spacey vocals ricochet between a blistering guitar, all while a double-tracked mono drum plays like a call to action.  This is an anti-love song. When unhealthy adoration becomes a quest for romance, or approval in this case, we find ourselves doing strange things. In this story, the protagonist justifies total metamorphosis in the name of subservience. “It’s self-humiliation in the pursuit of a potential suitor’s attention,” as frontman Eliot puts it.
