Anyone that has seen this band live before is sure to recognise it from past setlists. The group had played it as an unreleased track amongst their own shows and a host of major festivals, namely,

Greenman, Trans Musicales 2024, Reeperbahn 2024 and ESNS 2025. As budding upcomers, the group have also supported the likes of Getdown Services, Panic Shack, Gruff Rhys and the Bug Club.

Championed by Steve Lamacq, Amy Lame, Huw Stephens and Adam Walton, the group are already making their mark on the industry.

'Wow I love that, a South Walian answer to Psychedelic Porn Crumpets' John Kennedy, Radio X

name: Famous Friend
description:
Famous Friend is the sun-bleached, indie surf solo project of ASCAP award-winning artist and producer Zachariah Carlson. Born out of the fame-soaked dreamscape of West Los Angeles, Famous Friend began as an alter-ego, a playful mirror of the city’s obsession with image. His music blends washed-out indie surf guitars with sparkling dream pop production and post-punk drums, balancing joy and heartbreak in equal measure.

The result is nostalgic and cinematic: beach day euphoria melts into late night reflections about relationships past and present. Songs like “Tanlines” and “Nora” have earned millions of streams and support from KCRW tastemakers and helped secure him a spot as a recent member of the prestigious Taco Bell Feed the Beat class of 2025. Amidst all the noise, Famous Friend continues to turn California melancholy into shimmering, golden-hour anthems for dreamers and outsiders.

P.S. The multi-instrumentalist is also a frequent writer, producer, collaborator with some of Los Angeles’s premiere indie and alternative acts like Winnetka Bowling League, Casket Cassette, and Floats as well as composer for shows like the Emmy-Nominated “Alexa & Katie.”

name: FEET
description:
When FEET self-released their debut album in 2019, the group offered up a particularly oblique title: What’s Inside Is More Than Just Ham. But once listeners delved into the record, they found sloshing’s of guitar music that careered wildly between indie, psych, and subtle shades of new wave across an exciting and unpredictable 35 minutes. Since then, FEET have seen prominent live shows have seen them supporting the likes of Inhaler and even The Rolling Stones at their huge 2022 Hyde Park shows. The bands second album "Make It Up" garnered further critical acclaim with the band being invited to perform a BBC 6Music Live session off the back of the single releases Greasy Boy, Why Would I Lie and The Real Thing.

The band are returning in 2026 with their third album to be released on Submarine Cat Records amidst a year of heavy touring which will see the band on two UK and European headline stints throughout the album campaign. A very welcome return, then, for one of Britain’s most inventive bands, starting a new chapter afresh that builds on the brilliance of their first outing and takes it to a new level entirely. 2026, it’s fair to say, is ready for Feet to stomp all over it.

name: Femi Temowo
description:
Femi Temowo is a MOBO Award-nominated artist, composer, and music producer. His mastery on guitar and distinctive styles quickly earned him widespread recognition, leading to collaborations with world-class artists including George Benson, Amy Winehouse, Courtney Pine, Taylor Swift, The Roots, Omar, Soweto Kinch, and many more.

Beyond his virtuosity as a guitarist, Femi is a highly respected producer known for crafting warm, immersive soundscapes that blend jazz, soul, and African rhythms with contemporary influences. His production portfolio includes studio albums, live projects, and original scores for prestigious institutions such as the BBC and the National Theatre. Among his recent work, Femi has produced tracks for emerging UK artist Frenchie (formerly The Naked Eye), bringing his signature blend of musical
depth and emotional resonance to new voices. Continuously evolving, Femi Temowo remains a vital creative force, shaping modern music with authenticity, cultural heritage, and innovative artistry.

name: fifi knifefight
description: fifi knifefight is an Austin based glam punk band known for a powerful live presence and raw sound. Blending punk grit with theatrical flair, this is a must-see act for fans of Hole. Fronted by dynamic lead, the eponymous fifi knifefight, their performances often feature driving rhythms, unapologetic lyrics, and an in-your-face style that's intense yet captivating. Tracks like "joanie" and "THE PARTY" showcase their unique mix of emotional depth and defiance. Often found in downtown Austin and recently featured in several local festivals, fifi knifefight continues to make waves in the indie circuits.

name: Fime
description: LA alternative indie rock quartet Fime released their debut LP “Sweeter Memory” in 2022. Working with producer Melina Duterte from Jay Som, they infused their garage rock sound with shoegaze, ethereal and gauzy vocals and distorted, reverb laden guitar melodies. Fime is set to release there second album “Just Can’t Win” in September 2025.

name: Fine
description:
Fine is a Copenhagen-based singer-songwriter and producer whose music blends samples, acoustic and electric instruments into a groovy and ethereal crossover sound, both familiar and dreamlike.

Her debut album, Rocky Top Ballads (2024), turns experiments into songs by cutting and layering band improvisations. Bringing them together with melodies and voice. The album features loose-wristed-head-bobbing drums, a wide range of guitar sounds, bass riffs, reverb-soaked atmospheres, and real sound recordings — all woven together with Fine's distinctive voice and lyrics.

Live, Fine reshapes her hypnotic sound together with her band: Lola Hammerich on guitar (Baby in Vain), Andreas Murga on bass (Gorgeous), and Mads Muurholm on drums.

Starting early, Fine began her career over a decade ago with the Danish electronic trio Chinah, releasing three albums. She has since co-written for New Jeans with Erika de Casier and Smerz, attended Clarissa Connelly’s Kanonschoir, and collaborated with Astrid Sonne under the moniker Coined.

name: Fine Food Market
description:
Fine Food Market is the folk dream-pop project of Montreal-based multi-disciplinary artist Sophie Perras. Drawing from her training as a classical pianist and inspired by the sound of her beloved PSR3000 keyboard, the songs of Fine Food Market are intuitive, emotional, and fun.

Fine Food Market builds from the rudiments of country-folk and the experimental tendencies of the indie genre to articulate a musical place filled with sunny fields, old cars, and brightly painted houses.

Both eclectic and whimsical, the songs of Fine Food Market can also contain a real sadness, a feeling especially discoverable in her French lyrics. As a bilingual artist she unravels intimate and intricate musings in her own language, writing in a voice reserved for speaking to a close friend. Ultimately sincere, Fine Food Market may also pick up the tools of satire to describe difficult events of her own life.

Fine Food Market’s first EP, “I’m afraid to be in love with someone who crashes their car So much” was released in the beginning of March 2025 with Arbutus Records.

name: FINLANDS
description:
Formed in 2012 by Fuyuko Shioiri (Vo.Gt) and Kayo Koshimizu (Ba.Cho), the band gained attention through awards at RO69JACK and appearances at major Japanese music festivals including ROCK IN JAPAN FESTIVAL, RISING SUN ROCK FESTIVAL, and COUNTDOWN JAPAN.

They released two mini-albums, ULTRA and JET, in 2015, followed by the full-length album PAPER in 2016. Subsequent releases included the mini-album LOVE (2017) and the album BI (2018), both charting highly on Oricon, with sold-out headline shows beginning at Shibuya Club Quattro.

After the release of their first EP UTOPIA in 2019, Koshimizu (Ba.Cho) departed the band. In 2021, they held a sold-out tour final at Zepp DiverCity. Currently, Shioiri continues the project as the sole official member with supporting musicians.

In 2025, they released HAS, their first album in nearly four years, followed by a successful nine-city tour. Shioiri is also active as a songwriter for artists such as adieu (Moka Kamishiraishi) and Salyu.

name: Firecracker
description:
Firecracker is a punk rock’n’roll outfit from Bologna, Italy,
born in 2020. Their sound fuses the raw edge of punk
with grunge‑driven moods and a straight‑ahead,
no‑nonsense attitude. After a lineup shake‑up in 2023,
the band tightened its direction, keeping its trademark
grit while pushing for richer, more dynamic
arrangements. April 2025 saw the release of their new
EP Not Your City, a record that captures Firecracker’s
evolution and marks a new chapter in their sonic
journey.

name: Flesh Juicer
description:
Flesh Juicer is Taiwan’s most iconic heavy metal band, formed in 2006 in Taichung. Blending Deathcore and Hardcore with electronic textures and traditional pentatonic scales, they’ve forged a distinctive Taiwanese metal sound rooted in local culture. Their music draws inspiration from folk religion, temple processions, and social realities, transforming raw energy into a visceral expression of contemporary Taiwan.
Flesh Juicer’s work has consistently earned critical acclaim both in Taiwan and internationally. Their debut album ‘GIGO’ (2015) won the Golden Indie Music Award for Best Rock Album, while ‘Deep Sea Fairy Tale’ (2018) earned nominations at the AIM Independent Music Awards（US）. In 2021, ‘GOLDEN Taizi BRO’ swept three GIMA trophies, Best Live Performance, Best Band, and Best Album, solidifying their status as Taiwan’s metal powerhouse.

Known for massive sold-out shows of over 5,000 fans, Flesh Juicer has brought their electrifying performances to Clockenflap (Hong Kong), Summer Sonic (Japan), and Hammer Sonic (Indonesia). With a new album set for release in 2026 and a North American tour in the works, Flesh Juicer is not only a flagship band in Taiwan’s metal scene but also demonstrates strong potential to make a lasting impact on the global stage.

name: Flor de la Frontera
description:
Born in McAllen Tx raised in the border with Reynosa Mx mixed cultured, rancher family with passion for folklore, music, outdoors and traditions
Been doing cumbia for couple of year initially in México giving the cumbia rythms a spicy twist with tropical, norteño, amazónico, tumbado, inmortal ®gional flavors

name: Foliage
description:
The Inland Empire can either suffocate you or make you work even harder. For the past 10 years, Manuel Joseph Walker’s prolific output as Foliage has helped him become a widely recognized figurehead in modern Shoegaze. A chameleonic producer, Walker draws from the broader palettes of Post-Punk while slyly incorporating textures and ideas from Hip-Hop and Electronic records, revealing ephemeral but lasting impressions that feel simultaneously intimate and ritualistic, something you can listen to in your headphones late at night or shout along with a cold lager in your hand. His song “It’s Time” has been featured in nearly 19K TikToks from brands such as Le Creuset, F1, & Netflix.

With his latest single “Missing Hearts”, featuring a music video he directed, Walker has produced his most arena-ready tune yet. With millions of streams and a reputation for unforgettable live performances, Foliage has evolved from best-kept secret to cornerstone of Indie's next generation of hitmakers. In the wake of their first full-length record in six years on the way, Foliage is poised to make a massive splash at this year’s SXSW and all through 2026.

name: Foolish Ty
description: Foolish Ty is a versatile melodic Rap/R&B artist from Austin, Texas. Making his first appearance at SXSW he looks forward to introducing a new audience to his unique sound that has amassed him over 100,000 streams across all platforms.

name: Frankfurt Helmet
description:
Rising rapidly within the global indie scene, Frankfurt Helmet has emerged as a definitive voice in Chinese independent electronic music. As one
of China’s most innovative trans-media projects, the duo—comprising acclaimed drummer Romna and sound artist Yufei—merges their diverse
backgrounds to push the boundaries of electronic soundscapes.
Their sonic identity is defined by a striking contrast: the ethereal, atmospheric depths of modular synthesis layered over cold, precision
engineered mechanical rhythms. Having graced the stages of major international festivals and art exhibitions, Frankfurt Helmet continues to
redefine the intersection of live performance and sound art on a global scale.

name: FrivolousShara
description:
FrivolousShara is a high-voltage Hip-Hop artist and producer blending sharp lyricism, geek culture, and fearless energy into an unforgettable live experience. Blurring the lines between hip-hop, anime, gaming, and internet culture, her sound is bold, playful, and unapologetically her own.

On stage, she brings nonstop momentum, confidence, and charisma. Every set feels like a controlled chaos: hype, emotional, silly, weird, and impossible to ignore. Her music balances fun and intensity, pairing swagger and sauciness with moments of raw honesty that pull the crowd all the way in.

With music featured in professional wrestling and competitive fighting game spaces, FrivolousShara has become a standout force at the intersection of hip-hop and geek culture. She thrives in rooms full of gamers, anime fans, hip-hop heads, and anyone ready to turn up and feel something real.

name: Future Nobodies
description:
Future Nobodies is a genre-bending trio from Chicago, IL. Influenced by the 2000’s NYC indie scene as well as 1980’s post-punk and new wave, the band has developed a nostalgic, emotionally charged sound that is solely their own. Often described as “sad happy music to dance to,” the trio croon like Morrissey over bass heavy melodies and crying guitar licks.
The band released their first album in 2021 (Hotel Del La Muerte) as an online project that gained immediate traction. In 2022 they released their Over it/Apasionada EP. “Over It” was placed on an official Spotify playlist causing the song to reach over a million streams and gain the band over 50K monthly listeners overnight. In 2023 they performed at Riot Fest. The line up included acts such as Death Cab For Cutie, Queens of the Stoneage, and The Cure. In 2024 they released their self-titled sophomore album, Future Nobodies. The album was picked up and distributed by Young & Cold Records. With the record labels help, the band made their European debut at Germany’s annual Wave Gotik Treffen Festival. Since then, the band has gained underground popularity and is currently touring cities across the U.S.

name: The Gasoline Gypsies
description:
Crisp harmonies, dual lead guitars, and a rhythm section built on drums, bass, and keys makes up The Gasoline Gypsies. But, their recent exponential growth is born of a work ethic that has earned them the reputation one of the tightest bands in Michigan.
Music built to serve the songs, drawing influence from the roots of rock, folk, bluegrass, and country, The Gasoline Gypsies craft a unique style of Americana Rock; Music painting images of the wonder of nature while engaging thoughtful, and mature poetry, spinning themes that invite us to an understanding of our common human journey. A Gasoline Gypsies show asks us to breathe in all of the world, and exhale a unifying message of realistic hope, celebrating both life’s challenges and joys, reminding us that amid the ebb and flow of life, we are all on this ride together.
The Gasoline Gypsies plugged in can rock large venues. Unplugged they can enchant small rooms.
The Eight time Detroit Music Award winners are feverishly followed by their loyal fan tribe, The Vagabundos. Meet a Vagabundo, and you’ll likely be enchanted by an alchemy that draws together the music, the people, and the family that is The Gasoline Gypsies experience.

name: Gavin the Hotrod
description: Gavin the HotRod is a Jacksonville, Florida–based hip-hop artist known for blending Southern grit, faith-rooted conviction, and sharp, punchline-heavy lyricism. He has steadily built momentum through consistency, live shows, and a catalog that balances technical skill with substance. Drawing from classic Southern rap energy while staying modern and introspective, Gavin has grown a loyal audience with thousands of monthly listeners.

name: Georgia Webster
description:
Georgia Webster grew up in a small town in western Massachusetts, where quiet days and wide-open space gave her the freedom to write songs from a young age. With a guitar in hand and artists like Taylor Swift and Avril Lavigne in her headphones, she found her voice early, and it didn’t take long for others to notice. After building a devoted audience online, Georgia made the move to Nashville, where she found herself opening for artists Kelsea Ballerini & Ingrid Andress.

Now stepping into her next chapter, Georgia is embracing a pop-driven sound that blends the warmth and storytelling of early 2000s pop rock—pulling inspiration from artists like Sheryl Crow, Jewel, and Tori Kelly—with the intimacy and emotional honesty of modern voices like Gracie Abrams and Maggie Rogers. But it’s not just about the music…it’s about the message. Georgia is becoming a voice for the next generation of female songwriters, creating a space where people can be themselves, share the stories that make them human, and connect beyond the screen. Whether she’s writing, performing, or building community in real life, her mission is clear: have fun, care deeply, and help others feel seen through creativity.

name: Geto Gala
description: Geto Gala is an Austin-based hip-hop duo formed by vocalists Deezie Brown and Jake Lloyd. Known for blending Southern rap, "candy slab" tradition, and, in particular, the influence of DJ Screw, they released their debut EP in 2021 before dropping their full-length album, Major League, in 2025.

name: GILT
description: Bounce riffs in skinny jeans. Polyrhythms in Affliction shirts. breakdowns4breakdowns? :3

name: Girl Tones
description:
Girl Tones, of planet Earth, are a high-energy rock duo brought to life by two sisters named Kenzie and Laila. Both classically trained musicians, Kenzie transitioned from cello to guitar and Laila from piano to drums in an effort to electrify sentient beings from this galaxy to the next. Their debut releases were produced by Brad Shultz of Cage The Elephant and released via his label Parallel Vision in partnership with Big Loud Rock.
Their first offerings have earned the praise of Rolling Stone, VICE, Consequence, PAPER, NME, DORK and many others with Flaunt saying, “Their sound is fluid, and yet with each release, they evolve as a harmonious group, developing their unique sound as one.”
Girl Tones has toured with Cage The Elephant across the globe, as well as The Velveteers, hey, nothing. and Silversun Pickups in North America. Making their unignorable festival debut at Lollapalooza, Shaky Knees, Austin City Limits and more, Rolling Stone said, “While the White Stripes — their most obvious comparison — were about controlled energy, Girl Tones are proudly imperfect.”
As the band jumps into 2026, they have no shortage of new music and new tour dates up their sleeves.

name: Glass Mansions
description:
Austin alt-pop trio Glass Mansions create music that moves — propulsive beats, heavy synths, and intimate pop melodies led by the sultry, unmistakable voice of Jayna Doyle.

Live, it’s pure Rock n’ Roll – raw, sweaty, passionate and covered in a cloud of fog and confetti – and chances are you’ve probably seen them at some point or another as they’ve crisscrossed the country, playing places like SXSW for the past 3 years and Warped Tour, Canadian Music Week, Illfest, Indie Week Canada, and Florida Music Festival before that. They've also shared the stage with bands like Phantogram, Robert Delong, Young The Giant, Urban Heat and The Unlikely Candidates along the way.

Their music has been featured on MTV, Netflix and Bravo and after releasing the fiery "STANDING O" in 2022 and sultry "NEARSIGHTED" in 2023 to both streaming success and critical acclaim the band has returned with the dark alt-pop track "VIOLET" and accompanying music video to finish the trilogy.

In 2025 the band was selected to become a Sonic Guild Artist, accelerating their creative output. Look for a brand new single to be released just before SXSW.

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

name: Glassio
description: Glassio is the Dream-Pop–tinged Indie-Dance project of Irish-Iranian songwriter and producer Sam R. Blending melodic sweetness with brooding dance beats, his self-described “melancholy disco” sound has earned over 25 million streams and global acclaim. Since emerging with the viral 2016 EP Poptimism (whose single “Try Much Harder” hit No. 9 on Spotify’s Global Viral Chart), Glassio has toured internationally with acts like Clap Your Hands Say Yeah, Nada Surf, and Electric Youth, and released two acclaimed LPs—For the Very Last Time (2020, Downtown Music) and See You Shine (2022)—with songs featured on Netflix and HBO. Raised between the Middle East and California and later based in New York and London, Sam draws influence from New Wave, 60s chamber pop, and early-2000s electronica, channeling it into rich, cinematic pop. His upcoming third album, The Imposter (2026), written during his move from New York to London, fuses shoegaze, folk, and dream pop in a neo-noir exploration of self-confrontation and creative rebirth. “I wanted this album to make people ask if they’re living the life they’re meant to,” he says. “For me, this is about rediscovering who I am as an artist.

name: Glaze
description: Glaze is an shoegaze band hailing from Austin, Texas, blending dreamy soundscapes with powerful, hook-driven melodies. Known for their atmospheric sound and raw, heartfelt lyrics, Glaze crafts music that resonates with themes of self-discovery, love, and the complexities of modern life. The band’s rich guitar tones, tight rhythms, and ambient textures invite listeners into a sonic journey, captivating audiences at each live performance. With a dedicated fan base and a growing reputation for compelling live shows, Glaze continues to make waves in the Austin music scene and beyond, bringing a fresh yet nostalgic vibe to rock.

name: Gogol Bordello
description:
Since 1999, international punk band Gogol Bordello, led by Ukrainian frontman Eugene Hütz, has been filling up rooms with an energy that could run a whole city. A lifelong lover of the punk scene growing up in Ukraine, Hütz finally found himself where he felt he belonged, in New York’s Lower East Side in the late 90s, where he went to shows and later performed at the legendary CBGB. Crashing at friends’ apartments and playing acoustic sets in NYC Ukrainian bars, his group steadily grew to an 8 piece multicultural band, combining Eastern, Western and Latin traditions. Since then the band has lit up stages around the world alongside System of a Down, Primus, Rancid, Dropkick Murphys, dueted with Regina Spektor, and cut albums with legends Rick Rubin, Steve Albini and a forthcoming album with Nic Launay.

Russia's war in Ukraine is personal for Eugene & the band, who have been tirelessly advocating for Ukrainian solidarity, partnering with Nova Ukraine, ArtDopomoga, and putting together benefits with Patti Smith, The Hold Steady, Suzanne Vega, Magnetic Fields, Matisyahu and more. Additionally, they collaborated with Bernard Sumner on a cover of the Angelic Upstarts “Solidarity” with proceeds going to the Ukrainian Soldiers Recovery.

Gogol Bordello’s forthcoming record, We Mean It, Man!, is due out in March 2026. For this album, Hütz set out to blend post-punk textures and aggro to Gogol Bordello’s free-wheeling gypsy-punk. He chose to work with the production team of Nick Launay (Gang of Four, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Idles) and Adam “Atom” Greenspan (Nick Cave, Idles, Flogging Molly) to accomplish this goal. Together with his long running band, they knocked out twelve super punchy and hook-laden songs. The title track, “We Mean It, Man!” is all pile-driving punk intensity which crescendoes into no-wave sax skronk. “No Time For Idiots” is a Strummer/Jones-esque riff-punk with a giant chorus payoff. “Life Is Possible Again” voices an optimism against the dread of the Ukraine war. “Solidarity” features New Order’s Bernard Sumner on the Angelic Upstart’s Solidarność-punk anthem updated to address the Ukraine war effort. This is the album and political message the world needs now.

name: GOKUMON
description:
The band 'Uchikubi Gokumon Doukoukai' is a three-piece band formed in Japan in 2004.
While active within Japan under the kanji name '打首獄門同好会' (Uchikubi Gokumon Doukoukai),
representing Japanese culture, they operate internationally under the more easily pronounceable name 'GOKUMON.'

Featuring a mixed-gender lineup with a male guitar/vocalist and a female rhythm section,
the band is known for its unique style that combines a heavy sound with a 7-string guitar and 5-string bass.
This distinctive musical approach, coupled with laid-back lyrics infused with a sense of everyday life, has established a new genre known as 'Seikatsu Micchaku-gata Loud Rock' (Life-Immersed Loud Rock).

In their live performances, the band incorporates VJ (visual jockey) elements,
projecting visuals and lyrics on screens synchronized with the music.
This not only enhances the auditory experience but also provides a visually captivating aspect.

name: Grace Sorensen
description: Grace Sorensen is one of the fastest independent-rising stars in the music scene. As a multi-hyphenate singer, songwriter, and dancer, she’s been dubbed "Austin's Wonderkid" and “Austin’s R&B Cool Girl” by the Austin Chronicle and KUTX. In her young career she has already been featured on Joe Budden’s “Sleeper Picks,” collaborated with BLK ODYSSY, been inducted to the Recording Academy's Class of 2025, played Austin City Limits Festival, SXSW Austin & London, and surpassed one million organic streams on her single "Digits.” She debuted her versatile album "BLUEPRINT" February 2025 and has exciting expectation of new collaborations, visual projects, and records.

name: Graham Reynolds
description: Called “the quintessential modern composer” by the ​London Independent​, Austin-based composer-bandleader-improviser Graham Reynolds records and performs music for film, theater, dance, rock clubs, and concert halls. He recently scored Richard Linklater’s He recently scored Richard Linklater’s Blue Moon (Sony) with Ethan Hawke and Margaret Qualley, Hit Man (Netflix), Happy Jail (Netflix), Stop Hitting Yourself (Lincoln Center Theater), Out of Her Mind (BBC), Grimm Tales (Ballet Austin), and a multi-year commission from Ballroom Marfa, The Marfa Triptych, culminating in his Creative Capital Award winning project Pancho Villa from a Safe Distance. Amidst his many other projects, Graham also serves as the Artistic Director of the new music focused non-profit Golden Hornet. In 2020, Graham signed with London-based record label Fire Records and released his original score for Alfred Hitchcock’s silent classic, The Lodger. His most recent release with Fire, Mountain (March 2025), is a full-length solo album that draws from the full breadth of his musical career.

name: Grandmas House
description:
Grandmas House, Bristol’s finest and loudest 4 piece, have been busy honing their grunge and post-punk influenced sound. With an attack that is both relentless and melodic, the all-female band are a genuinely unique proposition - refusing to be pigeon holed, they are here to shake up perceptions with their intelligent, stylish and raucous take on rock music.

Citing influences from Nirvana to Porridge Radio and Idles to boygenius, the band have been developing their dynamic songwriting. The music moves between aggressive and heavy instrumentation and slower, more melodic passages, creating a powerful contrast. They use their voices to create layered harmonies and the result is a unique and expansive sound.

The band have supported Idles, Big Special, Katy J Pearson and Arxx. They’ve been championed by BBC Introducing and BBC Radio 1 and have had BBC 6 Music support from Steve Lamacq, Emily Pilbeam and Amy Lamé.

name: grima
description:
Reverby guitars and post-punk energy meet dreamy Spanish
vocals – somewhere between future anxiety and the desire for
self-realization.
German-Spanish artist grima emerged on Cologne’s wave scene in
2024, leaning into a '90s-inspired shoegaze sound that now defines
both his live shows and debut EP.
Early single En busca de caught international attention – including
airplay by London DJ and musician Nabihah Iqbal on her BBC Radio
6 show. Following his live debut in Berlin, grima played international
showcases in spring 2025, including Liverpool Sound City (UK) and
c/o pop Festival (DE).
His debut EP instantes (antes de caer) was released in July 2025,
accompanied by a sold-out release show in his adopted hometown
Cologne. The EP was featured on several Spotify Editorial Playlists
and even landed the cover of Fresh Finds Spain.
Recent highlights include a support slot for acclaimed American
shoegaze band glare and three shows at Reeperbahn Festival
2025 – all while grima is already working on new material.

name: The Gringos
description:
The Gringos are an indie rock band building a real-world scene.
Born from house shows, late-night living room sessions, and college basements, their sound blends raw indie rock energy with melodic songwriting and a loose, lived-in Southern warmth. Their music feels like something you stumbled into — loud enough to feel alive, honest enough to feel personal.

The Gringos aren’t just a band — they’re building a community. From packed college rooms to growing regional tours, their shows feel less like concerts and more like gatherings. The kind where strangers become friends, choruses get screamed back, and everyone leaves feeling like they found something.

If you’re looking for polished pop — look somewhere else.
If you’re looking for your new favorite band before everyone else finds them — welcome.

name: Grocery Bag
description: Grocery Bag are the latest in a new breed of face-melting rock & roll straight out of Austin, Texas. The garage rock-psych-punk 4 piece, led by diminutive singer Bella Martinez, have been tearing up stages around Texas since 2023, being handpicked by the likes of Osees, Frankie & The Witch Fingers & Farmer's Wife to support on multiple shows as well as a critically-acclaimed set at Levitation Festival 2024. Following this breakthrough performance, the band were added as main support on Psychedelic Porn Crumpets tour in April/May 2025, playing 22 shows & solidifying their reputation as one of the best live bands in the country. Their debut album 'Break You' (released in Nov 2023) is a great raw snapshot of young talented musicians creating something exciting, to-the-point, that leaves you replaying time & time again. New music is expected early 2026!

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

name: Grrrl Gang
description: Hailing from the cultural city of Yogyakarta, Indonesia, Grrrl Gang is a rising force in the independent music scene with their infectious melodies, anthemic songs, and electrifying live performances. The power trio, composed of Angeeta Sentana on guitar and vocals, Akbar Rumandung on bass, and Edo Alventa on guitar, has been making waves in the Southeast Asian music scene since their formation in 2016. Grrrl Gang's music is a celebration of their collective roots and a testament to the power of pop music to connect people across cultures and borders. Their lyrics touch on themes such as feminism, mental health, and relationships with a raw honesty that speaks to a generation of young listeners. With their infectious energy, socially conscious lyrics, and unique sound, Grrrl Gang is poised to take the global music scene by storm and become a voice for a new generation. Their full-length debut album, Spunky! is the sound of a band not content to rest on its laurels, despite gathering an impressive list of achievements since Grrrl Gang first got together in 2016 and proceeded to take the local, regional, and international indie scenes by storm.

name: Grupo Salvaje
description: Grupo Salvaje is an Austin-based band with deep Mexican roots and over 25 years of musical experience, delivering high-energy performances that ignite dance floors and bring communities together. Known for their cumbias and crowd-moving rhythms, the group proudly represents Mexican and Latin culture through music that connects generations. Drawing from traditional Mexican styles while pushing a vibrant sound, Grupo Salvaje blends cumbias, norteñas, and nonstop dance music into a dynamic live experience. Their versatility and stage presence allow them to adapt effortlessly to any crowd, making every show a celebration.

events.venue: Flatstock Stage @ Austin Marriott Downtown (Moontower Hall)

name: Gus Baldwin & The Sketch
description: Gus Baldwin is a singer/songwriter/ex-hippie/part-time punk from Austin, TX. After a stint holding down drums for Dallas surf punks Sealion in high school, Baldwin went on to form the Psych Pop combo Acid Carousel, which he led for 6 years and 20 something releases before departing the band. Moving to Austin, Baldwin started quickly self releasing a string of singles and EPs on his own GetWithIt! Imprint and establishing himself as the godson of Texas Rock n Roll. Teaming up with former bandmates and friends Gus formed The Sketch in 2022. Embracing the aggression of dirty punk, the looseness of garage, and the charm of power pop, The Sketch established themselves as new cornerstones of the Austin rock scene. Recording their debut LP with the group in one day of recording in LA in the spring of 2024, “The Sketch” is the culmination of Baldwin’s vision, manifested through the power of The Sketch themselves. In late 2025, Baldwin released his first full length solo LP. With the selt-titled debut, Gus focuses in on his rock n' roll stylings, while at the same time showing great versatility as a songwriter. Not being afraid to mix opposite loves of Punk and Pop into one cohesive album.

name: Gus Englehorn
description: If Gus Englehorn didn’t exist, one of his songs would have to invent him. A former pro snowboarder reborn as a nomadic psych-pop prophet, Englehorn has lived a rollercoaster life that reads like one of the fantastical fables that fill his songbook. Back in January 2020, right at the dawn of the pandemic, Englehorn released his first album, Death & Transfiguration [...] But even as life has since opened up again, Englehorn is still firmly situated in a world of his own madcap design. Where 2022’s Dungeon Master walked the tightrope between DIY discord and prog-scaled storytelling, his third album, The Hornbook, magically transmutes the entire history of 20th-century rock ‘n’ roll—’50s golden oldies, ‘60s garage spunk, ‘70s glam flamboyance,‘80s indie transgression, ‘90s lo-fi weirdness—into an alien transmission from the future. The Hornbook was mixed by Paul Leary from the legendary punk band Butthole Surfers and marked the beginning of a fruitful collaboration. Leary and Englehorn reunited on The Broken Balladeer, due February 27th 2026, this time with Leary taking on the role of producer. They also enlisted the help of industry legends Stuart Sullivan, Howie Weinberg and Kramer.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: haha Laughing
description: haha Laughing is an Austin-based experimental noise rap project consisting of long-time local musicians Jay Dilick and Aby Oviedo. The duo blends elements of hardcore rap, free-jazz, distorted electronic music and punk energy into 3 minute explosions of catchy catharsis. The chaos they curate is driven home through their live shows where Dilick and Oviedo's back and forth vocals, noise breakdowns, sample flips, and sense of playfulness create a must see live performance that is energetically engaging and delightfully disorienting. haha Laughing has released multiple EP's and singles since 2021, and released their first album "LOSING TEETH DREAM" in May of 2025. Their follow up EP "BIG WHATEVER" is set to be released Spring 2026. haha Live. haha Laugh. haha Love.

name: Hana Lili
description:
Hana Lili is on a mission to pursue her truth. For the Welsh artist, songwriting has always been a way to make sense of what words can’t quite hold. Her self-titled EP, Hana, marks her boldest step yet — an intimate collection that distils emotion into its rawest form. Blending confessional storytelling with the dynamic spirit of 90s and early 00s alt-rock, Hana crafts
songs that balance vulnerability and power. Drawing inspiration from artists like Alanis Morissette, Radiohead and Gwen Stefani, she channels emotional honesty through soaring melodies and unfiltered energy. Each song feels like a conversation with herself — an exploration of identity, doubt, and the small moments that shape who we are.
Hana’s music merges introspection with rebellion, turning personal chaos into connection. Raised in Wales and a first-language Welsh speaker, Hana’s sense of place runs deep. Her roots in the Welsh Eisteddfod tradition — a celebration of language, music, and storytelling — instilled in her a lasting belief in the power of creative expression.
With a sound that bridges intimacy and universality, Hana Lili stands as one of alt-pop’s most distinct and fearless emerging voices.

name: Hania Derej
description:
Hania Derej (20) - composer, pianist, arranger and conductor. Student of the Conservatorium van Amsterdam (jazz composition and arrangement) and the Music Academy in Kraków (symphonic conducting). Author of over 130 compositions she creates music in a variety of styles, including illustrative, jazz, chamber, film or electronic music. She has won multiple composition and performance awards including the Grand Prix of Energa Ladies Jazz Festival in Gdynia, Main Prize in “Sanki” 2025, music contest of “Gazeta Wyborcza” newspaper (the new hope of the polish music scene), the Main Prize of the first “Jazz Talents” competition within the 21st edition of Jazz Spring Zakopane 2025, Triton Award for the greatest artistic personality of the 54 th edition of FAMA Festival 2024 in Świnoujście, a special award for compositions and arrangements at the Junior Jazz Festival 2023 in Wadowice, and the “Young Composer 2023” award funded by the Polish Composers’ Union in Warsaw during the International Piano Forum in Sanok. Within this Piano Forum, Hania also received piano awards, such as a distinction for the performance of a concert with the National Polish Philharmonic Chamber Orchestra and a concert with the Lviv Chamber Orchestra “Academy.”
As a conductor, Hania has had the opportunity to lead concerts with the National Philharmonic Chamber Orchestra (Poland), Elblag Chamber Orchestra (Poland), Lviv Chamber Orchestra “Akademia” (Ukraine) and the Moravian Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra (Czech Republic), among others. Hania also participates in international music projects and conferences in Europe, such as European FAMES Orchestra (Macedonia), The Playground Residence (Germany, The Netherlands), International Sync Camp (Poland), International Jazz Platform (The Netherlands, Norway, Poland), Music Export Academy in Poland, Global Conservatory and Eastern European Music Export Academy (Ukraine), “Iceland Airways networking mission”, ESNS Showcase Festival & Conference networking mission (The Netherlands) and Jazzahead 2025 (Germany). Last but not least - in the JAZZTOP 2024 music critics’ survey of the international magazine JAZZFORUM, Hania Derej won the “New Hope” award for her solo work and came 5th in the “New Hope - Ensemble” category (for her work as Hania Derej Quintet). In April 2025, Hania was awarded a distinction in the nationwide “Young Promoter of Poland” Contest, under the Honorary Patronage of the Wife of the President of the Republic of Poland, for young Poles whose activities contribute to the popularization of knowledge about Poland and building a positive image of Poland in the world.

name: Hanorah
description:
Searching. Playfulness. Rediscovery of the once known. These thoughts permeate through Hanorah’s creative impulse. The multidisciplinary Canadian artist, chiefly known for her
powerful emotive voice, transforms the old into the new as she charts waters at once familiar and unknown. Weaving influences from RnB, rock, and shoegaze, she’s ready to redefine what soul music can be, exploring new sonic landscapes as she creates something both fresh and timeless.

Her new EP, Closer Than Hell, is a collection born from that very tension—between desire and uncertainty, between the things you don’t know and the parts of yourself you’re afraid to face. The theme of searching threads through each song, a quiet but persistent pull toward something elusive, something just out of reach. You hear it in the aching vulnerability of her lyrics, the way her voice rises and falls as if chasing after a feeling that might only exist for a fleeting second, before slipping away. But there’s play in it too. Her EP is about the delicate, messy dance between letting go and holding on—about being lost but also willing to find the joy in the search.

name: Haters
description:
Haters are an Australian indie punk/garage band formed by Jai Sparks (vocals/guitar), James Priest (drums), and Kaito (Kaitlyn Hold – bass/vocals). For fans of Fontaines D.C., The Beths, IDLES, and Wunderhorse. Their songs are drenched in emotion and exist to make you feel something, they speak of real life, friendship, mental health, profound loss and the beauty of the human experience.

The band travelled to Canada to record their debut album non-violent with Scott Middleton (Cancer Bats), capturing their intense, unfiltered sound. Known for their high-energy live shows, Haters have performed at Bigsound (Australia), NXNE (Toronto), Sled Island (Calgary), and completed several cross-country Canadian tours.

Their debut album non-violent was released in March 2025, accompanied by sold-out shows throughout Canada and Australia accompanied by rapid growth across streaming and fan engagement, with listenership led by the US, followed by Canada and Australia, 1000's of playlist adds and major Apple Music and Spotify editorial support.
With a fierce commitment to honesty, connection, and powerful performances, Haters continue to build momentum as a force in the indie punk scene.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Haylie Davis
description:
Haylie Davis belongs to an intriguing LA scene that boasts several acts harking back to the halcyon days of Laurel Canyon songwriting – including Alex Amen, Drugdealer, Sylvie and Sam Burton, many of whose projects she has appeared on. From origins of psychedelic folk pop and 70s cosmic Americana, Haylie’s sound is an infectious alternative take on modern pop music, with plenty of hooks and a huge chorus; she is the Carly Simon for post-Generation Z. Her euphoric range sits somewhere between Joan Baez, Carole King and Emmylou Harris.

“Gently hued Laurel Canyon folk-pop songs” - Rolling stone

name: Hector Gannet
description: Hector Gannet are from the town of North Shields, high on England’s north east coast. Things centre on lead singer-songwriter Aaron Duff whose compositions draw closely on his beloved home terrain. Yet Hector Gannet’s music – folk, rock, ancient, modern – also reaches out into the wider world. Hector Gannet have been praised by music lovers from Chris Packham to Sam Fender, while Uncut magazine acclaimed the band as “North Shields’ answer to Crazy Horse”. There have been live dates with artists from Elbow, Sea Power to Lindisfarne, Richard Thompson & Kathryn Williams – & massive shows with Sam Fender at the vast North Eastern shrine that is St James’ Park football ground. Hector Gannet have drawn pleasing reactions. On BBC 6 Music, musician and broadcaster Tom Robinson greeted a “band of exceptional talent”. In a **** review, MOJO magazine saluted the “pointedly political, natural-world-advocating folk rock” of their The Land Belongs To Us album. Louder Than War website put Hector Gannet among 25 bands to change your life. Forthcoming album includes rousing soul sermons which blend their North Eastern heart with touches of Dexy’s, Style Council-period Weller and a bit of the Boss

name: Hemi Hemingway
description: With the rock’n’roll panache of a dive bar matador and the emotional force of a knife in the guts, Hemi Hemingway makes music that thrills, spills and breaks hearts. The effortlessly slick New Zealand star has a connoisseur’s ear for the finest parts of musical history, sweeping 60s rock, 50s sheen and 80s romanticism into the present day, refurbishing and refashioning them into something new and fresh. At home in the spotlight, he’s a showman in the best troubadour traditions, but one with real depth, showcasing swagger and vulnerability in equal measure.

name: HNRY FLWR
description:
Henry Flower is the cult rock alter-ego created by David Van Witt, who derives great inspiration from his peculiar upbringing. Born in Belgium and raised in a meditation community in Iowa, Van Witt spent his childhood moving around the US with his single, clairvoyant mother who remembers her own birth. Flower and his musical collective and live band dubbed The Infinite Void interpret these childhood memories through a spiritual, dreamlike lens for their debut album, VISIONS OF THE DAYTIME MOON (October, 2023).

During the album’s six-year writing process, Flower incorporated meditation, drone music, hypnosis, improvisation, and other eclectic techniques to produce an indie rock record that is as imaginative as it is classic. In the album, Flower ponders the mysteries of life in poetic croons over a bed of psychedelic flutes, soulful piano, 70s guitars, bouncing congas, gospel choirs, new age beats, and innovative production.

With his seven-piece live band, The Infinite Void, Henry Flower proselytizes his imagined religion, praising the infinite void and building a cult-like following with electric, church-like live performances.

Henry Flower and his band are an iconic NYC entity, gathering over 30 players on their roster throughout their six-year album process. Musicians on their upcoming album and seven preceding singles include co-producer Sam Cohen (Kevin Morby, Dangermouse, Sharon Van Etten), Melanie Chambers (Oracle Sisters, Widowspeak, Lovetempo), Mattie Safer (The Rapture, Poolside), Abdon Valdez III (Cornelia Murr), Rosie Slater (Darlene Love, Delicate Steve), and saxophonist/flutist Walter Fancourt (Yeasayer, Super Yamba Band).

name: Hohnen Ford
description: Born and raised in North London, Hohnen Ford grew up immersed in London’s vibrant Jazz scene, becoming fixated on instrumental jazz music of the 20th Century and later studying Jazz at the Royal Academy of Music. Since graduating, Hohnen Ford has been developing a unique and timeless approach to songwriting drawing on influences from the Great American songbook to artists such as Joni Mitchell.

name: Holy Gabbana
description:
John Robert Hill Jr. (b. August 3, 1996), better known by his stage name Holy Gabbana, is a rapper coming out of Jacksonville, Florida.

In December of 2018, John was sentenced to 5 months in county jail and had a life changing experience. He began to grow an understanding of Jesus Christ due to his cellmate, which ultimately led him to getting saved and starting a Christian hip hop career. He released his first single as a Christian rapper, “Holy Flow” in August 2022.

name: Home Counties
description: Home Counties return with their second album 'Humdrum', a sharp, dance-driven evolution produced by Al Doyle of LCD Soundsystem and Hot Chip. Trading guitars for restless grooves and twitchy synths, the band dissect the chaos of modern life with wit and precision. Dual vocalists Will Harrison and Lois Kelly explore jealousy, self-doubt and overthinking across ten hook-laden tracks that balance melancholy and euphoria. Already acclaimed for their electrifying live shows, Humdrum cements Home Counties as one of the UK’s most inventive new bands.

name: Honey I'm Home
description:
Honey I'm Home is an Amsterdam-based shoegaze outfit that powerfully captures the raw energy of '90s alternative rock and blends it with a fresh, modern sound. Inspired by bands like My Bloody Valentine, Smashing Pumpkins, and DIIV, they've created their own unique take on the shoegaze, indie, and emo genres. On stage, Honey I'm Home unleashes their full power: captivating live shows that balance between fragile intimacy and explosive outbursts carried by layered guitars and deeply felt lyrics.

Recently named #1 emerging act at Europe’s leading new-music showcase festival (ESNS), a list with a strong track record of identifying artists before their breakthrough. “Honey I'm Home is reaping the benefits of the shoegaze revival. But it's not just timing, they are really great. The packed room gets their faces melted off, but sometimes gets a breather in the shape of a beautiful verse. The unexpected breaks, original melodies and smart tempo changes give the set its own, authentic sound.”

The band supported Hotline TNT, Goat Girl and the Crawlers on shows throughout the EU and UK, and played key European showcase festivals including ESNS, Reeperbahn Festival and Left of the Dial.

name: Honey Made
description: Austin’s Honey Made delivers a modern, high-energy spin on vintage soul -and funk, channeling legends like James Brown, Sly and the Family Stone, and Earth, Wind & Fire while staying rooted in rich R&B traditions. Honey Made calls its take on contemporary RnB, Texas RnB. It is RnB with Texas Heat. Named Best Live Band in Austin by Austin Fit Magazine twice in a row, the band’s dynamic performances have earned them multiple official SXSW showcases, and stages alongside Karl Denson’s Tiny Universe, The Soul Rebels, Funk You, and The Spin Doctors. With acclaimed releases including Brand New, Charge It To The Band Fund, and Pass Me By, Honey Made is quickly expanding their reach beyond Austin with their infectious hooks, fearless funk grooves, and a sound that invites every listener into the fold.

name: Hot Garbage
description: Hot Garbage melt into a heavily volatile yet undeniably palatable amalgamation of sonic elements. Calling on the driving rhythms of dark post-punk and motorik krautrock, the Toronto-based outfit seamlessly works shining melodies and swirling textures into deliberate, brooding arrangements. Since forming in 2015, the four-piece have toured extensively throughout Canada, the United States, Europe and the United Kingdom, bringing their intense live sets to festivals such as Levitation, Freakout Fest, Treefort, SXSW, Sled Island, FME, M for Montreal and Pop Montreal, and sharing the stage with notable acts such as Osees, Ty Segall, L.A. Witch, Frankie and the Witch Fingers, JJUUJJUU, Mdou Moctar, Wand and Kikagaku Moyo. The quartet recently returned with Precious Dream (January 19, 2024 via Mothland & Exag’ Records), a sprawling collection of songs written in isolation and brought together alongside visionary producer Graham Walsh (METZ, Preoccupations, Holy Fuck, !!!), offering an exhilarating new breath into the world of post-punk and modern psychedelia, a listening experience that is equally cathartic and introspective.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: I See Orange
description:
We are a Mexican lead British 3-piece alternative post-grunge rock band. Starting in early 2022, our lead singer moved from Mexico to the UK. The band formed after an impromptu rehearsal session and discovering the chemistry we had playing together we quickly got to work. Writing, playing gigs and recording, releasing our first single in that same year, shortly followed by our debut EP Lonesome Joy. We are now about to release our debut Album with the first few singles already out and their music videos on YouTube hitting almost half a million views.
Hailing from Mexico, Giselle brought to the UK her unique taste and a talent for writing folk pop, looking to explore a new musical direction fuelled by a passion for rock. Finding Cameron and Charlie, two British born and raised musicians marked the inception of I See Orange, mixing multiple genres into their unique post-grunge sound, a deliberate combo of captivating melodies, clever lyricism and heavy rock.
Bringing raw energy, heavy riffs and powerful melodic vocals to every stage we hit. We blend the gritty, nostalgic sound of the 90's with our own unique twist.

name: I-SKY
description:
I-SKY, West Malaysian based Producer-DJ - inspired by the likes
of Skrillex, Baauer, TNGHT and Boys Noize; started with shows that always promised a
tailored selection expanding from his favourite local/regional products to carefully curated underground dance finds from his internet digs, he since has established himself as a household name in the 2010s KL nightlife scene.

While DJ-ing has always been a conduit for his artistry, I-SKY delivers his crafted studio-to-stage experience best as both an artist and passionate producer. Known for his fresh-to-death remixes, I-SKY originals ride along the same wavelength too through his constant redefinitions of electronic dance.
Though the name doesn't have any literal meaning, the autodidactic disciplinary defines his namesake with, "I just needed
to find a catchy name... to find something that rhymes with my first initial, hence, the I... and SKY. Over the years, I guess the name gave meaning to itself. There's a saying: the sky is the limit. I've always hated being stuck in a box. I like to let my creativity run wild. To be free to experiment & dabble in different sounds & styles. So, l am the limit to what I can and wanna do."

name: ICHIGORINAHAMU
description:
rinahamu is a Tokyo-based artist, songwriter, composer, producer, and DJ.
Rooted in electronic music, she creates a distinctive world that seamlessly blends music, fashion, and culture.
In addition to her solo work, she is also active as a vocalist for BPM15Q and Tokyo Den-Nou, both projects from Den-On-Bu.

name: Ideal Collective
description: Formed in 2017 Ideal Collective consists of 5 MCs Salus Herb, Rowski, Mikeal, Darxx and Marvodagreat.With DJ-GSharp backing them on the 1's and 2's Ideal blends vintage Hip-Hop styles reminiscent of golden era rap crews such as Wu-Tang Clan, Jurassic 5, and a Tribe Called Quest, but bring a fresh take on it with the blending of modern productions and vinyl cyphers with lifestyle raps and turn up tracks you'll get a bit of everything when listening to Ideal Collective.

name: Ifeanyi Elswith
description:
Hailing from Chicago’s South Side, Ifeanyi Elswith is an R&B/Hip-hop artist known for her fearless fusion of jazz, soul, pop, house, reggae, dancehall, and her Belizean roots—crafting a sound that’s unmistakably hers. Named 1st runner-up for The Chicago Reader’s ‘Best R&B Artist’ of 2023 and a 312 Award nominee for Afro Artist of the Year, she’s been highlighted by platforms like Chicago Tribune, Vocalo, Windy City Live, and Audiotree.
Ifeanyi has shared stages with artists such as Oddisee, Twista, Vic Mensa, dancehall legends Capleton and Junior Reid, and Panic! At The Disco’s Brendon Urie. Her music has reached global audiences through placements on MAX, NBC, Tubi, and in a Belikin Beer commercial in Belize. With her unique style and magnetic, pretty gyal energy, Ifeanyi isn’t just making music—she’s making waves.

events.presented_by: German Music Export by Initiative Musik

name: Ilusión
description:
Ilusión is a trio formed by Fernando Soria Salmerón, Jesús Beltrán, and Carlos Mayo Jimenez; three friends who connected through their love for music and shared roots as first-generation Mexican-Americans living in Delaware. With family ties to Quiroga, Michoacán, Jiménez, Chihuahua, and Huehuetlán el Chico, Puebla, their songs carry the weight of two cultures, three journeys, and one voice that speaks from the heart.

They grew up listening to everything — from the romantic ballads their parents played at family gatherings to the raw, emotional sounds of corridos tumbados and alternative rock. That blend of influence shows up in their music, where traditional meets modern, and every lyric is grounded in real feeling. For Fernando, Jesús, and Carlos Ilusión is more than a name — it’s a reflection of their dreams, struggles, and everything they’ve felt along the way. Their sound isn’t boxed into one genre because they don’t live in just one world.

name: Important Group
description: Important Group is a very important band from Austin, Texas. You may call it a supergroup that includes members of Being Dead, Punching Bag, They Had So Many Names, Zero Percent APR, and many other side projects. But this is now a main project. Important Group has a repertoire of light-hearted-heartfelt-heart-wrenching songs. Three friends rocking out.

name: In Phases
description: In Phases is a POC WLW alt-rock artist fusing rock, metal, electronic, hip-hop, and R&B into a gritty, underground-club sound, drawing cinematic influence from action-horror and gothic action films.

name: indie tribe
description: Indie Tribe is an influential independent Christian hip-hop collective founded in 2016 by rapper nobigdyl.. Currently, the group consists of nobigdyl., Mogli the Iceburg, Jon Keith, DJ Mykael V, and Torey D'Shaun. Known for their high-energy, collaborative, and authentic style, they blend diverse musical influences with faith-based lyrics to bring glory to God. In 2026, they are set to release their first album since 2023, along with a full tour & their 6th annual festival, Holy Smoke.

name: INK
description: Superstar songwriter and genre-defying artist Ink is a lauded creative force, celebrated for her work on seismic cultural projects like Beyonce's GRAMMY® Award-winning COWBOY CARTER, RENAISSANCE and Kendrick Lamar's GNX – including co-writing multi-week No. 1 smash “Luther." Most recently, the latter earned Ink 3 nominations at the 2026 GRAMMYs: Album of the Year, Record of the Year, and Song of the Year. With her debut EP BIG BUSKIN’ released in October 2025, including singles "Turquoise Cowboy," “Hoedown,” and “Sweet Tea,” Rolling Stone proclaimed, "Ink is ready to fully dive into her own artistry." Making waves and more music on the horizon, along with a debut performance at Stagecoach, 2026 marks the official rise of a powerful new voice in American music. Born in Germany and raised in Georgia, Ink got her start busking on the streets before going on to collaborate with legends like Trae tha Truth and Nipsey Hussle. Her music – rooted in country, Southern rap and classic Americana – is as rich and bold as her story.

events.venue: Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: The Irrepressibles
description:
The Irrepressibles is the project of Jamie Irrepressible, composer, vocalist, producer, and visual conceptualist known for emotional performance and genre-blurring sound. A defining voice in queer art pop and alternative performance, Jamie blends classical beauty, alt-pop experimentation, and bold visual concepts.

Debuting with Mirror Mirror (2010) and its global hit In This Shirt—now over 325M streams and widely used in film and TV—The Irrepressibles gained a devoted international following. Follow-ups Nude (2012) and Superheroes (2020) expanded this cinematic, intimate world.

With Yo Homo! (2024), hailed as “a milestone in queer indie rock” and “desire paired with alt-rock swagger,” Jamie entered a raw, sexually candid, and sonically adventurous new phase.

The Irrepressibles have performed sold-out shows at Barbican Centre, Royal Festival Hall, and Latitude Festival, and collaborated with Röyksopp, ionnalee, and Tinlicker.

Through music, video, and performance, Jamie explores identity, sensuality, freedom, and connection, standing as one of the most compelling queer voices in contemporary music.

name: Isak Thomas and The Stoop Boys
description:
Isak Thomas and The Stoop Boys is a soul/funk collective of artists primarily based out of Austin, Texas, and Nashville. Originally founded in Boston, MA, by Isak “Thomas” Kotecki (keyboard/guitar/vocals) in 2017, Isak began collaborating with close friends from music school, Connor Frawley (bass/vocals) and John Cattini (lead guitar/vocals), with a shared love of ’70s soul, funk, and rock music.
When the three eventually moved their separate ways across the country, they continued to convene once a year for a week of writing and recording. This tradition has stayed true through three EPs and two albums, garnering millions of streams and features such as KUTX’s Song of the Day.
The group has a unique take on its writing process, with every member serving as a rotating writer and vocalist, centered around native Austinite Isak Kotecki as producer. In the latest full album release, 'The Stoop Boys', the group saw the addition of Armando Baeza (drums/vocals) and Logan “Wildman” Garza (vocals/percussion), also joining as writers.
The Stoop Boys aim to bring music that feels like yesterday, hits like today, and sticks with you tomorrow.

name: IYLA
description: Iyla is a Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter who blends soul, jazz, r&b, and pop into her music. Her stage name, which means "moonlight", reflects her night owl tendencies and ends in "L.A.", a nod to her hometown.

name: J Soulja
description:
J Soulja is a powerhouse in Austin’s hip-hop scene—known for his sharp lyricism, electric performances, and trailblazing hustle. He’s rocked stages alongside stars like Wale and members of TDE, toured Texas with Curren$y, and headlined his own sold-out show in Austin.

His music caught major attention after he created the official theme song for comedian Brian Simpson’s Netflix Special “Live From The Mothership,” now surpassing 100,000 streams and 10,000+ Shazams across platforms.

Beyond the mic, J Soulja is the founder of The Pre-Roll ATX, the city’s premier open mic and artist development platform that’s launched countless local talents onto major festival stages like SXSW, ACL, and even Roskilde Festival in Denmark.
With brand collaborations from Swisher Sweets to Adidas & even including receiving a Proclamation for his own day in Austin Texas - J Soulja stands as both an artist and architect of Austin’s next hip-hop era—turning independent grind into global momentum..

name: J'ray
description:
J’ray is a Nigerian-born Afrobeats singer and songwriter whose sound blends infectious rhythms with emotional storytelling. Raised in Lagos, his passion for music was shaped early through church and community performances, laying the foundation for a style rooted in authenticity and global appeal.

Now based in the United States, J’ray has been building a growing international audience since launching his professional music career in 2017. His music fuses Afrobeats, Afro-fusion, and R&B, marked by vibrant energy, smooth melodies, and themes of love, resilience, and connection.

J’ray has collaborated with artists and producers across Africa, North America, and South America, including award-winning producer DJ Dever and SNDY Music, expanding his reach across cultures and borders.

At SXSW, J’ray delivers a dynamic live performance that reflects his mission: connecting cultures through sound and storytelling while representing the next wave of global Afrobeats music.

name: J-Nice The Kingdom Builder
description:
J-Nice The Kingdom Builder, is an Austin, TX Christian hip-hop artist who has been creating music for over 20 years. He is the founder of Kingdom Builder Ministries. This movement inspires youth and young adults to use the arts to present the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

J-Nice has released seven Mixtapes, over 20 Music Videos, published poems, hosted the longest-running Christian hip-hop showcase in the state of Texas, won Christian Hip-Hop Artist of the Year at the Kingdom Excellence Awards, and released 4 albums that have charted on Apple Music. He has been on platforms presented by the National Football League, MTV, BET, CBS, Spectrum News, and many more. This lyrical wordsmith makes it his duty to teach biblical truths with witty and clever wordplay, which is sure to leave listeners pleasantly surprised.

name: Jacki Daniels
description: Jacki Daniels is a Michigan-based, Nashville recording artist known for her powerhouse vocals, magnetic stage presence, and emotionally charged songwriting. In 2025, she was awarded Rising Star of the Year at the Josie Music Awards, the largest independent music awards show in the world, and received four Michigan Music Awards along with the Vehicle City Sound Podcast Fan Favorite Award two years in a row, establishing her as one of pop-country’s most promising new voices. Jacki’s versatility extends well beyond pop-country, with musical roots in rock, folk, a cappella, musical theater, R&B, electronic pop, indie, and classical. She performs everything from intimate solo acoustic sets to full band, high-energy shows, bringing a bold, genre-blending edge to every stage. She is the creator and host of The Jacki Daniels Show and co-host of Singers in the Round, a singer/songwriter showcase highlighting standout talent. Jacki also tours nationally with the Ultimate Kenny Rogers Tribute Show. Check her schedule for upcoming tour dates at www.thejackidanielsshow.com

name: Jadarrion
description: Known for deep selections across vinyl and digital, and a growing catalogue of groove-driven productions, Jadarrion continues to push boundaries and solidify his place as a name to watch.

name: Jade Omari
description: Jade Omari is an independent singer-songwriter from Hyattsville, Maryland known for her raw lyricism and soul-driven sound. She crafts songs rooted in emotional truth, growth, and resilience. Her live performances create a genuine connection—where storytelling and presence take center stage!

name: JAKEGATEWOOD
description:
JAKE GATEWOOD is a Texas-based DJ, producer, creative director, and curator whose disco- and house-driven sound has become a staple on dance floors across the U.S. Known for groove-forward, high-energy sets, his work is built for packed rooms and long nights.

As an artist and curator, Jake has performed alongside and collaborated with acts including Yung Bae, Never Dull, Coco & Breezy, Lee Foss, Marshall Jefferson, Joshwa & more, earning a reputation for versatility behind the decks and a sharp ear for forward-thinking dance music.

In 2022, he founded Take A Break, a house-music label, event series, and festival platform that has quickly become a cornerstone of the Southern dance-music scene. After selling out 20 consecutive shows and moving over 20K tickets, Take A Break has grown into a multi-scale brand supporting both emerging and established artists.

Jake also maintains an ongoing partnership with Apple Music, curating DJ mixes and editorial content that bring his taste and perspective to a global audience. Beyond music, he is the creative force behind BOOGIES, a Dallas-based discotheque rooted in classic dance-floor culture with a modern edge.

name: Jamaica Moana
description:
Jamaica Moana is THE non-binary Māori (Ngāpuhi/Tainui) and Samoan rapper, songwriter, creative director and ballroom icon reshaping what hip-hop from “down under” can be. Based in Western Sydney on Dharawal and Gadigal land, Jamaica fuses hard-hitting rap, R&B and club electronics with ancestral fire, ballroom attitude and fierce queer identity.

A leader in the Australian ballroom scene and co-founder of The West Ball, Jamaica builds stages where queer, trans and BIPOC communities can take up space on their own terms. Her debut EP BUD & DENI (2025) channels grief, legacy and life in Western Sydney into razor-sharp, deeply personal anthems.

After years of cultivating a cult following across clubs, fashion runways and spaces like Dark Mofo, Phoenix Central Park and Sydney Festival, Jamaica now brings her explosive show to SXSW Austin as the inaugural Walk to Austin Award recipient.

name: Jamie Duffy
description:
At just 24, Jamie Duffy has emerged as one of Ireland’s most compelling new artists, blending folk, classical, and contemporary influences into a sound that’s both intimate and cinematic. His debut single Solas became the most streamed debut by an Irish artist since Hozier’s Take Me To Church, with over 135+ million streams on Spotify, 27 million YouTube views, and 7.3 billion views on TikTok.

In 2024, he released his debut EP On A Wing, sold out his first Irish headline tour (2,600+ tickets), and supported Andrea Bocelli and Hans Zimmer at BST Hyde Park.

In October 2025, he released his highly anticipated debut album Jamie Duffy. Crafted over two years between wild coastlines and still nights across the two awe-inspiring landscapes of Ireland and Iceland, the album reflects Jamie’s rural Monaghan roots, shaped by changing environments, Irish folklore, love, light and trepidation. It is a true labour of love and effort rarely known by those in their early twenties, but for Jamie, it was a journey he’s been working towards for some time. While evident themes of nature, journey, light and hope spring forward from early listens, the messages within the album, will hopefully, be different for everyone.

Alongside the album, Jamie has scored his first feature film 500 Miles, (starring Bill Nighy and Maisie Williams) due to be released in 2026. Reuniting with his album producer Atli Örvarsson at his home studio in London, the project highlights the creative strength and synergy between the two collaborators.

With over 2 million monthly listeners on Spotify and sold out dates across Ireland, UK and Europe, Jamie is cementing his status as a formidable and rapidly rising global artist whose music continues to resonate with a massive and expanding international audience.

name: Jana Diab
description:
Jana Diab is a Cairo-born, London‑based singer-songwriter whose work blends emotional vulnerability with a bold, genre‑fluid sensibility.

Raised in a home steeped in the arts — her mother introduced her to Theater and Broadway — Diab grew up absorbing the power of storytelling and performance.

Her music draws from the experimental, kaleidoscopic sounds of artists like Lorde, Half Waif, and Saya Gray, yet her lyricism is deeply personal: negotiating identity, ADHD, and the tension of living between cultures.

In 2023 she released her debut EP Season One via Interscope, and in November she followed it with an extended edition featuring additional tracks.

Most recently, on 17 October, she released her new single “Cipriani,” on U–nation Music, marking the next chapter in her artistic evolution. She also holds the distinction of being the first ambassador for the fashion house Miu Miu across the Middle East.

At 23, Diab continues carving a space that honors her heritage while defying easy categorisation — a voice for third‑culture youth finding clarity through art.

name: Jasmine Jethwa
description:
Jasmine makes swaying, folk-tinged acoustic pop songs with a full voice that teems with rich emotion. Her sonic palette makes sense when she describes the music she was most interested in growing up. “The earliest memories I have are of driving down to see my grandparents, and we listened to different music in the car on my dad’s iPod,” she recalls, “There’d be David Gray, Tracy Chapman, Dido, Gipsy Kings, The Eagles – old songs, classic albums. And I feel like they went into my psyche. I’m obsessed with any kind of acoustic, well-played guitar.”

She also references her love of R&B and a current new love with Fontaines DC (“the first time I heard them they grabbed my heart; if my music does what they and other artists do for me and moves them to feel something, I’d be happy”). There is also mention of the emotional resonance of watching Bollywood films with her Gujarati grandmother back when she was a kid: “In terms of vocals, I do think that’s made a bit of an impact,” she says of those Hindi songs she internalised.

name: Jaxs
description:
Jaxs, the electrifying lyricist from Currie, North Carolina, broke out as a Top 5 finalist on Netflix’s Rhythm + Flow Season 2. Known for her pen, magnetic presence, and genre-blending sound, she delivers every performance.
 
More than an artist, Jaxs is a branding powerhouse. She’s partnered with DTLR x New Balance and BACARDÍ x Casa BACARDÍ at Dreamville Festival, cementing her influence beyond music. She’s also graced stages like SXSW, Howard University Springfest, Grind Pretty Festival, did DTLR HBCU TOUR 2025 and more.
 
Her freestyle over a beat by super producer Timbaland went viral, amassing over 4 million views and proving her lyrical skill on a global scale. Her single “DOX MRTNS” was named an Editor’s Pick by The Hype Magazine, and she’s keeping the momentum going with her newest release, “Tomato Tomato”—a bold, witty track that showcases her originality and edge.
 
Influenced by Eminem, André 3000, Missy Elliott, Joyner Lucas, and Childish Gambino, Jaxs brings a fearless, Southern-rooted sound that pushes boundaries. With over 500K followers across social media, a rising brand profile, and nonstop creative energy, Jaxs is one of hip-hop’s most exciting new forces.

name: Jaylon Ashaun
description: Jaylon Ashaun is a nomad redefining connection through music. Blending soulful R&B, hip-hop, and pop with heartfelt lyricism, he creates records that feel both intimate and expansive. His music isn’t just something you hear, it’s something you experience. Each release captures a chapter of his evolving journey, inviting listeners into honest conversations about love, identity, growth, and belonging.

name: Jazz re:freshed DJs
description:
As a close-knit family made up of music promoters, DJs, label owners and festival organisers, they’ve been regenerating jazz and jazz-influenced music culture since their 2003 conception.
JRF has cooked up a session that brings the spirit of the jazz & club culture they hail from.

THE DJs
Top Rock and Adam Rock - Founders of Jazz re:freshed

name: Jeff Akoh
description:
Jeff Akoh is a Nigerian singer-songwriter whose soulful vocals and genre-blending sound sit at the crossroads of Afropop and R&B. He rose to prominence as the youngest winner of MTN Project Fame West Africa, marking the beginning of a steadily evolving music career.

He has since released a growing body of work that has amassed millions of streams across digital platforms, anchored by his debut album Lokoja and a run of widely received singles. In 2025, Akoh released his latest EP, Rebel Heart, a project that reflects a more personal and boundary-pushing phase of his artistry.

Akoh has collaborated with a range of artists across genres, including Eric Bellinger, alongside other notable regional and international creatives, continuing to expand his sound and global reach.

name: Jenna Cole
description:
Jenna Cole is a Newcastle-based Afrobeats artist, songwriter and producer creating globally-minded music from the heart of Whitley Bay. Blending warm vocals with infectious rhythms and soulful melodies, her sound moves between Afrobeats, R&B and Pop, delivering records that feel both intimate and energetic.

As a former principal Songwriter and Creative Director within a major label girlband line up, Jenna has taken this vast experience and continued to develop her songwriting and production as a solo Artist, crafting a sonic that is true to her roots and rapidly connecting with her new-found international audience. After amassing over 2M views and 500k streams on her debut release in 2025, she was named a BBC Introducing "One to Watch" for 2026, and makes her live US debut at SXSW Austin.
location: NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE, UNITED KINGDOM, ENGLAND

name: Jenna Shaw
description:
Jenna Shaw is an Austin, TX based dj/producer who focuses on the developing psytechno genre, as well as hard dance and DNB. Her sound has been evolving to include more psytrance and drum and bass elements to the musical experience.

Jenna’s goal is to mesh different styles of techno along with psy and dnb elements to keep the crowd moving at high bpm rates while still finding a solid groove and intricate sounds to keep the mind and body in flow state.

name: Jessie Chambers
description:
Jessie Chambers is an independent singer-songwriter crafting timeless pop with a glam-rock edge. Her effortless, unmistakable voice delivers songs that are both deeply personal and irresistibly catchy. After featuring on Nurko & Last Heroes’ “Promise Me,” Chambers broke through with singles like “Guess U Suck” (850K+ streams) and “Fever Dream,” which landed on Spotify’s Fresh Finds Pop.
In 2025, she was featured on Algorhythm by Los Wizzards, a project nominated for a 2026 Grammy Award, marking a career milestone and highlighting her versatility as an artist and collaborator. Her music will also be featured in the upcoming short film Lake St. Claire, written & directed by Caitlin Meyernik, expanding her work into film and visual storytelling.
Her single “Fall Right Back” made waves across streaming and social media and was highlighted by Women in Music as one of their Top Songs of 2025. Chambers’ performances have taken her from The Troubadour to Revolution Live, opening for Saint Motel, appearing in respected showcases nationwide, and making her SXSW debut this year. With new music on the way, Jessie Chambers continues to carve a singular path through today’s indie-pop landscape.

name: JLQ
description: JLQ (aka the Julie Lowery Quartet) is a quartet on Austin’s Flak Records known for its lush vocals and catchy melodies. The band features Austin music veterans Julie Lowery (lead vocals, acoustic guitar), Andy Maguire (bass), David Mider (percussion) and Jenny Smith (violin) playing and singing dreamy, four-part harmony ear worms.

name: Joe Harvey-Whyte
description:
Joe Harvey-Whyte is one of the most innovative and exciting pedal steel players around. He has worked with a diverse range of artists including Liam Gallagher & John Squire , James Vincent McMorrow, The Magic Numbers , Susanne Sundfør , Billy Bragg , Tony Visconti , Nilüfer Yanya , Jody Stephens , Bullion , Mozart Estate, Alabama 3, Young Jesus & many more.

Aside from his work as a session musician Joe is also a multidisciplinary artist working at the cross section between ambient/experimental music, visual art and environmental sound. His solo work combines the sound of the pedal steel guitar with electronics and field recordings to make works that create a space for deep listening & reflection.

name: Joe Patitucci
description:
Joe Patitucci is a multi-media artist and pioneer in the field of plant music and bio-sonification, uniquely blending his background in music, design, and environmental advocacy. His innovative work creates immersive sonic environments that bridge natural and digital worlds, resonating with audiences' intuitive connection to Earth.

As the creator of PlantWave, Joe uses specialized sensors to translate the bio-rhythms and electrical frequencies of plants into ambient music. This groundbreaking approach revolutionizes how we perceive and interact with plant life, opening new avenues in sound art, wellness, and environmental consciousness.
