Joe's installations and performances, ranging from intimate galleries to large-scale festivals, have captivated audiences worldwide. His commitment to art as a medium fosters a deeper understanding of the bond between humans and nature.

In 2021, Joe’s company, Data Garden, released PlantWave. PlantWave enables anyone to experience plant music in their homes, gardens, or on the trail, democratizing this unique interaction and integrating Joe's vision into everyday life.

name: JOPLYN
description:
JOPLYN is a Berlin-based electronic live act moving between melodic house, techno, and electronica, guided by a distinct voice - both literal and emotional. Writing, producing, and performing exclusively original material, her live shows unfold as immersive experiences where vocals, synths, and improvisation meet intuition and intensity.
Her music has traveled widely through collaborations with artists such as Booka Shade, Röyksopp, Robyn, Damian Lazarus, MK, and Jan Blomqvist, with releases on labels including Defected, Get Physical, Diynamic, Crosstown Rebels, Mobilee, and Watergate Records. In 2022, Pete Tong named her BBC Radio 1’s Future Star.
Beyond the club, JOPLYN’s work reflects a growing curiosity for depth, vulnerability, and transformation. After more than 150 shows worldwide, including Ibiza residencies at Hï Ibiza and WooMoon/Cova Santa and a debut at Coachella’s Yuma Tent, she is opening a new chapter. She is currently working on her fourth studio album, set for release in 2026 on her own label None Of The Above (N.O.T.A.) Berlin, exploring a more expansive and emotionally resonant sound.

name: Jordan Walsh
description:
Jordan Walsh is a percussionist, producer, and educator based in Austin, Texas. A proponent of electronics and theater in music, he strives to perform the most absurd music with the most genuine fervor. Jordan's recent work includes esteemed composers including Elainie Lillios, Aida Shirazi, José Martinez, and Louis Raymond Kolker. Frequently engaged as a solo performer, Jordan has appeared at the SEAMUS conference, the New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival, Percussive Arts Society International Convention, New Music Dublin, and the Bowling Green State University New Music Festival.

Jordan currently serves as principal percussionist for the Density512 new music collective, is a member of minimalist metal group Goliath Was Bigfoot, acts as the sometimes third part of the legendary Line Upon Line Percussion, and is one half of the live-only-nonbroadcast-pirate-radio phenomenon Peach Blossom Highway. When he is not engaged with contemporary classical music, he can be found playing drums with Austin Bands including Maru Haru and Middle Sattre. Jordan proudly endorses Pearl/Adams Percussion, Sabian Cymbals, Black Swamp Percussion, and Innovative Percussion.

name: Joshua Ray Walker
description: Joshua Ray Walker is one of Americana’s most arresting new voices. A Texas singer-songwriter whose powerhouse vocals, razor-sharp writing, and magnetic stage presence have earned praise from Rolling Stone, NPR, Billboard, and fans around the world. Known for his humor, heartbreak, and once-in-a-generation vocal range, Walker’s show pulls back the curtain on the characters, places, and moments behind his prolific and acclaimed discography. On stage, he’s warm, hilarious, and disarmingly honest, moving from roaring laughter to pin-drop-quiet confession in a matter of seconds. Joshua Ray Walker’s performances reveal him at his very best: raw, vulnerable, and unforgettable.

name: Joudy
description:
"Pain is a fine knife sharpened by love." So says Joudy frontman Diego Ramirez when reflecting on the NYC group's latest endeavors. This emotional clarity and exposed honesty is a hallmark of the band's most vital, intense era yet. Set aside are the evocative lyrics and lush soundscapes of their earlier releases. In their place, lyrical and sonic directness is embraced on the unvarnished and love-torn upcoming album Permanent Maintenance (out DATE on Trash Casual). This is a record that distills Joudy's soaring rock into something simply shorter, louder, and stronger.

For the trio, rounded out by fellow Venezuelan emigres Hulrich Navas (drums) and Carlos Rey (bass), this streamlining is just another natural step forward as they uncompromisingly blaze a trail amongst life's shadowy moments.

Joudy have always tried to make sense of "this messy universe". While the wide angle lens fantasies of recent albums, Obertura and Destroy All Monsters, sought to do that through grand expositions, Permanent Maintenance brings it down to the most acute of human experiences: to love and to lose. While these are deeply personal songs, they are universal.

name: Jovi Greene
description: Jovi Greene is an 18-year-old breakout country artist from Maryland with more than 7 million streams. He’s already opened for Jake Owen, Riley Green, Aaron Watson, Whiskey Myers, and more. Jovi has earned a loyal following through his cinematic, self-produced content and a performance style that turns first-time listeners into real fans.

name: Joyeria
description:
Joyeria (pronounced Joy-ah-ree-ah) is a London-based outfit led by a Canadian-Polish songwriter who famously spent years quitting bands at their peak to keep his creative soul intact. Now a staple of London's underground scene, the group is a vehicle for "working in the dark"—a shape-shifting project that prizes sincerity over polish.

Musically, Joyeria delivers a darkly comic blend of slacker indie and experimental post-punk. Fronted by a deadpan baritone, the songs tackle the absurdity of modern adulthood, capitalism, and workday fatigue with biting, sardonic wit. Their EPs, FIM and Graceful Degradation, were produced by Dan Carey, captured raw and live-to-tape to preserve the "chaos" of the moment rather than a rehearsed demo.

While born from a singular vision, Joyeria is a formidable four-piece band. Known for being "purposely under-rehearsed," the ensemble thrives on improvisation, ensuring no two sets are the same. With a stage presence that balances Ian Curtis’s intensity with Stephen Malkmus’s irony, the band utilizes an unpredictable, dissonant energy to create a sound that is as imposing as it is eccentric.

name: Jugg Mugg Da Jugganott
description: 1/3 of the Odd Squad!!! Coughee Brothaz Lieutenant…

name: Julia Blair
description:
Julia Blair is known for her ability to strike emotional chords her audiences didn’t realize were waiting to be hit. Her work lives at the coalescence of laugh-out-loud humor and acute melancholia, and it’s a rare show that doesn’t elicit tears from someone in the crowd.

Praised by Pitchfork for her “smooth country alto”, Under the Radar described her sound as an exploration of the “broader world of chamber pop, soul, and gentle salves of singer/songwriter intimacy.” Graham Hunt has called her a modern-day Carole King. Some people look effortless on stage; Blair somehow pulls off the opposite trick. She doesn’t traffic in effortlessness– she performs with full-body earnestness that sings from the crown of her head down through her toes.

Her new album, All of My Important Things, is out November 7 on Don Giovanni Records, examines our relationship to material possessions through the lenses of childhood memory, a secondhand blanket, and the enduring notion that a lifetime of accumulated shit can never match the wonder of the first little treasures we held as kids.

name: Julie Nolen
description:
Julie Nolen is a Texas-based singer-songwriter whose music blends raw storytelling with the grit of rock & roll. Born under the wide-open skies of West Texas, her songs carry the dust of desert highways and the resilience of those who call them home. A proud voice in queer country, Julie brings authenticity to a genre rooted in tradition, proving that country music is for everyone.

In 2025, she was an official SXSW artist, showcasing her dynamic live performance. Now, she’s rolling out a five-song project leading up to a full EP drop in time for AmericanaFest in September. The lead single, “Love Me When I’m Leaving,” sets the tone for a collection of songs that explore the beauty and heartbreak of moving on.

Whether playing an intimate acoustic set or leading a full band, Julie delivers music that’s as honest as it is powerful.

Little bit moody, little bit soulful country, a little in your face, unapologetic, bold.

name: Junerise
description:
"Bruce Springsteen + Cocteau Twins = Junerise" - KUTX

Junerise is the heartland dream pop project of Austin-based, Utah-transplant singer-songwriter June Bennion, (They/Them).

Looking ever skyward, June channels influences from the grounding story-centric songwriting chops of James Taylor and Bruce Springsteen to the ethereal gradient-scapes of The Cocteau Twins and Brian Eno with a dash of The Cure's dance-forward sensibilities. Their songwriting comes from a well of lived experiences growing up as a closeted queer person in the god-fearing Mormon mountain states.

June tackles feelings of isolation, wonder, and perseverance against the odds set against a sunset sky, quickly fading out of view as each song flows from scene to scene as each story is told. Junerise is a long incubated project which at times is downright danceable while also reveling in the beautiful transience of each passing moment.

name: Just Jim
description: Just Jim is a multidisciplinary creative living in Austin, Texas. Known locally as a club DJ, he has carved out a reputation as a tastemaker behind the decks. He has an instinct for connecting with the crowd, and is beloved for his ability to communicate with music. His sets are as genre-defying as they are expansive, which provides the source code for his unique style of production. Although labeled as "house music," elements of Hip Hop, R&B, jazz, experimental, and world music are seamlessly incorporated to make for a rich sound full of hidden gems.

name: Kaash Paige
description:
Kaash Paige (born D’Kyla Paige Woolen on January 8, 2001, in Dallas, Texas) is a singer and songwriter known for her smooth blend of R&B, EDM , Alternative, Pop and hip-hop. She began uploading songs to SoundCloud while in high school, breaking out with her viral hit “Love Songs” in 2018. That success led to her first album Parked Car Convos (2019) followed up by Teenage Fever (2020), both filled with dreamy, emotional storytelling!

Kaash continued to evolve with her 2022 project S2ML showcasing deeper songwriting and more confidence in her sound. By 2024 , she began moving independently, focused on creative freedom and ownership.

In 2025, Kaash Paige Dropped a Trap Mixtape Titled “KAASHMYCHECKS” & A R&B/HIP HOP PROJECT Titled “2 Late To Be Toxic”. she has leveled up globally Going on her China Tour summer of 2025. headlining her second U.S. Tour “ Better than revenge “ & performing in Brazil at the Cena Festival in November 2025 .

marking a new chapter in her career as an international artist. From SoundCloud uploads in Dallas to world stages across continents, Kaash Paige continues to prove why she’s one of the most refreshing and visionary voices in the world.

name: Kali Horse
description: The experimental art-rock collab of multi-instrumentalist creators Sam Maloney and Desiree Das Gupta, Kali Horse blends fantasy and harsh realism, colliding genres with reckless abandon. Production that dips between the best of alt-rock and avante-pop spheres, Kali Horse is a celebration of intentional genrelessness. Digital and live drums under emotional harmonies, swimming guitar enveloped by foley samples make the live band ripple with eccentricity. Their avante-pop whimsicality channels Björk, their soaring anthemic moments reflect their rock roots. The combo of Sam's feathery vocal and Des' powerhouse belt has their voices in conversation with one another - a hypnotic connection. The debut record 'Some Type of Electric Lagoon' (2023) is a vibrant metaphorical swamp journey, an opus. The new EP '2099' veers into industrial soundscapes - a bold snap back to reality. More bite and grit, with a higher polish than ever thanks to Emmy-winning foley artist Brandon Bak (Possum, OOZ). The live act lit up festivals like NYC’s New Colossus and Ontario's River & Sky, opening for and somehow making sense with SUUNS and Ruby Waters alike. Hypnotic. Psychedelic electronic. artrockbeats.

name: Karina Galicia
description:
Mexican singer and songwriter. Karina Galicia explores her context and surroundings through pop and R&B soundscapes.
Her body of work includes her debut album “Cancionero del Nuevo Milenio” released in 2020, which portrays human fragility and an EP titled “Las Sangres”,that narrates the stories of six Mexican women whose lives were shaped by violence.
In 2024, Karina Galicia signed as a songwriter with Sony Music Publishing. In April 2025, Karina released her second album “Mudanzas” under the label Discos Licenciado by Warner Music. Mudanzas offers a unique and thrilling sonic experience, taking the best of R&B elevating it through fusions of pop and folk. Mudanzas is an album of many facets: emotional,sorrowful, introspective, and above all, filled with love and growth, “I wanted to portray the hope of becoming a better version of myself.My body is a house—my house—and I’m willing to inhabit and break it down as many times as needed.”
Her most notable performances include:
Festival Internacional Cumbre Tajín – 2019, Veracruz
Festival Noche de Primavera – 2021, Mexico City
FESTIVAL HERA HSBC – 2024, Mexico City
FESTIVAL SINERGIA – 2024, Mexico City
HOUSE OF VANS – 2024, Mexico City

name: Karma Sheen
description:
Karma Sheen is a London-based project led by British-Pakistani artist Sameer Khan, fusing the spirit of psychedelic rock with the emotional depth of Hindustani Classical music. Born from the tension between tradition and distortion, the project reimagines raag-based forms through fuzz pedals, improvisation and diasporic imagination.
Rooted in Khan’s training under Ustaad Latafat Ali Khan (Sham Chaurasi Gharana), Karma Sheen translates classical ornamentation into immersive soundscapes. Khan is joined by guitarist Amad Chima, sitarist Rodrigo Bourganos, bassist and visual artist Grisha Grebbenikov, and drummer/DJ Arun Dhanjal, forming a collaboration that bridges ancient lineage with contemporary subculture.
The band released their debut album in 2023, followed by extensive UK and European touring, including sold-out headline shows at Rich Mix and the 100 Club, and festival appearances at Shambala and Trans Musicales, where they recorded a KEXP live session due for release in early 2026.
Now working with EBB Music, Karma Sheen are building international momentum as they prepare to release their second album in 2026.

name: Kayanne Peppa
description: Born in 2001, Philadelphia ignited its very own genre-bending firecracker: Kayanne Peppa. Also known as “Bunnii,” Kayanne began her creative journey at a young age, exploring various arts, writing, orchestra, & musical theater. Her curiosity later expanded into cosplay/design, & music laying the foundation for the bold world she creates today. Inspired by her brother, she began recording her own raps on GarageBand in high school, transforming a playful hobby into something more. Her music now emerges from the depths of fearless self-expression, blending hip-hop grit, punk rebellion & an unmistakable sense of play. With her animated and striking stage confidence, Kayanne Peppa turns every performance into an experience. Being instantly recognizable for her bunny ears, each show she lovingly gives them out to honor the memory of her beloved bunny, Kirby.Drawing inspiration from artists like Missy Elliott, Aaliyah, Michael Jackson, Avril Lavigne, Gwen Stefani to name a few, she refused to stay in one lane. To her life is one big anime, where exaggeration, bold looks, and unapologetic individuality are quite essential.Kayanne Peppa’s music is made for main characters only!

name: Keetheweeb
description:
Meet Keetheweeb: A Rising Star in Music and Gaming

Keetheweeb is an anonymous female singer known for her eclectic blend of genres, including Pop, Cinematic, and Nerdcore. Hailing from Louisiana, she burst onto the scene with her unique sound, captivating audiences with heartfelt lyrics and infectious melodies. She is widely known for her anime inspired tracks like “Mastermind” (Ayanokoji) and “Bomb” (Reze).

Her notable collaborations include working with renowned artists like Rustage on the hit track “Assimilate” which showcased their complementary styles. She also teamed up with Johnald to make “Breakdown” for their twist on a K Pop Demon Hunters Fan Song that gained traction on YouTube .

In the gaming world, Keetheweeb has made waves with placements in popular gaming competitions such as EVO, where her track “Waves” became a fan favorite. She has contributed thematic music to Genshin Impact, enhancing player experience with her signature sound.

With a growing fanbase and a flair for innovation, Keetheweeb is poised to become a major player in both the music and gaming industries. Keep an eye on this talented artist as she continues to break boundaries and redefine her craft!

name: Keira Vana
description: Keira Vana is a rising dark-pop artist turning heads with her recent singles Aftertaste and Medicine. Known for sharp, emotional storytelling and a sound that’s both haunting and addictive, she blends confidence and vulnerability into music that stays with you.

name: The Kellows
description:
"Your future headliners of tomorrow" - Jess Iszatt RADIO 1
"That is the way to do it." — John Kennedy, RADIO X

Sheffield’s most exciting alt-indie export

Following the meteoric rise of their previous release ‘Breathe Me In’—and the industry-shaking buzz of their breakthrough ‘Do You Want Me To?’—the Steel City four-piece are no longer just "ones to watch." Having already secured the backing of tastemakers like Steve Lamacq (BBC Radio 6 Music), John Kennedy (Radio X), and BBC Radio 1, The Kellows are entering 2026 with the momentum of a band destined for the main stage.

Recording in Sheffield with legendary producer Alan Smyth (the man behind the desk for the Arctic Monkeys' seminal early tracks). That iconic Sheffield DNA is woven into the fabric of the single, capturing the raw, electric energy that has become the band's hallmark.

Led by the formidable 17-year-old lineup of Will Harris (Vocals/Guitar), Evan Applegate (Guitar/Vocals), Charlie May (Bass), and Rueben Huddleston (Drums),

name: Kenzzo
description:
Kenzzo is an artist from Monterrey, Nuevo León. With just 21 years and an EP released this 2025, it has already positioned itself as one of the new promises of pop in Mexico.
His proposal, which he calls inorganic pop, seeks to expand musicals horizons with fresh sounds that start from the mixture of the warmth of the grand piano and experimentation with digital synthesis.

name: Kety Fusco
description:
Kety Fusco is electro-acoustic harpist, composer, and producer who has redefined the harp for the contemporary stage. Armed with her 47-microphone electro-acoustic harp, distortion pedals, and electronics, she transforms the instrument into a visceral voice that screams, whispers, and resonates far beyond classical tradition.
Her debut album The Harp was selected by Iggy Pop as “best album” on BBC Radio 6, and in 2025 she will release BOHÈME (A Tree in a Field Records), featuring a collaboration with Iggy Pop. Fusco has toured extensively across Europe and Latin America, performing at prestigious venues such as the Royal Albert Hall, Montreux Jazz Festival, and Mexico’s CENART, and as a Swiss cultural ambassador at the Euro Jazz Festival (Mexico City) and South America tour for Swiss Embassies.
In 2025, she has also been invited by the U.S. Department of State to participate in the prestigious International Visitor Leadership Program (IVLP), recognizing her as an ambassador of Swiss music and cultural innovation.
Her work bridges classical training and radical experimentation, from reimagining Beethoven’s “Für Elise” as a furious electronic cry to composing soundtracks for film and RAI Radio3. With over 200 live shows in three years, Kety Fusco is carving an unprecedented path for the harp in electronic music.

name: KID PHENOMENON
description:
A seven-member dance and vocal group that embodies Tokyo's new generation culture, "TOKYO NEO POP".
Armed with their unique performance style, these young talents are set to create a new phenomenon from Tokyo to the world.
Debuting in August 2023.

name: Kids
description:
Kids is an art punk project focused on writing the most subversive music possible within tight limitations. Their sound is characterized by a lack of effects pedals, idiosyncratic arrangements and song forms, and an irreverent high energy that contrasts with their relatively minimal sound. The crown jewel of Kids is in the double vocals: All of their music relies on meticulous interplay between Venezuelan guitarist Julio Prato and bass player Ani Kramer on the vocal front, reimagining the idea of a song as more of a conversation between lead vocalists rather than the highlight of just one. All this is laid atop a flurry of cutting edge guitar work, grounding bass lines, and the one-of-a-kind surgical manner of drumming Colin Ferguson always brings to the table.

Their debut full length album REPETITIOM VARIATIOM released in the summer of 2024 is their most ambitious release to date, relying on disorientation, indulgently varying repetition, evocative imagery, and their signature sound palette to conceive music that feels familiar, humorous and encouraging, yet pronouncedly uncanny.

name: Killakmadeinbrooklyn
description:
Killakmadeinbrooklyn, also known as Killa K, is a Brooklyn-born rapper delivering unapologetic hip-hop rooted in real life, emotional truth, and street confidence. Her music blends sharp lyricism, bold femininity, and raw storytelling—turning pain, betrayal, and self-discovery into power-packed records.

Independent and self-driven and a mother of two Killa K carved her lane without following industry formulas. Her sound is confrontational yet relatable, balancing hard bars with vulnerability and confidence with honesty. Every release reflects growth, self-awareness, and an unfiltered voice that refuses to be ignored.

name: King Cooley
description: King Cooley is a neo-soul, hip-hop artist based in Atlanta, Georgia and known for blending her warm southern-twang, certified rap bars, and captivating melodies. With a sound that’s equal parts nostalgic and forward-thinking, King Cooley’s music is an introspective journey through themes of love, self-discovery, and social change. Her breakthrough track, "Climate Change," brought critical attention to her ability to address complex issues with authenticity, gaining over 300,000 streams on Spotify. Following this success, King Cooley’s latest video, “Get Down,” has racked up over 100,000 views on Youtube and songs like “Got That” and “Reunion Season” have been featured on Netflix’s Love Is Blind tv show, and Tyler Perry’s, Sistas, on BET, respectively.

name: KING NO-ONE
description:
With a name as regal as their ambition, KNO are reshaping boundaries as they set out to release their debut album in April 2026.

This charismatic trio built their reputation through relentless touring and a catalogue of singles that bristle with both confidence and vulnerability.

Glistening guitar riffs, punchy rhythms and poetic narratives ensure their sound is both urgent and heartfelt.

These narratives are channelled into lyrics that are as revealing as they are relatable.

The songwriting is a testament to their roots. Each track is a vignette of life, steeped in nostalgia, resilience and a yearning to belong. It’s music that’s as much about catharsis as it is about connection.

First single ‘Transgressions’ is a confessional anthem. Nostalgia and identity are painted vividly in the second single as the band retrace childhood, its warmth underpinning an unflinching honesty.

Yet it’s the title track which lies at the emotional heart of this debut. Empathy is portrayed as both gift and curse, a force that connects deeply to others’ pain, yet at times threatens to overwhelm.

It’s a debut album that’s as unguarded and unflinching as the band themselves, sure to resonate with anyone whose heart has ever felt too full.

name: Knats
description:
Knats, a quintet led by two lifelong best mates from Newcastle Upon Tyne, Stan Woodward (Bass) and King David-Ike Elechi (Drums), alongside their younger sidekick and virtuoso Trumpeter, Ferg Kilsby, making Geordie Jazz, with sophisticated arrangements, strong melodies and danceable grooves.

After moving to London at the end of 2022, Knats took London by storm playing sold out jazz re:freshed and Rough Trade East headliners, supporting Str4ta at a sold Jazz Cafe and performing for the BBC proms; as well as working with and backing the likes of Geordie Greep, Eddie Chacon, Yellowdays and collaborating with major fashion brands Palace, Beams and Arc’teryx. Following their signing to Gearbox Records at the beginning of 2024, Knats released their debut self-titled album in March of 2025 and embarked on their first UK headline tour. From this they went on to receive critical acclaim from the likes of Jazzwise, Downbeat, Rolling Stone Japan, The Guardian and many more; as well as being nominated for ‘Jazz Newcomer of the Year’ at this year’s Parliamentary Jazz Awards.

name: KOAD
description: KOAD has one goal as an artist: “I want to make men cry and women dance.” The 23-year-old rapper, producer, and director from the San Fernando Valley is redefining Indian-American artistry with his debut album TREEHOUSE. Born Ajay Dodani to Indian immigrant parents, KOAD blends Bollywood nostalgia, hip-hop, and pop into something unmistakably his own. Teaching himself to produce at 13 and leaving school at 14 to pursue music full-time, he transformed his family garage into a studio with his brother and manager, Amit. His breakout single “Deepika” — a cheeky love letter to Bollywood icon Deepika Padukone — earned co-signs from SZA, Isaiah Rashad, Zane Lowe, and the actress herself. He followed with “dirty,” a sharp satire on cultural fetishization that amassed over 25M views and marked his directorial debut. Now signed to 10K Projects, KOAD is also the co-founder of KOGO, an artist community home to prolific originals including Asha Imuno, Curtis Waters, REHMA, CONNIE, Nafeesisboujee & more. With TREEHOUSE, he fuses vulnerability, swagger, and imagination into a world built for people to feel, dance, and belong.

name: Kodie Shane
description:
A cornerstone of Atlanta’s alternative scene, Kodie Shane is the seasoned architect of "Ethereal Trap." Evolving from a teenage prodigy into a fully autonomous force, she navigated the major-label system at Epic Records before successfully negotiating her independence. Today, she operates with 100% creative control and a "glitter-eyed" aesthetic that defies convention.

A songwriter first, Kodie holds credits on 95% of her catalog, with over 100 releases and 100M+ streams to her name. Her raw vulnerability and melodic precision have made her a premier collaborator and a global touring staple. Whether headlining international dates from London to South Africa or supporting icons like Jhené Aiko, Lil Uzi Vert, and Willow Smith, her high-octane stage presence is unmatched.

Beyond music, Kodie is a premier tastemaker cited by Vogue and Pitchfork. Blending luxury high fashion with streetwear, she has fronted global campaigns that challenge gender norms, solidifying her status as a visual icon for a loyal community of 850,000+ followers and 300,000 + monthly listeners on Spotify

name: KOJ
description:
KOJ is the sound of defiance rising from Liverpool, UK: a working-class voice turned outward, loud enough to cut through the noise, resilient enough to remain unshaken, and connected enough to represent a frustrated generation.

Drawing from the raw British sub-cultural sounds of Grime, Rap and Punk, KOJ creates music that confronts power while rooted in relatability and everyday struggle. Revolutionary in spirit yet populist in appeal, his music is built to connect, move, and be felt collectively. At its core is courage - raw, direct lyricism exploring survival and defiance, darkness and light, pressure and pride.

KOJ showcased his lyrical authority on his acclaimed debut EP Villain With A Conscience, earning support from Clash, Wonderland, The Face, Apple Music and Amazon Music.
Live is where KOJ reaches another level. He doesn’t perform - he leads. From Boomtown to Radio 1 Big Weekend, Reeperbahn and SXSW, his shows become charged, communal moments where tension turns to release.

More than a catalogue, KOJ is building a movement through purpose-driven visuals, tech-led collaborations and his growing TRiBE community — “a man on a mission,” as The F-Word Magazine puts it.

name: Korda Korder
description:
"I've not stopped playing this for days" - STEVE LAMACQ, BBC RADIO 6
"Authentic...really special" - BBC RADIO 6 ROUNDTABLE
"Sounding Amazing" - JOHN KENNEDY, RADIO X
"Stunning single" – HUW STEPHENS, BBC RADIO 6
"A Spellbinding Song" - FRESH ON THE NET
"Stunning and Beautiful" - GOD IS IN THE TV
"One of those records that stops you in your tracks" - AMAZING RADIO
"Is this the best new band in the UK?" - THE ZINE

name: Kordelya
description:
KORDELYA es una artista y productora mexicana de electro-pop y R&B, reconocida por unir lenguajes y culturas a través de sonidos y letras honestas, a veces vulnerables y otras veces irónicamente sarcásticas.
Con su álbum debut Mal Hecha, KORDELYA conecto con público al retratar, con orgullo, la imperfección de ella misma en cada canción. Su vulnerabilidad y autenticidad se reflejan tanto en su música como en sus videoclips cinematográficos, que dan vida a su universo visual.
A lo largo de su carrera, ha compartido escenario con artistas como Ximena Sariñana, José Madero y Leonel García. Además, fue invitada por Billboard como artista asociada en el programa Latin Women in Music, y se ha presentado en plataformas y medios como Telemundo Acceso Total Live, Azteca TV, TIDAL Living Room Sessions y Sofar Sounds Give Rise de Fujifilm Instax.

name: KUOKO
description: KUOKO is an artist from Hamburg, Germany, known for her unmistakable voice and pop music shaped by her own electronic production. With millions of streams to her name, she brings brand new music to SXSW- expect a live set made to both dance and drift.

name: LA ROSA NOIR
description:
La Rosa Noir is a Chicago indie alternative band whose sound blends moody atmospheres with the sharp edges of surf, post-punk, and new wave. Their debut album, Arellano, dives into themes of love, loss, and self-discovery, weaving heartfelt, sentimental narratives through dynamic and emotionally charged arrangements. Formed in 2018, the band grew out of Chicago’s DIY scene and has since taken the stage at Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Riot Fest, sharing bills with artists such as Jack White, Green Day, Citizen, Son Rompe Pera, and The Red Pears.

For fans of: La Luz, Siouxsie & The Banshees, The Hives, Mazzy Star, The Cramps, Muse.

name: La Texana
description: La Texana, the music project of José Ramírez, was born in 2021 in Tijuana, Baja California. At 17, with just a laptop and guitar, he began recording music inspired by Spanish alternative rock and post-punk influences. He debuted with Nunca He Sabido Amar, and in 2023 released his first EP, Morro, featuring Un Día Como Hoy, now with over 6.5 million streams. In 2025, La Texana released his first full-length album, signed by the spanish label Sonido Muchacho "La Casa Que Cae", a 10-track record exploring identity and new beginnings, reaching over 8 million streams. It includes standout tracks like Terco, El Sol, and Dispara. In May, he performed a sold-out debut at Lunario of Auditorio Nacional and is now touring across Mexico (40+ cities) and 7 countries, with more dates to come. La Texana is currently preparing for his biggest show yet at Teatro Metropólitan in February 2026. His style continues to evolve, blending vulnerability and nostalgia, while connecting with a new generation of Mexican musicians and growing an international audience.

name: Larry Seaman
description: 'One of Austin's best songwriters' has a new album, Mind How You Go, out on Flak Records. Larry's killer band includes Jon Sanchez (Flying Saucers, Roky Erickson), Andy Maguire ( Spoon, Dogzilla), Ray Flynt (2020), and Jenny deWulf Smith (JLQ).

name: The Last Real Circus
description:
From Richmond, VA, Jason Farlow & The Last Real Circus craft a raw, soulful blend of Americana and Indie Rock. The project is a musical collective centered on singer-songwriter Jason Farlow, renowned for his energetic stage presence, heartfelt storytelling, and musicianship.
Touring both solo and with his band, Farlow has captivated a loyal following with heartbeat singles like “Nottoway” and “Gypsy Woman.” His sound channels a wide range of influences, from Tom Petty and Joe Cocker to Kings of Leon and Alabama Shakes.
Their rising trajectory has earned them opening slots for an impressive roster of artists, including Jon Russell of The Head and The Heart, Band of Heathens, Blues Traveler, Nicole Atkins, Bones of JR Jones, Devon Gilfillian, Tim Reynolds, Biz Markie, The Sleepwalkers and many others.

name: Lee Bains
description: Lee Bains is a songwriter and poet from Birmingham, Alabama, who, with his band The Glory Fires, has released four studio albums of what Rolling Stone calls “Southern gospel punk” since 2012. His most recent album, Old-Time Folks, released by Don Giovanni Records in 2022, explored stories of People’s movements in the Deep South to acclaim from the likes of Rolling Stone, The New York Times, NPR, and the Guardian. He has collaborated in live performance and on recordings with artists including Lonnie Holley, Moor Mother, Pussy Riot, Algiers, and Mourning [A] BLKstar. In addition to playing shows around the U.S. and Europe, Lee has published poetry in The New Yorker, and lent his music to support striking coalminers, immigrants’ rights groups, abortion funds, and anti-racism organizations.

name: Lee Vasi
description:
Lee Vasi is an Atlanta-based R&B artist originally from Fayetteville, North Carolina. Raised singing with her siblings and performing in theater, her Puerto Rican-Dominican and African American heritage shaped her diverse musical influences and passion for honest storytelling. She wrote her first song at age 10 while backstage at The Lion King on Broadway, where she performed as Young Nala, and later appeared on American Idol.

After taking time to reconnect with her faith and artistic direction, Lee returned in 2023 with her single “My Bad,” which gained traction following a bilingual a cappella performance on Kai Cenat and Speed’s livestream. In early 2024, her breakout single “Teach Me” went viral on Instagram and TikTok ahead of release, earning her first Billboard chart entries, including #2 on Gospel Digital Song Sales and #21 on Hot Gospel Songs.

name: Leo Von Sol
description: Leo Von Sol is a pop and R&B artist based in Austin, Texas, pairing sleek pop songwriting with R&B phrasing, and a lower baritone vocal presence. Influenced by artists like Tinashe, KAI of EXO, and Omar Apollo, his work blends polished performance instincts with a cinematic visual sensibility and modern production choices. His recent EP, Garden of Sol, is focused on themes of nostalgia, temptation, and solitude, expressed through bright pop and R&B sonics and sun-rich visuals that draw from early-2000s pop language without feeling like a throwback. A Recording Academy member, Leo Von Sol balances candid, behind-the-scenes authenticity with a professionally branded presence, while his style sits at the intersection of luxury streetwear and high fashion, always intentional, elevated, and lived-in.

name: LEOA
description:
Brazilian singer and songwriter Luísa Nascimento has spent over a decade shaping a powerful and experimental sonic journey. As the frontwoman of Luísa e os Alquimistas, she became a recognized voice in Brazil’s contemporary music scene, reaching over 20 million streams and performing on notable stages across Brazil and Europe.

In 2025, she reemerges as LEOA, opening a new artistic chapter rooted in the rhythms of Brazil’s Northeast and in dialogue with the Caribbean and Latin America. Her sound blends rap, afrobeats, pop, and Afro-diasporic influences into an energetic, dance-driven experience.

With a magnetic presence and distinctive songwriting, LEOA moves between Portuguese, English, Spanish, and French, weaving bridges between cultures and identities. Her music is a space of freedom, where ancestral sounds meet contemporary production with rhythm, intensity, and poetry.

name: Les Itinérantes
description:
One of France’s most distinctive a cappella acts, Les Itinérantes turn three voices into an immersive, ritual-like live experience.

Les Itinérantes (french for "The Wanderers") are one of France’s most acclaimed a cappella trios, recognized for transforming vocal performance into a powerful live experience. Founded in Paris in 2017, the group was born from a chance encounter and a shared desire to explore the voice beyond established genres.

Without instruments, they approach singing as a living, embodied material - a space of memory, transmission, and human connection. Their repertoire spans over nine centuries of music and more than fifty languages, blending ancient and traditional songs with original compositions. This diversity is not encyclopedic, but intentional: a search for what unites people across time, cultures, and borders.

Praised by the French press for the ritual, purity, and emotional depth of their performances, Les Itinérantes are known for rare vocal precision and a strong sense of presence. Their concerts are intimate and immersive, offering audiences a focused, shared experience of listening.

name: Leslie Kirchoff
description: Where the New York fashion set goes, you’ll likely find Kirchhoff,” said Style.com about Leslie Kirchhoff, who was named one of their Top 10 New DJs, as well as “The Coolest Girl in the Room” by Paper Magazine in their Beautiful People Issue. After learning to DJ in Paris in 2011, she made her New York debut with a Friday night residency at the notorious Boom Boom Room at the Top of the Standard Hotel, and quickly became an in-demand staple in the downtown Manhattan party scene. Her skills on the decks and timeless music collection have brought her clients like Louis Vuitton, Dolce & Gabbana, Cartier, and American Express, to name a few. She’s performed around the world in cities such as Paris, London, Berlin, Tokyo, Stockholm, Mexico City, Miami, Las Vegas, and more.

name: Lew Apollo
description:
Lew Apollo is a rising force in modern soul, captivating audiences with his soul-stirring melodies and poignant songwriting. KUTX praised him as “the perfect summer vibe,” a fitting description for an artist whose music blends hypnotic guitar, cinematic production, and a sultry, smoky voice into lush, resonant soundscapes. Originally hailing from rural Barnum, MN, Lew’s artistry is deeply rooted in his home state’s heritage, fusing the legacies of Bob Dylan and Prince with modern influences like Hozier, Leon Bridges, and Labrinth.
The tragic loss of his father in 2022 profoundly shaped Lew’s songwriting, catalyzing a body of work that confronts themes of grief, isolation, and resilience while offering hope and connection. His debut EP JUNGLE, produced by BLK ODYSSY, introduced him as a bold new voice and fueled a run of sold-out shows at iconic Austin venues like The Pershing and Antone’s.
Since then, Lew has taken his music to wider audiences, touring in support of Los Lonely Boys and earning airplay on KUTX with his single “Diamonds and Gold” as well as “Let the Light In” from his debut album. Self-produced from start to finish, Fool’s Gold has already surpassed 300,000 streams in under two months and is creating buzz for its fearless vulnerability and lush production. Press outlets have echoed the excitement: AMP Music declared “Lew Apollo will be a force in the R&B and pop stratospheres. Be warned,” while Earmilk praised how “Apollo’s signature smoky voice sets the tone for a sultry soundscape.” With his clear vision and unwavering dedication to using music as a vessel for healing, Lew Apollo is quickly emerging as one of the most exciting new voices to watch in soul.

name: Lil Asian Thiccie
description:
Kuala Lumpur-based rapper, singer, and songwriter Lil Asian Thiccie has earned herself a spot in the forefront of the Malaysian urban music scene by continually pushing the envelope. With a lustful sound that teases trap, pop and everything good in between, her tongue-in-cheek lyrics and dreamy delivery marks her distinct sound and persona.

With an established career and presence as a standout female rapper and hip- hop starlet that has spanned the last four years, Lil Asian Thiccie is now introducing a new era of her music and identity. With an all-new sound and direction, this release plan covers the journey ahead for Lil Asian Thiccie as she evolves into the hyperpop superstar of her dreams.

name: LilJayFromDaO
description:
LilJayFromDaO is a rising reality rap artist from Austin, Texas, known for blending raw street perspective with authentic Texas storytelling. Rooted in real-life experience, his music reflects the resilience, ambition, and culture of the city that shaped him, delivering records that connect across generations and communities. His sound carries the grit of Southern hip-hop while remaining energetic, accessible, and purpose-driven.

Building strong momentum, LilJayFromDaO is a two-time official SXSW artist and has toured across Texas alongside legendary artist Chingo Bling, solidifying his reputation as a powerful live performer. His rise has earned notable recognition, including being named “Next To Blow” by Rap Economics, “Top 20 Texas Latino Artist” by Texas Buzz, and “Top 20 Rap Artist” by AustinStreetsTV.

He's received genuine co-signs from Texas hip-hop icons Paul Wall, Bun B, and Lil Keke, and has worked with artists such as Chingo Bling, GT Garza, Wacotron, Slim Thug, OC Chris, That Mexican OT, Dee Baby, and more. As his platform continues to grow, LilJayFromDaO remains focused on representing Austin with authenticity while pushing Texas hip-hop forward on a national level.

name: Little Guilt
description:
Delivered from the West coast of Australia, Little Guilt arrive as a cocktail of honeyed vocals, hypnotic synths and wistful lyricism brought forth with driving guitars. Since their formation in early 2021, the indie outfit have unwittingly captured the hearts of music lovers in both the digital realm and on stage through sold-out venues around Australia.

Since their debut, Little Guilt have supported Los Bitchos, Great Gable, Telenova, Old Mervs and more. They’ve earned acclaim from tastemakers including Tone Deaf, Frankie Magazine, Pilerats and Music Feeds, secured airplay across triple j, Double j, triple j Unearthed and community radio. The group were also showcasing artists at Bigsound 2024.

2025 saw Little Guilt release two singles and join UK artist Freak Slug as the main support on their Australian national tour. The five-piece has kicked off this year supporting Nilüfer Yanya and showcasing at SXSW Austin. You can expect to hear new music from Little Guilt with their new 6-track EP releasing mid-2026.

With a subtle air of formidable cool and songs to sink your teeth into, it seems a little guilt goes a long way.

name: Little Wilderness
description:
Little Wilderness is a dynamic, homegrown rock band that draws inspiration from the rugged landscape of Southwest Colorado, blending the raw energy of rock 'n roll with the unique environmental influences of the Four Corners region. Formed in 2011, the band has become a key player in Durango's music scene, with a lineup that includes Paul Henderson (guitar/singer), Dan Szabo (lead guitar), Juan Lopez (bass), and David Sachs (drums).

Their debut album, Big Tent (2019), released on Flak Records out of Austin, Texas, encapsulates their diverse sound. The album's opening track, “Crazy World,” is a high-octane composition that sets the tone with its fiery guitar riffs and driving rhythm. Other songs, like “Narrow Gauge,” incorporate elements of country and Americana, while tracks like “Laid Low” and “Starting New” showcase their indie rock sensibilities. The band’s style evokes the spirit of an era when garage bands ruled the airwaves, characterized by loud amps and hard-hitting drums.
With their blend of gritty rock 'n roll and Southwestern flavor, Little Wilderness proves that the genre is alive and well, and they’re here to keep it that way.

name: Lodri
description:
Lodri (Rodrigo Nieves) Venezuelan Producer/Composer based in Austin, currently in his beginnings in the music industry.

Actively involved in the city’s emerging music movement. His sound blends Latin rhythms with electronic influences, creating a fresh and vibrant style that represents the new wave of urban music in Austin.

He has taken part in various local and events, collaborating with artists, collectives, and brands that support the independent music culture.

He brings a strong sense of variety and versatility to his instrumentals.

He experiments with genres such as Afrobeat, Reggaeton and Merenguetón, and has also begun exploring styles like R&B, Tech, and Dembow.

name: Lofi Legs
description:
Conceived in the waters of Arroyo Seco, forged in the Bay Area DIY scene,
Lofi Legs is an SF-based band whose rotating members always includes Paris
Cox-Farr writing songs about falling in love, dropping acid, and being nowhere
and everywhere at once. Starry-eyed love ballads share space with broken hearts
and killer guitars.

name: Lola Kinsey
description:
At 20, Texas-based artist Lola Kinsey is stepping fully into her own, blending classic rock roots with a modern pop shimmer. Her debut EP Come of Age captures the messy in-between of growing up. Heartbreak, family tension, and the pressure of figuring out who you’re supposed to be versus who you actually are.

Inspired by icons like Stevie Nicks, Cher, and Linda Ronstadt, Lola builds songs around strong melodies, big feelings, and a genre-bending spirit that feels both timeless and current. Ask her what genre she makes and she’ll still say “Linda Ronstadt,” a wink to her love of fearless storytelling and emotional honesty.

Momentum continues to build: three tracks from her debut EP Come of Age have received radio play on KXT and 88.1 Indie, and she appeared as an official SXSW 2025 showcase artist. With a return to SXSW and a Jambaloo appearance in 2026, plus her debut album slated for release this year, Lola is ready to take over the world one disco at a time.

name: Lola Tried
description: Lola Tried is a fast-paced, loud-as-hell rock band from Austin, Texas, with driving guitars, sharp melodies, and the commanding voice of Lauren Burton. Their sound blends snarling guitars, punchy rhythms, and an emotional edge that swings between chaos and control. With a relentless live presence and hooks that hit like a gut punch, Lola Tried channels the messy urgency of feminine rage through a sharp, modern lens.

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

events.venue: Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: Loren Heat
description:
Seductive, sharp, and unapologetically fearless, Loren Heat is a bold new force in UK pop. Emerging from Middlesbrough in the industrial heartland of north east England, Loren wasted no time making waves with their debut EP “Scarlet Haze”.

Exploring the turbulence of admitting your feelings and experiencing some of your hardest points in life, Heat’s heart-on-sleeve lyrics combine the sweetest parts of love with the most vulnerable parts of lust.

Their sharp-edged pop has already caught the attention of major tastemakers including Clash, DIY, Spotify, Apple Music, BBC Introducing, Record of the Day, Notion, Atwood and Earmilk, to name but a few.

Inspired by global icons like Billie Eilish, Lady Gaga, Slayyyter, Dua Lipa and JADE, Loren is as unapologetic as their story – an exploration of queerness, identity and the raw chaos of navigating life in the North East.

After a breakthrough 2025 which saw Heat perform acclaimed sets the likes of The Great Escape, Kendal Calling and BBC Introducing from the Glasshouse, Loren recently inked a deal with Interval Records (Generator/Universal Music Group).

name: Los Discorde
description:
Desde que inició la pandemia no hemos parado de componer y escribir todas las diferentes sensaciones que a lo largo de nuestra visión hemos tenido que recorrer.

Nos gusta pensar en la unidad de las personas cuando existe música en vivo, cuando podemos brincar y bailar con todo el cora.

Los Discorde somos una familia de amigos y un laboratorio de sonidos en donde nos gusta experimentar con otros artistas las diferentes formas de ver y escuchar lo que nos gustaría que vivieran desde otra perspectiva, pero siempre con la idea de pasarla bello, compartir y disfrutar el camino

name: Los Gran Reyes
description: Los Gran Reyes are a Dallas-based nine-piece cumbia powerhouse led by Agustín Granados Jr. (AG), blending traditional cumbia styles with modern and electronic influences. Drawing from Cumbia Lagunera, Sonidera, and Argentina, their sound is high-energy, culture-driven, and built for the dance floor. Their latest album, Cumbia Vibes, marks a bold new era of cumbia moderna and solidifies Los Gran Reyes as one of the most exciting live Latin acts today.

name: Louie Lee
description: Change doesn’t ask for permission; it disrupts and transforms. For Louie Lee, this truth began early. Growing up in a trailer park outside Detroit, he witnessed his mother working three jobs to make ends meet, instilling in him an unyielding work ethic. Battling a hearing impairment while soaking in the diverse sounds of metal, hip hop, rock, pop, and country, music became his escape and means of expression. The loss of his grandfather marked a turning point, igniting a new honesty in his songwriting that earned him Song of the Year at the Detroit Music Awards in 2022. Louie Lee's unique sound, labeled Country Hop & Roll, combines modern 808 basslines with country twang, crafting music that feels both grounded and dynamic. His lyrics delve into rarely explored emotional territories, balancing high-energy anthems with heartfelt ballads. Louie’s live performances forge deep connections with audiences, transforming shows into communal experiences where fans actively participate. As a storyteller, Louie is reshaping country music’s landscape, inviting non-country listeners to the genre while redefining its essence. His journey of creation through truth is just beginning.

name: Lovpune
description: Lovpune is a queer indie-electronic pop artist who moved from conservative Texas to Los Angeles. She channels that transformation into late-night soundscapes perfect for empty highways and midnight dance floor connections. Writing and producing her own music, she creates infectious hooks wrapped in shimmering melodies. Lovpune is a soundtrack to stories of chosen family and authentic self-discovery.

name: LU GOT THE TASTE
description:
From Monterrey, Nuevo León, Mexico, LU GOT THE TASTE was born from the fusion of music and dance. Having begun her exploration of dance and performance at the age of seven, encompassing genres such as jazz, heels, contemporary, and showdance, Lu launched her musical career in front of the microphone and camera. Her perfect control of rhythm and her body are evident in each of her tracks, from hip hop to dembow and even alternative. One thing is clear: LU is here to stay.

Under the Slowly label in collaboration with Angeles Mafia, LU's project promises to be the underdog of 2026.

events.presented_by: German Music Export by Initiative Musik

name: Lucaa
description:
Originally from the Blue Ridge Mountains of North Carolina but currently living between LA, NYC and Richmond, VA; Lucaa (she/they) is the brainchild of singer/producer Stepha, who is a 2 spirit Afro-Indigenous artist whose genre-bending indie/alt-pop brand of music features raw and deceptively deep songwriting that pulls from their experiences as a young model in NYC, and being a queer BIPOC artist.

At a young age, Lucaa remembers listening to their father (who was a backup singer for Stevie Wonder, Earth Wind and Fire, and Michael Jackson) and mother (a trained opera singer). After teaching themself how to sing and play songs on piano by ear, Lucaa now takes a grungier approach to altpop, with influences harnessed from Radiohead, Billie Eilish, Willow, & girl in red.

Lucaa's career is growing quickly. A notable SXSW 2024 showcase early on led to major label interest and a fruitful year of performances and international branding campaigns with Leica Cameras and TurboTax. Lucaa was also a featured artist alongside Black Eyed Peas front man Taboo for Reserved Magazine, and appeared in Vogue Japan's October Edition (print), KEXP, Ones to Watch, and Them.

name: Lucid Express
description:
Kim Ho has escaped the clogged streets, blinding lights and noise of central Hong Kong to the region’s northern mountains. Heartbreak and disillusionment are on her heels.

In these mountains, in sight of both the Chinese border and the international hub of downtown Hong Kong, Ho seeks to make sense of who she, and her bandmates, are. The pride they’d felt as teenagers has long faded. Their multicultural progressive city has become politically oppressive since 2014, when anti-state protests were countered with beatings, politically-targeted arrests, and death threats from government officials. Says Ho, “we’ve been steadily losing hope for a decade now”.

Their response has been to create their own universe revolving around their studio practice space nestled in an unassuming industrial district on the edge of the city.

'Instant Comfort' is the sound of a young band who've traveled the world, seen what it has to offer, held it for a moment, before watching it slip through their fingers. While the group’s first recordings arrived buoyant on a wave of hopeful romanticism, this latest outing is more complex; mapping their journey from uncertainty to a renewed sense of self-reliance.

name: Lucky
description:
Growing up in Staghorn Flat, Victoria, Lucky burst onto the scene in flurry of fuzzy guitars
and captivating storytelling. Blending the raw energy of alternative rock, with the dreamy
haze of modern indie, her music captures the nuances of life's everyday moments and
dives deep, putting you right at the centre of her world.

Having supported the likes of The Belair Lip Bombs, Hockey Dad, Armlock and Dear
Seattle, the Melbourne based artist is set for an exciting 2026 - following the release of
her single ‘Lady Beetle’, Lucky is building a devoted audience who are eagerly waiting to
see what’s in store next.

name: lucky break
description: lucky break is a 24-year-old New York-born indie rock artist based in San Francisco. Blending classic alt-rock, punk, and modern indie pop with a knack for homegrown radio hooks, the Biggest Thing EP marks lucky break's first official release. The collection, poised to establish the artist as a significant new voice in music, was recorded with Elliot Woodbridge (Ha Vay) in a makeshift car studio, each track offering a glimpse into the mysticism and whimsy of her expansive sonic world. And it’s just the beginning: Her full-length debut will release May 2026.

name: Luke Tyler Shelton
description: Born in the new millennium, Luke Tyler Shelton makes soul-soothing rock-and-roll with all the ineffable charm of a faraway time. With a profound gift for dreaming up heavenly melodies and fantastically loose grooves, the Los Angeles native found his sound as part of a close-knit scene of young musicians and artists—a DIY-minded community whose spirit and sensibilities recall the near-mythic creative hotbed of early-’70s Laurel Canyon. Produced by Shooter Jennings (Brandi Carlile, Tanya Tucker) and Jonathan Wilson (Father John Misty, Angel Olsen), Luke’s debut body of work merges country-rock, folk-pop, and Southern soul into songs that immediately transport the audience into a state of enchanted ease.

name: Luna Tropical
description: Luna Tropical is an homage to the cumbias that raised us. Known for getting asses out of seats with nonstop danceable cumbias, hot accordion and saxophone solos, and dynamic drums, Luna Tropical brings traditional Latin music with a modern flare.

name: Lynn
description:
LYNN is a 24-year-old artist from Birmingham, Alabama, making waves in the Hip-Hop/Rap and R&B scene. Her music is all about owning the moment, showcasing the power of women through bold, unapologetic rap bars, while also hitting us with those smooth, soulful R&B vibes.
Though she’s just getting started, LYNN has already made a big splash, earning the title of “Bama Hip-Hop/Rap Female Artist of the Year” at the 2022 Alabama Music Awards. She’s all about breaking boundaries and creating a space for herself in the industry while uplifting her community along the way.
With her unique sound and unstoppable energy, LYNN is on a mission to inspire and pave the way for others, all while cementing her place as one of the freshest voices in the game.

name: Mackwood
description:
Dubbed “UK music’s best kept secret” (Clash UK), drummer and producer Mackwood is rapidly emerging as one of the most exciting voices in the new wave of UK jazz and beyond. Cutting his teeth with Col3trane, Jim Legacy and ELIZA, and coming up through crossover projects like Silhouettes Project and Levitation Orchestra, Mackwood has carved out a distinctive niche between progressive jazz, beatmaking and alternative dancefloor rhythms. His sound fuses the pedigree of UK and international jazz with London’s new generation of player-producers, continuing the UK’s celebrated tradition of boundary-breaking crossover.

Now stepping into the spotlight with his debut album MASTER CHANGES, he is cementing his reputation as a forward-thinking artist with global reach. With roots in jazz but a sound that bridges hip hop, electronic and bass culture, Mackwood’s music crosses scenes and audiences alike. His collaborations span both acclaimed names and rising talent, while his live energy and versatility are fast building him a worldwide reputation.

name: Magic Rockers of Texas
description: Magic Rockers of Texas are a punchy power-pop rock band from Austin, TX, delivering gritty hooks and high-energy live shows rooted in catchy songwriting and garage-infused rock & roll. Led by charismatic singer Jim Campo, the group features Will Grover on guitar, Chris Kues on guitar & synth, Pat Ford on bass, and McGarrity Stanley on drums. Since forming in the mid-2010s, they’ve become local favorites, known for infectious riffs, spirited performances across Austin’s venues, and releases like the album Gorging on American Fare and singles such as “Houston” and "Words in a Bin." Blending melodic pop sensibilities with raw, fast-paced rock, Magic Rockers of Texas embody the vibrant independent music spirit of their hometown.

name: Mama Duke
description: Fresh off the national spotlight of America’s Got Talent, Mama Duke has emerged as one of the most commanding voices in music and culture today. As a Season 20 finalist, she earned Mel B’s coveted Golden Buzzer, launching her straight into the finals and into living rooms across the country. In that historic run, she became the first female rapper ever to reach the Top 10 in the show’s history—shattering expectations and proving that rap can be stadium-sized, deeply vulnerable, and undeniably powerful all at once. Comparisons to icons like Missy Elliott followed, but Mama Duke made it clear. She’s not here to imitate, she’s here to redefine.

name: Manny Phesto
description: Manny Phesto is a Minneapolis/San Diego based hip-hop artist known for sharp lyricism, commanding live performances, and a career built independently. He has toured nationally and performed internationally in Havana, Cuba and Mexico City, with appearances at major festivals including Soundset. Manny has collaborated musically with Devin the Dude and is a co-founder of Coughee alongside him. He has appeared on bills with Ice Cube, J. Cole, Freddie Gibbs & Madlib, and The Alchemist, and his music has been covered by Pitchfork, XXL, and NPR, earning a reputation as a respected performer rooted in culture, community, and independent hip-hop.

name: MARCO PLUS
description:
Marco Plus is carving out his own lane in hip-hop, blending razor-sharp lyricism with boundless sonic versatility. Hailed as a symbol that rap is alive and well, his technical prowess and raw authenticity have earned nods from outlets like Power 105.1’s The Breakfast Club, Complex Mag, Rap Caviar and more.

After spending a week with the giants of Dreamville, it was clear that Marco’s pen could hold weight in any room. His viral moment on Kai Cenat’s Mafiathon stream only further solidified his undeniable talent and magnetic presence, showing the world that his confidence is rooted in skill, not hype. His latest album, Marco Plus vs. Tha Underworld, continues that statement featuring a standout collaboration with Smino and proving he can spar with some of the sharpest voices in the game. Whether it’s on livestreams, stages, or in the booth, he’s amongst those leading the charge.

name: Mariae Cassandra
description:
Mariae Cassandra is an Australian singer songwriter from Perth, Western Australia, rapidly emerging as one of the country’s most compelling new voices. First capturing attention through her online songwriting videos and viral moments across TikTok, Instagram and YouTube, Mariae’s ability to pair intimate storytelling with hook driven pop has resonated with a growing global audience.

In 2024, Mariae won triple j Unearthed High with her breakout single “MillIon Billion Trillion” - a heartfelt ode to friendship that showcased her knack for emotionally direct, timeless songwriting. The win marked a turning point, positioning Mariae as a standout new artist and accelerating her rise beyond digital platforms.

Throughout 2024-25, Mariae built strong momentum, touring nationally as support for WAFIA, Spacey Jane, The Buoys and boywithuke, signing to Select Music and her debut EP “Everything In my Backpocket” via AWAL.

In 2025, Mariae warmed up main stages for Charli XCX and beabadoobee at Laneway Festival, was named one of Live Nation’s Ones To Watch and showcased at BIGSOUND and SXSW Sydney.

name: Marissa Nadler
description:
For over two decades, Marissa Nadler has carved out a singular place in the musical landscape, where ethereal folk, shadowy Americana, ambient soundscapes, and experimental textures converge. Anchored by her unmistakable mezzo-soprano and fingerstyle guitar, Nadler’s music conjures vivid emotional worlds—intimate, otherworldly, and timeless.
A prolific songwriter, Nadler has built a discography defined by spectral beauty and haunting lyricism. Her songs, dreamlike and lush, are rich with imagery and nuance. Nadler released her debut album, Ballads of Living and Dying, in 2004, a collection that announced her as a major voice in the underground. A skilled visual artist as well, Nadler’s background in painting deeply informs the cinematic scope of her songs. Following her early work, she partnered with Sacred Bones and Bella Union for July (2014), marking a new chapter in creative clarity and critical acclaim. Strangers (2016), For My Crimes (2018), and The Path of the Clouds (2021) further expanded her sonic palette.
Her 10th full-length, New Radiations, was released on August 15th. Expansive, melodic, and emotionally vivid, it captures Nadler at her most personal and visionary.

name: Mark Cooper
description: Mark Cooper is a multi-disciplinary Rapper and Producer, carrying the torch of Nerdcore from Detroit, Michigan. His branded work consists of a large body of verses and cyphers touching on all things considered “Nerdy” or from Gaming Culture, including references from but not limited to Gaming Systems of all brands, Transformers, Power Rangers, Halo, Naruto, and Tron, earning the perfect branding of “nostalgic.”

name: Marley Hale
description: Born in Texas and raised in Northern California, Marley Hale’s musical influences followed: Texas’s deep, country and western swing roots met San Francisco’s folk and rock legends. The result: classic country tropes, turned on their heads through a switching of roles or a repossessed identity; delicate, revelatory explorations of what it means to be a friend, lover, or neither; and second person addresses to herself that offer both an onlooker’s and her own perspective. After California, Hale spent time in Austin, TX and Portland, OR before relocating to Brooklyn, NY, where she recorded her debut EP, By My Own Ways, released July 2024, and began touring the US and Canada. After spending the better part of three years on the road, she moved back home to Austin, where she now resides.

name: Marni Ct.
description:
Marni carries a down-to-earth and authentic energy. The indie rock band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 2022, and consists of Nicolas Lara (vocals, guitar), and Michaela Gradstein (vocals, guitar). The project began as Lara’s solo work in Palm Springs, where he released the debut album Whiskey Girl, before evolving into a full band the following year.

Marni intertwines heavy distorted guitars with beautifully soft moments, drawing on influences such as Title Fight, Greet Death, and Hovvdy. Their newest EP fml era (2025), produced by Corey Coffman of Gleemer, is a portrait of being down on your luck, with unpolished guitars, and emotionally direct storytelling.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: Marty
description: Marty, is an independent artist, producer, and entrepreneur based in Los Angeles. With over 1 billion streams he runs Apollo Records, a creative label built on craftsmanship, faith, and long-game thinking, blending music, design, and culture into a cohesive vision.

name: Maru Haru
description: Maru Haru is a gaggle of musical misfits amplifying Asian American and queer experiences through bombastic anthems, intimate strings, and personal stories of heart and strife. Their projects are community driven, collaborating with multimedia artists, Asian American and LGBTQ+ vendors, and cultural centers throughout Austin, TX for not only concerts, but also films, food festivals, and celebrations. No matter the occasion, Maru Haru is motivated to share affirmation, empathy, and joy through their music.

name: Maya Manuela
description:
Maya Manuela is an indie-pop artist originally from Duxbury, Massachusetts, raised on an oyster farm before relocating to Nashville in 2019 to pursue music full-time. Her work blends intimate, emotionally precise songwriting with warm, modern production—songs that feel confessional without losing their pop instincts.

In 2023, Maya gained viral traction with her breakout single “Multiverse,” sparking two East Coast tours, festival appearances including Levitate Music Festival and Musicians Corner, and support slots for artists such as Angie McMahon. Her momentum continued with her debut album American Doll (2025), a candid and self-aware body of work that explores desire, disillusionment, and identity with quiet confidence. Named Musicbed’s Artist of the Year in 2025, Maya Manuela has emerged as a compelling new voice in indie pop—equal parts tender, incisive, and unafraid to tell the truth.

name: MC Frontalot
description: World's 579th-greatest rapper. Progenitor of nerdcore hip-hop and still that subgenre's Final Boss. Celebrating year 20 on tour.

name: MEEK
description:
You know that moment you realised Lady Gaga was named after a Queen song? MEEK is kind of the musical and stylistic culmination of that connecting glue, the secret chemical equation that bonds them. She is walking class war, musical defiance and the return of glam rock at its most instantly and commercially appealing. She’s dancing on the gay bar bar-top with a sparkler fizzing in your cocktail.

MEEK is not a work in progress. She is fully formed, earned her stripes, comes from nothing, nepo-baby baiting execution of timeless pop brilliance. While sounding directly descended from the DNA of famed countercultural misfits and bona fide pop aces, all strewn across the decades, her music is a no messing, straight shoot for the top.

name: Meg Elsier
description:
meg elsier is an indie-rock singer, songwriter, and visual artist based in New York City. One of the most exciting new voices in the indie-rock scene, meg juxtaposes sweet vocals and opulent melodies with grungy guitars and weighty production. Keen wit and self-awareness shine through her lyrics, seamlessly weaving into the fabric of her ethereal shoegaze sound.

meg's debut album 'spittake' blends elements of grunge, contemporary pop, folk, and indie-rock, and showcases meg’s ability to create dynamic, versatile, and effortlessly catchy music. Across the album’s 11 tracks, she delivers musings on love, death, nostalgia, youth, anxiety, depression and everything in between, with a uniquely self-deprecating touch. “The story isn’t necessarily linear,” she explains. “But the main connection throughout is this unreliable narrator that you as a listener determine your view/trust of. They are incredibly inconsistent with their statements but I believe they think they’re telling the truth.”

name: Melanie Dyer
description:
Growing up on her family's farm in Mount Russell, regional Australia, Melanie Dyer started crafting her stories into songs at the age of twelve. With an authentic blend of her down-to-earth farm girl roots, dynamic stage presence and catchy contemporary songwriting chops, Melanie has performed at some of the world's biggest country festivals, including CMA Fest in Nashville, CMC Rocks, and the Big Red Bash in Australia. As a talented artist and songwriter, Melanie has racked up multiple #1 country radio hits and earned three nominations for Most Performed Country Work at the APRA Awards.
With over 12.5 million streams, her chart-topping albums Fresh and Between You and Me have garnered her prestigious Golden Guitar nominations and the coveted APRA Professional Development Award. Her breakout hit Memphis T-Shirt catapulted her into the mainstream spotlight on commercial radio networks and a remarkable six-week stint at number one on the Australian Country Hot 50 Chart. In 2025 Melanie relocated to Nashville, Tennessee to chase her dreams of building a global audience and sharing her music across the USA.

name: Mên An Tol
description:
Formed in the orbit of a South London pub, the spirit of Mên An Tol’s music can be traced back to frontman Bill Jefferson’s own musical education in his native Cornwall where he’d play folk sessions in and around the local pubs – in-fact the band name itself is taken from a rural site of ancient stones.

The band’s instant chemistry (completed by mandolinist Felix Knox, bassist Max Silvey, drummer Tom Stevens and guitarist Robert Wiseman) is writ-large as they channel the raw grit of folk greats like The Pogues and The Waterboys alongside the mainstage urgency and confidence of Britpop giants. Perhaps most vitally, the songs proudly reclaim lost folk traditions with the use of the mandolin coupled with vibrant storytelling.

The band released two EP's in 2025, the most recent being September's 'This Land’, featuring the track ‘Not Ideal’ - produced by Carlos O’Connell of Fontaines DC who got involved after seeing them live.

Throughout the year Mên An Tol have gone from strength to strength. They've picked up praise from NME, Rolling Stone UK, The Independent, DIY, So Young and more. At radio the band were on the B List at BBC 6 Music with single 'Not Ideal' and recorded a Maida Vale session for Steve Lamacq. On his Apple Music radio show Elton John has given two different tracks a spin, stating "I really love their sound".

The band played two shows at 2025 Glastonbury Festival alongside European festival runs, UK touring and dates supporting The Libertines and Miles Kane. They also played The Great Escape and finished the year with a packed out London headline at The Lexington.

name: mer marcum
description:
Waco, Texas-born, now Brooklyn-based alt-folk indie artist and producer Meredith (mer) Marcum has emerged into the New York City scene. Trading her small-town roots for Brooklyn’s bustling music scene, mer set out to carve her niche and make authentic art in many forms, which comes through in her singular and introspective music characterized by evocative, lyrical intimacy underscored by fresh production.

mer marcum is currently gearing up to release her debut EP, You Never Did Anything Wrong, on May 1, which kicked off with the single, “Body (ft. Jia*),” earlier this year, and amassed over 250k streams in the first month. Last year, she supported Hollis Howard, Hudson Freeman, and Deloyd Elze. Most recently, she opened for Devon Again’s sold-out NYC show and will be opening for Darryl Rahn in March.

She has recieved acclaim from the likes of NPR All Songs Considered, Ones To Watch, Wonderland, Line of Best Fit, BBC Radio 6, and many more.

name: Michael The Lion
description:
Michael The Lion is the latest and greatest pseudonym of long-time Philadelphia DJ and producer DJ Apt One. Michael's trademark sound features live instruments sitting seamlessly with sampled grooves to create organic, classic textures. The Lion sound is always funky, always strong and always ready for the floor.

Michael was a part of the multi-genre style of DJing that catapulted his adopted Philadelphia to the pinnacle of the DJ world in the early 2000s. His years of seasoning as a DJ have seen him play all styles imaginable all across North America and Europe. As a part of the duo RCMP, his work foreshadowed the emergence of Nu-Disco before the genre even had a name. Now, as Michael The Lion, he is pushing the boundaries of funk in modern dance music.

name: Mid Century Modern
description:
Mid Century Modem (MCM) is a Seattle-based alternative jazz duo featuring Seattle Hip Hop emcee/producer King Khazm, and singer/songwriter, Jesse Kogita.

2024 Golden Ear Award Nominees for NW Alternative Jazz Group of the Year, MCM’s music is a hand-built collage of original and improvised digital and live music built on the foundations of jazz and hip hop. They have shared the stage with Kassa Overall, Abstract Rude, Myka 9, DJ Scene, Supreme La Rock, Def-I, and others, and in 2026, were recognized by the City of Los Angeles for their contributions to the arts.

Their musical journeys have spanned over two decades respectively, with both artists performing throughout the United States, and internationally at events such as Montreux Jazz Festival, North Sea Jazz Festival, Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, Hempfest, World’s Fair Dubai, Earshot Jazz Festival, and Festival de la Juventud.

name: Miguel Ortiz y El Nuevo Estilo
MILHD
description: MILHD is an indie pop/rock band carving out a vibrant niche in Austin's music scene. Blending catchy hooks, soulful melodies, and punchy guitar-driven energy, their music is built to connect. Whether in a packed dive bar or on a festival stage, songs like Casanova deliver thoughtful lyrics wrapped in an indie groove that keeps the room in motion.

name: Minori
description:
MINORI out of Kingston Jamaica, dubbed 'Mini from the block', has arrived with a freshness. Tough yet full of soul, she bends Hip Hop, Reggae, RNB, Dub and Dancehall into something different, connecting with people at the core level.
MINORI has been touring Nationally through out the USA since 2021 gracing festival stages such as Reggae Rise Up, Cali Roots, Montana Hemp Fest and opening for internationally acclaimed artists such as Nattali Rize and J-Boog taking audiences by storm with mesmerizing performances. Her epic live show is set on the wings of her masterful lyrical content and powerful vocal talent, winning hearts everywhere she steps.
With her 2021 debut single release RED PILL she pushed Hip Hop / Trip Hop realms amassing attention with her fresh original style.
“Play it loud! I definitely give this one the #RebelMusic stamp of approval. Not often you see this style of lyrical delivery
by a sistren, so it’s very refreshing for me. I’ll be anticipating what else is in store”
- Kabaka Pyramid
"There’s an undeniable presence and power in MINORI’s lyrics and vocal flow"
- Nattali Rize

events.presented_by: German Music Export by Initiative Musik

name: Mission
description: Born in Greenville, Mississippi, and raised in Sacramento, California, Antonio Smith, better known as Mission, is a genre-defying Christian music artist who has dedicated his life and music to glorifying God. As a husband to Shawnay Smith and father of four—two boys and two girls—Mission’s journey of faith began when he gave his life to Christ at the age of 18, and his music continues to reflect that commitment. Mission’s life and music are deeply rooted in Matthew 6:33: “Seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.” He believes in doing God’s will, not his own, and encourages others to love God’s people. His personal motto, “All of You, none of me,” is based on the scripture “I must decrease so the Lord can increase,” signifying his desire for God’s will to be done in his life above all else.

name: MITA
description:
MITA — The Alchemist of Latin Pop
Based in Mexico City, MITA is a producer, singer-songwriter, composer and DJ shaping a distinctive vision of contemporary Latin pop. Holding a Master’s degree in Social Sciences, she fuses intellect and instinct to read the collective pulse and translate it into refined yet playful Latin pop narratives infused with R&B, Kpop and tropical rhythms. A composer for Netflix and HBO, MITA moves fluidly between the club and the stage, delivering magnetic performances where connection, presence and storytelling place the audience at the center. Her debut album D.A.R (Desire, Love & Romance) frames love as a cyclical journey toward self-acceptance, positioning MITA as a multifaceted voice of modern Latin identity.

name: Mobeethicc
description: Mobee Thicc is a southside Chicago born & raised DJ who in 6 years, has brought people together with her dynamic & unique open-format style and are in high demand from neighborhood bars to major festival stages. She has begun to expand her portfolio to include major US cities including NYC & Houston, TX. Mobee is sure to bring you hours of quality sets that will leave lasting impressions on your crowds!

name: Modern Cinema Master
description:
Modern Cinema Master is a four-piece band formed in Taipei, whose sound is heavily influenced by the independent rock of the 1990s. Their music is driven by sharp noise, post-punk energy, and lo-fi anthems.

Since 2019, the band has remained true to its roots, focusing wholeheartedly on creation. To date, they have released two EPs, three singles, and two double-CD albums, amassing more than forty original songs. Their live performances are equally renowned, frequently selling out thousand-capacity venues in Taiwan and China.
