In 2025, they were invited to perform at the Incheon Pentaport Rock Festival in Korea, where they received an enthusiastic response.

Modern Cinema Master’s music is simultaneously raw and refined, pairing poetic, thought-provoking lyrics with a powerful sonic edge. Their track “I Want to Kill Romance and Murder Poetry” earned Taiwan’s most prestigious independent music award for Best Rock Song, with the jury praising it as “savagely precise, capturing the very essence of rock.”

Blending fierce, driving melodies with blunt, hard-hitting lyrics, The Modern Cinema Masters fuse critique and irony into one powerful voice, a sound that captures the essence of our times.

events.presented_by: German Music Export by Initiative Musik

name: Money Mark
description: Legendary composer, inventor, and the unofficial “Fourth Beastie Boy,” Money Mark has been rewriting the sonic playbook since ’75. With a career spanning Billboard #1s and collaborations with icons like David Byrne, Jack White, Miley Cyrus, and Beck, he is the ultimate musical pivot point. Part virtuoso, part mad scientist, Mark currently spends his time inventing new instruments and using unconventional experiments to find the sounds of tomorrow.

name: Montclair
description: Montclair is the Austin, Texas-based, independent folk-rock project resulting from four friends’ expression of joy and curiosity for life. Montclair's sound explores themes of self-discovery and emerging adulthood, from the beloved surf rock groove of “Pastel Lies” to the forlorn folk guitar wave in “Passing Through”. Their debut album, “Heart is Alive!” explores their musical potential and emotional range, both on full display in the first two singles, the titular and upbeat “Heart is Alive!” and the enigmatic rock powerhouse “Coming to the Rescue”. With a dynamic range of music, Montclair’s live performances are energetic and engaging, and they are known to have a strong crowd pull in Texas. Montclair has been invited to play onstage to crowds at festivals and iconic Texas venues such as House of Blues Houston, and a sold-out Antone's Nightclub, with nationally touring acts like Echosmith, The Brook and The Bluff, Dayglow, Giant Rooks, The Wldlfe, Briscoe, and many more. They look forward to the release of their debut album and the adventures and inspirations that await them ahead.

name: MORGAN
description:
With combined streams of over 100 million and a dedicated online following, Morgan is doing things her way. Morgan began performing at just three years old and by eighteen she’d joined Rudimental as a globally-touring vocalist. Her solo debut ‘My Year’ spotlit her brand of sparkling pop, before a collaboration with Ebenezer (‘Mulholland Drive’) earned her over 10 million streams. Her subsequent EP ‘Alien’ referenced golden-era pop. That same year, ‘ADCT’ (written when she was 17) soared to the #1 spot on both TikTok Trending Sounds and the UK Top 50, earning over 30 million streams. Morgan also co-wrote and featured on Rudimental & Digga D’s ‘Be the One’, Sigma’s ‘Adrenaline Rush’ and Purple Disco Machine's most recent album. She’s been writing for some of the biggest K-pop artists (including NCT’s Jaehyun, TWICE & Aespa).

Morgan released her EP ‘Emotional Gangster’ last October and went on to sell out her first UK headline tour at the end of the year including a show at London’s iconic Jazz Cafe. She turned up the heat with the release of ‘One Man’ featuring the legendary Beenie Man, paired with the unapologetic anthem ‘Bad Gyal Energy’.

name: Morgan Munroe
description:
"A voice that stops you in your tracks" – BBC Radio 1

Hailing from Leicester, UK, Morgan Munroe is one of the most exciting voices in contemporary R&B.

Fresh off four standout sets at Glastonbury 2025 and recent performances at SXSW London and SXSW Texas, this award-winning powerhouse continues to push boundaries. She’s earned a BBC Radio 1 Track of the Week, featured on Ghetts’ latest album, and received recognition from Vogue Italia, Mahalia, and DJ Ace. With over 33K monthly listeners on Spotify, her music has landed on the FIFA 2020 soundtrack and gained support from some of the industry's most respected tastemakers.

As part of the MOBO Unsung Class of 2025, Morgan Munroe is showing the world exactly why she’s one to watch - on stage, on record, and beyond.

name: Mosmo
description:
Carlos Ramos Molina, known as MOSMO, is a new voice reshaping regional Mexican music.
Born in Hermosillo, Sonora, he broke into the spotlight in 2022 on Netflix’s La Firma, performing before industry leaders including Rauw Alejandro, Yandel, Nicki Nicole, Lex Borrero, and Tainy.

Blending corridos with raw emotion, MOSMO fuses the bélico with the romantic, the party with introspection. Inspired by tumbados but influenced by pop, trap, and urban melancholy, his music is honest, unfiltered, and deeply personal.

Built without shortcuts or backing, MOSMO represents a generation raised on Peso Pluma, Natanael Cano, and Junior H, while carving a lane entirely his own.
He’s not chasing virality. He’s building something real

name: Ms. Ca$H
description: Ms. Ca$H is a Georgia rapper whose sharp delivery and "get-money" mindset blend ATL trap rhythm with Southern grit. Known as The Female Sweet Jones, she crafts anthems for the hustlers and self-made queens chasing independence. With tracks like Money Mission and Amen, she's turning her grind into a lifestyle brand — one verse at a time.

name: MUGGER
description: Based out of Austin, TX, Mugger is a supergroup featuring members of Creepoid, The Well, and Radioactivity. The music is abrasive, aggressive, and feels like being jumped in a dark alley on the way home from a night of heavy drinking. It's equal parts hardcore and vintage punk rock.

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

name: MURTY
description:
There’s something about MURTY’s voice that sounds like a storyteller who can flirt, argue, and get in his feelings all within the same breath. He slides between smooth R&B, natural soul instincts, and unfiltered honesty. His songs feel like late-night confessions, unsent texts, and the confidence it takes to say what most people only think.

He sings with intention. There’s humor in the pain, soul in the simplicity, and zero interest in staying in one lane. MURTY isn’t here to sound perfect. He’s here to sound like himself, flaws, feelings, and all. He's not just making music. He’s making moments you laugh at, relate to, and secretly replay.

name: mypilotis
description:
mypilotis (pronounced: “my-pilloh-TEA”, one-word, stylized in all lowercase) is a San Antonio-based indie project and alias of multi-instrumentalist, songwriter, and self-proclaimed “homemade producer”, Chesca Umeno, blending DIY charm with catchy melodies, addictive hooks, and thoughtful songwriting, crafted with love at home in a small room, played with electric energy, and shared with awkward charm.

In the studio, mypilotis consists of solely Chesca who writes, records, and plays all of the parts and instruments. On tour and during live performances, mypilotis is supported by close friends and fellow musicians – Joey Gonzalez on lead guitar, Edgar Betancourt on drums, Sophie Kurihara bass, and JJ Herron on keys. mypilotis takes inspiration from artists such as Dayglow, Ginger Root, Boy Pablo, Mini Trees, and ATARASHII GAKKO! where the artist has grown from intimate DIY home recordings to a must-see high-energy live act.

name: N@te!
description: N@te! is an up and coming artist hailing from the land of the 7—the 757, the 7 Cities. Known for his raw, unmistakable sound, N@te! is a true lyrical powerhouse, effortlessly delivering both hard-hitting hip-hop/rap and smooth R&B hits. His music blends sharp storytelling with emotion and melody, showcasing versatility, authenticity, and a voice that commands attention across genres.

name: Nathaniel Stewart
description: Nathaniel Stewart writes songs that evoke nostalgic memories, inspired by the sincerity and sound of early 1970s songwriters, engulfed in the hazy glow of modern dreamy indie. His music drifts between melancholy and hope, acting as a witness to the human experience. Each song is a quiet reflection of nature, stillness, and a longing for connection and purpose – an invitation to slow down and be present in the moment.

name: Nattali Rize
description:
Nattali Rize is known for high energy, thought provoking and uplifting live performances, the powerhouse international band from Australia & Jamaica channel a deep world & reggae influence to present a one of a kind experience.
With the long awaited sophomore studio album, LIBERATE, released worldwide on March 7th, the Nattali Rize band will be embarking on a global campaign of live shows and opportunities to connect with communities and people around the planet, this powerhouse act will be performing a headline Album Launch Tour in the USA followed by Europe, Australia, Japan and Beyond.
“Nattali is a bright light in the world with a vision that extends beyond the stage.” - Michael Franti
Her global anthem “One People” has amassed over 9 million views on youtube, Nattali and her group continue to connect across borders & waters with many highly acclaimed International festival appearances around the world. “One of the nation’s most refreshing voices” - Rolling Stone
“INFECTIOUS!” - NPR

name: Neptune XXI
description:
Neptune XXI is a multidisciplinary artist, storyteller, and cultural architect whose work fuses the spiritual with the sonic. Raised in Northeast Washington, D.C., shaped by Southern lineage, and sharpened by Baltimore’s creative edge, she creates at the intersection of healing, futurism, and ancestral memory. A graduate of Mount St. Mary’s University and author of From My Mind’s Eye, she bridges scholarship with soul, weaving language, sound, and movement into transformative experiences.

Praised by The Baltimore Sun for her “rhythmic mastery and profound syntax,” Neptune XXI has been a resonant voice in contemporary art since her debut EP TwentyOne (2018). Her catalog, including HEAL (2023), Medicine Music (2024), and Medicine Music II (2026) reflects her commitment to collective restoration, emotional liberation, and reclaimed joy. On stage, her performances become multisensory experiences blending music, poetry, and hella swag.

She is also Founder of the non-profit, Nu Indigo Nation, cultivating safe, self-sustaining futures for Black people through art, education, and wellness.

name: New Constellations
description:
New Constellations – the ethereal brainchild of lifelong sidekicks Harlee Case and Josh Smith –
encapsulates a sonic dreamscape of eager melodies, striking guitar hooks, and celestial vocals
that softly tangles listeners into a web of cosmic glow.
The Portland-based duo first explored collaborating when they were 14, recording a song together in
Josh’s childhood bedroom, before spending the next 15 years exploring their individual
approaches to music separately and eventually crafting the dynamic perspective that would
become New Constellations.
The two debuted with the single, “Hot Blooded,” an incomprehensibly magnetic voyage that
offers warmth and compassion, and has now amassed over 120M streams. After a monumental
first few years, Harlee and Josh are electric as ever, poising themselves for upcoming releases that
can only be described as a continuation of their signature gilded alchemy.

name: Next of Kin
description:
In March of 2023, Lili Hickman, Caelin Tralongo and Madison Baker, didn't realize what awaited them on the other end of a rough mix. After a single listen, what began as a collaboration on Jekyll & Hyde transformed into a full album and the budding of new band. Some may call it fate, others pure luck, but they call it Next of Kin.
With a sound that blends country-tinged soundscapes, marked by rich three-part harmonies and honest storytelling, it's hard for any listener in any room not to be moved by this cult country trio currently taking Austin, TX by the horns-one venue at a time.

name: NEZZA
description: NEZZA is a Dominican-Colombian triple threat—singer, dancer, and songwriter—carving her own lane in today’s pop landscape. A proud “no sabe” kid, she reps the Spanglish experience unapologetically, blending sleek bilingual lyrics with infectious melodies and choreography that hits just as hard as her hooks. The Spanglish pop princesa, NEZZA, is on a mission to become the face of pop for a younger generation that looks like her—Latinx, multifaceted, and owning every part of their identity. With visuals as bold as her voice and storytelling rooted in culture, confidence, and emotion, NEZZA is here to move—and move you.

name: Nicky Diamonds
description:
Nicky Diamonds is an afro-indigenous country-blues musician from San Antone, TX currently stationed in Nashville, TN.

Pulling inspiration from old hymn books and family history, he's recounting the stories of his ancestors through his unique songwriting style. By keeping the roots of country and blues alive he puts captivating twist to the tales and tunes of our people.

Nicky spends most of his time touring the country with his 95 year old dobro and occasionally with his band 'The Deepcuts'. His new delta blues album, recorded at Willie Nelson's studio in Spicewood, TX is set to release in spring 2025.

If you're lucky enough you'll catch Nicky at a honky-tonk or juke joint close to home. His live show is a sight to see and you'll leave with a groove stuck in your bones.

name: NIGHT DRIVE
description:
“Exactly the kind of glossy, echoed Interpol and Lower Dens vibes that are ideal to put on while rocketing down the interstate at 90mph in the dead of night.” — Spin Magazine

Night Drive transforms cinematic sci-fi landscapes into high-impact synth-pop. Their emotive style fuses shadowed textures and reflective lyrics with soaring hooks and driving beats, creating a sleek, kinetic sound that has resonated across film, television, and radio worldwide.
Touring alongside Crystal Castles, CHVRCHES, Ladytron, ACTORS and The Psychedelic Furs, the group has built a reputation for immersive live performances that resonate long after the final note. New releases arriving very soon.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: Nightbus
description:
Nightbus are a brooding, cinematic two-piece (4 members live) blending post-punk, trip-hop, and late-night electronica into something dark, hypnotic and unmistakably their own. Formed in Manchester UK in 2023, their music captures the anxious beauty of city life after hours—dripping in atmosphere - bass-heavy and emotionally raw. With haunting vocals, reverb-soaked guitars, and minimalist beats, they echo the ghosts of The Knife, Portishead, early Cure, Chromatics and the XX, all while carving out a space all their own.

The early demos caught the ears of tastemaker label and magazine So Young, who released two 7"s from the band, one in 2023 and another in 2024 - both selling out with champions at BBC R1 and 6 Music, The Guardian, NME, The Fader, Brooklyn Vegan, The Line Of Best Fit, Dummy, DIY + Dork supporting the singles.

Underground shows followed leading to festival appearances at Left Of The Dial, Blue Dot, Manchester Psychfest and Float Along, headline shows at Supersonic in Paris, Manchester and London and support shows with Rock Action signings Bdrmm across the UK.

Nightbus released their debut album 'Passenger' on Melodic records, October 2025 to critical acclaim.

name: Niiasii
description:
Niiasii is an alternative pop artist from Southeast Virginia pushing the boundaries between pop, R&B, and alternative sounds. Her music is fueled by true emotion, a mix of love, heartbreak, and the relentless pursuit of freedom. On stage, Niiasii is electric. Turning vulnerability into energy, and every performance into a deep connection with the audience. With shows across the East Coast, she’s created her own lane for genre- bending music and unapologetic expression

One of Niiasii's notable accomplishments is her music project titled "The Art Of Changing Form," which has gained significant recognition with over 100,000 streams. Since that release, Niiasii has gone on to deliver 3 more cohesive projects that have solidified and deepened her community of supporters. As the buzz continues to build, this emerging alt-pop talent stands firmly on the path to breakthrough success.

name: Nilipek.
description:
Nilipek. is a Berlin-based Turkish singer-songwriter whose delicate yet powerful sound has shaped the landscape of Turkish alternative music for the last decade. Her performances blend delicate, breathy vocals with moments of raw intensity; creating an atmosphere that shifts between vulnerability and bursts of noise.

Releasing her long-awaited fourth album, Uydurduğumuz Oyunlarla (“The Games We Made Up”) digitally in May 2024 and on vinyl in January 2025, she delivered her most intricate and emotionally resonant work yet. The tracks promise the listener a forty-five-minute uninterrupted journey while combining political symbolism in lyrics with innovative musical arrangements. The album also elegantly portrays Nilipek.’s musical evolution since her first album in 2015.

This year, the Turkish singer-songwriter is releasing her first fully English single, Safe Coast, in collaboration with the producer Cody Fitzgerald (Stolen Jars). The song captures the search for meaning and security in an ever-shifting, and increasingly perilous world, while creating a sanctuary in its sound.

name: NOA
description:
SP
NOA, la nueva cara del Pop Urbano mexa, a sus 21 años, se posiciona como una de las promesas de la escena actual. Es intérprete, compositor y productor musical con formación en instituciones de prestigio internacional como Berklee.
Su sonido es una propuesta distintiva que fusiona la energía del pop estadounidense de 2010 con géneros urbanos y melodías de R&B. Esta versatilidad le ha permitido colaborar con productores ganadores del Grammy y firmar con el sello Cincodoce Music, ademas de presentarse como opening act para artistas como Tito Double P, El Malilla y Bogueto.

EN
NOA, The New Face of Mexican Urban Pop, At 21 years old, NOA is positioning himself as one of the most promising talents in the current scene. He is a singer, songwriter, and music producer with a background in prestigious international institutions such as Berklee College of Music.
His distinctive sound fuses the energy of 2010s U.S. pop with urban genres and R&B melodies. This versatility has allowed him to collaborate with Grammy-winning producers, sign with the label Cincodoce Music, and perform as the opening act for major artists such as Tito Double P, El Malilla, and El Bogueto

name: NOAMZ
description:
NOAMZ is a flutist, vocalist, multi-instrumentalist, and producer making alt soul music. She was raised in a small town in Wisconsin by a Guadeloupean mother and French father.

She went on tour in 2024 on her artist project, released her EP “Personne” August of 2025 with Guesthouse, and plays regularly across SoCal and the Midwest. And has recently grown in popularity online for her flute beatboxing.

Featured on numerous LA based artist tracks, radios, and the Senegalese soccer anthem, she plans to release three musical projects this coming year, from her meditative flute project “Retrouvaille” to her soulful Melodic DnB EP “TEXTURES” dropping this March.

name: Nudo
description: nudo is a psychic handshake/brain trust between Joaquin Tenorio and Eric Hernandez. Hailing from Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua, MX and Eagle Pass, Texas, USA, respectively. The pair met while living in Austin, TX and have been making music together since 2017. Throughout this time, their sound has journeyed from something like an improvised industrial, to more aleatoric collage passages, and is currently honing in on a more song based, corrido oriented zone, however pried apart.

name: Nug
description: Nug is a musical group made up of four friends in Portland, OR. Blending and bending the genres of Post Punk, Indie Rock, Shoegaze, Nu-metal, Psych Rock, and probably some other things, Nug has been described we-think-affectionately as “Parquet Courts meets Grateful Dead” and “a jam band for people who hate jam bands” and “really friendly guys making loud music”. Nug’s debut record “Kerfuffle” released in February of 2025 and remains released to this very day.

name: Odanga
description:
Odanga is an Afrofusion artist, battle rapper, producer, and engineer blending African tradition with American hip-hop. His sound fuses soulful R&B, sharp lyricism, and vibrant Afro rhythms into a cinematic, emotionally grounded experience.

With over 15 years on the mic, Odanga has performed from freestyle cyphers to major stages, including Sway In The Morning at SXSW 2018. His battle rap career spans top leagues, highlighted by the headline clash Odanga vs Steve-O on OSBL, notable battles against J Morr and Stuey Newton of Ultimate Rap League, and appearances on RBE and Tha Kulture.

His latest singles, “Maembe” and “Heart,” introduce Find Your Way Home, an upcoming album centered on identity, healing, and self-return. Whether on festival stages or intimate rooms, Odanga creates music meant to uplift, empower, and reconnect listeners with themselves.

name: OKAN
description:
Taking their name from the word for “heart” in the Afro-Cuban religion of Santería, the duo OKAN creates an alchemy of Cuban rhythms and chants with high-octane indie jazz and pop. Singing in Spanish, Yoruba, and Spanglish, OKAN explores resistance, rebirth, and joy — forging rhythm and harmony through acts of survival, both personal and cultural.

Following their Juno Award–winning album Okantomi — performed on NPR’s Tiny Desk and toured internationally while supporting Grammy-winning duo Rodrigo y Gabriela — OKAN’s upcoming fall release "Ife Ira" features a collaboration with Daymé Arocena.

OKAN is led by violinist and vocalist Elizabeth Rodríguez and percussionist and vocalist Magdelys Savigne — both Grammy and Latin Grammy nominees — whose powerful harmonies and fearless musicianship have earned the duo a global following.

name: Olivia Ellen Lloyd
description:
Olivia Ellen Lloyd will try anything once. From flight attendant school in Dallas to producing theater in New York City and teaching in Guatemala, Lloyd sought an adventurous life, but struggled to find a greater sense of purpose. That is, until she found her way back to music. Lloyd channels her restless spirit into songs that pay homage to her Appalachian roots while charting fresh territory for a sound that is uniquely her own.

Heavily influenced by country, folk, and indie rock, Lloyd’s sound combines the rooted sounds of her traditional Appalachian upbringing with the fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants nature of her current life. She is inspired by the rich sounds of New York City, the peaceful quiet of her small West Virginia hometown, and life on the road in between.

Her 2025 sophomore record "Do It Myself" landed her debut appearances at Mountain Stage, Americana Fest, and Brooklyn Folk Festival and her debut album, Loose Cannon, has been streamed over 1 million times while Olivia has been busy crossing the country opening for artists like Kelsey Waldon, Tommy Prine, and Jobi Riccio, winning songwriting contests (Kerrville in 2023), and generally eating life down to the rind.

name: Olivia Morreale
description: Olivia Morreale (aka Princess Liv) possesses a powerhouse vocal and creative sensibility that have defined her presence as a versatile artist across several genres. She has toured the world performing with Grammy- winning rock, pop, and country acts, using her experiences in varied musical contexts to perfect her own sound. As a solo artist born in Manhattan, NY, the songs she writes and the way she sings them are steeped in the jazz tradition that she picked up during her high school days at jazz clubs in Manhattan, but with an indie pop spin. Many of her lyrics reflect her experiences on the road, and she has built a loyal following online through her presence on the scene as a writer and musician. Liv has also toured her own project throughout the US; her latest EP “Return to Sender” is a culmination of her past few years of adventure, heartbreak, and growth.

name: OOZ
description:
OOZ is an experimental noise-rock band from Toronto, CA. ⁠
⁠
OOZ embodies immediacy & improvisation in their approach to playing and recording. ⁠Live shows are loud, physical and chaotic with sounds collapsing under pressure as the room turns into part of the set.

name: Oscar Ortiz
description:
“Music will never stop evolving, and I will continue to grow with it.” ~Oscar Ortiz

Born into an artistic family of Regional Mexican artists, Oscar Ortiz is the youngest of four leading artists in the genre: Gerardo, William, and Kevin Ortiz. However, Oscar shines on his own with his youthful style and talent as a composer, fusing cumbia and ballads with modern corridos.

His solo music began to transcend borders with the singles “El Del C8” (2023) and “FIRST LOVE” (2024) with Edgardo Núñez; the latter catapulting him onto the global scene with over 200 million streams on Spotify, a No. 1 spot on Billboard Regional Mexican Airplay, platinum certifications, and virality on TikTok.
This phenomenon was followed by other songs that consolidated his musical identity, such as "ALVRGZO" (with Alex Favela and Código FN), "Anillos" (with Oscar Maydón), "Modo Bélico" (with Polo González), "23/7," and "Ice Cream" (with Los Mismos de la M).

Oscar Ortiz didn't stop there. In 2025, he continued to reap hits like "Y Si Te Vas," a single released with Carin León, which peaked at #5 and is currently #7 on Billboard's Regional Mexican Airplay charts. Additionally, he has other songs released this year, such as “Aplauso” with Matisse, “AMIGOS PARA QUÉ”, “CARO,” and soon “LAST KISS” which will be released in October 2025. Added to this is his biggest project to date: his first studio album, projected to be released in January 2026. In Oscar's words, this project brings “a lot of love and heartbreak… corridos, versatile sounds, a little bit of everything,” in addition to collaborations with artists from different regional currents.

name: Oscar Twins
description: Oscar Twins are an alternative/post-punk band from Turin, Italy. After a period of writing and perfecting their songs, the band recorded the 9 tracks that became their self-titled debut album. released in 2025 by We Were Never Being Boring, and representing the synthesis of the band's musical maturity and self determination.

name: Our Shame
description:
Blending folktronica with and leftfield pop, the duo Our Shame (凹與山) consists of producer/singer-songwriter Estelle H and percussionist Isan, seeks something spiritual in the modern day technology addiction from an East Asian perspective.

Their debut album ‘Modern Problem’, an independently produced fusion of electro-folk and retrowave, the album has earned recognition from music editors across Europe, North America, Australia, New Zealand, and Southeast Asia, finding its way into many curated playlists and Spotify Viral 50. On their second album, ‘Hidden Album’(2025), Our Shame approach it like wallflowers at an underground rave, documenting the unspeakable with a quiet but unflinching lens. Built on a foundation of folktronica and synth-pop, their palette stretches from acoustic guitars and field recordings to splashes of Trip-hop, UK Garage and techno.

With a unique mix of soulful vocals, synthesizers, guitars, drum machines, their sound fuses the cold textures of digital precision with the warmth of analog tones. The duo has performed at notable events like Reeperbahn Festival 2024 (Germany), Minami Wheel (Japan), Megaport Festival (Taiwan) and Sonik Philippines.

name: Oya Noire
description:
Oya Noire (she/they) is a stunning Haitian-American singer and songwriter from Brooklyn, NY. An undeniable force and artist, Oya started off as a backup vocalist for 2x Grammy winner, Timothy Bloom. Now, as an independent artist, Oya Noire channels her New York City roots fusing high-energy with Neo-soul and Jazzy rhythms that linger long after the song ends.

A storyteller with magnetic lyrics, Oya writes songs that are honest and unapologetically her own. She mesmerizes audiences, captivating music lovers at iconic venues such as Baby’s All Right, SOBs NY, and Blue Note Jazz Club. With her stage presence and call-and-response hooks, Oya's hit singles “Slow Down”, “Hunnid Band$”, and “Gangsta” are sure to warm up any crowd. A fan-favorite with over 5.5 million streams across DSPs and a well-anticipated mixtape on the way, Oya Noire leaves no heart untouched and no lyric wasted.

name: Ozer
description: Ozer, San Francisco’s own, has been cultivating his lyrical voice since the age of six, first turning to music as a refuge from life’s challenges and later sharpening his craft through the influence of artists like J. Cole, Kendrick Lamar, and Nipsey Hussle. What began as inspiration evolved into intention as Ozer matured—transforming lived experience into honest, reflective songwriting grounded in execution, flow, and substance. Following the release of his latest EP Fog City, he has shared stages with Westside Boogie, Topaz Jones, Trayce Chapman, YGTUT, and more, solidifying his presence as a formidable and thoughtful emcee. A writer at heart and performer by nature, Ozer uses language as a lyrical canvas, drawing from the essence of real life to create music that resonates with clarity, purpose, and lasting impact.

name: P.H.0
description:
P.H.0 [P-H-"zero"] is a NYC-based SILKPUNK quartet reshaping the city's underground. Fusing the raw, intense metal riffs with the haunting cry of the traditional Chinese erhu and techno-dystopian synths, they craft sounds that are at once chaotic and controlled, futuristic and ancient. Their live shows—referred to as "rituals"—transform ancient Taoist traditions into ear-crushing soundscapes that defy time, crashing into chaotic mosh pits under visceral strobing lights to create what some describe as a rave in an abandoned shrine from Cyberpunk 2077.

Their momentum has carried them from NYC festivals like New Colossus and Punk Island to sold-out shows across the East Coast, proving their reach in every environment—from the historic Gramercy Theatre, where they were handpicked by Danish prog-metal giants VOLA to support their North American tour, to inside an abandoned tunnel where they performed for more than 500 ravers. They were further recognized by NPR's Tiny Desk as a top 50 "Top Shelf" artist in 2025, and by Bandcamp Daily, who praised their debut album KARMA for “reimagining what Asian music might sound like.” P.H.0 continues to build a cult following, one ritual at a time.

name: Paisley Fields
description: Paisley Fields writes country music. His songs are tender and authentic, but also pretty good with a joke. They’re mindful of tradition, but deeply informed by his singular background — as a teenage Midwestern church pianist, a Manhattan piano bar survivor, and a touring member of pioneering queer country outfit, Lavender Country. The stories are his, but the feeling they convey — love, loneliness, lust, and so on — are, hopefully, still universal.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth Patio

name: Pär Hagström and Charlatans of Love
description:
(New album DREAMERS BELIEVERS ILLUSIONISTS PREACHERS out in November 2025)
Pär Hagström has always moved along the outer edges of music – from the first stumbling chords on his family’s pump organ in Huskvarna, through 90s death metal and 70s hard rock, to the innermost heart of gospel. It’s a journey shaped as much by philosophy, literature, and theater as by rock clubs and church halls, eventually arriving at a universe of its own where drama and soulful preaching merge into one.
As a frontman, Hagström is as much a preacher as he is a singer. His voice carries a natural theatrical force – raspy and silky at the same time – with an instinctive readiness to let the music chafe, sweat, and hypnotize. Drawing inspiration from Tom Waits, Led Zeppelin, Mavis Staples and the Blind Boys of Alabama, and together with his band Charlatans of Love, he has in recent years shaped a new musical entity where gospel, soul, psychedelic rock, and funk meet in something as seductive as it is uncompromising.

DREAMERS BELIEVERS ILLUSIONISTS PREACHERS is a continuation of the mini-album The End Again (2024), picking up where the story left off.

name: Parris Chariz
description: "A Detroit native, on the rise with a mission to bridge the gap between faith-based platforms and mainstream music. Parris Chariz, short for charismatic, is an edgy, yet vibrant artist with a trap sound. Parris experienced numerous downfalls throughout his life but those valleys lead him to music. His debut album “2045” gained the attention of tastemakers within the CHH and mainstream Hip-Hop community. From being listed on Rapzilla’s Freshman in 2016 List to headlining a nationwide tour along with Ty Brasel, WHATUPRG, & Aaron Cole. Parris has made his mark within the Hip-Hop community that is extremely unique and far from the rest. His music has encouraged his listeners to know what’s real and to be true to yourself through every obstable this life brings us. His recently released album “Take You To Parris” has set a standard of authentic creativity provided a voice to the unheard. Parris has made his mark as a creative and will continue to make music that speaks to the soul."

name: Passion Pit
description: Passion Pit is an American alternative indie pop band formed in 2007 in Cambridge, Massachusetts, primarily acting as the moniker for singer-songwriter and producer Michael Angelakos. Initially a solo project, the band gained fame for, high-energy, synth-driven pop, with hits like "Sleepyhead" and "Take a Walk".

name: Pat G
description:
Pat G is an American rapper based in Austin, Texas, bringing a refreshing, purpose-driven voice to modern hip-hop. Known for his infectious energy and uplifting message, he creates family-friendly music that still hits hard—blending motivation, faith, and elite lyricism into every performance.

Pat G has performed across California, Florida, Oregon, Texas, Louisiana, and internationally in Toronto, building a growing national and global fanbase. He has been booked three times for the iconic Pecan Street Festival, selected as an official show artist five times, and has performed at major events and venues including Circuit of the Americas, Temple Bloomin’ Festival, and Indie Week Toronto. Closing out 2024, he opened for Lupe Fiasco on four live shows—marking a major career milestone.

Since his first mixtape The Demo (2013), Pat G has continued to evolve through projects including A Different Perspective (2015), The In Between EP (2016), Whatever It Takes (2019), and Talk To Me Nice EP (2024).

Originally from Temple, Texas, Pat G uses music—grounded in his Christian faith—to tell real stories, unite audiences, and inspire hope.

“Be relentless! We don’t just talk it, we live it.”

name: Patriarchy
description:
Patriarchy is the Los Angeles industrial pop duo of Actually Huizenga and AJ English, exploring sex, power, subversion, and death where desire and fear collide. Known for chaotic, boundary-pushing live performances that dissolve the line between performer and audience, the band fuses infectious electronic pulse with industrial metal, distorted synths, and spoken-word intensity.

Since their breakout releases Asking For It and The Unself, Patriarchy sharpened their sound into something harder and more immediate on 2025’s Manual for Dying, produced in collaboration with Twin Shadow. The album drives their industrial roots deeper into dark club territory while amplifying their theatrical edge.

Their live reputation has carried them from the experimental extremity of Roadburn Festival to the indie forward energy of Wide Awake Festival, the darkwave revivalism of Cruel World Festival, and the metal intensity of Brutal Assault — proving Patriarchy move seamlessly between underground art spaces and large-scale international stages.

At SXSW 2026, they arrive sharper than ever.

events.presented_by: Green Witch Recordings and Pop Sickle

name: Pei-Yu Hung
description:
Pei-Yu Hung is a Taiwanese vocalist and multidisciplinary performer whose work bridges pop, performance art, and contemporary theater. Born in Kaohsiung and based in Taipei, she approaches music through a “body-based performance” philosophy, integrating dance, voice, and visual storytelling to expand the expressive range of modern pop. Her collaborations span independent musicians, theater troupes, and experimental artists, making her one of Taiwan’s most versatile and forward-thinking performers.

In 2022, Pei-Yu released her debut album ‘Silver Lining’ , a ten-track journey through light and shadow, personal reflection, and emotional subtlety. The album earned eight nominations at the Golden Melody Awards, winning Best New Artist. In 2023, her song “The Same” (同款), the theme for the film ‘Day Off’ won Best Original Film Song at the Golden Horse Awards.

Widely regarded as one of the most accomplished female vocalists in the Mandarin-speaking music scene over the past decade, Pei-Yu Hung continues to define contemporary Mandarin-language music with her distinctive voice and artistry. Seamlessly moving between lyrical pop and avant-garde soundscapes, she merges experimentation with expressive depth, redefining contemporary Mandarin music and bringing a bold, fresh dimension of Taiwanese sound to the global stage.

Pei-Yu released her highly anticipated second album ‘Still Moving’ in October 2025, featuring collaborations with artists from Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, and Singapore. For the new single “It's Nothing Personal”, she enlisted Polish director Chris Rudz, who previously directed dance videos for Japanese artist Fujii Kaze, to helm the music video, with choreography created in collaboration with Japanese choreographer Chikako Takemoto, showcasing a dynamic cross-border, cross-disciplinary creative energy.

name: Perdón Amor
description: Three friends from northern Mexico who have been making music together since 2020. Perdón Amor was born in 2024, and the trio keeps pushing forward, driven by their passion and strong chemistry in the studio and on stage. Their energy and creativity shine through in the new sounds and bold rhythms they’re creating, showing where they’re headed and making Perdón Amor a project worth watching in 2026

name: PIAO
description:
Shanghai born, Los Angeles transplant PIAO is the artist you’ve been waiting for. With heartfelt lyrics and a vocal range that hits both ends of the spectrum, PIAO breaks the mold of the traditional pop artist and creates her own lane. Berklee graduate and multi-instrumentalist, PIAO's relentless pursuit of musical growth has granted her invaluable opportunities to collaborate with esteemed artists, producers, and industry giants including the likes of T-Pain, Myles William, Banx & Ranx, and more, as well as touring with notable acts like Mariana Trench, Tiffany Day, Jhariah, and more.

Since releasing her debut EP, Tissues, PIAO’s music has quickly captured the attention of listeners and industry tastemakers alike. Landing on major editorial playlists like New Music Friday, Hyperpop, Next-Gen Singer-Songwriter, Jasmine, Pop All Day, Alpha, Feeling Blue, and New In Pop, PIAO’s music has amassed millions of streams and received praise for her strong melody and relatable storytelling. With new music set to release in Spring 2026, prepare to immerse yourself in the enchanting world of PIAO and experience a new era of pop music.

name: Pierce Washington
description: Pierce Washington is an award-winning hip-hop artist from Dallas, Texas, whose sound bridges jazz influences, live instrumentation, and modern production — creating music that feels both timeless and forward-thinking. Known for his cinematic storytelling and commanding stage presence, Pierce has emerged as one of the leading voices in Dallas hip-hop. His collaborations with legendary producer Madlib and rap icon Lil Wayne showcase his versatility and creative range. Fresh off headlining The Proof of Concept and Folktales tours, Pierce continues to push artistic boundaries through his innovative approach to music, visuals, and brand artistry.

name: The Pink Stones
description: On their intoxicating new album, Thank the Lord...it’s The Pink Stones, Pinkston and his bandmates do precisely that, offering up a joyful, adventurous take on ’60s twang that blurs the lines between cosmic country, folk, bluegrass, soul, and psychedelic rock. Recorded once again with co-producer/engineer Henry Barbe (Drive-By Truckers, Deerhunter) in the band’s hometown of Athens, GA, the collection showcases a more deliberate, mature side of The Pink Stones’ sound, one that reflects all the personal and sonic growth that’s defined the last few years for the hard touring five-piece. The songs on Thank the Lord... are humble and timeless, full of wry, sardonic wit and rich, evocative storytelling, and the performances are easygoing and amiable, with an effortlessly natural feel that belies the masterful craftsmanship behind them. The result is a record that wears its influences proudly on its sleeve, even as it a subverts expectation, a work of poignant longing and playful humor that tips its cap to everyone from Merle Haggard and Earl Scruggs to Don Williams and The Byrds as it looks both forwards and backwards all at once.

name: Planeta No
description:
Gonza from planeta no is amazin musician, and play, dance for fun us.
He currently lives in Mexico City, premiering new music in collaboration with friends he's made throughout his career and during his time in Mexico. It's an incredible show full of color, dance, and lots of rhythm.

name: Plastikboy
description:
Plastikboy is known for creating fresh songs that stand out for their unique sound and passionate lyrics, addressing love as a source of both inspiration and sorrow. His distinctive, soulful vocal timbre has been one of the most defining aspects of his music.
Plastikboy work revolves around his worldview, human relationships, and his own emotions. His music explores themes such as intense love, obsession, and emotional dependency, presenting a raw and honest approach.
Her lyrics reflect an artistic space free from judgment, where she openly expresses her feelings. Key projects include "Si no estás" (2023), her debut single in the plug genre, and "Alfin del día" (2024), an R&B and alternative pop EP.

name: PONS
description:
IF YOU STOP YOU DIE -

Rock n’ Roll will never be a lazy game. PONS is here to set the record straight.

Channeling the wild, untamable spirit of the masters of the road that came before them, PONS brings a relentless, “NO MERCY” approach to DIY touring. Burning more calories in one night than most bands do in a year, PONS doesn’t play just music—they detonate on stage

Taking cues from the anarchic swagger of Iggy Pop and the electronic chaos of Suicide, frontperson Jack Parker spits the digital bile of our decaying, internet-saturated world straight in your face. It’s a new noise pop for the modern age.

With their dashing look and salesman’s eye, PONS has supported notable acts such as Gogol Bordello, Lambrini Girls, A Place To Bury Strangers, Laura Jane Grace, Geese, Vundabar, Frankie and the Witch Fingers, and more.

BEAR WITNESS TO PONS.

name: Pretty Jane
description: Pretty Jane is a Detroit-born, Nashville-based indie rock/pop trio comprised of Trevor Dalrymple (vocals), Luca DiVergilio (bass), and Ethan Strain (lead guitar), who met after dating the same set of twins. They are known for their intimate and energetic music, which has garnered them over ten million streams and a large online following. Their sound is often described as a blend of alternative and indie with pop appeal, creating music that explores themes of intimacy, connection, and the complexities of relationships earning them the moniker 'music that feels like kissing your friends'.

name: Prissy P
description:
Prissy P is a Bay Area–raised DJ and curator based in Austin, TX. Shaped by Northern California’s cultural diversity, her sound blends R&B, hip hop, reggaeton, Afrobeats, and global rhythms into sets rooted in feeling, movement, and connection.

She is an active presence in Austin’s music scene, DJing across nightlife, corporate events, and large-scale community activations, including athletic and wellness-driven experiences. Her ability to move fluidly between nightlife and daytime environments reflects her range as both a DJ and curator.

Outside the club, Prissy P focuses on music in open-air and daytime settings. Through projects like Picnic Beats and Vitamin R&B, she creates spaces where sunshine, music, and nature come together. As someone who navigates depression and anxiety, outdoor environments paired with music have been deeply grounding, turning personal rituals like beach days and picnics into shared experiences.

Her long-term goal is to become an MLB stadium DJ, specifically for the Los Angeles Dodgers. A lifelong baseball fan, she believes music is the heartbeat of a stadium, shaping energy, emotion, and collective memory.

name: promqueen
description: promqueen is a queer second generation Vietnamese American Pop/Rap Artist based in Austin. Signed under mHart - Texas’ first and only Asian American music label - promqueen operates between Music, Storytelling, Community, and Identity, combining both Vietnamese and English lyrics in her songs and visuals. 2026 will feature the release of her third album, “szn three,” as well as the inaugural MODERN event: a music and fashion festival celebrating Vietnamese American lifestyle taking place in Austin in August.

name: Prowess The Testament
description:
Hailing from Washington, D.C., Prowess The Testament is a commanding force in hip-hop, blending intricate storytelling, spiritual depth, and masterful lyricism into a singular artistic voice. With a career rooted in authenticity, she has shared stages with Wu-Tang Clan, Jay Electronica, Citizen Cope, Skyzoo, and Sufjan Stevens. Her moniker, bestowed by elder statesman KRS-One after a standout performance during Hip Hop Appreciation Week, reflects her exceptional dedication to craft and culture.

Named a breakout artist to watch by Pitchfork, Prowess is known for immersive, narrative-driven performances that feel part concert, part ritual. Following the Sailor Moon coded Lunar Prelude: Sailor Overture and Legend of the Moon (Deluxe Edition), she is readying Sacred Water, a Dragon Ball Z inspired collaboration with Tsoh Tso, and Royal Flush Chronicles, a three-part series centered on Princess Peach, arriving in 2026.

A best-selling co-author, co-writer of the 2026 Rap Laureate Journal, and host of Boom Bap Chat, Prowess is also an ultra high net worth strategist and real-life alchemist, transforming purpose into art, vision into legacy, and performance into experience.

name: Pyrex
description: Pyrex Whippa (Kedrick Isaiah Cannady) is a Baltimore-born producer and rapper known for his atmospheric, dark trap beats as a prominent member of 808 Mafia and Metro Boomin’s Boominati collective. He has produced for artists like Future, Young Thug, and 21 Savage, launching his solo rap career in 2019 with projects like Sincerely, Rex.

name: Q Tha Hero
description: Hailing from Long Beach, California, Q THA HERO is an alternative rapper driven by authenticity and fearless individuality. He began making music at 13, building a foundation of raw songwriting and expressive delivery that’s become his signature. Drawing inspiration from superheroes, film, and pop culture, his music feels both personal and cinematic—balancing real emotion with larger-than-life energy. Now based on the East Coast, Q THA HERO continues to evolve while holding onto the grit and character of his West Coast roots. Bold, unfiltered, and unapologetically himself, he’s carving out a lane that’s impossible to ignore

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: QUANNA
description: Quanna is a Savannah-born, New York–based creative entrepreneur, artist, and cultural organizer, best known as the founder of CareFreeBlackGirl, a nationally recognized lifestyle brand celebrating Black femmes through music, community, and entrepreneurship. As a musician, Quanna has released multiple projects, including Q, Miss Thang, and her 2025 single “Rollin Up”, and plans to release more music in 2026. Her sound blends hip-hop, R&B, and alternative influences, showcasing her versatility as an artist. Over the last year, she has performed at major cultural events including SXSW, Charlotte Pride, Toronto Pride, Brooklyn Fashion Week, and more, consistently using her platform to amplify Black femme voices. At SXSW, Quanna continues to merge music, community advocacy, and cultural programming, creating space for creativity, connection, and visibility for Black women and femmes nationwide

name: QUIMIKOZ DEL SON
description:
QUIMIKOZ IS A LATINO CUMBIA-FUSION BAND BASED IN DALLAS–FORT WORTH, TEXAS,
DELIVERING A HIGH-ENERGY, BARRIO-FORWARD SOUND ROOTED IN TRADITION AND
REIMAGINED FOR TODAY’S AUDIENCES. BLENDING VALLENATO-STYLE ACCORDION MELODIES
WITH AFRO-CUBAN CUMBIA RHYTHMS, REGGAE GROOVES, HIP-HOP INFLUENCES, AND A
DYNAMIC HORN ENSEMBLE, QUIMIKOZ CREATES AN AUTHENTIC EXPERIENCE THAT HONORS
THE CULTURE OF THE BARRIO WHILE CONNECTING WITH CROWDS ON ANY STAGE.

FORMED IN 2009, QUIMIKOZ HAS PERFORMED AT MAJOR FESTIVALS AND CULTURAL EVENTS
INCLUDING SXSW AS OFFICIAL ARTISTS FOR TWO CONSECUTIVE YEARS, TEXAS RANGERS
CULTURAL EVENTS, MICHELADA FEST FORTH WORTH, CUMBIA NIGHTS AT SUNDANCE SQUARE,
AND OTHER ESTABLISHED COMMUNITY CELEBRATIONS. THEIR 2013 ALBUM QUIMIKOZ 1.0
FEATURES FAN FAVORITES “LLEGÓ LA NEGRA” AND “CUMBIA CAGUAMERA,
” WHILE THEIR 2023
SINGLE “UN DOS TRES!” INTRODUCED THE BAND TO A NEW GENERATION OF LISTENERS.
THEIR SONG “LLEGÓ LA NEGRA” IS FEATURED IN THE AMAZON PRIME SERIES SIN HUELLAS,
EXPANDING QUIMIKOZ’S REACH BEYOND THE STAGE. FROM CLUB VENUES AND LARGE OUTDOOR
FESTIVALS TO PRIVATE AND CORPORATE EVENTS, QUIMIKOZ BRINGS RHYTHM, CULTURE, AND
INFECTIOUS ENERGY TO EVERY PERFORMANCE

name: Radium Dolls
description:
Radium Dolls are a four-piece powerhouse from Brisbane/Meanjin, known for explosive live shows, razor-sharp lyricism, and a swaggering sound packed with punch, confidence, and grit. Blending ferocity, humour, and introspection, they’ve carved out a distinct place in Australia’s modern rock landscape—raw, fearless, and unapologetically their own.
Their debut album Legal Speed dropped in March 2024, earning national airplay, critical acclaim, and a QLD Album of the Year nomination. Singles like ‘CIA’, ‘Wandering Eye’, and ‘NAA’ quickly became fan favourites, launching a packed East Coast tour capped off with a sold-out hometown show at Brisbane’s iconic venue, The Zoo. They followed it up with the Man Scout single tour in November—further fuelling their reputation for unmissable, high-octane performances.
Now, fresh off their biggest run yet, the Scorching Heat headline tour saw them sell out all shows and play to their largest crowds to date. With new music on the horizon and international ambitions in sight, Radium Dolls are charging into their next chapter—poised to push Australian rock into bold new territory.

name: Rafa Parra
description:
Rafa Parra, cantautor/productor originario de la Ciudad de México. Experimentando con nuevas formas de expresión dentro del pop urbano, mezclando letras románticas con ritmos irresistibles como el dembow y el merenguetón. Su estilo fresco y
emocional invita tanto a bailar como a enamorarse.
Con canciones como “A Besos Si” y “Olaya <3”, Rafa ha comenzado a llamar la atención por su forma única
de contar historias de amor con flow, ritmo y mucha sensibilidad. Su música suena a momentos reales:
mensajes no enviados, fiestas que terminan en confesiones y corazones que laten más fuerte.
Rafa crea canciones que se sienten cercanas, con hooks pegajosos y melodías que se quedan en la
cabeza. Su propuesta es emocional y pensada para conectar con quienes viven el amor con intensidad,
entre el reggaetón lento y las composiciones.

name: RAKEL
description:
RAKEL is an Icelandic artist working in song, memory, and atmosphere. Her music folds together voice, field recording, and emotion into layered compositions that feel intimate and expansive. She has become a quietly singular presence in the Icelandic music landscape, performing with artists like Nanna (Of Monsters and Men), Axel Flóvent, and Kaktus Einarsson. Her debut album - a place to be - was released on Ólafur Arnalds’ OPIA Community in October 2025 and garnered widespread acclaim from top Icelandic and global media alikel, with The Line of Best Fit calling her “Iceland’s next breakout star” and writeups in Billboard, Exclaim!, SPIN, London Standard and more. She dominated the Iceland Airwaves festival in November 2025, with the festival awarding her the prestigious “PLUS Award”, granted to one artist each year that is ready to take over the world.

a place to be is part diary, part landscape. Birds, clocks, breath, soft synths, the creak of a floorboard, nothing is too small to become part of the composition. RAKEL’s work invites you into a space where thought becomes sound, memory becomes movement, and music becomes a place to be, for now.

name: The Ramona Flowers
description: The Ramona Flowers channel the airtight interplay, undeniable chemistry, and uncontainable energy of four close friends jamming in a room into anthems that are as cinematic as they are catchy. As such, the UK quartet—Steve Bird [vocals], Sam Dyson [guitar], Dave Betts [keys, guitar], and Ed Gallimore [drums]—infuse pop with the personal and tactile touch of live instrumentation, lean songcraft, and lush organic production. In essence, the group ignite a fresh and fiery sound the old-fashioned way.

name: Randy Perez
description:
Randy Perez is a producer and DJ based in Phoenix, Arizona. Growing up just outside of Madison, Wisconsin, Randy found his love and passion for music in the local garage band scene, finding him spending countless hours studying classic rock, punk, and metal.

Randy began his electronic music career in 2022, quickly gaining a reputation for high energy, genre spanning sets, lighting a spark in every crowd. Randy is a performer who feeds off the energy and emotion of his audience. As a producer, his growth is evident from 2024 singles 'Not Like You' and 'This Baby's on Acid,' to 2025's 'Warehouse in West Phoenix,' and 'The Motion,' with Canadian artist Ashton Adams.

Randy is a staple at clubs and festivals, including Decadence and Goldrush Arizona. He has supported artists such as Diplo, Sidepiece, Jauz, Omnom, Valentino Khan, and more on their Arizona stops and performed in San Diego, Los Angeles, and Toronto.

Randy has received support from Angry Dogs Records (San Diego), Direct Action Records (Miami), LFTD Global (Canada), Storytime Records, and Synesthesia Records (Phoenix). He is a Cosmic Academy alum, and his single ‘The Motion’ received support on Insomniac Radio (Analog).

name: Raq Baby
description: Chicago-born and Atlanta-raised, Raq Baby is carving out his own lane in hip-hop with an unapologetic sound that blends raw street emotion with melodic vulnerability. His music captures the highs and lows of his come-up — gritty, honest, and charged with energy that connects instantly with the youth of his generation. Raq continues to captivate his audience with is newest project I Never Gave AF, a bold statement of self-determination that earned him a placement on local playlists and music blogs across the South. His sound fuses the unfiltered storytelling of classic trap with drill rap — creating music that hits hard both in the club and through headphones. On stage, Raq’s presence is magnetic. He’s performed alongside artists like SahBabii, YTB Fatt, Hunxho, and Vonoff1700, bringing an unmatched energy that’s helped him sell out his first headline show at Atlanta’s Aisle 5 and secure bookings at Rolling Loud. Beyond the music, Raq Baby stands as a voice for authenticity — a young artist who’s seen struggle, growth, and triumph, and channels all of it into his art. Raq Baby is more than an artist — he’s a movement in the making.

name: Ras Mundi
description:
Ras Mundi is an international reggae band from Austin, TX that incorporates elements of hip-hop and rock & roll creating a conscious message of culture and unity.
Up from humble roots, Ras Mundi currently consists of nine members working together to create a massive sound to heal the soul and the nation.
Their sound resonates vocal harmonies, heavy percussion, melodic keys, thick baselines, and trumpet… with lyrics chanting down the Babylon System and resurrecting the movement of Jah people!

Ras Mundi has shared the stage with reggae luminaries The Wailers featuring Junior Marvin, Third World, and Michael Black.
Ras Mundi hopes to accomplish big ‘TINGS in 2026 that includes playing the SXSW Music Festival, as well as releasing a full-length album of original material. One love.

name: The Red Eye Gamblers
description:
The Red Eye Gamblers are a psychedelic southern rock band with a uniquely Austin, Texas sound. They bridge elements of rock, bluegrass, and jammy psychedelia to create a new experience with every show.

They have a deep repertoire, and in over two years of live shows, they have never played the same set list twice. They will often venture outside of their normal 5-piece lineup featuring a saxophone, djembe, and harmonica to create an unforgettable live experience.

They released their debut single "Let You Down Easy" in October 2024. A fan favorite from live shows, "Let You Down Easy" is a fast-paced song about simply saying goodbye. In September 2025, they followed it up with their next single "Whiskey Memories." "Whiskey Memories" is a powerful ballad about reminiscing on the past and learning to move on from the troubles it may have caused. The song features introspective lyrics, instrumental breakdowns, and showcases even more of what The Red Eye Gamblers have to offer.

From starting with backyard shows in east Austin, all the way to the Continental Club and the incredible stages at SXSW 2025, The Red Eye Gamblers are one of THE bands to watch for SXSW 2026 & beyond

name: Redzed
description:
REDZED is a Czech rap-metal outlier turning underground chaos into global momentum. Writing and producing everything himself — from raw guitar riffs to hard-hitting beats — he fuses serrated modern rap with the weight of late-’90s/’00s metal. The result is a dark, cinematic crossover that speaks fluent mosh pit and playlist alike.

His 2024 album Tales Of A Necromancer solidified a singular vision, while viral tracks like “Rave In The Grave,” “Meth Phonk,” and “Drugs = Magic” have racked up tens of millions of streams, pushing him past one million monthly Spotify listeners worldwide.

Onstage, REDZED is relentless — sweat-drenched, high-impact, and impossible to ignore. After sold-out headline shows, international tours, and major European festival slots, he arrives ready to turn SXSW into a collision of rap kids and metal die-hards.

name: Rehash
description:
Rehash is an indie-rock band from South Florida that began with two high schoolers making music in their bedrooms. In June 2023, they wrote and recorded their self-titled debut album “Rehash”, cementing themselves as one of the most exciting emerging acts on the East Coast. To date, everything has been written, recorded, produced, mixed, and mastered by the band. Their latest project “mock” has been a favorite of fans since its release in June of 2025. With more music on the way, Rehash is gearing up for their biggest year yet.

They started off touring on opening runs with acts like Alexsucks and Dogpark. They’re currently on tour and have sold out 75% of the shows.

With the release of their sophomore album Mock in June 2025, Rehash saw explosive growth—streaming numbers jumped over 50% in the last two months, reaching over 5 million monthly streams.

name: REHMA
description:
Inspired by her culturally rich & diverse upbringing, between her Pakistani-Muslim heritage to her formative days in Chicago, REHMA's sonic worlds are eclectic & vibrant. The singer-songwriter artfully weaves her powerful vocals with poetic lyricism, floating between pop, dance, and R&B, to create a singular soundscape & aesthetic that she coins as "desi-futurism"
Off the back a buzzing 2024, with a massive feature on Coke Studio (100M+ views across platforms), the cover of EQUAL Pakistan & a top slot on the Best Of Fresh Finds Year-End List), & earned co-signs from Savan Kotecha, Natasha Noorani, Zulfi, Sid Sriram & more. She's cemented herself as a promising creative force, not only in the rising South Asian diaspora, but across global pop music. Her forthcoming project, ANOMALY, is a refreshing take on modern pop & a timely, urgent coming of age story from the Pakistani-Muslim multi-hyphenate as she navigates her identity, religion, sexuality, and femininity.

name: Reilly Downes
description:
Reilly Downes is a torchbearer of modern heartbreak, blending rustbelt grit with cosmic country soul. Hailing from Texas and now rooted in the Chicago music scene, she’s made a name for herself with her “small, but mighty” voice and songs that cut to the bone. Downes has shared the stage with artists like Maggie Rose, Kaitlin Butts, and Jaime Wyatt, and has been featured in Rollingstone.

With a background in both the Americana and indie circuits, Reilly delivers raw, emotionally charged performances with her band, The Acid Cowboys. Her songs, like sad polaroids of love and loss, explore themes of queer identity, grief, and survival.

She is currently in the process of recording her sophomore album with executive production by Jaime Wyatt who has worked alongside Butch Walker, Shooter Jennings, The Black Pumas, and more.

name: REJAY
description:
REJAY, singer-songwriter from Niseko, Hokkaido. During her childhood, she was
influenced by her Australian father and grew up listening to many different genres
of music. She started writing her melodies and lyrics at the age of 13. With a
video she uploaded on YouTube, her singing voice attracted the ears of JQ from
Nulbarich. After she moved to Tokyo, she started her career under the production
of JQ. She has a one-of-a-kind voice that combines the extremes of shadow and
transparency.

name: Remey Williams
description: Remey Williams is a 2× Grammy-nominated singer, songwriter, producer, and drummer from Camden, New Jersey, now based in Hampton, Georgia. Raised in the church and born into a musical legacy as the son of O’Jays bassist Jimmy Williams, Remey began playing drums at age 10 and developed a soulful, emotionally driven sound. He has collaborated with artists including Summer Walker, Usher, Ari Lennox, and Childish Gambino, contributing to certified projects such as Still Over It. Currently the touring drummer for Summer Walker, Remey’s work spans live performance, production, and major TV placements, including PowerBook: Ghost and The Chi.

name: Reuben Vincent
description:
From Charlotte, NC, Vincent has already built an uncommon résumé—releasing music with 9th Wonder, touring alongside Rapsody, Pusha T & Bas and earning a reputation for wisdom and restraint well beyond his years. His growing catalog balances incisive commentary, emotional maturity, and allusion-heavy wordplay, guided by a deep respect for where hip-hop has been and a clear vision for where it can go next.
That vision comes fully into focus on Welcome Home, his latest album and a defining statement in his career. Produced entirely by 9th Wonder, the project is a reflective homecoming—both literal and spiritual—chronicling 25 y/o Vincent’s return to North Carolina after time spent chasing ambition elsewhere. Across warm, soulful, modernized boom-bap, he explores belonging, faith, failure, and growth, positioning “home” not just as a place, but as a state of mind.
Now signed to Roc Nation and firmly aligned with the Jamla lineage, Reuben Vincent isn’t chasing accolades—he’s building something more enduring. With Welcome Home, he stands as both a student of the culture and a leader within it, pushing North Carolina rap forward while honoring the foundation that shaped him

name: The Reverent Few
description: The Reverent Few emerged from Chicago’s blues scene and have called Austin home for over a decade. They are a band bound by shared history, raw honesty, and a lived-in belief in the power of music to connect and heal. With voices that carry like old hymns and instrumentation that cuts with both grit and grace, their songs aren’t just played, they’re inhabited. There’s gospel in the bones, blues in the breath, and rock and roll in the resolve. Their debut album, Ain’t No Place to Be (2020), was recorded in Dripping Springs and released through Bearpath Records. It's an eight-track collection steeped in soul both sonically and spiritually featuring contributions from Anthony Farrell of The Greyhounds. Critics praised its emotional weight and its blend of warmth, pain, and resilience. Their latest single, The World Will Be Wood to You, recorded live to tape at DogStar Studios, is a raw, analog meditation on loss and grace. Written during quiet reckonings and bedside goodbyes, it holds ache and light in equal measure. It's an offering, a gesture toward gentleness in a fractured world. The Reverent Few remind us that tenderness still matters, that community still holds.

name: RIA
description: Ria is a rising Mexican singer-songwriter from Mexicali, Baja California, whose fresh, emotional, and deeply personal voice bridges tradition and innovation in regional Mexican music, exploring themes of resilience, love, heartbreak, and everyday life. With a sound that carries both emotional depth and fearless authenticity, she stands out as a fresh creative force. She is helping redefine the role of women in Mexican music, bringing a powerful feminine lens to the regional genre and inspiring a new wave of female artists. Her stage debut arrived on the ¡AY MAMÁ! TOUR, where she opened for Tito Double P in both Monterrey and Guadalajara, performing for over 20,000 fans and leaving a striking impact on the live circuit. Today, she continues expanding her audience with over 105k monthly Spotify listeners and her single “Pagana” surpassing 1.4 million views on YouTube, positioning her as one of the most promising emerging voices carrying regional Mexican music to global audiences.

name: Rosa Anschuetz
description: Rosa Anschütz is a musician and sound artist whose practice merges composition, installation, and performance. Her sound blends the dark ambience of post-punk and cold wave with ethereal polyphony and synth-driven melodies. She has released three LPs: Votive (2020), accompanied by nine clay sculptures inspired by votive offerings; Goldener Strom (2022), which was staged at the Deutsche Oper Berlin; and Interior (2024), featuring nine tracks, each accompanied by a sequined landscape hand-stitched by Anschütz. Her new album, Sabbatical, was released on September 26, 2025, on Heartworm Press, US.

events.presented_by: German Music Export by Initiative Musik

name: Rosegarden Funeral Party
description:
Rosegarden Funeral Party has made a strong mark on the international post punk and goth scene since the release of their debut EP The Chopping Block in 2018. Since then, the band has released the EP At the Stake in 2020 and three full length albums: Martyr in 2019, In the Wake of Fire in 2021, and From the Ashes in 2024. Their work has earned critical acclaim from outlets including Post Punk, LA Weekly, SF Sonic, and the Dallas Observer.

The band has toured extensively across the United States as both a headliner and support act, completing over thirteen tours. In 2023, Rosegarden Funeral Party made their UK and European debut with performances in Italy, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Scotland, England, and Germany. Highlights included headlining Beautiful Noise Festival and supporting Skeletal Family and Corpus Delicti at Wave Gotik Treffen in Leipzig.

Blending classic gothic sounds with modern pop sensibility, Rosegarden Funeral Party delivers emotionally resonant lyrics centered on heartbreak, healing, and self love. Their message of kindness and connection has helped cultivate a devoted and steadily growing global fanbase.

name: Ruido Selecto
description: Ruido Selecto is a musician, producer, and sound engineer from Medellín, Colombia. His music focuses on Caribbean rhythms such as Cumbia, Salsa, Electronic Dub, and Afro-diasporic styles that have traditionally reached Colombia through the Picó Soundsystem culture. Ruido defines his sound as "Caribbean Bass." Since 2015, he has released two studio albums and several collaborations and EPs (Secret Lab 2015, Piratería Caribeña y Contrabando 2019 Equador 2022, and Cumbia Soundsystem EP 2025). In 2024, he released a series of remixes of iconic tracks from the legendary Colombian label Discos Fuentes, titled 14 CAÑONAZOS EN DUB, an audiovisual production that was highlighted by the specialized media outlet Gladys Palmera. He has toured nationally and internationally in Mexico and Central America, with additional performances in the United States and Europe. Ruido Selecto has participated in festivals such as Altavoz, África Futura, and Invazion Fest, sharing the stage with artists like Mitú, Afrotronix, Ghetto Kumbé, Systema Solar, Alligatorz, among others. He has worked as a producer and mastering engineer for Discos Fuentes , Folcore Barcelona and No Sabes.

name: runo plum
description: patching, the intimate debut LP from Minneapolis-based singer and songwriter runo plum, gracefully captures the contraction, expansion and release of an intense period of emotional repair, in soft-edged, radiating indie rock. The record’s unbridled sincerity isn’t anything new for runo plum, who’s been writing and quietly sharing bedroom dispatches of her intricate folk for a half-decade. During the pandemic years, she steadily caught the ears of a widening circle of listeners and began independently releasing a series of singles and EPs, all while cutting her teeth on the live side supporting Searows, Angel Olsen and Hovvdy.

events.venue: Radio Day Stage @ Downright Austin Backyard

name: Ryan Dove
description: Ryan Dove is a rapper and producer from El Paso, Texas, now based in Austin. Known for his energetic shows across the city, he makes lighthearted, relatable hip hop that keeps crowds smiling and moving. If you’re looking for a fun, feel-good live experience, Ryan Dove delivers every time.

name: Ryley Hall
description:
Ryley Hall is a multi-talented musician, singer, and actor. She was born in Covington, Louisiana and raised in San Antonio, Texas. She began her music career in elementary school, performing in choir and school plays. During her years in high school, she began writing original music with Chelsea Guy and together they wrote her debut album Moments. On her sixteenth birthday, she was gifted a guitar by her grandmother and began playing acoustic shows locally.
Ryley graduated from the University of Incarnate Word in May of 2025, where she majored in Music Industry Studies. She recently released her single, "F U" in February 2026.
Ryley's love for music stems from the joy and escape it gives to the listener. She feels that when we listen to music we are all equal, because music touches us at our core and brings out emotions we have all experienced in our lives. She is equally passionate about acting and voice over work, and is actively pursuing these careers along with her music. Regardless of the form it takes, Ryley dreams of building her career in the arts. Her goals include becoming a full-time entertainer and touring the world.

name: Saige Davis
description: Raised in a sunny southern California beach town, Saige Davis writes country-leaning songs straight from the heart with melodies that feel everlasting. Writing primarily on her own, she creates music that feels grounded and familiar - and yet wholly her own. Influenced by both the country classics and also Americana with a modern edge, her songs lean on acoustic guitars, simple arrangements, and lyrics that leave room to breathe. Whether written quietly at home or brought to life in the studio with producers Caleb Nelson (Mt. Joy) and Patrick Lyons (Colter Wall, Luke Grimes, Noeline Hoffman), Saige’s music shows a deep respect for timeless storytelling and feels imminent for a breakthrough in the year ahead.

name: Saint Avangeline
description:
Saint Avangeline is an Atlanta-based independent artist, merging ethereal sounds with raw, unfiltered vocals, crafting a striking contrast that mirrors the depths of human emotion. Deeply rooted in her journey with mental health, domestic abuse, & growing up queer, her songs offer an honest exploration of inner turmoil, rage, hope, & resilience.
Growing up with her head in a sketchbook & performing in various orchestras, and jazz bands, combined with her unique sound-to-color synesthesia known as Chromesthesia, Avangeline focuses on writing and creating from a color palette. Music is like painting, every sound is a different texture, color, and form. She also often listens to music in languages she doesn't understand, are made up or distorted, or that contain no words at all. She found that she could focus more deeply on the emotion embedded within the sound and she would often memorize entire orchestral scores and video game soundtracks as a child.
Focusing on painting an image not only through words but through the very fiber of sound, her music strives to transcend the barriers of language and strike hearts in the way hers was.

name: Saint Harison
description: Bio: Saint Harison is a rising artist with an undeniable voice from Southampton, United Kingdom. He currently lives in Los Angeles, CA. Having quickly risen to Internet fame from public support from SZA and Jazmine Sullivan to Justin Bieber, Timbaland and Elton John, he’s one of the latest artists to watch. Citing Amy Winehouse and Frank Ocean as two key musical influences, Saint has been covered by Rolling Stone, British Vogue, Wonderland, etc. and was named Apple Music's global Up Next artist. He made his late night TV debut on Jimmy Kimmel Live! after his viral COLORS performance of “ego talkin,” which sparked the viral #egotalkinchallenge on TikTok. His 7-track EP lost a friend was released in 2023 and has amassed over 200M cumulative streams, continuing to grow. He returned in fall 2025 with his single "ghosted," and recently released his latest single "bad," produced by Grammy-winning producer duo NovaWav (Beyoncé, JAY-Z, Jazmine Sullivan, etc.). He's gearing up to release his highly anticipated project this year.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth
Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: Sam LLanes
description:
Sam Llanes is a Christian Hip Hop artist with a message rooted in hope, love, and faith. Blending CHH with heartfelt storytelling, Sam brings a fresh sound with a timeless purpose. His music speaks to the ones who feel forgotten, the youth searching for direction, and anyone needing a reminder that God still moves.

From the stage to youth groups, and through his work with 4KIDS and the Youth Group Tour, Sam lives what he raps. Every lyric is a reflection of his journey—a husband, a father, a worship leader, and a man who found purpose through Jesus.

For the overlooked. For the outcast. For every kid. This is Sam Llanes.

Love God Love People Change The World

name: SAMWOY
description:
To a growing group of those in the know, the name SAMWOY signals epic, genre-warping
music that cuts through the Canadian landscape with rare force. Led by Montreal-based auteur
Sam Woywitka, the project has evolved into a powerhouse collective of the city’s most
adventurous musicians. SAMWOY’s tracks veer from ambient serenity and lush orchestration to explosive synths and
distorted rhythms, all anchored by Woywitka’s obsession with emotional extremes. His
sophomore album Even Sad Boys Like To Have Fun is out now and has become a
breakthrough release, charting on Earshot for 48 consecutive weeks while earning national
and international attention. Live, SAMWOY is a visceral experience volatile, beautiful, unpredictable. The project has
delivered acclaimed showcases at POP Montreal and M for Montreal, as well as a standout
performance at SXSW.
Rooted in themes of chaos, catharsis, and redemption shaped in part by Woywitka’s near-fatal
car accident in his Vancouver Island hometown. SAMWOY’s music thrives on contrast:
post-punk grit against electronic gloss, euphoria against collapse. It’s a world where nothing is
off limits and beauty is always carved from the wreckage.

name: Samy Sharif
description:
Samy Sharif moved to Los Angeles in mid 2023 to launch a solo effort after having spent the prior decade in the Chicago-based Alternative quartet, Bonelang.

In 2024, he released three albums (House of Failure, House of Fix, and House of Bliss) that were then put together and re-released as one large body of work entitled Three Houses.
​
​Samy is a first generation Egyptian/Irish artist; New York born and Chicago raised. He is a published poet, songwriter, and an aspiring writer/director.

name: Sarah Crean
description:
Irish/Brighton-based artist Sarah Crean is an indie-pop singer-songwriter whose music combines emotional clarity with layered, melodic arrangements. Her 2023 EP Death by Laundry featured the breakout single “2:00am,” now streamed over 7.5 million times on Spotify, and earned support from BBC Introducing, BBC Radio 1, The Line of Best Fit, Clash, Nialler9, and Spotify editorial playlists. The first single from her upcoming album, “22 Angel,” has already reached 80,000 streams and was featured on New Pop UK.

Sarah has toured the UK supporting acts including Florence Road, U.S. Girls, and Bombay Bicycle Club, with highlights such as a performance at the O2 Forum London alongside CMAT. Now independent and on the verge of her debut album - created entirely by women and inspired by the myth of Calypso - Crean explores heartbreak, home, and everything in between. With the album due mid-2026, she is emerging as one of alt-indie pop’s most compelling new voices.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Sasha Wrist
description:
Sasha Wrist is a bilingual singer-songwriter and vocal artist from Venezuela, now based in Los
Angeles. Her genre-bending sound fuses the grit of hip-hop, the pulse of electronic music, the
sensuality of R&B, and the emotional depth of Latin pop.

Her voice first gained traction in the global music scene through the viral success of her Splice
vocal packs, which have been downloaded and sampled by producers worldwide, incorporating Sasha’s vocals into standout tracks like “Famax” and “Perreo”.

In late 2024, Sasha released her debut album, LA CHAMA. More than just a debut, the album serves as a love letter to her Venezuelan roots. Tracks like “SUR,” “CORO,” “KRTELUO,” and “LLANEROS” explore her upbringing, resilience, and self-discovery.

Beginning in early 2025, Sasha made a sharp artistic pivot with the release of The Wrist
