Wave, a melodic house EP with tracks like “Ya Te Borre,” and “IGOT2." She also collaborated with some of the world’s biggest phonk artists, Ariis, YB Wasg'ood, and Nakama, on their track “LUNA LA.”

Sasha Wrist's next project, titled "404:NJD" will release in February 15 and will bring her back to rap roots.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Scuttino
description: "Your Favorite Cousin” Scuttino is one of the most exciting new voices in hip-hop. The multifaceted rapper, singer, and songwriter hails from Oak Cliff, a tough inner-city area of Dallas, Texas that’s also home to artists such as Yella Beezy, N’Dambi, and The D.O.C. With his love for hip-hop, neo-soul, and R&B, Scuttino has developed a versatile vibe that fuses classic instrumentation with modern production, along with his own mellow style and gift for wordplay. Inspired by a diverse range of artists, from T-Pain to Lil Wayne to hometown hero Erykah Badu, he has crafted a sound that is fresh and innovative, yet rooted in tradition and southern culture. Scuttino sets himself apart from other artists with his smooth and confident flow, his soulful melodies, and his distinctive vocal fry, which gives him a unique and recognizable voice that makes him stand out in the crowded hip-hop universe. This breath of fresh air has captivated audiences, both locally and online, with streams and views that are constantly piling up across multiple platforms. Keep your ears open for Scuttino, who's sure to take the music world by storm and become your favorite artist's "Favorite cousin".

name: Secret Family
description: Bump the mids and tap the fuzz. Insert sway, conjure a bounce: jangle, thud, chime. A union hall for proletariat pipe dreams. Soundtracks for the world’s longest lunch break. Friends on amaro. Wind chapped melodies pulled thru the fog conduit. Sounds hung in vaped memory, old friends/new feelings. Music for garbage trucks and the babble of brooks. Anchored in Bay Area garage lust and Montana river rock. Rock for now. Rock however. Taste like always. Rock n’ roll for whomever.

name: Semisoft
description: Semisoft is a dreamy post-grunge trio hailing from Tacoma, Washington. Blending spacey, hypnotic textures with explosive riff-driven energy, their sound lands somewhere between Fuzz, PJ Harvey, and Natural Child. Following the release of their Greenway Records debut 7", the band is preparing to unveil their second EP on Den Tapes, the Seattle-based cassette label and community founded by Kay Redden. Looking ahead, Semisoft’s long-awaited full-length album is slated for release next year.

name: Seulement
description:
Seulement is the solo project of Mathieu
Arsenault, an electronic musician and
audiovisual artist from Montreal. His work
explores the imperfections of the human body
in our era of technological perfection. More
specifically, he is interested in the integration
and transformation of the human voice and
gesture in digital arts. First known as the lead
singer of the electronic rock band Technical
Kidman, his solo practice now extends to
audiovisual performances, as well as albums
and experimental films. His work has been
presented at numerous festivals including
MUTEK Montréal (CA), ELEKTRA (CA),
Videocittà (IT), Modular M+ (HN), CODEC
(PE), Lunchmeat (CZ), Wavelength (CA),
Sound/Image (UK), International Film Festival
Rotterdam (NL), Festival International des
Films sur l’Art (CA), Iceland Airwaves (IS) and
Suoni Per Il Popolo (CA).

name: Sex Mask
description: Experiencing Sex Mask live is all gas, no brakes. The band’s artsy, electric fusion of proto-post-punk and writhing no-wave cool leaves little room for breathing space – and not least of all because shirtless frontman Wry Gray will often find himself directly within the immediate peripheral of anyone close to the front.

name: Shai Gabriel
description: An artist at the crossroads of country and hip-hop, Shai Gabriel creates the kind of songs that feel as epic as a movie: gripping, unpredictable, immense in scope but rooted in raw emotion. On his journey, the Texas-bred singer/songwriter charts a cinematic road trip through the wilds of the American South, bringing a powerful new depth to his storytelling while pushing further into the country/folk-inspired sound he's explored in recent years. Drawing inspirations from Country, Pop, Hip Hop and Gospel he creates a dynamic sound that captures the hearts of fans.

name: Shallowater
description: Born where the dust bowl never died. Raw West Texas dirtgaze.

name: Shao Dow
description:
Rapper, Manga Author, and occasional Ninja—Shao Dow (Rhymes with “Wow Bro”). He creates music inspired by anime and gaming but written for the soundtrack of life.

The closest thing you'll ever meet to a real-life anime character, Shao travelled solo to China to train with monks in Shaolin Kung Fu, he taught himself Japanese and now raps skilfully in two languages.

A fiercely independent artist, Shao creates powerful, genre-blending music built on infectious hooks and razor-sharp lyricism. He was selected as the official England representative for the UK’s National Day at Expo 2025 in Osaka, and invited to perform for the Japanese ambassador at the Embassy of Japan in London.

Shao Dow’s music has featured in 'Fortnite' and has been used by games 'God of War' and 'Borderlands 4' as well as Amazon Prime Video for the Arsenal documentary. He also writes the music for the popular One Jump Man vs Shaggy Ball Z animated series.

When it comes to performing, Shao delivers an unforgettable stage show — mixing high-energy music and Kung Fu for an experience unlike any other, continuing to prove that independence, musical excellence, and Anime Protagonist Energy can go hand in hand.

name: She23
description: She23 is an Austin-native singer, rapper, DJ and songwriter known for blending genres and building culture at the same time. Fusing hip-hop, R&B, and alternative influences, She is known for high-energy, club-oriented tracks and local performances. Active in the ATX music scene for over 15 years, She released the "2H3EO" EP in 2024 and is known for singles like "Goofy Goober" & "Chedda". You can also find She23 spinning some of your favorite hits at local venues such as Coconut Club, Traphouse and many more. Beyond the music, she curates and coordinates events that spotlight community, collaboration, and emerging voices. She23 has stepped onto official stages for SXSW, Dream Con, and AfroTech, continuing to make her mark as both a genre-blending artist and a force behind the scenes.

name: The Sheila Divine
description:
Aaron Perrino refuses to be beat. The Boston music scene veteran, who helms The Sheila Divine, has spent decades confounding expectations with songs that deftly weave power-punching political criticism amongst mundane daily frustrations. Songs that expose purest grief alongside deepest love.

The Sheila Divine’s upcoming sixth album, The Middle Ages (out DATE on Trash Casual), is a deeply human document of everyday life. Across ten new tracks Perrino bares his soul and searches his heart in songs that navigate the wide gamut of lived experience: from the wrenching loss of his mother, through parental anxieties for his own children’s wellbeing, to the strains of congested city life, fractured relationships, and rage at what his nation has turned into.

name: Shreea Kaul
description: Global pop and R&B artist Shreea Kaul is an artist to remember. She is paving the way for a new genre to emerge, seamlessly blending her South Asian roots with modern pop and R&B. Her viral single Tere Bina sparked over 100,000 Instagram Reels and 30,000 YouTube Shorts, while her self directed music video surpassed 1 million views. Her album Cruel Intentions followed, crossing 13 million streams within just four months of release, marking a major breakout moment in her career and cementing her as a multi-talented visionary. Shreea Kaul continues to establish herself as one of the most promising voices from the South Asian diaspora.

name: Shunk
description: Formed over the Fall of 2022, Shunk is a four piece from Montreal. Drawing from a vast catalog of musical influences, their sound ranges from shimmering French love songs, to cataclysmic rock. The band's live performances are intense and mesmerizing, the whimsical lyrics and cutting riffs fashion a distinctive sound.

name: Silvertone
description: Born in the fevered jam scene of Chicago, Silvertone brings an eclectic blend of groovy rhythms, powerful licks, and soulful lyrics to rock music. Each member of the quartet separately found their way to the Windy City in search of band mates and it wasn’t long before they found each other. Their diverse musical backgrounds mixed with their happy-go-lucky personalities lead them to create energetic foot-tapping riffs fused with catchy head-bobbing melodies, making a unique “rock and roll sound you can dance to” and leaves you wanting more.

events.venue: Flatstock Stage @ Austin Marriott Downtown (Moontower Hall)

name: sir eddie c
description:
Sir Eddie C is designing the next era of hip-hop from the middle of America.

The St. Louis–based artist represents a new St. Louis: forward-facing, culturally fluent, and unwilling to wait for co-signs. He calls his music “regular people rap,” but what distinguishes him is scale of vision. Each release arrives as a fully realized world, complete with its own aesthetic system, narrative arc, live direction, and sold-out limited merch.

He doesn’t drop projects. He builds worlds.

Concepts unfold through alter egos, staged moments, and immersive performances that feel cinematic without losing emotional precision. Beyond his own catalog, his annual Sir Eddie C & Friends show has grown into a packed, independently produced homecoming concert, proof that his audience doesn’t just listen. They participate, invest, and return.

With a sharp pen, controlled visual language, and commanding stage presence, Sir Eddie C operates as a full-package artist and multidisciplinary brand architect. He’s not waiting to be discovered. He’s constructing something too intentional to ignore.

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: Slomo Drags
description: Slomo Drags are masters of bouncy indie-rock jams full of gorgeous vocal harmonies and gnarly, angular guitar work. The vibrant music is the perfect trojan horse for wildly irreverent lyrics featuring such characters as The Rich Pervert in the self driving car or The Repeater who corners you on a bar patio and subjects you to a never ending loop of the same three sentences. Slomo is kicking off 2026 with a string of single releases on Spaceflight Records, starting with "Fresh Bread" - a hypnotically catch tune for folks who love paranoia and malaise with their pop.

name: Social Cig
description:
Born & brewed in Wisconsin, Social Cig is the 'Indie-Skate-Rock' music project of Filipino American, Parker Schultz. Consisting of contagious authenticity, cheery live shows, and cultivating an original story with an attitude of gratitude, Social Cig is creating full-circle moments. Leafing through global music scenes with an ambitious DIY approach and writing songs that capture a genuine outlook from a modern-day Midwest cowboy, Social Cig has become a well-rounded grassroots venture.

A Social Cig song sorts the extraordinaries of personhood; a lyrical short story woven together with playful strength and catchy grips in the feel-good realm of indie rock. Sketching a memoir and gardening an actively verdant fan base, Social Cig continues to expand its landscape by sharing the stage with acts such as Wet Leg, Lime Cordiale, Noah Kahan, CAKE, Motherfolk, PREP, Arlo Parks, M.A.G.S., Kainalu, Ax and the Hatchetmen, Miloe, The Symposium, Dizzy, The Crowe Boys, Landon Conrath, Motel Breakfast, Windser, Michael Cera Palin, and Lowertown.

name: Social Order
description:
Social Order is a Los Angeles and Las Vegas–based trio blending melodic pop, post punk, and darkwave into a sound that feels both cinematic and intimate. Formed during the isolation of 2020, the band features Mason Musso and Anthony Improgo of Metro Station alongside Andrew Ward of Nuwave Fighters. Their music explores the tension between nostalgia and reinvention, light and shadow, intimacy and distance.

They gained early attention with their debut EP How To Lie, followed by singles Worst Way, All My Life, Boys, and the EP Strangers, earning placement on Spotify’s Darkwave playlist and praise from Alternative Press and Post-Punk.com. Entirely self-produced and self-directed, Social Order maintain a strong DIY ethos. The band made their major festival debut at Cruel World and completed a North American tour with French Police in November, continuing to expand their shadowy, emotionally charged world.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth
Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: Sofish
description:
Sofish is one of the most promising new voices in Mexico’s alternative pop scene. A singer, songwriter, and creative director from Guadalajara, she blends French house, Latin pop, and alternative R&B into a bold, global sound that is both elegant and visceral.

Her single Me Caigo went viral on TikTok in France and Latin America, earning placements on Spotify’s Fresh Finds Global, Fresh Finds Latin, Mixto, and Novedades Viernes, as well as the cover of OYE POP and Mixto. The track also drew international media attention, with Remezcla calling it “iconic… fresh and elegant… diva alert.”

Sofish is preparing to release her first album in early 2026, supported by upcoming singles like Flashbacks (a track with strong sync potential). She is a Latin Grammy Cultural Foundation and Berklee College of Music scholar, and has performed at major stages such as Tecate Emblema, Wine Colors, and Lunario (Auditorio Nacional).

With her ambitious storytelling and high-end visual artistry, Sofish is ready to bring her project to international audiences.

name: someshiit
description:
someshiit is a Taiwanese hip-hop artist known for his unique blend of bedroom rap and live band arrangements. Drawing influence from UK, Japanese, and Korean hip-hop, he emerged in 2019 with the breakout single “Those Who Told Me to Quit Smoking Are All Dead” (5M+ views on YouTube), the track’s poetic and raw storytelling quickly resonated with a new generation of listeners. His debut album ‘A FOOL’ pushed even further, fusing gritty lyricism with lush, genre-blurring production alongside collaborators like Samjoo (deca joins), Sam Yang, and Pei-Yu Hung, earning him Best New Artist at the Golden Melody Awards, Taiwan’s most prestigious music honor.
From TV screens “The Rappers 2” to major Taiwanese festival stages like Megaport, Vagabond, and FireBall Fest, he weaves lush live-band arrangements as the backbone of his sound, layered with razor-sharp, prose-like lyricism that cuts straight to the core. His self-produced shows consistently sell out, including his first overseas performance in Hong Kong, proving that his music’s emotional gravity transcends borders. Internationally, he has worked alongside acclaimed Japanese rapper maco marets and South Korean psychedelic band CHS, garnering attention from various media outlets and hip-hop labels.

With a reimagined EP set to drop in 2025 marking six years since his breakout hit, someshiit isn’t just evolving, he’s shaping a new creative language for Mandarin rap, redefining its boundaries one verse at a time.

name: Sonido Cachimbo
description:
Sonido Cachimbo is a cumbia project born in Ciudad Juárez, México, and rooted in the lived experience of the Juárez–El Paso border region. Formed in the early 2010s amid a context marked by violence, migration, and social fragmentation, the project transforms those realities into an energetic and celebratory sound grounded in popular dance traditions.

Blending cumbia with elements of rock, punk, and other hybrid influences, Sonido Cachimbo creates music that invites collective joy while carrying the memory and resilience of border communities. Their live performances are known for their high energy, festive atmosphere, and strong connection with diverse audiences on both sides of the border.

The project has released two full-length albums, Tropicumbia Fronteriza (2014) and Fiesta Popular (2017), the latter co-produced by Rodrigo Rojas of the Chilean band Juanafe, and has collaborated with artists such as Clemente Castillo (Jumbo), Edna Nao, and Paulina del Campo. In 2024, Sonido Cachimbo released “Monitor,” a reinterpretation of the song by Volován. The group is currently working on a new EP of original material planned for vinyl release.

name: Sonora Tukukuy
description:
Sonora Tukukuy is a Miami-based music collective, known for its modern take
on roots cumbia rhythms blended with modern sounds fueling Miami’s diverse
community and its permanent growth. Sonora Tukukuy’s fresh approach, combined with the energetic, danceable
nature of cumbia,has helped the genre gain traction at local venues, festivals,
and clubs. They’ve contributed to the resurgence of Latin American folk music in
modern spaces, showing how it can be reinterpreted and made relevant in a
cosmopolitan environment.
Their proposal is enriched by the diverse backgrounds of its members, who come
from various Latin American countries and beyond. This multicultural mix
brings different musical influences, perspectives, and styles into their work,
resulting in a fusion of sounds that appeals to a broad range of audiences. The
band's ability to incorporate various genres and rhythms while maintaining the
core essence of cumbia demonstrates how traditional music can evolve and
connect with contemporary global cultures.

name: The Sophs
description: The Sophs is a multi-genre six-piece hailing from Los Angeles, California, who’s confessional lyrics and nostalgic instrumentation make a statement regardless of whether they intend to or not

name: Sorry Youth
description:
Sorry Youth is a power trio formed by guitarist Weni, bassist Giang Giang, and drummer Chung-Han. Taiwanese lyrics are an essential base of their songwriting as well as a hallmark of Sorry Youth, and the song arrangements capture a strong sense of live performance. They have established one of the unique features of the Taiwanese-rock sound nowadays with the essence of their music that is deeply influenced by bands from the 80s and 90s, such as The Cure, Sonic Youth, Yo La Tengo, Mogwai, The National, and Wilco, etc.

As one of the leading acts in Taiwan’s independent music scene, Sorry Youth has sold out numerous headline shows and performed at major festivals including Summer Sonic (JP), Megaport Festival (TW), Shima Fes SETOUCHI (JP), Mori Michi Ichiba (JP), and SXSW (US). Their international tours have taken them across Japan, South Korea, Canada, and Hong Kong, among others.

As they enter their 20th year, Sorry Youth continues to expand their global reach, with upcoming performances at CLANG Music Festival 2025 (SG), Busan International Rock Festival (KR), and a new Japan tour in 2025.

name: Soucream
description:
Isaac Sosa, better known as SOUCREAM, is a Venezuelan artist born on July 5, 2003. He lived in his country until 2018, the year in which he emigrated with his family to Buenos Aires, Argentina. There he discovered the world of funk and began to collaborate with Mauro Hansen, his producer and creative ally, with whom he continues to create today.

In January 2023, he decided to leave Buenos Aires and settle in Miami, Florida, a city that opened the doors to accelerated growth within the Latin Funk movement, recognized “el funk de tu pais”.

name: SoundMass
description:
Sound Mass is an ever-evolving collaboration between Austin’s My Education and Utah’s Theta Naught, celebrated for immersive, cinematic soundscapes and electrifying live performances. Since its inception, the project has captivated audiences with a seamless fusion of post-rock, ambient, classical, and experimental elements, crafting music that is as emotive as it is expansive.

Building on more than a decade of boundary-pushing work, Sound Mass is preparing to unveil a brand-new studio album in 2026, promising bold textures and sweeping arrangements that further refine their signature sound. Their performances at SXSW and beyond showcase the chemistry between these two collectives, offering listeners a transformative, deeply resonant journey through instrumental storytelling.

With a new chapter on the horizon, Sound Mass continues to affirm the power of collaboration and the limitless possibilities of sonic exploration.

name: SpaceGoonz
description: As was foretold by the prophecy, the SpaceGoonz have entered this plane of existence. They crash-landed in Austin, Texas, in 2023. Their current mission: to reinvent what it means to be a Hip-Hop artist in the capital city of Texas. They are returning to SXSW for the third consecutive year, continuing to help elevate the local Hip-Hop scene into a nationally recognized hub for the art form. Comparable to Wu-Tang Clan, Brockhampton, Flatbush Zombies, ETC. Consisting of members from all around the country and spanning multiple generations, their sound is a collage of the different Hip-Hop practices, melded together by the diverse backgrounds of every member. So it doesn’t matter what god you believe in or what media you consume, as long as, when we say “Space,” you say… “Goonz”

name: Spacestation
description:
In 2022, five young men from Iceland, unsure of where their life was going formed a rock band, with the goal of bringing style, fun, dance and catchy songwriting back to Icelandic rock music. Spacestation has in the past couple of years gained a reputation as the country’s most exciting new rock group and its most proliferate live band.

Like Velvet Underground, Sonic Youth and My Bloody Valentine before them, Spacestation aspire to redefine what noise can be within the context of pop music.

Their music combines inventive use of alternate tunings, guitar strumming and feedback, with the intensity of shoegaze, catchy Krautrock rhythms and the attitude of 60s psychedelia, to create a new, jogging, sonic landscape that makes you waste away insightful nights dancing with strangers.

name: Spencer Thomas
description:
Atlanta-based artist Spencer Thomas returns with Cynical Vision, his third and most incisive album yet, out March 20, 2026. Wry and sardonic, the record balances humor and existential dread, blending retro synths, vintage drum machines, and fuzzed-out guitars into an intoxicating mix of analog and electronic sounds. Nods to Randy Newman, Lou Reed, Warren Zevon, and Tom Petty shine through as Thomas holds a mirror to modern life, delivering a whip-smart meditation on the absurdity and beauty of living and loving in the 21st century.

“In a lot of ways, it felt impossible for me to not write about this stuff,” Thomas says. “I leaned into what felt interesting and current and funny, and tried to make something visceral and honest.”

After releasing his 2019 solo debut Hangin’ Tough, he moved to Athens, GA in 2020 and joined indie rock band Futurebirds as their keyboardist. “It was a fantastic opportunity,” he explains, “but it kept me away from home and from my own music.” His 2024 sophomore album The Joke of Life earned rave reviews, and in 2025 he stepped away from Futurebirds to devote himself fully to creating Cynical Vision.

name: Spike Fuck
description:
Spike F*ck is a rare figure in contemporary music: direct, disarming, and impossible to pin down. Emerging from Melbourne’s underground in the late 2010s with The Smackwave EP, Spike fused bleak synth-pop, post-punk melodrama, and brutally honest songwriting into something both vulnerable and confrontational. Armed with only a backing track and a microphone, early live shows saw Spike sing candidly about addiction, gender, dysfunctional love, and collapse: a kind of wounded sincerity that quickly drew a cult following. Just as things seemed to be breaking open, Spike disappeared, retreating from public life amid a personal reckoning.

After a four-year hiatus -- during which time rumours swirled about death, institutions, or becoming a monk -- Spike returned sober, clear-eyed, and transformed. The music that followed is bigger, wilder, and more alive. Performed with a rotating full band, the new material draws from ‘70s glam, spiritual soul, and damaged rock and roll, but always filtered through Spike’s unmistakable voice: bruised, intense, poetic.

These are songs about recovery, identity, survival, and letting go not sanitised, not triumphant, but real. Where the early work stared into the void, the new work steps forward with purpose. It’s not a reinvention. It’s an evolution, one born from chaos, now grounded in clarity.

name: Spoon Benders
description:
Spoon Benders is a three-piece punk rock band from Portland, Oregon, delivering raw volume, sharp hooks, and nonstop momentum. Stripped down and loud, the band thrives on a high-energy live show that feels just barely contained—fast, sweaty, and direct, with nothing wasted.
Built on constant movement, Spoon Benders have spent years touring relentlessly, honing their sound on stages across the country and earning a reputation as a band that hits hard and never phones it in. Their music channels punk’s urgency and grit, powered by tight chemistry and an aggressive edge that only a three-piece can deliver.
Now, Spoon Benders are preparing to release their highly anticipated third album, capturing the intensity of the road and the confidence of a band fully in its stride. With new songs on the way and the volume turned up, Spoon Benders continue to prove that three people are more than enough to make some serious noise.

name: SRI
description:
SRI is a Brooklyn-based DJ, producer, and artist crafting futuristic club music through a South Asian lens. Known for percussive, high-energy sets and hypnotic vocals, she builds immersive worlds that feel both cinematic and visceral.

“SXSW is about discovery, and this showcase highlights how South Asian artists are shaping what’s next. I’m excited to bring my world, my sound, and my community into that space.” She will be featured as a performer for the SOUTH ASIAN HOUSE Soundvilla showcase for SXSW 2026.

Leading up to her showcase performance, she will be releasing a single that fuses the worlds of Brooklyn, NY and Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India.

name: Stalefish
description:
Stalefish is a 6-piece band from Austin, Texas. Fresh off their first two full-length records in 2024 (Stalefish Does America, and It’s All Down Here From Hill) the band refuses to take their foot off the gas.

Stalefish is happy to share their love letter to pop music: a six-song EP titled New Pop Experiments Vol. 1, available now via Happen Twice. The EP's quick yet deliberate recording process lends it a sense of spontaneity and cohesion, capturing the band's hunger, optimism, and adventurous spirit. Known for their ‘90s indie rock style, Stalefish looks to bring their sound into the modern era, embracing their most earwormy ideas.

Songwriter Dalton Hausman was inspired by watching Royel Otis at Austin City Limits when his girlfriend turned to him and said, “You could do this!” This vote of confidence lit a fire underneath Hausman to take a stab at writing a radio hit. The lead single “1000 Books a Day” came directly out of that challenge and kickstarted the project.

Creating New Pop Experiments Vol. 1 was transformative for the band, involving remote collaboration across different cities, digital sharing of ideas, and intense bursts of in-person creativity.

Musically, the recordings offer a ripe sonic landscape complete with strings, horns, synthesizer, and lots of electric guitar. True to the lyrical tradition of the band, the songs are about romantic love, self-love and reassurance, and perhaps most importantly, how to party.

The full EP, New Pop Experiments Vol. 1, is available now via Happen Twice!

name: Stare Away
description: Emerging from the heart of New York City’s underground music scene, Stare Away is the brainchild of Ben Nelson, a project that fuses post-punk intensity with a retro-coded aesthetic inspired by the dark alternative icons of the 1980s. Haunting melodies and brooding soundscapes channel the spirit of goth-driven acts from that era, offering a sonic journey steeped in existential reflection and melancholic beauty. A true embodiment of modern dark romanticism, Stare Away continues to captivate audiences seeking meaning in the shadows.

name: Steven Bamidele
description:
Nigerian-born, London-based singer, songwriter, musician, and producer Steven Bamidele is known for his distinctive reverb-drenched falsetto, synth textures, and syncopated beats. Citing the influences of contemporary creators Frank Ocean, Tyler the Creator, Solange and Childish Gambino, he puts social commentary and artistic narratives at the forefront of his music.

His recent sophomore album THE CRASH! was written against the backdrop of an ever-changing world, combining indie-soul and jazz, acoustic and electronic textures, along with daydream-esque storytelling. The LP received support from Blues Project, Somewhere Soul, BBC Radio 3, BBC 6Music, BBC Introducing, WorldwideFM, Clash, Wordplay and Fusicology, alongside playlisting from Jazz FM, FIP Radio France and KCRW.

To critical acclaim, he has headlined London’s iconic 100 Club, Brighton's Dome Studio and Prince Albert, Jazz re:freshed, Pizza Express Live Soho and more. Steven has supported renowned artists Alice Russell, Sly5thAve, Hot 8 Brass Band, Marlon Craft, Kymara, Ebi Soda, while making festival appearances at We Out Here, Love Supreme, Shambala, The Great Escape, Brick Lane Jazz, SXSW London and beyond.

name: Still Blank
description: Still Blank’s sound is a unique blend of shoegaze haze, folk intimacy, and emotionally raw ambient alt-rock grit. With lyrics steeped in people-watching, dreams, nature, and existential observation, their songwriting draws from both introspection and their surroundings. Ben and Jordy met by chance in Liverpool 2 years ago sparking a lightning-in-a-bottle creative partnership. What started as casual jam sessions in a basement quickly evolved, with sessions ranging from stripped-back recordings on a broken classical guitar to studio lock-ins fuelled by long walks through rural Wales and a shared commitment to imperfection. In May 2025 they performed their first show as a band at Permanent Records Roadhouse. Debut single "What About Jane" is a grungy, folk-inflected reflection on identity, societal perception, and the expectations we’re forced to confront to uncover who we really are.

name: Stockz
description:
Stockz is a Houston-based artist and entrepreneur redefining what modern hip-hop can represent. Operating at the intersection of music, finance, and education, he transforms real-world experiences—risk, discipline, ownership, and long-term vision—into sharp, motivational records that resonate both on stage and off.

Known for confident delivery and polished, cinematic production, Stockz has performed on major stages including Rolling Loud (U.S. & Thailand), REVOLT World, and a Live Nation–headlined show at House of Blues Houston. He has also brought his sound to academic and cultural spaces, performing at UT Austin’s Student Founder Fest and opening for national tours alongside artists from TDE and the West Coast hip-hop circuit. His live shows blend high energy with intention—equal parts performance and mindset.

Beyond music, Stockz has collaborated with brands such as Nike, adidas, Experian, Samsung, True Religion, and REVOLT TV, bridging corporate partnerships with authentic cultural storytelling. A former Roc Nation–affiliated artist, he brings a rare combination of industry polish, independence, and entrepreneurial clarity to every release.

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: Storey Littleton
description: Storey Littleton is a songwriter from Woodstock NY. Her first album “At a Diner” is out February 2026 on Don Giovanni Records. Inspired by the likes of Judee Sill, Liz Phair, and Kacey Musgraves, Storey’s feathery vocals blend the melodies of pop with the pang of folk, at once gentle and all-consuming. The album features moments of restraint and rupture: intricate finger-picked melodies give way to electric guitar rumbles and wails alongside the humor, drama and catchiness of 60’s girl group pop. Her other musical projects include fronting the band M0NOGAMY alongside Livia Reiner and Matthew Danger Lippman, and playing guitar and keys for Ida, Lola Kirke, Calder the Destroyer, Luella and The Hedons.

name: Subpar Snatch
description:
Subpar Snatch is a fierce, unapologetic punk rock powerhouse from Austin, Texas, delivering high-energy anthems that punch as hard as they play. Known for blistering bass riffs, riotous rhythms, and unapologetically raw lyrics, the band turns every stage into a sweaty, cathartic release for the crowd. These self-proclaimed shit asses draw on influences like Riot Grrrl and modern garage punk, Subpar Snatch blends ferocity with fun — their live shows are equal parts mosh pit and inside joke, fueled by razor-sharp wit and pure, unfiltered passion. They’ve built a loyal following through electrifying performances at local venues, roller derby bouts, and DIY festivals, creating an inclusive space for rebels, misfits, and anyone who wants to scream along.
With a reputation for turning chaos into community, Subpar Snatch is ready to bring their high-octane, Texas rebellion to a stage near you. "Subpar" is anything but.

events.presented_by: Art Decade Creatives - Austin Heavy Hitters

name: Suck Brick Kid
description: Suck Brick Kid is a hook-heavy pop-punk band built on big riffs, bigger choruses, and just enough self-awareness to keep it dangerous. For over a decade, they’ve balanced earnest, heart-on-sleeve energy with sharp, tongue-in-cheek lyricism—turning existential spirals and dive-bar observations into shout-along anthems. Their releases are tight, punchy, and conceptually driven, walking the line between chaos and craft. Known for sweaty, cathartic live shows that feel equal parts therapy session and house party, the band thrives in rooms where volume and vulnerability coexist. Suck Brick Kid isn’t trying to reinvent punk—just to play it loud, honest, and impossible to ignore.

name: Sugabooo
description:
Fresh from a seminal performance at All Together Now’s Last City stage, Sugaboo is set to make a statement as he has sold 450 tickets to his debut headline show in the Iconic Dublin venue Whelans. From forwarded many times WhatsApp releases to 12K monthly Spotify listeners, Sugaboo has been building a buzz in the Dublin underground. His debut mixtape “Kimmagination” released in August 2025 has garnered attention from Kneecap’s Moglai Bap who endorsed the album on instagram. When the Irish ex-Taoiseach Leo Varadkar is a follower. Lewis Capaldi is an early fan aswell and has been playing Goin Ballistic to the crowds before his arena shows on his recent UK tour.

Earlier this year, Sugaboo featured on Lil Skag’s “Pilgirmmage to Kimmage,” which received Track of the Week on the Nialler9 blog. With a collaborative mixtape with Lil Skag, “Skagaboo,” on the horizon.

Sugaboo’s momentum is building now. Having opened for Mik Pyro of Republic of Loose fame to a sold-out crowd in Whelan’s main room, Sugaboo has proven his live credentials. With a string of shows under his belt, having toured Ireland and the UK. Expect live versions of the tracks you’ve had on repeat, plus a few surprises. Bring the crew, bring the energy. This isn’t just a show – it’s a statement of raw energy. Dublin 12 inside the place; real bars, no industry fluff, No hype merchants, no messing just a room full of heads who’ve been watching this build from the shack days.

name: Sultanes del Yonke
description: Born on the frontera, Sultanes del Yonke channels the chaos, color, and rhythm of the border into a sound built from the unexpected. As they prepare to promote their debut album, due in April, the band is evolving its sound — keeping their regional rhythms and DIY spirit while weaving in samples, drum machines, and experimental, dance-driven styles. This collision of influences does true justice to the yonke in their name: raw, eclectic, and born from the beautiful chaos of the border. Recent milestones include a tour supporting Tropa Mágica and a standout performance at SXSW, solidifying their expanding live footprint.

name: Sūn Byrd
description:
With a Spellemann (norwegian Grammy) nomination for their debut album in hand, Sūn Byrd is ready to kick off the new campaign for the upcoming album In Paradiso, heavily inspired by American and British soul from the 60s and 70s.

With a horn section that never rests, basslines that drive the songs forward, neatly ironed pants, and undeniable coolness, Sūn Byrd could just as easily be born in New Orleans as in Oslo. But it's in Norway that they've first made a name for themselves. They released their Spellemann-nominated debut album in 2024 and have already played over 250 concerts together. You can just try to imagine how tight Sūn Byrd sounds live, and then add a little more. Now, they're about to release In Paradiso, their first album on Jansen Records.

On In Paradiso, you'll be served soulful tracks that follow in the footsteps of artists like Leon Bridges, Thee Sacred Souls, and Sharon Jones and The Dap-Kings. Johan Helland's vocals are perhaps the first thing that stands out, with its distinctive tone, range, and vulnerability, but it’s when the whole band comes in that you’re truly dazzled. The keys, horns, guitar, and bass all find their place, seamlessly shifting between being a musical locomotive and charming you into submission with beautiful ballads.

Sūn Byrd’s music is universal and timeless, and there’s really nothing that sounds like this on the Norwegian music scene today. It’s perfect for large festival stages, would make a great soundtrack for countless films, or simply while you hang out after closing time at a smoke-filled off-license bar in the southern U.S.

Posting Spotify link here, since it did not work below: https://open.spotify.com/artist/32PUtLgz3SzD5Ihjdxoa6r?si=-g3wUV8ARxy3Htw3bXNW0Q

name: Sun Room
description:
Born and raised in San Diego’s surf-rock scene, Sun Room went from getting their house shows shut down for playing too loudly to selling out venues across a dozen countries. Formed in 2021, the band gained viral attention after two songs featured on Netflix’s Outer Banks. Expanding beyond their hometown, they sold out U.S. shows, supported Louis Tomlinson, toured Europe with Inhaler, and headlined their first North American tour in fall 2022, selling over 15,000 tickets. In spring 2023, Sun Room toured North America with Inhaler before returning to SoCal to finish At Least I Tried, which earned widespread acclaim.

In summer 2025, Sun Room released their latest EP, Ritual of Chaos, before supporting Flipturn and embarking on a 20+ date headline tour. The project showcases the band’s love of blues-rock, shoegaze and post-punk garage influences absorbed from playing worldwide. Their live show channels the energy of their early San Diego house shows - bigger and more electrifying with every performance.

Sun Room continues to push their sound, explore new cities, and draw inspiration from their experiences. Their highly anticipated debut album is set for release in early 2026.

name: Sunforger
description: Sunforger is a band from Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Their music has been described as “fast slowcore,” “weird punk,” and “post-everything”. They’ve made a box big enough to hold post-punk, grunge, college rock, shoegaze, and post-hardcore, and Sunforger is still firmly outside it. Their effortless uniqueness is built on rhythmic and percussive guitars, infinitely repeatable cadences, and emotive hypnagogia. The name Sunforger is spoken with reverence in DIY circles across North America, disseminated over half a decade of Bandcamp deep-diving, touring, festivals, a self-titled album, and a 7-minute EP. Sunforger’s eagerly awaited second album, entitled Weight, arrives May 2026 via the labels Cooked Raw and Julia’s War.

name: Sunshine Spazz
description:
Sunshine Spazz is a garage rock power trio with hints of punk and blues from Ocean County, New Jersey. Ryan Rutter (guitar/vocals) and Michael Rutter (bass) are brothers by blood, and that can be felt in the music as they battle for their tones to be heard, whether the fuzzy bass prevails or the reverberating, delayed guitar grabs your sonic sensations. Jamie Lawler (drums) is the glue of the band, as well as the moderator that keeps The Rutter Brothers from turning the musical space into a combat ring.
Sunshine Spazz's self-titled debut album released in November of 2023, and allowed them to complete two interstate runs, as well as the opportunity to play Asbury Park's Sea.Hear.Now Festival in September of 2024 alongside acts like Bruce Springsteen, Action Bronson, The Gaslight Anthem, Illiterate Light, and many more. With singles to be released in fall and winter of 2025, and an album release in January 2026, the three boys bonded by rock will be hitting the road much more. Their new album packs a punch that is a beautiful release in dealing with grief. After losing a very dear friend, Sunshine Spazz has transformed this project into a creative coping mechanism and a tribute that reflects the depth of their bond that once was. It goes to show that what seemingly ends, actually continues energetically.

name: Superfan
description:
Composing and producing in his Los Angeles living room from age 11, Flanagan cites his earliest musical experiences as piano recitals attended by Hollywood directors and Weezer’s frontman, who Flanagan remembers “commenting on my rhythmic sensibility” by pointing at his foot tapping to keep time during his first performance. Flanagan began circulating studios filled with aspiring millennial producers in his teens, informed by an orchestral background fueled by public school music programs in which he played both upright bass and violin. It was then that he taught himself to use DAWs and the rules of “heavily-produced” pop music.

Flanagan found success during the pandemic under his first name, ‘KALI’. His initial releases garnered the appearance of a budding career as an indie-pop star, with millions of streams and collaborations with seasoned high-profile producers and industry teams. Despite the upward mobility, Flanagan’s growing interpersonal dysphoria was easily a metaphor for his dissatisfaction with his artistic output and community as he reached adulthood. Growing up in Los Angeles was contingent on this ever-present new wave of pop music oblivion; “hits” made in 5-hour sessions with strangers, a social life suffocated by others’ aspirations for fame, and an absent audience for live music that pushed past the prescriptions of recorded music. Following his physical transition (to become male), his three-word synth pop hooks were swapped out for stanzas describing dissociation and gender envy, soundtracked by a now-signature, deeply tuned acoustic guitar.

Flanagan’s pared-down playing style and vocal have drawn comparisons to songwriters as Kurt Cobain, Leonard Cohen and Nick Drake. He has held monthly residencies at the now-defunct Los Angeles staple Genghis Cohen, (which drew the attendance of Julian Casablancas) and New York’s Pete’s Candy Store. Superfan has since played shows with the likes of Jordan Patterson (with whom both Flanagan and Almassi are frequent contributors), Quiet Light, untitled (halo), Autobahn, Horsegirl, Userband, as well as in the UK & Europe alongside acts such as Tiberius B and Samba Jean Baptiste. He is booked for shows with Kelora, Knifeplay, Dan English, and Kath Bloom in the fall. Flanagan is a member of the rising NYC emo band, Holidays in United States, who is in the process of recording a full-length project. Additional contributions as a multi-instrumentalist will be found on Jordan Patterson’s upcoming debut, “The Hermit”. Kali is currently a student at Hunter College studying Anthropology and writing as a freelancer for the artist-favorite Creative Independent.

events.venue: Austin City Limits Live at the Moody Theater

name: SUUVI
description:
SUUVI is a Cuban-Chinese composer, producer, and multidisciplinary artist whose roots in electronic cello-driven performance inform a bold, genre-fluid sonic vision. After 15+ years appearing internationally as a classical soloist in venues such as Carnegie Hall, La Fondation Louis Vuitton, and the Berlin Philharmonie - and touring as the solo cellist in Hans Zimmer’s live show - she expanded beyond the stage, blending cello, electronics, and storytelling to craft immersive works that reflect her multicultural background and social-impact mission. She has composed and produced original music for theater, dance, and film/TV, working across genres from contemporary classical to electronic, hip-hop, and pop, with artists like D-Smoke, Teyana Taylor, FAVE and many more - earning recognition for her boundary-pushing artistry and emotional depth.

Her debut album, Dark Therapy, pushes post-classical music into avant-garde electronic and cinematic realms, inviting listeners into a space of introspection, healing, and sensory immersion.

name: Swapmeet
description:
Swapmeet are an Adelaide/Kaurna Country based four piece who are set to release their debut album in 2026. With indie rock foundations, characterised by sonic experimentation, and a punk spirit, Swapmeet are known in the local and international circuit for their playful, chaotic onstage presence.

After a successful showcasing debut at BIGSOUND 2024 - the band returned home for the South Australian Music Awards where Swapmeet were awarded "Best Release" for their debut EP "Oxalis" and "Best Song" for fan favourite "Ceiling Fan".

2025 saw the band tour nationally with The Murder Capital and support Suki Waterhouse at PICA. In between sold out debut headline shows - Swapmeet showcased at SXSW Sydney 2025 and left having been awarded with "Best Emerging Artist". Swapmeet will be backing this up at SXSW Texas - making this the bands international live debut.

name: SWDEJAY
description:
SWDEJAY (Southwest Ejay) is a first-generation Mexican-American DJ from Southwest Detroit, deeply rooted in the city’s rich musical legacy. Known for his high-energy, open-format style, he seamlessly blends Latin House, Reggaeton, Dembow, Baile Funk, and Ghetto Tech — reflecting both his heritage and Detroit’s forward-thinking sound.

As the curator of Fiesta House, he has played a key role in shaping Detroit’s Global Latin club scene, holding multiple residencies at some of the city’s top nightlife venues while building a cultural bridge between Detroit and the world. His sound has reached international dance floors through performances and productions in Paris, Berlin, London, Chicago, Guadalajara, and Mexico City.

A true ambassador of global music, SWDEJAY continues pushing boundaries — bringing Detroit energy, Latin rhythm, and worldwide club culture together wherever he plays.

name: t-low
description:
t-low is one of the most distinctive voices of the new German music generation. With a raw emotional honesty and a sound rooted in emo rap and alternative pop, he has become a defining figure in the post-Gen-Z youth culture of the German-speaking world. Born and raised in a small town in northern Germany, t-low emerged from SoundCloud culture and quickly gained nationwide attention with his unfiltered lyrics and melodic sensibility. His music explores themes of mental health, love, identity, and existential struggle delivered with a rare vulnerability that resonates deeply with his audience.

With multiple gold and platinum records, sold-out tours, and chart-topping singles, t-low has established himself as a generational voice in Germany. Yet despite his commercial success, he has consistently pushed boundaries and stayed artistically uncompromising. In late 2025, t-low will release his highly anticipated comeback album "REAL MUSIC", marking a return to his roots with a more introspective, emotionally complex sound. His showcase at SXSW 2026 is not about breaking into the U.S. market - it’s a statement.

name: Tavo Rayo
description:
Tavo Rayo, a south Texas native rising star in the reggaetón and perreo scene, blends infectious rhythms with magnetic stage energy to captivate audiences across the U.S. and Latin America. Known for his dynamic flow and catchy hooks, he’s rapidly gaining momentum carving out a space as a fresh voice in urban Latin music.

With roots deeply planted in the perreo tradition, Tavo Rayo’s sound is a vibrant fusion of old-school reggaetón beats and modern urbano influences, appealing to both traditional fans and a new generation of listeners. His recent singles have garnered notable playlist placements and rave reviews for their authenticity and dancefloor-ready vibe.

Tavo’s live performances are a high-energy experience, blending charismatic interaction with an electrifying presence that commands the stage and ignites crowd participation. As he continues to expand his footprint bringing authentic Latin flavor, undeniable talent, and an engaging performance that leaves audiences wanting more.

name: Thelonious Love
description: Artist & Activist, Thelonious Love is back with a powerful new sound. On his fourth studio project, with love, from JURNT Entertainment, lyrically at least, nothing is off the table for Love. His diary of songs range in themes from mental health, queer & black identity, addiction, relationships, social justice, and social media. Swaggering a unique baritone delivery, Love blends genres together while adding live instrumentation to deliver a unique Hip-Hop sound. Backed by his band and his boyfriend, Sean Maddox, Theo’s live show has evolved into on of Austin’s most memorable performances.

name: Theo Lawrence
description:
For the past 10 years, Theo Lawrence has been making a name for himself as France's favorite songbird. A truly one-of-a-kind country singer and genuine keeper of the flame, Lawrence came into his own on his Austin-made 2023 LP release, Cherie, and on his all-acoustic album, Pickin' & Singin'. His most recent release, a duet All Fifty States (with Melissa Carper), is a playful back-and-forth about two people in love who don’t always see eye to eye. It's a perfect showcase of storytelling, connection, and the artistry Theo brings to every song.

Lawrence pens classic love songs and delivers with a croon straight out of the Charlie Rich and Ray Price golden years. In recent years, he has played a pivotal role in reviving an interest for Country Music in Europe, and with his recent move to Austin, TX, Theo Lawrence is bringing his honed craft back to its American cradle.

Newly signed to Warner Records, we expect to hear Theo's name a lot more in the coming months and years.

name: Tia Tutt
description: Tia Tutt, born on January 6th in Augusta, GA, hails from Lincolnton, GA. From an early age, she faced the profound loss of her brother, shaping her journey with profound challenges. However, Tia found solace and expression in music, which became her refuge and passion. Her path led her to Los Angeles, where she endured a grueling two-year period of homelessness. Despite the adversity, Tia persevered, channeling her experiences into her music. During this time, she recorded an impressive four mixtapes, each containing 20 songs, showcasing her resilience and dedication to her craft. Despite the hardships she faced, Tia emerged stronger, using her artistry as a means of empowerment and self-expression. Today, she continues to live vibrantly, thriving as both a person and an artist, constantly evolving and creating music that resonates with audiences around the world. Tia’s journey is a testament to the power of perseverance and the transformative nature of music in the face of adversity.

name: The Tiarras
description: Meet The Tiarras: Tori, Sophia, and Tiffany Baltierra, a dynamic trio of multi-faceted artists who effortlessly blend genres and cultural influences to create global music that knows no boundaries. Sisters turned bandmates, The Tiarras have embarked on a journey that defies conventions and embraces sonic exploration. Hailing from a Mexican-American heritage, The Tiarras draw from the rich tapestry of musical diversity that surrounded their upbringing. Their vibrant compositions seamlessly weave together elements of rock, Latin, pop, soul, reggae, and blues, resulting in an eclectic yet refined sound that challenges the very notion of genre. Fueled by a passion for community and inclusivity, The Tiarras' music is a conduit for spreading positive energy and empowering messages. Their tracks, like "Soy Chingona" and "Let Love Free," resonate far and wide, gaining recognition on prestigious platforms including NPR World Cafe, Mitú & Grimy Goods. Committed to releasing more original music that defies expectations and embraces their global influences, their journey is one of breaking boundaries, sparking positive change, and leaving an indelible mark on the music landscape.

name: Tipa Tipo
description: Tipa Tipo fuses '70s soft rock and disco with Latin rhythms to create their fresh take on tropical yacht rock en español. Praised by KEXP for their "spellbinding rhythms, infectious pop hooks and endless grooves," the power trio serves up a bilingual sonic landscape that makes you want to dance and think. Fronted by co-producers Adele Fournet and Felipe Wurst, with Jordan Auber on drums and percussion.

name: Tom A Smith
description: A 21 year old singer/songwriter/producer based in Sunderland, England. Signed to Fiction Records and previously worked with Miles Kane and Hugo White (The Maccabees(

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Torture and the Desert Spiders
description:
Torture and the Desert Spiders is a NYC-based indie post-punk project based on the songwriting of NY-native Anna Kunz. The project, previously based in the north of England, has performed well over 400 shows since its inception, including a currently running 46+ week headline residency in NYC as well as shows for the BBC at the Cavern Club (Liverpool), at Webster Hall (NYC), for the British Arts Council with Mattiel (Hull), at Kendal Calling Festival (2022, 2023), and sold out shows at the Supersonic Club (Paris), The Windmill Brixton (London), and Night and Day (Manchester, UK).
The project has recently released two singles mixed by Alex Poeppel (Telescreens). Torture and the Desert Spiders next NYC show will be supporting Cab Ellis at the Bowery Ballroom on January 9th.

name: Total Wife
description:
Come Back Down, the new album by Nashville experimental-pop duo Total Wife, was born from the edge of sleep. When composer and producer Luna Kupper would begin to fall asleep during late-night mixing sessions, the songs would follow her into the halfway place between dream and lucidity. Like Dale Cooper in Twin Peaks, she’d wake with a new perspective on the puzzle she was piecing together. “I’m a psychological mixer — I’m trying to think of how someone’s experiencing the sound, versus getting stuck in trying to make all these different tones and using all this gear to make something sound a certain way,” Kupper says.

And like a spiral from waking life into dream, the songs on Come Back Down are endlessly self- referential, building whole universes from a single point. Kupper sold all of her synths to make rent before she started working on the album, and so every inorganic sound is instead built from samples of the band’s own work. A guitar on one song may be reprocessed and used as a synth on the next, while everywhere on the album vocal samples are taken from a single unreleased cover of Elliott Smith’s “Between the Bars.” In tribute to this process, the album was almost named The Julia Set after the mathematical equation which feeds into itself again and again, creating beautiful fractal images. The intention was to create something complex but accessible; experimental, yet precise and without abstraction.

name: Trophy Wife
description: Trophy Wife is unapologetic. Based in Brooklyn, this trio bares all through a hazy, distorted lens. With the 2024 release of their debut album Get Ugly, McKenzie Iazzetta’s confessional lyrics, Christian Pace’s riff-like bass lines, and Michael Martelli’s pounding drums transform raw diary entries into cathartic anthems for the parts of ourselves that are best swept under the rug.

name: True Jackson
description:
True Jackson is an independent artist who blends 90s grunge rock production with an anthemic pop vocal. A native of Los Angeles, True has been embraced by the vibrant New York music scene, having performed at such legendary venues as the Mercury Lounge, Baby’s All Right, and Le Poisson Rouge, to name a few.
True channels her emotions into catchy hooks and electrifying guitar riffs, painting a clear picture of where she has been and where she’s going with her debut song: “Paint Me”, released in 2024 and featured in the American High film, 'Prom Dates', streaming on Hulu.
True’s debut EP, RIP TRUE, was released in 2025 and features standouts “Smooth Talking” and “Bad”. Making music for the crashout girlies, these 4 songs encapsulate struggling with self-doubt and navigating out of her youth into her 20’s, allowing the audience to scream and dance through life, embracing the imperfections instead of sitting in it.
Her follow-up project explores a toxic relationship and how the heroine ultimately regains her power. The project will be released in Spring 2026 with two lead singles coming just before she takes Austin, TX by storm as part of this year’s South by Southwest Festival.

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: TTSSFU
description: TTSSFU – aka Tasmin Nicole Stephens – quickly went from being a mere fixture in Manchester’s indie scene to one of its fastest-rising stars, now poised to break out well beyond it. Known for conjuring vast, atmospheric worlds from her bedroom using just Garageband, she watched as early releases like her Warhol-inspired 2024 EP “Me, Jed and Andy” picked up steam. Since then, she’s traded bedrooms for stages supporting Kim Deal, English Teacher, Soccer Mommy and Mannequin Pussy, plus sold out headlines across the UK and packed festival sets from Green Man to the Great Escape.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth Patio

name: The Tullamarines
description:
The amalgamation of four distinct voices from Adelaide, The Tullamarines tell their stories through a shared perspective that feels intimate, honest, and quietly uplifting. Josh, Angus, Benny and Lucinda met on the local gig circuit, quickly bonding over a mutual love of songwriting and collaboration. From those early connections, they’ve crafted a sound that reflects each member’s individual sensibilities - a style they affectionately call cosy-pop.

Their songs move through life’s highs and lows with the warmth of an old friend, inviting listeners into their living room, putting the kettle on, and sitting with whatever feeling the day brings. That sense of closeness runs through both their recorded work and their live shows.

Having appeared on festival line-ups including Beyond The Valley, Laneway Festival, Spin Off Festival and New Year’s Eve on the Hill, and toured extensively alongside artists such as Old Mervs, The Preatures, Ball Park Music and Alex Lahey, The Tullamarines continue to build a reputation for heartfelt songwriting and deeply human performances.

name: Two-Man Giant Squid
description: A post-punk project out of Brooklyn NY, Two-Man Giant Squid has earned acclaim in the New York City underground for their ability to fuse dance-punk, garage, and psych influences into fierce live shows and ambitious recordings (KEXP, SPIN). They lean on an eclectic mix to produce their sound including matter-of-fact vocal delivery, intricate synth design, and lately- a theremin. Their most recent LP was unveiled at last year’s SXSW festival and later charted at #89 on National Indie Radio charts. With a slate of releases & tours planned for 2026, Two-Man Giant Squid brings their signature creativity and DIY spirit to the forefront of the post-punk revival.

events.presented_by: iLL Manner x The Smoke Out ATX: A Phat A$$ Rap Show

name: Unsafe Space Garden
description:
Unsafe Space Garden is a genre-bending outfit from Portugal known for their chaotic, theatrical and deeply immersive live shows. With a sound rooted in neo-psychedelia, experimental rock and a touch of surreal humour, the band pushes musical boundaries with fearless creativity and a clear artistic vision.

Described by European press as “a surrealist orchestra,” their concerts often blur the line between performance and ritual - unpredictable, cathartic and strangely uplifting. Their critically acclaimed albums Bro, You Got Something In Your Eye – A Guided Meditation (2021) and Where’s The Ground? (2023) draw comparisons to artists like Frank Zappa, Captain Beefheart or The Flaming Lips, while forging a language uniquely their own.

More than just experimentalists, Unsafe Space Garden are storytellers - unpredictable, emotional and sonically adventurous. A live act designed to be seen, heard, and remembered.

name: urboi.
description: urboi. es un productor y DJ mexicano con una trayectoria consolidada dentro de la música electrónica. Ha trabajado con artistas como Guaynaa, Anuel AA, Bruses, Dillon Francis y SIA, logrando discos de oro, platino y una nominación al Latin Grammy. Su enfoque versátil le ha permitido conectar con distintas escenas y públicos, presentándose en festivales como EDC México y Tecate Pal Norte.

name: Valee
description: Valee is a Chicago-born rapper known for his minimalist delivery, deadpan charisma, and hypnotic approach to trap and street rap. Emerging from the city’s underground, he broke through with cult-favorite records like Womp Womp and Good Job, You Found Me, later releasing projects via Kanye West’s GOOD Music before continuing independently. Valee’s sound is defined by sparse beats, unconventional flows, and an anti-performative cool that has influenced a wave of modern rap aesthetics. He’s collaborated and shared stages with artists across the experimental and mainstream rap spectrum, earning a reputation as a tastemaker’s rapper with lasting cultural impact rather than trend-chasing appeal.

name: Valsian
description: Oscar and Eunice, a music electronic pop mexican duo.

name: Very Necessary
description: Two Texas producers, Steelo Foreign and Roy Smith have recorded and produced for an impressive roster of talent, including Gucci Mane, Sada Baby, Smooky MarGielaa, Jazz Cartier, Bella Thorne, ThouxanbanFauni, Maxo Kream, Playboi Carti, OMB Peezy, Stunna4Vegas, Trae Tha Truth, Guapo, Chalie Boy, Warhol.ss, Billyracxx, and many more. Their extensive credits reflect their commitment to excellence and ability to work across genres.

name: Victor Jones
description:
Victor Jones has taken off tremendously in the past year and change, hitting a over million streams on spotify in 2025 alone, with success on tracks such as Mother Teresa and I Get Hurt boosted by strong short form social media campaigns. Victor comes from a background of comedy and theater as much as music, and it shows through even (especially?) in his darkest songs.

Victor plays with a modular backing band consisting of 1-2 people and carefully arranged backing tracks. His shows are high energy, danceable, and chantable. He prides himself on having, at least in the past year, made people cry at every show, and alternately, made them dance.

name: Victoryland
description:
Victoryland is the Brooklyn-based project of musician Julian McCamman. His label-debut, My Heart Is A Room With No Cameras In It, out January 23, 2026 via Good English, is a triumphant, despondent, and ultimately fun experimental pop-rock album. Victoryland started in Philly 2023 with the release of tape, Sprain, which echoed more of what the Philly scene was dishing out: lo-fi, tape-recorded rock with a capital R. It was the collaborative efforts of producer Dan Howard that brought the new vision and sound into full focus.Dan and Julian previously worked on Julian’s now-defunct Texas-to-Philly based band, Blood’s Loving You Backwards LP, a collaborative effort between six bandmates. That experience pushed Julian toward a more personal process of recording, starting with home demos and then bringing them to Dan to shape into songs. This relationship ultimately led Julian to move to NYC.

The sound of the album, recorded between Julian’s Bed Stuy basement and Dan’s Williamsburg studio, is the sound of a bright and beaming collaboration. Landing somewhere between lo-fi and hi-fi production, the songs have the glossiness of a radio-friendly hit mixed with the distortion and rough edges of a home demo. Every song keeps at least one element of the initial recording, while building around the loops and half-songs Julian scrapped together. The lyrics on the record span from humorous self-aware popisms (“‘you and I’ will soon be, used to be ‘us’”) to crushing realities of bitterness(“i’ll never forgive you, that’s how I keep you close”) to abstract imagery (“mothers wave from doorways, in ostinato”), all delivered with such an immediacy and fervor that in the middle of singing along, you wonder if this guy slept much last night.

My Heart wrangles with heavy subject matter (love, disconnection, sexual frustration, emptiness etc.), but the terminal statement of the record is about the cleansing nature of pop music. That, if a song can force you to “bliss out” over a hook or a loop, or even make you dance, it can be the spoonful of sugar to swallow the hard pill with; this is what Victoryland strives to do: package the most exhausting realities of life, love, and the search for connection in a world starved of it, into a fun 2-5 minutes, and for the runtime of Victoryland’s first major statement, you might even feel like you’re not alone.

name: Villain Park
description: Villain Park is a Los Angeles-based hip-hop duo known for their sharp lyricism, cinematic production, and raw, unfiltered energy. Blending West Coast grit with modern underground sensibilities, the group has built a loyal following through relentless releases and electrifying live performances. With a sound that’s both nostalgic and forward-thinking, Villain Park continues to carve their own lane in independent hip-hop.

name: Vin Zeal
description:
Vin Zeal is a Houston, Texas–based artist blending the emotional depth of R&B with the infectious appeal of pop. Performing professionally since 2012, Vin Zeal has spent over a decade honing a sound rooted in authenticity, stage presence, and connection—bringing both polish and passion to every performance.

Known for smooth vocals, melodic storytelling, and live guitar accompaniment, Vin Zeal creates music that feels both timeless and contemporary. Her ability to seamlessly incorporate guitar into her performances adds a dynamic, intimate edge to both recorded and live experiences.

With extensive live performance experience and a clear artistic vision, Vin Zeal continues to build a compelling catalog that bridges pop accessibility with R&B soul—positioning her as a dynamic and evolving artist with longevity in mind.

name: Vintage Jay
description: Vintage Jay hailing from off Rundberg Ln in Austin’s gritty, very culturally diverse Northside. Austin based rapper and DJ has risen up to speak for a section of Austin that has rarely had a voice. Blending tales from the streets with very poignant bars of consciousness and social reform. Vintage Jay was featured on KUTX radio September Artist of the month and KUTX Summer Jam. Making him an official NPR Session artist. The city of Austin has also given Jay his official proclamation date September 12th. From producing cultural and musical events to as well expressing his life through music. Jay has become an individual of many traits, his latest album Still I Rise, speaks of a new age of creativity and musical expression to the ear. His growth in his music is something that appears in every album, and one thing that never changes is that he stays true to himself and the craft. Jay has become a true tastemaker and one of the biggest Latino figures in Austin, TX. To represent the Latino culture with pride and honor is something Jay has done since day 1.

name: VUKOVI
description:
VUKOVI are a dynamic two-piece alt-rock outfit from Scotland fronted by vocalist Janine Shilstone and guitarist Hamish Reilly. Their sound combines blistering riffs and melodic vocals with elements of heavy-rock, noise-pop, and nu-metal, suitable for fans of Bring Me The Horizon, PVRIS, Don Broco and Rage Against The Machine. Following the critical success of their 2017 debut (‘VUKOVI’) and the electrifying follow-up ‘Fall Better’ (2020), VUKOVI truly ascended to stratospheric new heights with their third album, ‘NULA’ (2022). While ‘La Di Da’, drawn from their debut, remains a perennial fan favourite, tracks such as ‘LASSO’, ‘HADES’ and the anthemic ‘I EXIST’ continue to command chaos from fans in live settings across the globe. VUKOVI released their latest album ‘MY GOD HAS GOT A GUN’ via Sharptone Records in 2025, recorded and co-produced by legendary Machine at The Machine Shop Studio in Texas. The album garnered praise for its cathartic yet exorcistic expression of themes surrounding mental health, religion and female empowerment.
Having toured with the likes of Babymetal, Enter Shikari, PVRIS, Nothing More and One Ok Rock, VUKOVI continue to build their audiences worldwide.

name: Wacotron
description:
Wacotron is a Texas trap artist from Waco, Texas, delivering high impact records rooted in authenticity, pressure, and precision. Built from the ground up, his rise reflects a disciplined approach to music, pairing raw street perspective with elite level production and proven performance metrics.

After building organic traction online, Wacotron’s momentum accelerated through his affiliation with Pick Six Records, where his sound sharpened and his reach expanded. His breakout phase was defined by collaborations with producers from the 808 Mafia camp, resulting in hard hitting releases that generated millions of views and streams across digital platforms. These records didn’t just circulate, they converted, placing Wacotron in front of a national audience and solidifying his market viability.

Anchored by dark, bass driven production and a commanding delivery, Wacotron’s catalog speaks directly to trap culture while maintaining crossover appeal. His visuals and singles consistently perform at scale across YouTube and streaming services, reflecting a growing fanbase and long term positioning in today’s dominant trap landscape.

name: Water Damage
description:
“Arguably the most exciting rock band to emerge from the American experimental underground this decade.” - Grayson Haver Currin, MOJO Magazine 2025

Drones are a powerful force, capable of whisking our thinking mind far, far, away. Austin-based collective Water Damage yields the same power whenever they pick up their instruments. Veterans from other projects (a.o. Swans, more eaze, Spray Paint, USA/Mexico and more), the band is not unfamiliar with the unshakeable power in drones; still, as Water Damage, they stretch out drone’s possibilities to their limits, bowing to the principle ‘Maximal Repetition Minimal Deviation’. Water Damage explore ecstatic oblivion, repeating basic riffs and rhythms until time seems to falter. Once an idea takes off, they pursue it forever; as Pitchfork said, their 2024 double LP ‘In E’ doubles as a “glorious mind eraser”.

name: Wave Chapelle & NilexNile
description: Hip-hop artist’s from the north side of Milwaukee who grew up on the sounds of Soulful Midwest rap. Separately they put out a steady stream of music over the last 5 years and have performed at various music festivals including Summerfest, Mile of music, and SXSW. Recently they’ve come together to form a duo ahead of their new project in the works for 2026.

name: Werkha
description:
Werkha (aka Tom Leah) is a multi-instrumentalist, producer & DJ hailing from Manchester and Cumbria. He has been consistently releasing music and creating live experiences for over a decade. Werkha’s music fuses analogue jazz-funk vibes with the UK’s electronic, resulting in a number of releases nestled between the sounds of broken beat and cinematic moments. Deep synths and delectable drums ride alongside live horns and a wealth of string textures. Shortly after his track “Sidesteppin” was picked up by Gilles Peterson for his Brownswood Bubblers compilation, Werkha’s debut landed on the acclaimed Brighton imprint Tru Thoughts. He went on to sign to the Worldwide Award-winning First Word Records, releasing his self-produced sophomore album ‘All Werk Is Play’ in 2022. This featured collabs with MC Chunky (Eglo Records / Swamp 81), Ellen Beth Abdi (A Certain Ratio), Kemani Anderson (Secret Night Gang), Nick Blacka (GoGo Penguin) and Tom Driessler (Tom Misch / Jordan Rakei) amongst others.

His vibrant energetic live shows include a selection of instruments, looped and fused with a mix of tightly packed samples that set the moment alight, blending beauty and dance.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth Patio

name: West Texas Exiles
description: Featuring five musicians who grew up in El Paso, Lubbock and Amarillo, the West Texas Exiles draw upon the wide-open western reaches of the Lone Star State with a wide-ranging, Americana-centered sound. Rising from the embers of the Dirty River Boys, which Marco Gutierrez co-founded in 2009, the Austin band features a triple-threat of songwriters in Gutierrez, Daniel Davis and Colin Gilmore (son of legendary Texas troubadour Jimmie Dale Gilmore), plus seasoned bassist/producer Eric Harrison and latter-day Dirty River Boys drummer Trinidad Leal. The Exiles' 2023 debut EP paved the way for their first full-length album, 8000 Days. Since its September release the album has steadily risen to #8 on the Americana radio charts and has drawn critical praise. The recordings build upon the live chops the group has honed through a weekly residency at Austin’s legendary Continental Club plus gigs at key local events such as SXSW and Willie Nelson’s Luck Reunion, as well as high-profile touring appearances at Nashville’s Americanafest, Braun Brothers Reunion and San Francisco’s Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival.

name: Whitelands
description: Originally inspired by a Slowdive KEXP session, London-based quartet Whitelands fuse their diverse musical backgrounds into an updated spin on shoegaze that amplifies marginalized voices and perspectives. Formed in the late 2010s as the solo project of Etienne Quartey-Papafio, Whitelands evolved into a full band ahead of their official debut album, Night-Bound Eyes Are Blind to the Day (2024), released during a U.K. tour with Slowdive. The project takes its name from a campus at London’s Roehampton University, where Quartey-Papafio first performed live. Their self-titled 2018 debut, a lo-fi blend of jagged indie rock and hazy grunge textures, hinted at the immersive sound they would later embrace. A turning point came when Quartey-Papafio stumbled upon Slowdive’s 2017 KEXP performance, igniting a deeper fixation on shoegaze. The current lineup consists of Jagun Meseorisa, Vanessa Govinden, and Michael Adelaja who bonded through shared experiences of neurodivergence and racial identity. Whitelands’ forthcoming album, Sunlight Echoes (out January 30, 2026), expands their sound, moving beyond shoegaze’s shadows toward something bigger, brighter, and unmistakably their own.

events.venue: British Music Embassy @ Palm Door on Sixth

name: Wilby
description: Jersey-born Maria Crawford has been paving her way through the Nashville independent music scene since 2014. Now Brooklyn-based, she continues to capture listeners with her fiercely vulnerable songwriting and compelling live performances. Wilby’s debut single “Bad” (2020) gained immediate attention, followed by "Translucent Beauty” (2021), drifting between bedroom pop and indie rock. Her sophomore EP, “Happiest Woman” (2023), marked a shift toward showcasing a full-band production, mirroring the force of Wilby’s live sound. Wilby’s debut album, “Center of Affection” (2025, via Hit the North Records), explores both the cathartic side of indie-rock and the vulnerable side of twangy folk. Wilby has been featured in FLOOD Magazine, Luna Collective, and Ones To Watch, named an Artist to Watch by Atwood Magazine, with support from Seattle’s KEXP and Nashville’s WNXP and Lightning 100.

name: Willgood
description:
Willgood has now been DJing long enough that the original plan to fund a nationwide automotive repainting initiative exclusively in red has been officially downgraded from “ambitious” to “symbolic.” What started as a financial experiment became a long-term commitment to dance floors, tasteful grooves, and basslines that behave like they know what they’re doing.

Still operating without formal mentorship (DJ Pagliacci remains legally unreachable), Willgood approaches DJing as a serious craft with unserious presentation favoring disco, house, and dance music that sneaks up on you, locks in, and refuses to rush. Still has the long term goal of being the 4th member of Being Dead. He loves Ferraris, not because they’re fast, but because they’re precise, opinionated, and allergic to subtlety.

The hat is gone. The red remains. Catch Willgood at SXSW doing what he does best: keeping it fun, keeping it moving, and quietly convincing you this was always the plan.

name: willoh
description:
Missouri native willoh is riding the crest of a wave of excitement over her new series of singles leading up to her spring 2026 album release. On her latest track, EARMILK writes ““OUCHIE” defies easy categorization, blending synth-pop, raw punk attitude, and alt-rock vibes into a shifting, avant-garde sound.”

Willoh’s self-produced 20205 debut, not more than that, but more please presents us with a raw honesty rendered through snowy vocals that sit in rarefied air and belies the artist’s 19 years. In September she released the labyrinthine “Buckshot” to critical acclaim.

From her home in Springfield, Missouri, willoh records and creates music, having first found her footing on Garageband before graduating to LogicPro–making the upgrade from her earnings working many long shifts at McDonalds.

name: Willy J Peso
description:
Willy J Peso is a Detroit-born lyricist whose music reflects the city’s raw honesty, hustle, and resilience. Blending sharp lyricism with cinematic production, his sound balances lived experience, ambition, and introspection—unapologetic and forward-moving.

Operating in the lane of Wiz Khalifa, Curren$y, Larry June, and Big Sean, Willy delivers laid-back confidence, intentional bars, and a lifestyle-forward perspective rooted in independence, ownership, and longevity. His music feels grown and purposeful—made for people building something, not chasing moments.
