Beyond the stage, Willy J Peso is a cannabis entrepreneur and reform advocate, partnering with licensed brands across Michigan, New Jersey, and Florida. Through music and business, he pushes equity, normalization, and economic opportunity for communities historically impacted by prohibition.

On stage, Willy doesn’t just perform—he represents a Detroit-born movement driven by culture, entrepreneurship, and reform.

name: Wim Tapley & The Cannons
description:
Based in Athens, Georgia, Wim Tapley came of age playing venues in Washington D.C. and its sprawling suburbs. There, he honed his voice with the passion of a born troubadour, drawing in a diverse fanbase with his easy showmanship and distinct style.

Since 2021, Athens has been home to Wim and his live band The Cannons. His first week in town, Wim made his way onto a local bill, etching a name for himself as a fresh and favorite hometown voice. He is ardently received by his ever-growing following at legendary regional venues like the 9:30 Club, Eddie’s Attic, and the Georgia Theatre—the latter of which he’s sold out more than once—and on tours across the country.

Firmly rooted in Americana and dashed with glamorous pop sensibilities, the swinging depths of neo-soul, and a sprinkling of riotous horns, Wim’s arresting sound is as fresh as it is ageless, as fevered as it is raucous fun.

A sonic westward expansion of fuzzed-out guitars, defiant horns, and dusty vocals, his discography blazes a fresh new take on folk-pop while honoring the songwriting giants that paved the way before him like Jason Isbell, Bill Withers, and Chris Stapleton.

name: Worlds Worst
description: As SLC-based band, Worlds Worst, release their sophomore LP, American Muscle, the band continues to perfect their unique approach to the indie, slacker rock sound. The new LP, released via tastemaker labels Smoking Room and Julia’s War Records, mixed and mastered by Jack Shirley, features standout singles like "Angus," “Gas Hands” and the 2024 track “Motor Mouth.” On American Muscle, the band takes new risks and showcases how they have grown as songwriters while maintaining their noisy, ‘90s rock style. Worlds Worst has toured extensively across the US, headlined Philly's Julia's War Fest, performed at SLC's Kilby Block Party twice, played the new Best Friends Forever Festival in Las Vegas, Boise’s Treefort Fest, and earned recognition as one of Stereogum’s Best New Bands.

name: xBValentine
description: xBValentine is a queer Latina artist from Georgetown, Texas, unapologetically carving her own lane in the music world. As a first-generation creative, she’s spent over a decade breaking barriers from racking up accolades at open mics to sharing stages with names like Joyner Lucas, WESTSIDE Boogie, Snow Tha Product, Lupe Fiasco, & more. Known for her bold, genre-blending sound, XB’s music fuses hip-hop, R&B, and Latin influences, reflecting her diverse roots and fearless individuality. Her rise has been meteoric first going viral in 2020 with her LGBTQ+ anthem “Vibe With You,” surpassing a million streams across platforms. In 2023, she made waves again with Paul Wall on “LIKE DIS,” amassing over 10 million TikTok views. Most recently, her hit “Don’t Play With Me” featuring Amanda Perez exploded online, earning 2.2 billion TikTok views, nearing 1 million YouTube views, and surpassing a million streams across platforms. xB isn’t just a voice; she’s a movement.

name: Ximena Soto
description: Ximena Soto is an upcoming artist from Monterrey, México, and a rising voice in contemporary R&B. Her music blends modern R&B with nostalgic samples inspired by trending sounds from the 80s and 90s, shaping a fresh identity. Backed by established producers in the Mexican music scene, Ximena has fully found her sound and is currently working on an EP set for release next year. As an ambassador of the LGBTQ+ community, she delivers “hot music” rooted in freedom, self-expression, and emotional connection, reaching audiences beyond labels and genres.

name: YARD
description:
YARD are the electrifying three-piece electropunk band from Dublin. Known for their intense and immersive live shows, YARD bridges the gap between electronica and post-punk, creating an auditory onslaught that leaves audiences sweaty, energised, and strangely unnerved.

Since their inception, YARD has shared stages with the likes of A Place To Bury Strangers, Psychotic Monks and Mandy Indiana. Their electrifying live performances, akin to Death Grips, Nine Inch Nails and The Prodigy, have earned them coveted slots at festivals such as Les Transmusicales, Haldern Pop and Into The Great Wide Open.

With a recent live performance on KEXP, continued support from Rolling Stone, BBC Radio 6, Clash and Louder Than War among others and two self-titled EPs under their belt, YARD are set to continue their meteoric rise in 2026.

A recent live review captured the YARD experience perfectly: “In their presence, you see and feel them painstakingly crafting every note and sound with their bare hands, wrestling with different sockets, switches, strings, or even their voices. The venue was transformed into this factory of raw, unadulterated noise which kept us all at the mercy of the sound - collectively banging our heads in synchronicity.”

name: YES AND MAYBE
description:
Born amidst the cultural vibrancy of Glasgow and Paris, YES AND MAYBE is an electrifying two-piece band that pushes the boundaries of contemporary music.

The first band member, a multi-instrumentalist and writer, excels in crafting minimalist guitar-based melodies, demonstrating a perfect blend of ingenuity and precision. His obsessive self-criticism and penchant for perfection have allowed him to transform his influences into his own unique sound.

The second member, a performer, writer, and producer, brings his experiences and emotions to life through introspective lyrics paired with evocative, ethereal vocals. His artistry lies in balancing deeply metaphorical, grounded lyrics with melodies that evoke a sense of escapism. This potent mix of realism and fantasy forms an integral part of YES AND MAYBE's distinctive sound.
​
Their songwriting process, both organic and instinctive, evolves from a simple phrase or a recorded sound into a comprehensive musical piece within a day. Their songs encapsulate their raw emotions, serving as a beacon of authenticity in an industry often mired in overproduction.

YES AND MAYBE, though relatively new, brings a refreshing spontaneity and a shared vision to redefine the musical landscape. Their commitment to creating music that resonates with their listeners' shared experiences makes them a band worth investing in. Keep an eye on this Glasgow based duo—they're a unique proposition with a future as innovative as their sound.

name: Yoshi
description:
YOSHI es considerado uno de los artistas más completos y consolidados de México. Sus habilidades en producción musical, composición y dirección creativa, han resultado en un proyecto que orgánicamente conecta a través de una estética y mensaje únicos. Combinando distintos géneros y sonidos, ofrece una alternativa al mainstream latinoamericano con una propuesta que promete ser el nuevo pop mexicano. Ha trabajado con artistas como Alvaro Díaz, Latin Mafia, Jesse Baez, entre muchos otros.
Nominado 4 veces a Latin Grammy (Productor y Compositor) Nominado una vez a grammy (Compositor).

name: Yoso
description: Yoso is an Austin-based hip-hop artist known for blending high-energy performance with melodic, emotionally driven records. His sound reflects Southern influence, ambition, and authentic storytelling, allowing him to connect with both hype-focused and vibe-driven audiences. After gaining traction with his breakout single “You Don’t Know,” which surpassed 200K+ views, Yoso has continued building momentum through consistent releases and strong digital engagement. His latest release “NOW” represents a new chapter focused on growth and creative evolution. With official SXSW artist recognition and an expanding catalog of music and visuals, Yoso continues to establish himself as a rising independent artist focused on long-term development, performance excellence, and cultural impact.

name: ZAMAERA
description:
Zamaera is a Malaysian rapper, singer-songwriter, and storyteller known for her fearless, genre-defying sound and commanding live performances. Blending sharp lyricism with experimental production, she has carved a distinct space for herself in Southeast Asia and beyond.

Breaking through Malaysia’s hip-hop scene in the mid-2010s, Zamaera gained international recognition through releases such as ZvsZ and Get Munni, leading to performances across the region and abroad.

In 2021, she founded Mean Malaya Entertainment, a creative platform championing artistic independence and Malaysian talent. Her commitment to uplifting women in music led to the creation of Queendomfest, Southeast Asia’s first all-female music festival.

In 2025, Zamaera became the fourth Malaysian artist to perform at SXSW in Austin, Texas. Building on that momentum, she now presents the first-ever dedicated national showcase, Made In Malaysia, at SXSW 2026, featuring an all-Malaysian lineup.

Her latest single, Ikan Kekek, released in February 2026, reimagines a traditional Malay folklore rhyme through trap and techno textures, exploring cultural memory, artistic freedom, and non-linear expression.

name: Zastava
description: zastava is a music band from detroit, mi

name: Zeñal Nortex
description:
Zeñal Nortex es un grupo de música mexicana. El grupo fue fundado en el año 2022 por su líder, Eliud Garcia junto a el acordeonista Alexis Pérez Aragón.

La agrupación hace el lanzamiento de su primer disco de estudio titulado “Vamos Por Más” el 27 de Enero del 2023 donde colaboraron con compositores como Rey Rodríguez, reconocido en el género norteño.

Su canción “Ay! Güerita” escrita y producida por Eliud García (vocalista) ha rebasado las 145,000 reproducciones, y temas como el de “Quien Iba a Decirlo” de (Rey Rodríguez) también ha tenido éxito en los números digitales de Spotify y YouTube.

El más reciente tema de Zeñal Nortex lleva por nombre “El Del X6 ” un corrido que habla sobre la superación del latino, y es parte de una secuencia de corridos “Pa'l Luchon ” y “La Coyote o El Redeye”.

Nuevo álbum oficialmente anunciado para Marzo 2026.

For booking: (512) 712-3347
Frontera Chica Music Booking

name: Zola Marcelle
description:
The Bantu & Boundless artist, Zola Marcelle, is a Zimbabwean-born, London-based multidisciplinary artist. With a rare mix of Shona and Sotho heritage, her journey through music, culture, and history is steadily shaping her into an exciting contemporary voice of her generation. Raised partially in Bulawayo with a family steeped in music, Zola grew up with a deep connection to song and her African roots.

Belonging to a generation of active participants in Zimbabwe’s independence struggle, Zola adopted a profound sense of responsibility, identity, and freedom. Having grown up in a home where music was a staple diet, Zola was surrounded by the global sounds of legends like Sankomota, Andrae Crouch, Stevie Wonder, Jimmy Dludlu and Sibongile Khumalo. When she wasn’t listening to these musical greats, Zola would accompany her father on photography outings, a combination of visual and sonic inspiration that would later fuel her own creative process. These early experiences gave her a foundation in both artistry and activism.
